verses.sanskrit: सवादिष्ठया मदिष्ठया पवस्व सोम धारया इन्द्राय पातवे सुतः |||
verses.transliteration: svādiṣṭhayā madiṣṭhayā pavasva soma dhārayā indrāya pātave sutaḥ

translations.griffith: In sweetest and most gladdening stream  flow pure, O Soma, on thy way,  Pressed out for Indra, for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: रक्षोहा विश्वचर्षनिरभि योनिमयोहतम दरुणा सधस्थमासदत |||
verses.transliteration: rakṣohā viśvacarṣanirabhi yonimayohatam druṇā sadhasthamāsadat

translations.griffith: Fiend-queller, Friend of all men, he hath with the wood attained unto  His place, his iron-fashioned home.

verses.sanskrit: वरिवोधातमो भव मंहिष्ठो वर्त्रहन्तमः पर्षि राधोमघोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: varivodhātamo bhava maṃhiṣṭho vṛtrahantamaḥ parṣi rādhomaghonām

translations.griffith: Be thou best Vṛtra-slayer, best granter of bliss, most liberal:  Promote our wealthy princes' gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यर्ष महानां देवानां वीतिमन्धसा अभि वाजमुत शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: abhyarṣa mahānāṃ devānāṃ vītimandhasā abhi vājamuta śravaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward with thy juice unto the banquet of the Mighty Gods:  Flow hither for our strength and fame.

verses.sanskrit: तवामछा चरामसि तदिदर्थं दिवे-दिवे इन्दो तवे न आशसः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmachā carāmasi tadidarthaṃ dive-dive indo tve na āśasaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indu, we draw nigh to thee, with this one object day by day:  To thee alone our prayers are said

verses.sanskrit: पुनाति ते परिस्रुतं सोमं सूर्यस्य दुहिता वारेण शश्वता तना |||
verses.transliteration: punāti te parisrutaṃ somaṃ sūryasya duhitā vāreṇa śaśvatā tanā

translations.griffith: By means of this eternal fleece may Sūrya's Daughter purify  Thy Soma that is foaming forth.

verses.sanskrit: तमीमण्वीः समर्य आ गर्भ्णन्ति योषणो दश सवसारः पार्ये दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: tamīmaṇvīḥ samarya ā ghṛbhṇanti yoṣaṇo daśa svasāraḥ pārye divi

translations.griffith: Ten sister maids of slender form seize him within the press and hold  Him firmly on the final day.

verses.sanskrit: तमीं हिन्वन्त्यग्रुवो धमन्ति बाकुरं दर्तिम तरिधातु वारणं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: tamīṃ hinvantyaghruvo dhamanti bākuraṃ dṛtim tridhātu vāraṇaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: The virgins send him forth: they blow the the skin musician-like and fuse  The triple foe-repelling meath.

verses.sanskrit: अभीममघ्न्या उत शरीणन्ति धेनवः शिशुम सोममिन्द्राय पातवे |||
verses.transliteration: abhīmamaghnyā uta śrīṇanti dhenavaḥ śiśum somamindrāya pātave

translations.griffith: Inviolable milch-kine round about him blend for Indra's drink,  The fresh young Soma with their milk.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदिन्द्रो मदेष्वा विश्वा वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते शूरो मघा च मंहते |||
verses.transliteration: asyedindro madeṣvā viśvā vṛtrāṇi jighnate śūro maghā ca maṃhate

translations.griffith: In the wild raptures of this draught, Indra slays all the Vṛtras: he,  The Hero, pours his wealth on us.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व देववीरति पवित्रं सोम रंह्या इन्द्रमिन्दो वर्षा विश |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva devavīrati pavitraṃ soma raṃhyā indramindo vṛṣā viśa

translations.griffith: Soma, flow on, inviting Gods, speed to the purifying cloth:  Pass into Indra, as a Bull.

verses.sanskrit: आ वच्यस्व महि पसरो वर्षेन्दो दयुम्नवत्तमः आ योनिं धर्णसिः सदः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vacyasva mahi psaro vṛṣendo dyumnavattamaḥ ā yoniṃ dharṇasiḥ sadaḥ

translations.griffith: As mighty food speed hitherward, Indu, as a most splendid Steer:  Sit in thy place as one with strength.

verses.sanskrit: अधुक्षत परियं मधु धारा सुतस्य वेधसः अपो वसिष्ट सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: adhukṣata priyaṃ madhu dhārā sutasya vedhasaḥ apo vasiṣṭa sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: The well-loved meath was made to flow, the stream of the creative juice  ne Sage drew waters to himself.

verses.sanskrit: महान्तं तवा महीरन्वापो अर्षन्ति सिन्धवः यद गोभिर्वासयिष्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: mahāntaṃ tvā mahīranvāpo arṣanti sindhavaḥ yad ghobhirvāsayiṣyase

translations.griffith: The mighty waters, yea, the floods accompany thee Mighty One,  When thou wilt clothe thee with the milk.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रो अप्सु माम्र्जे विष्टम्भो धरुणो दिवः सोमः पवित्रे अस्मयुः |||
verses.transliteration: samudro apsu māmṛje viṣṭambho dharuṇo divaḥ somaḥ pavitre asmayuḥ

translations.griffith: The lake is brightened in the floods. Soma, our Friend, heaven's prop and stay,  Falls on the purifying cloth.

verses.sanskrit: अचिक्रदद वर्षा हरिर्महान मित्रो न दर्शतः सं सूर्येण रोचते |||
verses.transliteration: acikradad vṛṣā harirmahān mitro na darśataḥ saṃ sūryeṇa rocate

translations.griffith: The tawny Bull hath bellowed, fair as mighty Mitra to behold:  He shines together with the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: गिरस्त इन्द ओजसा मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते अपस्युवः याभिर्मदाय शुम्भसे |||
verses.transliteration: ghirasta inda ojasā marmṛjyante apasyuvaḥ yābhirmadāya śumbhase

translations.griffith: Songs, Indu, active in their might are beautified for thee, wherewith  Thou deckest thee for our delight.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा मदाय घर्ष्वय उ लोकक्र्त्नुमीमहे तव परशस्तयो महीः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā madāya ghṛṣvaya u lokakṛtnumīmahe tava praśastayo mahīḥ

translations.griffith: To thee who givest ample room we pray, to win the joyous draught:  Great are the praise& due to thee.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यमिन्दविन्द्रयुर्मध्वः पवस्व धारया पर्जन्यो वर्ष्टिमानिव |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyamindavindrayurmadhvaḥ pavasva dhārayā parjanyo vṛṣṭimāniva

translations.griffith: Indu as, Indra's Friend, on us pour with a stream of sweetness, like  Parjanya sender of the rain.

verses.sanskrit: गोषा इन्दो नर्षा अस्यश्वसा वाजसा उत आत्मा यज्ञस्य पूर्व्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ghoṣā indo nṛṣā asyaśvasā vājasā uta ātmā yajñasya pūrvyaḥ

translations.griffith: Winner of kine, Indu, art thou, winner of heroes, steeds, and strength  Primeval Soul of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: एष देवो अमर्त्यः पर्णवीरिव दीयति अभि दरोणान्यासदम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa devo amartyaḥ parṇavīriva dīyati abhi droṇānyāsadam

translations.griffith: HERE present this Immortal God flies, like a bird upon her wings,  To settle in the vats of wood.

verses.sanskrit: एष देवो विपा कर्तो.अति हवरांसि धावति पवमानो अदाभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa devo vipā kṛto.ati hvarāṃsi dhāvati pavamāno adābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: This God, made ready with the hymn, runs swiftly through the winding ways,  Inviolable as he flows.

verses.sanskrit: एष देवो विपन्युभिः पवमान रतायुभिः हरिर्वाजाय मर्ज्यते |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa devo vipanyubhiḥ pavamāna ṛtāyubhiḥ harirvājāya mṛjyate

translations.griffith: This God while flowing is adorned, like a bay steed for war, by men  Devout and skilled in holy songs.

verses.sanskrit: एष विश्वानि वार्या शूरो यन्निव सत्वभिः पवमानःसिषासति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa viśvāni vāryā śūro yanniva satvabhiḥ pavamānaḥsiṣāsati

translations.griffith: He, like a warrior going forth with heroes, as he flows along  Is fain to win all precious boons.

verses.sanskrit: एष देवो रथर्यति पवमानो दशस्यति आविष कर्णोति वग्वनुम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa devo ratharyati pavamāno daśasyati āviṣ kṛṇoti vaghvanum

translations.griffith: This God, as he is flowing on, speeds like a car and gives his gifts:  He lets his voice be heard of all

verses.sanskrit: एष विप्रैरभिष्टुतो.अपो देवो वि गाहते दधद रत्नानिदाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa viprairabhiṣṭuto.apo devo vi ghāhate dadhad ratnānidāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Praised by the sacred bards, this God dives into waters, and bestows  Rich gifts upon the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: एष दिवं वि धावति तिरो रजांसि धारया पवमानःकनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa divaṃ vi dhāvati tiro rajāṃsi dhārayā pavamānaḥkanikradat

translations.griffith: Away he rushes with his stream, across the regions, into heaven,  And roars as he is flowing on.

verses.sanskrit: एष दिवं वयासरत तिरो रजाण्स्यस्प्र्तः पवमानः सवध्वरः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa divaṃ vyāsarat tiro rajāṇsyaspṛtaḥ pavamānaḥ svadhvaraḥ

translations.griffith: While flowing, meet for sacrifice, he hath gone up to heaven across  The regions, irresistible.

verses.sanskrit: एष परत्नेन जन्मना देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः हरिः पवित्रेर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa pratnena janmanā devo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ hariḥ pavitrearṣati

translations.griffith: After the 'way of ancient time, this God, pressed out for Deities,  Flows tawny to the straining-cloth.

verses.sanskrit: एष उ सय पुरुव्रतो जज्ञानो जनयन्निषः धारया पवते सुतः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa u sya puruvrato jajñāno janayanniṣaḥ dhārayā pavate sutaḥ

translations.griffith: This Lord of many Holy Laws, even at his birth engendering strength,  Effused, flows onward in a stream.

verses.sanskrit: सना च सोम जेषि च पवमान महि शरवः अथा नो वस्यसस कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: sanā ca soma jeṣi ca pavamāna mahi śravaḥ athā no vasyasas kṛdhi

translations.griffith: O Soma flowing on thy way, win thou and conquer high renown;  And make us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: सना जयोतिः सना सवर्विश्वा च सोम सौभगा अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: sanā jyotiḥ sanā svarviśvā ca soma saubhaghā athā ...

translations.griffith: Win thou the light, win heavenly light, and, Soma, all felicities;  And make us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: सना दक्षमुत करतुमप सोम मर्धो जहि अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: sanā dakṣamuta kratumapa soma mṛdho jahi athā ...

translations.griffith: Win skilful strength and mental power. O Soma, drive away our foes;  And make us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: पवीतारः पुनीतन सोममिन्द्राय पातवे अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: pavītāraḥ punītana somamindrāya pātave athā ...

translations.griffith: Ye purifiers, purify Soma for Indra, for his drink:  Make thou us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सूर्ये न आ भज तव करत्वा तवोतिभिः अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ sūrye na ā bhaja tava kratvā tavotibhiḥ athā ...

translations.griffith: Give us our portion in the Sun through thine own mental power and aids;  And make us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: तव करत्वा तवोतिभिर्ज्योक पश्येम सूर्यम अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: tava kratvā tavotibhirjyok paśyema sūryam athā ...

translations.griffith: Through thine own mental power and aid long may we look upon the Sun;  Make thou us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यर्ष सवायुध सोम दविबर्हसं रयिम अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: abhyarṣa svāyudha soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim athā ...

translations.griffith: Well-weaponed Soma, pour to usa stream of riches doubly great;  And make us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यर्षानपच्युतो रयिं समत्सु सासहिः अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: abhyarṣānapacyuto rayiṃ samatsu sāsahiḥ athā ...

translations.griffith: As one victorious unsubdued in battle pour forth wealth to us;  And make us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: तवां यज्ञैरवीव्र्धन पवमान विधर्मणि अथा ... |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ yajñairavīvṛdhan pavamāna vidharmaṇi athā ...

translations.griffith: By worship, Pavamana! men have strengthened thee to prop the Law:  Make thou us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: रयिं नश्चित्रमश्विनमिन्दो विश्वायमा भर अथा .. . |||
verses.transliteration: rayiṃ naścitramaśvinamindo viśvāyamā bhara athā .. .

translations.griffith: O Indu, bring us wealth in steeds, manifold. quickening all life;  And mate us better than we are.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धो विश्वतस पतिः पवमानो वि राजति परीणन वर्षा कनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: samiddho viśvatas patiḥ pavamāno vi rājati prīṇan vṛṣā kanikradat

translations.griffith: ENKINDLED, Pavamana, Lord, sends forth his light on, every side  In friendly show, the bellowing Bull.

verses.sanskrit: तनूनपात पवमानः शर्ङगे शिशानो अर्षति अन्तरिक्षेण रारजत |||
verses.transliteration: tanūnapāt pavamānaḥ śṛṅghe śiśāno arṣati antarikṣeṇa rārajat

translations.griffith: He, Pavamana, Self-produced, speeds onward sharpening his horns:  He glitters through the firmament.

verses.sanskrit: ईळेन्यः पवमानो रयिर्वि राजति दयुमान मधोर्धाराभिरोजसा |||
verses.transliteration: īḷenyaḥ pavamāno rayirvi rājati dyumān madhordhārābhirojasā

translations.griffith: Brilliant like wealth, adorable, with splendour Pavamana shines,  Mightily with the streams of meath.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हिः पराचीनमोजसा पवमान सत्र्णन हरिः देवेषु देव ईयते |||
verses.transliteration: barhiḥ prācīnamojasā pavamāna stṛṇan hariḥ deveṣu deva īyate

translations.griffith: The tawny Pavamana, who strews from of old the grass with might,  Is worshipped, God amid the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: उदातैर्जिहते बर्हद दवारो देवीर्हिरण्ययीः पवमानेन सुष्टुताः |||
verses.transliteration: udātairjihate bṛhad dvāro devīrhiraṇyayīḥ pavamānena suṣṭutāḥ

translations.griffith: The golden, the Celestial Doors are lifted with their frames on high,  By Pavamana glorified.

verses.sanskrit: सुशिल्पे बर्हती मही पवमानो वर्षण्यति नक्तोषासा नदर्शते |||
verses.transliteration: suśilpe bṛhatī mahī pavamāno vṛṣaṇyati naktoṣāsā nadarśate

translations.griffith: With passion Pavamana longs for the great lofty pair, well-formed  Like beauteous maidens, Night and Dawn

verses.sanskrit: उभा देवा नर्चक्षसा होतारा दैव्या हुवे पवमान इन्द्रोव्र्षा |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā devā nṛcakṣasā hotārā daivyā huve pavamāna indrovṛṣā

translations.griffith: Both Gods who look on men I call, Celestial Heralds: Indra's Self  Is Pavamana, yea, the Bull.

verses.sanskrit: भारती पवमानस्य सरस्वतीळा मही इमं नो यज्ञमा गमन तिस्रो देवीः सुपेशसः |||
verses.transliteration: bhāratī pavamānasya sarasvatīḷā mahī imaṃ no yajñamā ghaman tisro devīḥ supeśasaḥ

translations.griffith: This, Pavamana's sacrifice, shall the three beauteous Goddesses,  Sarasvatī and Bhāratī and Iḷā, Mighty One, attend.

verses.sanskrit: तवष्टारमग्रजां गोपां पुरोयावानमा हुवे इन्दुरिन्द्रो वर्षा हरिः पवमानः परजापतिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṣṭāramaghrajāṃ ghopāṃ puroyāvānamā huve indurindro vṛṣā hariḥ pavamānaḥ prajāpatiḥ

translations.griffith: 1 summon Tvaṣṭar hither, our protector, champion, earliest-born,  Indu is Indra, tawny Steer; Pavamana is Prajāpati.

verses.sanskrit: वनस्पतिं पवमान मध्वा समङगधि धारया सहस्रवल्शं हरितं भराजमानं हिरण्ययम |||
verses.transliteration: vanaspatiṃ pavamāna madhvā samaṅghdhi dhārayā sahasravalśaṃ haritaṃ bhrājamānaṃ hiraṇyayam

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, with the meath in streams anoint Vanaspati,  The ever-green. the golden-hued, refulgent, with a thousand boughs.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवाः सवाहाक्र्तिं पवमानस्या गत वायुर्ब्र्हस्पतिः सूर्यो.अग्निरिन्द्रः सजोषसः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāḥ svāhākṛtiṃ pavamānasyā ghata vāyurbṛhaspatiḥ sūryo.aghnirindraḥ sajoṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: Come to the consecrating rite of Pavamana, all ye Gods,—  Vāyu, Sūrya, Bṛhaspati, Indra, and Agni, in accord.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रया सोम धारया वर्षा पवस्व देवयुः अव्यो वारेष्वस्मयुः |||
verses.transliteration: mandrayā soma dhārayā vṛṣā pavasva devayuḥ avyo vāreṣvasmayuḥ

translations.griffith: SOMA, flow on with pleasant stream, a Bull devoted to the Gods,  Our Friend, unto the woollen sieve.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तयं मद्यं मदमिन्दविन्द्र इति कषर अभि वाजिनोर्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tyaṃ madyaṃ madamindavindra iti kṣara abhi vājinoarvataḥ

translations.griffith: Pour hitherward, as Indra's Self, Indu, that gladdening stream of thine,  And send us coursers full of strength.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तयं पूर्व्यं मदं सुवानो अर्ष पवित्र आ अभि वाजमुत शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tyaṃ pūrvyaṃ madaṃ suvāno arṣa pavitra ā abhi vājamuta śravaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow to the filter hitherward, pouring that ancient gladdening juice,  Streaming forth power and high renown.

verses.sanskrit: अनु दरप्सास इन्दव आपो न परवतासरन पुनाना इन्द्रमाशत |||
verses.transliteration: anu drapsāsa indava āpo na pravatāsaran punānā indramāśata

translations.griffith: Hither the sparkling drops have flowed, like waters down a steep descent  They have reached Indra purified.

verses.sanskrit: यमत्यमिव वाजिनं मर्जन्ति योषणो दश वने करीळन्तमत्यविम |||
verses.transliteration: yamatyamiva vājinaṃ mṛjanti yoṣaṇo daśa vane krīḷantamatyavim

translations.griffith: Whom, having passed the filter, ten dames cleanse, as ’twere a vigorous steed,  While he disports him in the wood,—

verses.sanskrit: तं गोभिर्व्र्षणं रसं मदाय देववीतये सुतं भराय सं सर्ज |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ghobhirvṛṣaṇaṃ rasaṃ madāya devavītaye sutaṃ bharāya saṃ sṛja

translations.griffith: The steer-strong juice with milk pour forth, for feast and service of the Gods,  To him who bears away the draught.

verses.sanskrit: देवो देवाय धारयेन्द्राय पवते सुतः पयो यदस्य पीपयत |||
verses.transliteration: devo devāya dhārayendrāya pavate sutaḥ payo yadasya pīpayat

translations.griffith: Effused, the God flows onward with his stream to Indra, to the God,  So that his milk may strengthen him.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मा यज्ञस्य रंह्या सुष्वाणः पवते सुतः परत्नंनि पाति काव्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ātmā yajñasya raṃhyā suṣvāṇaḥ pavate sutaḥ pratnaṃni pāti kāvyam

translations.griffith: Soul of the sacrifice, the juice effused flows quickly on: he keeps  His ancient wisdom of a Sage.

verses.sanskrit: एवा पुनान इन्द्रयुर्मदं मदिष्ठ वीतये गुहा चिद दधिषे गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: evā punāna indrayurmadaṃ madiṣṭha vītaye ghuhā cid dadhiṣe ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: So pouring forth, as Indra's Friend, strong drink, best Gladdener! for the feast,  Thou, even in secret, storest hymns.

verses.sanskrit: अस्र्ग्रम इन्दवः पथा धर्मन्न रतस्य सुश्रियः विदाना अस्य योजनम |||
verses.transliteration: asṛghram indavaḥ pathā dharmann ṛtasya suśriyaḥ vidānā asya yojanam

translations.griffith: FORTH on their way the glorious drops have flowed for maintenance of Law,  Knowing this sacrifice's course.

verses.sanskrit: पर धारा मध्वो अग्रियो महीर अपो वि गाहते हविर हविष्षु वन्द्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pra dhārā madhvo aghriyo mahīr apo vi ghāhate havir haviṣṣu vandyaḥ

translations.griffith: Down in the mighty waters sinks the stream of meath, most excellent,  Oblation best of all in worth.

verses.sanskrit: पर युजो वाचो अग्रियो वर्षाव चक्रदद वने सद्माभि सत्यो अध्वरः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yujo vāco aghriyo vṛṣāva cakradad vane sadmābhi satyo adhvaraḥ

translations.griffith: About the holy place, the Steer true, guileless, noblest, hath sent forth  Continuous voices in the wood.

verses.sanskrit: परि यत काव्या कविर नर्म्णा वसानो अर्षति सवर वाजी सिषासति |||
verses.transliteration: pari yat kāvyā kavir nṛmṇā vasāno arṣati svar vājī siṣāsati

translations.griffith: When, clothed in manly strength, the Sage flows in celestial wisdom round,  The Strong would win the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानो अभि सप्र्धो विशो राजेव सीदति यद ईम रण्वन्ति वेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāno abhi spṛdho viśo rājeva sīdati yad īm ṛṇvanti vedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: When purified, he sits as King above the hosts, among his folk,  What time the sages bring him nigh.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यो वारे परि परियो हरिर वनेषु सीदति रेभो वनुष्यते मती |||
verses.transliteration: avyo vāre pari priyo harir vaneṣu sīdati rebho vanuṣyate matī

translations.griffith: Dear, golden-coloured, in the fleece he sinks and settles in the wood:  The Singer shows his zeal in hymns.

verses.sanskrit: स वायुम इन्द्रम अश्विना साकम मदेन गछति रणा यो अस्य धर्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa vāyum indram aśvinā sākam madena ghachati raṇā yo asya dharmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: He goes to Indra, Vāyu, to the Aśvins, as his custom is,  With gladdening juice which gives them joy.

verses.sanskrit: आ मित्रावरुणा भगम मध्वः पवन्त ऊर्मयः विदाना अस्य शक्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā mitrāvaruṇā bhagham madhvaḥ pavanta ūrmayaḥ vidānā asya śakmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Tle streams of pleasant Soma flow to Bhaga, Mitra-Varuṇa,—  Well-knowing through his mighty powers.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं रोदसी रयिम मध्वो वाजस्य सातये शरवो वसूनि सं जितम |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ rodasī rayim madhvo vājasya sātaye śravo vasūni saṃ jitam

translations.griffith: Heaven and Earth, riches of meath to win us wealth:  Gain for us treasures and renown.

verses.sanskrit: एते सोमा अभि परियम इन्द्रस्य कामम अक्षरन वर्धन्तो अस्य वीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ete somā abhi priyam indrasya kāmam akṣaran vardhanto asya vīryam

translations.griffith: OBEYING Indra's dear desire these Soma juices have flowed forth,  Increasing his heroic might.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानासश चमूषदो गछन्तो वायुम अश्विना ते नो धान्तु सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: punānāsaś camūṣado ghachanto vāyum aśvinā te no dhāntu suvīryam

translations.griffith: Laid in the bowl, pure-flowing on to Vāyu and the Aśvins, may  These give us great heroic strength.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य सोम राधसे पुनानो हार्दि चोदय रतस्य योनिम आसदम |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya soma rādhase punāno hārdi codaya ṛtasya yonim āsadam

translations.griffith: Soma, as thou art purified, incite to bounty Indra's heart,  To sit in place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: मर्जन्ति तवा दश कषिपो हिन्वन्ति सप्त धीतयः अनु विप्रा अमादिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: mṛjanti tvā daśa kṣipo hinvanti sapta dhītayaḥ anu viprā amādiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: The ten swift fingers deck thee forth, seven ministers impel thee on:  The sages have rejoiced in thee.

verses.sanskrit: देवेभ्यस तवा मदाय कं सर्जानम अति मेष्यः सं गोभिर वासयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: devebhyas tvā madāya kaṃ sṛjānam ati meṣyaḥ saṃ ghobhir vāsayāmasi

translations.griffith: When through the filter thou art poured, we clothe thee with a robe of milk  To be a gladdening draught for Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानः कलशेष्व आ वस्त्राण्य अरुषो हरिः परि गव्यान्य अव्यत |||
verses.transliteration: punānaḥ kalaśeṣv ā vastrāṇy aruṣo hariḥ pari ghavyāny avyata

translations.griffith: When purified within the jars, Soma, brightred and golden-hued,  Hath clothed him with a robe of milk.

verses.sanskrit: मघोन आ पवस्व नो जहि विश्वा अप दविषः इन्दो सखायम आ विश |||
verses.transliteration: maghona ā pavasva no jahi viśvā apa dviṣaḥ indo sakhāyam ā viśa

translations.griffith: Flow on to us and make us rich. Drive all our enemies away.  O Indu, flow into thy Friend.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्टिं दिवः परि सरव दयुम्नम पर्थिव्या अधि सहो नः सोम पर्त्सु धाः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ pari srava dyumnam pṛthivyā adhi saho naḥ soma pṛtsu dhāḥ

translations.griffith: Send down the rain from heaven, a stream of opulence from earth. Give us,  O Soma, victory in war.

verses.sanskrit: नर्चक्षसं तवा वयम इन्द्रपीतं सवर्विदम भक्षीमहि परजाम इषम |||
verses.transliteration: nṛcakṣasaṃ tvā vayam indrapītaṃ svarvidam bhakṣīmahi prajām iṣam

translations.griffith: May we obtain thee, Indra's drink, who viewest men and findest light,  Gain thee, and progeny and food.

verses.sanskrit: परि परिया दिवः कविर वयांसि नप्त्य्र हितः सुवानो याति कविक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: pari priyā divaḥ kavir vayāṃsi naptyr hitaḥ suvāno yāti kavikratuḥ

translations.griffith: THE Sage of Heaven whose heart is wise, when laid between both hands and pressed,  Sends us delightful powers of life.

verses.sanskrit: पर-पर कषयाय पन्यसे जनाय जुष्टो अद्रुहे वीत्य अर्ष चनिष्ठया |||
verses.transliteration: pra-pra kṣayāya panyase janāya juṣṭo adruhe vīty arṣa caniṣṭhayā

translations.griffith: On, onward to a glorious home; dear to the people void of guile,  With excellent enjoyment, flow.

verses.sanskrit: स सूनुर मातरा शुचिर जातो जाते अरोचयत महान मही रताव्र्धा |||
verses.transliteration: sa sūnur mātarā śucir jāto jāte arocayat mahān mahī ṛtāvṛdhā

translations.griffith: He, the bright Son, when born illumed his Parents who had sprung to life,  Great Son great Strengtheners of Law.

verses.sanskrit: स सप्त धीतिभिर हितो नद्य अजिन्वद अद्रुहः या एकम अक्षि वाव्र्धुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa sapta dhītibhir hito nady ajinvad adruhaḥ yā ekam akṣi vāvṛdhuḥ

translations.griffith: Urged by the seven devotions he hath stirred the guileless rivers which  Have magnified the Single Eye.

verses.sanskrit: ता अभि सन्तम अस्त्र्तम महे युवानम आ दधुः इन्दुम इन्द्र तव वरते |||
verses.transliteration: tā abhi santam astṛtam mahe yuvānam ā dadhuḥ indum indra tava vrate

translations.griffith: These helped to might theYouthful One, high over all, invincible,  Even Indu, Indra! in thy law.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वह्निर अमर्त्यः सप्त पश्यति वावहिः करिविर देवीर अतर्पयत |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vahnir amartyaḥ sapta paśyati vāvahiḥ krivir devīr atarpayat

translations.griffith: The immortal Courser, good to draw, looks down upon the Seven: the fount  Hath satisfied the Goddesses

verses.sanskrit: अवा कल्पेषु नः पुमस तमांसि सोम योध्या तानि पुनान जघनः |||
verses.transliteration: avā kalpeṣu naḥ pumas tamāṃsi soma yodhyā tāni punāna jaghanaḥ

translations.griffith: Aid us in holy rites, O Man: O Pavamana, drive away  Dark shades that must be met in fight.

verses.sanskrit: नू नव्यसे नवीयसे सूक्ताय साधया पथः परत्नवद रोचया रुचः |||
verses.transliteration: nū navyase navīyase sūktāya sādhayā pathaḥ pratnavad rocayā rucaḥ

translations.griffith: Make the paths ready for a hymn newer and newer evermore:  Make the lights shine as erst they shone.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान महि शरवो गाम अश्वं रासि वीरवत सना मेधां सना सवः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna mahi śravo ghām aśvaṃ rāsi vīravat sanā medhāṃ sanā svaḥ

translations.griffith: Give, Pavamana, high renown, give kine and steeds and hero sons:  Win for us wisdom, win the light.

verses.sanskrit: पर सवानासो रथा इवार्वन्तो न शरवस्यवः सोमासो राये अक्रमुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra svānāso rathā ivārvanto na śravasyavaḥ somāso rāye akramuḥ

translations.griffith: LIKE cars that thunder on their way, like coursers eager for renown,  Have Soma-drops flowed forth for wealth.

verses.sanskrit: हिन्वानासो रथा इव दधन्विरे गभस्त्योः भरासः कारिणाम इव |||
verses.transliteration: hinvānāso rathā iva dadhanvire ghabhastyoḥ bharāsaḥ kāriṇām iva

translations.griffith: Forth have they rushed from holding hands, like chariots that are urged to speed,  Like joyful songs of singing-men.

verses.sanskrit: राजानो न परशस्तिभिः सोमासो गोभिर अञ्जते यज्ञो न सप्त धात्र्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: rājāno na praśastibhiḥ somāso ghobhir añjate yajño na sapta dhātṛbhiḥ

translations.griffith: The Somas deck themselves with milk, as Kings are graced with eulogies,  And, with seven priests, the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: परि सुवानास इन्दवो मदाय बर्हणा गिरा सुता अर्षन्ति धारया |||
verses.transliteration: pari suvānāsa indavo madāya barhaṇā ghirā sutā arṣanti dhārayā

translations.griffith: Pressed for the gladdening draught, the drops flow forth abundantly with song,  The Soma juices in a stream.

verses.sanskrit: आपानासो विवस्वतो जनन्त उषसो भगम सूरा अण्वं वि तन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: āpānāso vivasvato jananta uṣaso bhagham sūrā aṇvaṃ vi tanvate

translations.griffith: Winning Vivasvān's glory and producing Morning's light, the Suns  Pass through the openings of the cloth.

verses.sanskrit: अप दवारा मतीनाम परत्ना रण्वन्ति कारवः वर्ष्णो हरस आयवः |||
verses.transliteration: apa dvārā matīnām pratnā ṛṇvanti kāravaḥ vṛṣṇo harasa āyavaḥ

translations.griffith: The singing-men of ancient time open the doors of sacred songs,—  Men, for the mighty to accept.

verses.sanskrit: समीचीनास आसते होतारः सप्तजामयः पदम एकस्य पिप्रतः |||
verses.transliteration: samīcīnāsa āsate hotāraḥ saptajāmayaḥ padam ekasya piprataḥ

translations.griffith: Combined in close society sit the seven priests, the brother-hood,  Filling the station of the One.

verses.sanskrit: नाभा नाभिं न आ ददे चक्षुश चित सूर्ये सचा कवेर अपत्यम आ दुहे |||
verses.transliteration: nābhā nābhiṃ na ā dade cakṣuś cit sūrye sacā kaver apatyam ā duhe

translations.griffith: He gives us kinship with the Gods, and with the Sun unites our eye:  The Sage's ofrspring hath appeared.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परिया दिवस पदम अध्वर्युभिर गुहा हितम सूरः पश्यति चक्षसा |||
verses.transliteration: abhi priyā divas padam adhvaryubhir ghuhā hitam sūraḥ paśyati cakṣasā

translations.griffith: The Sun with his dear eye beholds that quarter of the heavens which priests  Have placed within the sacred cell.

verses.sanskrit: उपास्मै गायता नरः पवमानायेन्दवे अभि देवां इयक्षते |||
verses.transliteration: upāsmai ghāyatā naraḥ pavamānāyendave abhi devāṃ iyakṣate

translations.griffith: SING forth to Indu, O ye men, to him who is purified,  Fain to pay worship to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अभि ते मधुना पयो ऽथर्वाणो अशिश्रयुः देवं देवाय देवयु |||
verses.transliteration: abhi te madhunā payo 'tharvāṇo aśiśrayuḥ devaṃ devāya devayu

translations.griffith: Together with thy pleasant juice the Atharvans have commingled milk,  Divine, devoted to the God.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पवस्व शं गवे शं जनाय शम अर्वते शं राजन्न ओषधीभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pavasva śaṃ ghave śaṃ janāya śam arvate śaṃ rājann oṣadhībhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Bring, by thy flowing, weal to kine, weal to the people, weal to steeds.  Weal, O thou King, to growing plants

verses.sanskrit: बभ्रवे नु सवतवसे ऽरुणाय दिविस्प्र्शे सोमाय गाथम अर्चत |||
verses.transliteration: babhrave nu svatavase 'ruṇāya divispṛśe somāya ghātham arcata

translations.griffith: Sing a praise-song to Soma brown of hue, of independent might.  The Red, who reaches up to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: हस्तच्युतेभिर अद्रिभिः सुतं सोमम पुनीतन मधाव आ धावता मधु |||
verses.transliteration: hastacyutebhir adribhiḥ sutaṃ somam punītana madhāv ā dhāvatā madhu

translations.griffith: Purify Soma when effused with stones which bands move rapidly,  And pour the sweet milk in the meath.

verses.sanskrit: नमसेद उप सीदत दध्नेद अभि शरीणीतन इन्दुम इन्द्रे दधातन |||
verses.transliteration: namased upa sīdata dadhned abhi śrīṇītana indum indre dadhātana

translations.griffith: With humble homage draw ye nigh; blend the libation with the curds:  To Indra offer Indu up.

verses.sanskrit: अमित्रहा विचर्षणिः पवस्व सोम शं गवे देवेभ्यो अनुकामक्र्त |||
verses.transliteration: amitrahā vicarṣaṇiḥ pavasva soma śaṃ ghave devebhyo anukāmakṛt

translations.griffith: Soma, foe-que chief o’er men, doing the will of pour forth  Prosperity upon our kine.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे मदाय परि षिच्यसे मनश्चिन मनसस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya soma pātave madāya pari ṣicyase manaścin manasas patiḥ

translations.griffith: Heart-knower, Sovran of the heart, thou art effused, O Soma, that Indra may drink thee and rejoice.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान सुवीर्यं रयिं सोम रिरीहि नः इन्दव इन्द्रेण नो युजा |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna suvīryaṃ rayiṃ soma rirīhi naḥ indav indreṇa no yujā

translations.griffith: O Soma Pavamana, give us riches and heroic strength,—  Indu! with. Indra for ally.

verses.sanskrit: सोमा अस्र्ग्रमिन्दवः सुता रतस्य सादने इन्द्राय मधुमत्तमाः |||
verses.transliteration: somā asṛghramindavaḥ sutā ṛtasya sādane indrāya madhumattamāḥ

translations.griffith: To Indra have the Soma drops, exceeding rich in sweets, been poured,  Shed in the seat of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: अभि विप्रा अनूषत गावो वत्सं न मातरः इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: abhi viprā anūṣata ghāvo vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ indraṃ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: As mother kine low to their calves, to Indra have the sages called,  Called him to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: मदच्युत कषेति सादने सिन्धोरूर्मा विपश्चित सोमो गौरीधि शरितः |||
verses.transliteration: madacyut kṣeti sādane sindhorūrmā vipaścit somo ghaurīadhi śritaḥ

translations.griffith: In the stream's wave wise Soma dwells, distilling rapture, in his seat,  Resting upon a wiId-cow's hide.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो नाभा विचक्षणो.अव्यो वारे महीयते सोमो यः सुक्रतुः कविः |||
verses.transliteration: divo nābhā vicakṣaṇo.avyo vāre mahīyate somo yaḥ sukratuḥ kaviḥ

translations.griffith: Far-sighted Soma, Sage and Seer, is worshipped in the central point  Of heaven, the straining-cloth of wool.

verses.sanskrit: यः सोमः कलशेष्वा अन्तः पवित्र आहितः तमिन्दुः परि षस्वजे |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ somaḥ kalaśeṣvā antaḥ pavitra āhitaḥ taminduḥ pari ṣasvaje

translations.griffith: In close embraces Indu holds Soma when  poured within the jars.  And on the. purifying sieve.

verses.sanskrit: पर वाचमिन्दुरिष्यति समुद्रस्याधि विष्टपि जिन्वन कोशं मधुश्चुतम |||
verses.transliteration: pra vācaminduriṣyati samudrasyādhi viṣṭapi jinvan kośaṃ madhuścutam

translations.griffith: Indu sends forth a voice on high to regions of the sea of air,  Shaking the vase that drops with meath.

verses.sanskrit: नित्यस्तोत्रो वनस्पतिर्धीनामन्तः सबर्दुघः हिन्वानोमानुषा युगा |||
verses.transliteration: nityastotro vanaspatirdhīnāmantaḥ sabardughaḥ hinvānomānuṣā yughā

translations.griffith: The Tree whose praises never fail yields heavenly milk among our hymns,  Urging men's generations on.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परिया दिवस पदा सोमो हिन्वानो अर्षति विप्रस्य धारया कविः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi priyā divas padā somo hinvāno arṣati viprasya dhārayā kaviḥ

translations.griffith: The Wise One, with the Sage's stream, the Soma urged to speed, flows on  To the dear places of the sky.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवमान धारय रयिं सहस्रवर्चसम अस्मे इन्दो सवाभुवम |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavamāna dhāraya rayiṃ sahasravarcasam asme indo svābhuvam

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, bring us wealth bright with a thousand splendours. Yea.  O Indu, give us ready help.

verses.sanskrit: सोमः पुनानो अर्षति सहस्रधारो अत्यविः वायोरिन्द्रस्यनिष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: somaḥ punāno arṣati sahasradhāro atyaviḥ vāyorindrasyaniṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: PASSED through, the fleece in thousand streams the Soma, purified, flows on  To Indra's, Viyu's special place.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानमवस्यवो विप्रमभि पर गायत सुष्वाणं देववीतये |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānamavasyavo vipramabhi pra ghāyata suṣvāṇaṃ devavītaye

translations.griffith: Sing forth, ye men who long for help, to Pavamana, to the Sage,  Effused to entertain the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पवन्ते वाजसातये सोमाः सहस्रपाजसः गर्णाना देववीतये |||
verses.transliteration: pavante vājasātaye somāḥ sahasrapājasaḥ ghṛṇānā devavītaye

translations.griffith: The Soma-drops with thousand powers are purified for victory,  Hymned to become the feast of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो वाजसातये पवस्व बर्हतीरिषः दयुमदिन्दो सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: uta no vājasātaye pavasva bṛhatīriṣaḥ dyumadindo suvīryam

translations.griffith: Yea, as thou flowest bring great store of food that we may win the spoil  Indu, bring splendid manly might.

verses.sanskrit: ते नः सहस्रिणं रयिं पवन्तामा सुवीर्यम सुवाना देवास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: te naḥ sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ pavantāmā suvīryam suvānā devāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: May they in flowing give us wealth in thousands, and heroic power,—  These Godlike Soma-drops effused.

verses.sanskrit: अत्या हियाना न हेत्र्भिरस्र्ग्रं वाजसातये वि वारमव्यमाशवः |||
verses.transliteration: atyā hiyānā na hetṛbhirasṛghraṃ vājasātaye vi vāramavyamāśavaḥ

translations.griffith: Like coursers by their drivers urged, they were poured forth, for victory,  Swift through the woollen straining-cloth.

verses.sanskrit: वाश्रा अर्षन्तीन्दवो.अभि वत्सं न धेनवः दधन्विरेगभस्त्योः |||
verses.transliteration: vāśrā arṣantīndavo.abhi vatsaṃ na dhenavaḥ dadhanvireghabhastyoḥ

translations.griffith: Noisily flow the Soma-drops, like milch-kine lowing to their calves:  They have run forth from both the hands.

verses.sanskrit: जुष्ट इन्द्राय मत्सरः पवमान कनिक्रदत विश्वा अप दविषो जहि |||
verses.transliteration: juṣṭa indrāya matsaraḥ pavamāna kanikradat viśvā apa dviṣo jahi

translations.griffith: As Gladdener whom Indra loves, O Pavamana, with a roar  Drive all our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit: अपघ्नन्तो अराव्णः पवमानाः सवर्द्र्शः योनाव रतस्य सीदत |||
verses.transliteration: apaghnanto arāvṇaḥ pavamānāḥ svardṛśaḥ yonāv ṛtasya sīdata

translations.griffith: O Pavamamas, driving off the godless, looking on the light,  Sit in the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: परि परासिष्यदत कविः सिन्धोरूर्मावधि शरितः कारं बिभ्रत पुरुस्प्र्हम |||
verses.transliteration: pari prāsiṣyadat kaviḥ sindhorūrmāvadhi śritaḥ kāraṃ bibhrat puruspṛham

translations.griffith: REPOSING on the river's wave the Sage hath widely flowed around,  Bearing the hymn which many love.

verses.sanskrit: गिरा यदी सबन्धवः पञ्च वराता अपस्यवः परिष्क्र्ण्वन्ति धर्णसिम |||
verses.transliteration: ghirā yadī sabandhavaḥ pañca vrātā apasyavaḥ pariṣkṛṇvanti dharṇasim

translations.griffith: When the Five kindred Companies, active in duty, with the song  Establish him, the Powerful,

verses.sanskrit: आदस्य शुष्मिणो रसे विश्वे देवा अमत्सत यदी गोभिर्वसायते |||
verses.transliteration: ādasya śuṣmiṇo rase viśve devā amatsata yadī ghobhirvasāyate

translations.griffith: Then in his juice whose strength is great, have all the Gods rejoiced themselves,  When he hath clothed him in the milk.

verses.sanskrit: निरिणानो वि धावति जहच्छर्याणि तान्वा अत्रा सं जिघ्नते युजा |||
verses.transliteration: niriṇāno vi dhāvati jahaccharyāṇi tānvā atrā saṃ jighnate yujā

translations.griffith: Freeing himself he flows away, leaving his body's severed limbs,  And meets his own Companion here.

verses.sanskrit: नप्तीभिर्यो विवस्वतः शुभ्रो न माम्र्जे युवा गाः कर्ण्वानो न निर्णिजम |||
verses.transliteration: naptībhiryo vivasvataḥ śubhro na māmṛje yuvā ghāḥ kṛṇvāno na nirṇijam

translations.griffith: He by the daughters of the priest, like a fair youth, hath been adorned,  Making the milk, as ’twere, his robe.

verses.sanskrit: अति शरिती तिरश्चता गव्या जिगात्यण्व्या वग्नुमियर्ति यं विदे |||
verses.transliteration: ati śritī tiraścatā ghavyā jighātyaṇvyā vaghnumiyarti yaṃ vide

translations.griffith: O'er the fine fingers, through desire of milk, in winding course he goes,  And utters voice which he hath found.

verses.sanskrit: अभि कषिपः समग्मत मर्जयन्तीरिषस पतिम पर्ष्ठा गर्भ्णत वाजिनः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi kṣipaḥ samaghmata marjayantīriṣas patim pṛṣṭhā ghṛbhṇata vājinaḥ

translations.griffith: The nimble fingers have approached, adorning him the Lord of Strength:  They grasp the vigorous Courser's back.

verses.sanskrit: परि दिव्यानि मर्म्र्शद विश्वानि सोम पार्थिवा वसूनि याह्यस्मयुः |||
verses.transliteration: pari divyāni marmṛśad viśvāni soma pārthivā vasūni yāhyasmayuḥ

translations.griffith: Comprising all the treasures that are in the heavens and on the earth,  Come, Soma, as our faithful Friend.

verses.sanskrit: एष धिया यात्यण्व्य शूरो रथेभिराशुभिः गछन्निन्द्रस्य निष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa dhiyā yātyaṇvya śūro rathebhirāśubhiḥ ghachannindrasya niṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: THROUGH the fine fingers, with the song, this Hero comes with rapid ears,  Going to Indra's special place.

verses.sanskrit: एष पुरू धियायते बर्हते देवतातये यत्राम्र्तास आसते |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa purū dhiyāyate bṛhate devatātaye yatrāmṛtāsa āsate

translations.griffith: In holy thought he ponders much for the great worship of the Gods.  Where the Immortals have their seat.

verses.sanskrit: एष हितो वि नीयते.अन्तः शुभ्रावता पथा यदी तुञ्जन्ति भूर्णयः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa hito vi nīyate.antaḥ śubhrāvatā pathā yadī tuñjanti bhūrṇayaḥ

translations.griffith: Like a good horse is he led out, when on the path that shines with light  The mettled steeds exert their strength.

verses.sanskrit: एष शर्ङगाणि दोधुवच्छिशीते यूथ्यो वर्षा नर्म्णा दधान ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa śṛṅghāṇi dodhuvacchiśīte yūthyo vṛṣā nṛmṇā dadhāna ojasā

translations.griffith: He brandishes his horns on high, and whets them Bull who leads the herd,  Doing with might heroic deeds.

verses.sanskrit: एष रुक्मिभिरीयते वाजि शुभ्रेभिरंशुभिः पतिः सिन्धूनां भवन |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa rukmibhirīyate vāji śubhrebhiraṃśubhiḥ patiḥ sindhūnāṃ bhavan

translations.griffith: He moves, a vigorous Steed, adorned with beauteous rays of shining gold,  Becoming Sovran of the streams.

verses.sanskrit: एष वसूनि पिब्दना परुषा ययिवानति अव शादेषु गछति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa vasūni pibdanā paruṣā yayivānati ava śādeṣu ghachati

translations.griffith: He, over places rough to pass, bringing rich treasures closely packed.  Descends into the reservoirs.

verses.sanskrit: एतं मर्जन्ति मर्ज्यमुप दरोणेष्वायवः परचक्राणं महीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ mṛjanti marjyamupa droṇeṣvāyavaḥ pracakrāṇaṃ mahīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Men beautify him in the vats, him worthy to be beautified,  Him who brings forth abundant food.

verses.sanskrit: एतमु तयं दश कषिपो मर्जन्ति सप्त धीतयः सवायुधं मदिन्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: etamu tyaṃ daśa kṣipo mṛjanti sapta dhītayaḥ svāyudhaṃ madintamam

translations.griffith: Him, even him, the fingers ten and the seven songs make beautiful,  Well-weaponed, best of gladdeners.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते सोतार ओण्यो रसं मदाय घर्ष्वय सर्गो न तक्त्येतशः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te sotāra oṇyo rasaṃ madāya ghṛṣvaya sargho na taktyetaśaḥ

translations.griffith: THE pressers from the Soma-press send forth thy juice for rapturous joy  The speckled sap runs like a flood.

verses.sanskrit: करत्वा दक्षस्य रथ्यमपो वसानमन्धसा गोषामण्वेषु सश्चिम |||
verses.transliteration: kratvā dakṣasya rathyamapo vasānamandhasā ghoṣāmaṇveṣu saścima

translations.griffith: With strength we follow through the sieve him who brings might and wins the kine,  Enrobed in water with his juice.

verses.sanskrit: अनप्तमप्सु दुष्टरं सोमं पवित्र आ सर्ज पुनीहीन्द्राय पातवे |||
verses.transliteration: anaptamapsu duṣṭaraṃ somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja punīhīndrāya pātave

translations.griffith: Pour on the sieve the Soma, ne’er subdued in waters, waterless,  And make it pure for Indra's drink.

verses.sanskrit: पर पुनानस्य चेतसा सोमः पवित्रे अर्षति करत्वा सधस्थमासदत |||
verses.transliteration: pra punānasya cetasā somaḥ pavitre arṣati kratvā sadhasthamāsadat

translations.griffith: Moved by the purifier's thought, the Soma flows into the sieve:  By wisdom it hath gained its home.

verses.sanskrit: पर तवा नमोभिरिन्दव इन्द्र सोमा अस्र्क्षत महे भरायकारिणः |||
verses.transliteration: pra tvā namobhirindava indra somā asṛkṣata mahe bharāyakāriṇaḥ

translations.griffith: With humble homage, Indra, have the Soma-drops flowed forth to thee,  Contending for the glorious prize.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानो रूपे अव्यये विश्वा अर्षन्नभि शरियः शूरो न गोषु तिष्ठति |||
verses.transliteration: punāno rūpe avyaye viśvā arṣannabhi śriyaḥ śūro na ghoṣu tiṣṭhati

translations.griffith: Purified in his fleecy garb, attaining every beauty, he  Stands, hero-like, amid the kine.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो न सानु पिप्युषी धारा सुतस्य वेधसः वर्था पवित्रे अर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: divo na sānu pipyuṣī dhārā sutasya vedhasaḥ vṛthā pavitre arṣati

translations.griffith: Swelling, as ’twere, to heights of heaven, the stream of the creative juice  Falls lightly on the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम विपश्चितं तना पुनान आयुषु अव्यो वारं वि धावसि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma vipaścitaṃ tanā punāna āyuṣu avyo vāraṃ vi dhāvasi

translations.griffith: Thus, Soma, purifying himwho knoweth song mid living men,  Thou wanderest through the cloth of wool.

verses.sanskrit: पर निम्नेनेव सिन्धवो घनन्तो वर्त्राणि भूर्णयः सोमा अस्र्ग्रमाशवः |||
verses.transliteration: pra nimneneva sindhavo ghnanto vṛtrāṇi bhūrṇayaḥ somā asṛghramāśavaḥ

translations.griffith: LIKE rivers down a steep descent, slaying the Vṛtras, full of zeal,  The rapid Soma-streams have flowed.

verses.sanskrit: अभि सुवानास इन्दवो वर्ष्टयः पर्थिवीमिव इन्द्रं सोमासो अक्षरन |||
verses.transliteration: abhi suvānāsa indavo vṛṣṭayaḥ pṛthivīmiva indraṃ somāso akṣaran

translations.griffith: The drops of Soma juice effused fall like the rain upon the earth:  To Indra flow the Soma-streams.

verses.sanskrit: अत्यूर्मिर्मत्सरो मदः सोमः पवित्रे अर्षति विघ्नन रक्षांसि देवयुः |||
verses.transliteration: atyūrmirmatsaro madaḥ somaḥ pavitre arṣati vighnan rakṣāṃsi devayuḥ

translations.griffith: With swelling wave the gladdening drink, the Soma, flows intoṭhe sieve,  Loving the Gods and slaying fiends.

verses.sanskrit: आ कलशेषु धावति पवित्रे परि षिच्यते उक्थैर्यज्ञेषुवर्धते |||
verses.transliteration: ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati pavitre pari ṣicyate ukthairyajñeṣuvardhate

translations.griffith: It hastens to the pitchers, poured upon the sieve it waxes strong  At sacrifices through the lauds.

verses.sanskrit: अति तरी सोम रोचना रोहन न भराजसे दिवम इष्णन सूर्यं न चोदयः |||
verses.transliteration: ati trī soma rocanā rohan na bhrājase divam iṣṇan sūryaṃ na codayaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, thou shinest mounting heaven as ’twere above light's triple realm,  And moving secm'st to speed the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: अभि विप्रा अनूषत मूर्धन यज्ञस्य कारवः दधानाश्चक्षसि परियम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi viprā anūṣata mūrdhan yajñasya kāravaḥ dadhānāścakṣasi priyam

translations.griffith: To him, the head of sacnfice, singers and bards have sung their songs,  Offering what he loves to see.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा वाजिनं नरो धीभिर्विप्रा अवस्यवः मर्जन्तिदेवतातये |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā vājinaṃ naro dhībhirviprā avasyavaḥ mṛjantidevatātaye

translations.griffith: The men, the sages with their hymns, eager for help, deck thee strong &teed,  Deck thee for service of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: मधोर्धारामनु कषर तीव्रः सधस्थमासदः चारुरताय पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: madhordhārāmanu kṣara tīvraḥ sadhasthamāsadaḥ cārurtāya pītaye

translations.griffith: Flow onward to the stream of meath rest efficacious in thy home,  Fair, to be drunk at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: परि सुवानो गिरिष्ठाः पवित्रे सोमो अक्षाः मदेषु सर्वधा असि |||
verses.transliteration: pari suvāno ghiriṣṭhāḥ pavitre somo akṣāḥ madeṣu sarvadhā asi

translations.griffith: THOU, Soma, dweller on the hills, effused, hast flowed into the sieve,:  All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विप्रस्त्वं कविर्मधु पर जातमन्धसः मदेषु... |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ viprastvaṃ kavirmadhu pra jātamandhasaḥ madeṣu...

translations.griffith: Thou art a sacred Bard, a Sage; the meath is offipring of thy sap:  All-bountcous art thou in carouse.

verses.sanskrit: तव विश्वे सजोषसो देवासः पीतिमाशत मदेषु ... |||
verses.transliteration: tava viśve sajoṣaso devāsaḥ pītimāśata madeṣu ...

translations.griffith: All Deities of one accord have come that they may drink of thee:  All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

verses.sanskrit: आ यो विश्वानि वार्या वसूनि हस्तयोर्दधे मदेषु ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā yo viśvāni vāryā vasūni hastayordadhe madeṣu ...

translations.griffith: He who containeth in his hands all treasures much to be desired:  All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

verses.sanskrit: य इमे रोदसी मही सं मातरेव दोहते मदेषु ... |||
verses.transliteration: ya ime rodasī mahī saṃ mātareva dohate madeṣu ...

translations.griffith: Who milketh out this mighty Pair, the Earth and Heaven, like mother kine  All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

verses.sanskrit: परि यो रोदसी उभे सद्यो वाजेभिरर्षति मदेषु ... |||
verses.transliteration: pari yo rodasī ubhe sadyo vājebhirarṣati madeṣu ...

translations.griffith: Who in a moment mightily floweth around these two world-halvcs:  All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

verses.sanskrit: स शुष्मी कलशेष्वा पुनानो अचिक्रदत मदेषु ... |||
verses.transliteration: sa śuṣmī kalaśeṣvā punāno acikradat madeṣu ...

translations.griffith: The Strong One, being purified, hath in the pitchers cried aloud:  All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

verses.sanskrit: यत सोम चित्रमुक्थ्यं दिव्यं पार्थिवं वसु तन नः पुनान आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: yat soma citramukthyaṃ divyaṃ pārthivaṃ vasu tan naḥ punāna ā bhara

translations.griffith: O SOMA, being purified bring us the wondrous treasure, meet  For lauds, that is in earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: युवं हि सथः सवर्पती इन्द्रश्च सोम गोपती ईशानापिप्यतं धियः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ hi sthaḥ svarpatī indraśca soma ghopatī īśānāpipyataṃ dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: For ye Twain, Indra, Soma, are Lords of the light, Lords of the kine:  Great Rulers, prosper ye our songs.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा पुनान आयुषु सतनयन्नधि बर्हिषि हरिः सन योनिमासदत |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā punāna āyuṣu stanayannadhi barhiṣi hariḥ san yonimāsadat

translations.griffith: The tawny Steer, while cleansed among the living, bellowing on the grass,  Hath sunk and settled in his home.

verses.sanskrit: अवावशन्त धीतयो वर्षभस्याधि रेतसि सूनोर्वत्सस्यमातरः |||
verses.transliteration: avāvaśanta dhītayo vṛṣabhasyādhi retasi sūnorvatsasyamātaraḥ

translations.griffith: Over the Steer's productive flow the sacred songs were resonant,  The mothers of the darling Son.

verses.sanskrit: कुविद वर्षण्यन्तीभ्यः पुनानो गर्भमादधत याः शुक्रं दुहते पयः |||
verses.transliteration: kuvid vṛṣaṇyantībhyaḥ punāno gharbhamādadhat yāḥ śukraṃ duhate payaḥ

translations.griffith: Hath he not, purified, impregned the kine whb long to meet their Lord,  The kine who yield the shining milk?

verses.sanskrit: उप शिक्षापतस्थुषो भियसमा धेहि शत्रुषु पवमानविदा रयिम |||
verses.transliteration: upa śikṣāpatasthuṣo bhiyasamā dhehi śatruṣu pavamānavidā rayim

translations.griffith: Bring near us those who stand aloof strike fear into our enemies:  O Pavamana, find us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: नि शत्रोः सोम वर्ष्ण्यं नि शुष्मं नि वयस्तिर दूरेवा सतो अन्ति वा |||
verses.transliteration: ni śatroḥ soma vṛṣṇyaṃ ni śuṣmaṃ ni vayastira dūrevā sato anti vā

translations.griffith: Soma, bring down the foeman's might, his vigorous strength and vital powe'r,  Whether he be afar or near.

verses.sanskrit: पर कविर्देववीतये.अव्यो वारेभिरर्षति साह्वान विश्वाभि सप्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: pra kavirdevavītaye.avyo vārebhirarṣati sāhvān viśvāabhi spṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: FORTH through the straining-cloth the Sage flows to the banquet of the Gods,  Subduing all our enemies.

verses.sanskrit: स हि षमा जरित्र्भ्य आ वाजं गोमन्तमिन्वति पवमानः सहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi ṣmā jaritṛbhya ā vājaṃ ghomantaminvati pavamānaḥ sahasriṇam

translations.griffith: For he, as Pavamana, sends thousandfold treasure in the shape  Of cattle to the singing-men.

verses.sanskrit: परि विश्वानि चेतसा मर्शसे पवसे मती स नः सोम शरवो विदः |||
verses.transliteration: pari viśvāni cetasā mṛśase pavase matī sa naḥ soma śravo vidaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou graspest all things with thy mind, and purifiest thee with thoughts  As such, O Soma, find us fame.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यर्ष बर्हद यशो मघवद्भ्यो धरुवं रयिम इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: abhyarṣa bṛhad yaśo maghavadbhyo dhruvaṃ rayim iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: Pour lofty glory on us, send sure riches to our liberal lords,  Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: तवं राजेव सुव्रतो गिरः सोमा विवेशिथ पुनानो वह्ने अद्भुत |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ rājeva suvrato ghiraḥ somā viveśitha punāno vahne adbhuta

translations.griffith: As thou art cleansed, O Wondrous Steed, O Soma, thou hast entered, like  A pious King, into the songs.

verses.sanskrit: स वह्निरप्सु दुष्टरो मर्ज्यमानो गभस्त्योः सोमश्चमूषु सीदति |||
verses.transliteration: sa vahnirapsu duṣṭaro mṛjyamāno ghabhastyoḥ somaścamūṣu sīdati

translations.griffith: He, Soma, like a courser in the floods invincible, made clean  With hands, is resting in the jars.

verses.sanskrit: करीळुर्मखो न मंहयुः पवित्रं सोम गछसि दधत सतोत्रे सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: krīḷurmakho na maṃhayuḥ pavitraṃ soma ghachasi dadhat stotre suvīryam

translations.griffith: Disporting, like a liberal chief, thou goest, Soma, to the sieve,  Lending the laud a Hero's strength.

verses.sanskrit: एते धावन्तीन्दवः सोमा इन्द्राय घर्ष्वयः मत्सरासःस्वर्विदः |||
verses.transliteration: ete dhāvantīndavaḥ somā indrāya ghṛṣvayaḥ matsarāsaḥsvarvidaḥ

translations.griffith: To Indra flow these running drops, these Somas frolicsome in mood.  Exhilarating, finding light;

verses.sanskrit: परव्र्ण्वन्तो अभियुजः सुष्वये वरिवोविदः सवयं सतोत्रे वयस्क्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: pravṛṇvanto abhiyujaḥ suṣvaye varivovidaḥ svayaṃ stotre vayaskṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: Driving off foes, bestowing room upon the presser, willingly  Bringing their praiser vitalforce.

verses.sanskrit: वर्था करीळन्त इन्दवः सधस्थमभ्येकमित सिन्धोरूर्मा वयक्षरन |||
verses.transliteration: vṛthā krīḷanta indavaḥ sadhasthamabhyekamit sindhorūrmā vyakṣaran

translations.griffith: Lightly disporting them, the drops flow to one common reservoir,  And fall into the river's wave.

verses.sanskrit: एते विश्वानि वार्या पवमानास आशत हिता न सप्तयो रथे |||
verses.transliteration: ete viśvāni vāryā pavamānāsa āśata hitā na saptayo rathe

translations.griffith: These Pavamanas have obtained all blessings much to be desired,  Like coursers harnessed to a car.

verses.sanskrit: आस्मिन पिशङगमिन्दवो दधाता वेनमादिशे यो अस्मभ्यमरावा |||
verses.transliteration: āsmin piśaṅghamindavo dadhātā venamādiśe yo asmabhyamarāvā

translations.griffith: With view to us, O Soma-drops, bestow his manifold desire  On him who yet hath given us naught.

verses.sanskrit: रभुर्न रथ्यं नवं दधाता केतमादिशे शुक्राः पवध्वमर्णसा |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhurna rathyaṃ navaṃ dadhātā ketamādiśe śukrāḥ pavadhvamarṇasā

translations.griffith: Bring us our wish with this design, as a wright brings his new-wrought wheel:  Flow pure and shining with the stream.

verses.sanskrit: एत उ तये अवीवशन काष्ठां वाजिनो अक्रत सतः परासाविषुर्मतिम |||
verses.transliteration: eta u tye avīvaśan kāṣṭhāṃ vājino akrata sataḥ prāsāviṣurmatim

translations.griffith: These drops have cried with resonant voice: like swift steeds they have run the course,  And roused the good man's hymn to life.

verses.sanskrit: एते सोमास आशवो रथा इव पर वाजिनः सर्गाः सर्ष्टा अहेषत |||
verses.transliteration: ete somāsa āśavo rathā iva pra vājinaḥ sarghāḥ sṛṣṭā aheṣata

translations.griffith: THESE rapid Soma-streams have stirred themselves to motion like strong steeds,  Like cars, like armies hurried forth.

verses.sanskrit: एते वाता इवोरवः पर्जन्यस्येव वर्ष्टयः अग्नेरिव भरमा वर्था |||
verses.transliteration: ete vātā ivoravaḥ parjanyasyeva vṛṣṭayaḥ aghneriva bhramā vṛthā

translations.griffith: Swift as wide winds they lightly move, like rain-storms of Parjanya, like  The flickering flames of burning fire.

verses.sanskrit: एते पूता विपश्चितः सोमासो दध्याशिरः विपा वयानशुर्धियः |||
verses.transliteration: ete pūtā vipaścitaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ vipā vyānaśurdhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: These Soma juices, blent with curds, purified, skilled in sacred hymns,  Have gained by song their hearts'desire.

verses.sanskrit: एते मर्ष्टा अमर्त्याः सस्र्वांसो न शश्रमुः इयक्षन्तः पथो रजः |||
verses.transliteration: ete mṛṣṭā amartyāḥ sasṛvāṃso na śaśramuḥ iyakṣantaḥ patho rajaḥ

translations.griffith: Immortal, cleansed, these drops, since first they flowed, have never wearied, fain  To reach the regions and their paths.

verses.sanskrit: एते पर्ष्ठानि रोदसोर्विप्रयन्तो वयानशुः उतेदमुत्तमं रजः |||
verses.transliteration: ete pṛṣṭhāni rodasorviprayanto vyānaśuḥ utedamuttamaṃ rajaḥ

translations.griffith: Advancing they have travelled o’er the ridges of the earth and heaven,  And this the highest realm of all.

verses.sanskrit: तन्तुं तन्वानमुत्तममनु परवत आशत उतेदमुत्तमाय्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tantuṃ tanvānamuttamamanu pravata āśata utedamuttamāyyam

translations.griffith: Over the heights have they attained the highest thread that is spun out,  And this which must be deemed most high.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम पणिभ्य आ वसु गव्यानि धारयः ततं तन्तुमचिक्रदः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma paṇibhya ā vasu ghavyāni dhārayaḥ tataṃ tantumacikradaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Soma, boldest wealth in kine which thou hast seized from niggard churls:  Thou calledst forth the outspun thread.

verses.sanskrit: सोमा अस्र्ग्रमाशवो मधोर्मदस्य धारया अभि विश्वानिकाव्या |||
verses.transliteration: somā asṛghramāśavo madhormadasya dhārayā abhi viśvānikāvyā

translations.griffith: SWIFT Soma drops have been effused in streams of meath, the gladdening drink,  For sacred lore of every kind.

verses.sanskrit: अनु परत्नास आयवः पदं नवीयो अक्रमुः रुचे जनन्त सूर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: anu pratnāsa āyavaḥ padaṃ navīyo akramuḥ ruce jananta sūryam

translations.griffith: Hither to newer. resting-place the ancient Living Ones are come.  They made the Sun that he might shine.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवमान नो भरार्यो अदाशुषो गयम कर्धि परजावतीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavamāna no bharāryo adāśuṣo ghayam kṛdhi prajāvatīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, bring to us the unsacrificing foeman's wealth,  And give us food with progeny.

verses.sanskrit: अभि सोमास आयवः पवन्ते मद्यं मदम अभि कोशं मधुश्चुतम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi somāsa āyavaḥ pavante madyaṃ madam abhi kośaṃ madhuścutam

translations.griffith: The living Somas being cleansed diffuse exhilarating drink,  Turned to the vat which drips with meath.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो अर्षति धर्णसिर्दधान इन्द्रियं रसम सुवीरो अभिशस्तिपाः |||
verses.transliteration: somo arṣati dharṇasirdadhāna indriyaṃ rasam suvīro abhiśastipāḥ

translations.griffith: Soma gows on intelligent, possessing sap and mighty strength,  Brave Hero who repels the curse.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम पवसे देवेभ्यः सधमाद्यः इन्दो वाजं सिषाससि |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya soma pavase devebhyaḥ sadhamādyaḥ indo vājaṃ siṣāsasi

translations.griffith: For Indra, Soma! thou art cleansed, a feast-companion for the Gods:  1ndu, thou fain wilt win us strength

verses.sanskrit: अस्य पीत्वा मदानामिन्द्रो वर्त्राण्यप्रति जघान जघनच्च नु |||
verses.transliteration: asya pītvā madānāmindro vṛtrāṇyaprati jaghāna jaghanacca nu

translations.griffith: When he had drunken draughts of this, Indra smote down resistless foes:  Yea, smote them, and shall smite them still.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोमासो अधन्विषुः पवमानास इन्दवः शरीणाना अप्सु मर्ञ्जत |||
verses.transliteration: pra somāso adhanviṣuḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ śrīṇānā apsu mṛñjata

translations.griffith: HITHERWARD have the Soma streamed,  the drops while they are purified:  When bIent, in waters they are rinsed.

verses.sanskrit: अभि गावो अधन्विषुरापो न परवता यतीः पुनाना इन्द्रमाशत |||
verses.transliteration: abhi ghāvo adhanviṣurāpo na pravatā yatīḥ punānā indramāśata

translations.griffith: The milk hath run to meet them like floods rushing down a precipice:  They come to Indra, being cleansed.

verses.sanskrit: पर पवमान धन्वसि सोमेन्द्राय पातवे नर्भिर्यतो वि नीयसे |||
verses.transliteration: pra pavamāna dhanvasi somendrāya pātave nṛbhiryato vi nīyase

translations.griffith: O Soma Pavamana, thou art flowing to be Indra's drink:  The men have seized and lead thee forth.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम नर्मादनः पवस्व चर्षणीसहे सस्निर्यो अनुमाद्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma nṛmādanaḥ pavasva carṣaṇīsahe sasniryo anumādyaḥ

translations.griffith: Victorious, to be hailed with joy, O Soma, flow, delighting men,  To him who ruleth o’er mankind.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दो यदद्रिभिः सुतः पवित्रं परिधावसि अरमिन्द्रस्य धाम्ने |||
verses.transliteration: indo yadadribhiḥ sutaḥ pavitraṃ paridhāvasi aramindrasya dhāmne

translations.griffith: Thou, Indu, when, effused by stones, thou runnest to the filter, art,  Ready for Indra's high decree.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व वर्त्रहन्तमोक्थेभिरनुमाद्यः शुचिः पावको अद्भुतः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva vṛtrahantamokthebhiranumādyaḥ śuciḥ pāvako adbhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow on, best Vṛtra-slayer; flow meet to be hailed with joyful lauds.  Pure, purifying, wonderful.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिः पावक उच्यते सोमः सुतस्य मध्वः देवावीरघशंसहा |||
verses.transliteration: śuciḥ pāvaka ucyate somaḥ sutasya madhvaḥ devāvīraghaśaṃsahā

translations.griffith: Pure, purifying is he called the Soma of the meath eflused,  Slayer of sinners, dear to Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व दक्षसाधनो देवेभ्यः पीतये हरे मरुद्भ्यो वायवे मदः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva dakṣasādhano devebhyaḥ pītaye hare marudbhyo vāyave madaḥ

translations.griffith: GREEN-HUED! as one who giveth strength flow on for Gods to drink, a draught  For Vāyu and the Marut host.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान धिया हितो.अभि योनिं कनिक्रदत धर्मणा वायुमा विश |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna dhiyā hito.abhi yoniṃ kanikradat dharmaṇā vāyumā viśa

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, sent by song, roaring about thy dwelling-place,  Pass into Vāyu as Law bids.

verses.sanskrit: सं देवैः शोभते वर्षा कविर्योनावधि परियः वर्त्रहा देववीतमः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ devaiḥ śobhate vṛṣā kaviryonāvadhi priyaḥ vṛtrahā devavītamaḥ

translations.griffith: The Steer shines with the Deities, dear Sage in his appointed home,  Foe-Slayer, most beloved by Gods.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन पुनानो याति हर्यतः यत्राम्र्तास आसते |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan punāno yāti haryataḥ yatrāmṛtāsa āsate

translations.griffith: Taking each beauteous form, he goes, desirable, while purified,  Thither where- the Immortals sit.

verses.sanskrit: अरुषो जनयन गिरः सोमः पवत आयुषक इन्द्रं गछन कविक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: aruṣo janayan ghiraḥ somaḥ pavata āyuṣak indraṃ ghachan kavikratuḥ

translations.griffith: To Indra Soma flows, the Red, engendering song, exceeding wise,  The visitor of living men.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व मदिन्तम पवित्रं धारया कवे अर्कस्य योनिमासदम |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva madintama pavitraṃ dhārayā kave arkasya yonimāsadam

translations.griffith: Flow, best exhilarator, Sage, flow to the filter in a stream  To seat thee in the place of song.

verses.sanskrit: तमम्र्क्षन्त वाजिनमुपस्थे अदितेरधि विप्रासो अण्व्याधिया |||
verses.transliteration: tamamṛkṣanta vājinamupasthe aditeradhi viprāso aṇvyādhiyā

translations.griffith: THE sages with the fingers' art have dressed and decked that vigorous Steed  Upon the lap of Aditi,

verses.sanskrit: तं गावो अभ्यनूषत सहस्रधारमक्षितम इन्दुं धर्तारमा दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ghāvo abhyanūṣata sahasradhāramakṣitam induṃ dhartāramā divaḥ

translations.griffith: The kine have called aloud to him exhaustless with a thousand streams,  To Indu who supporteth heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तं वेधां मेधयाह्यन पवमानमधि दयवि धर्णसिं भूरिधायसम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vedhāṃ medhayāhyan pavamānamadhi dyavi dharṇasiṃ bhūridhāyasam

translations.griffith: Him, nourisher of many, Sage, creative Pavamana, they  Have sent, by wisdom, to the sky.

verses.sanskrit: तमह्यन भुरिजोर्धिया संवसानं विवस्वतः पतिं वाचो अदाभ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tamahyan bhurijordhiyā saṃvasānaṃ vivasvataḥ patiṃ vāco adābhyam

translations.griffith: Him, dweller with Vivasvān, they with use of both arms have sent forth,  The Lord of Speech infallible.

verses.sanskrit: तं सानावधि जामयो हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः हर्यतम्भूरिचक्षसम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ sānāvadhi jāmayo hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ haryatambhūricakṣasam

translations.griffith: Him, green, beloved, many eyed, the Sisters with prosing stones  Send down to ridges of the sieve.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा हिन्वन्ति वेधसः पवमान गिराव्र्धम इन्दविन्द्राय मत्सरम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā hinvanti vedhasaḥ pavamāna ghirāvṛdham indavindrāya matsaram

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, Indu, priests hurry thee on to Indra, thee  Who aidest song and cheerest him.

verses.sanskrit: एष कविरभिष्टुतः पवित्रे अधि तोशते पुनानो घनन्नप सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa kavirabhiṣṭutaḥ pavitre adhi tośate punāno ghnannapa sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS Sage, exalted by our lauds, flows to the purifying cloth,  Scattering foes as he is cleansed.

verses.sanskrit: एष इन्द्राय वायवे सवर्जित परि षिच्यते पवित्रे दक्षसाधनः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa indrāya vāyave svarjit pari ṣicyate pavitre dakṣasādhanaḥ

translations.griffith: As giving power and winning light, for Indra and for Vāyu he  Is poured upon the filtering-cloth.

verses.sanskrit: एष नर्भिर्वि नीयते दिवो मूर्धा वर्षा सुतः सोमो वनेषु विश्ववित |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa nṛbhirvi nīyate divo mūrdhā vṛṣā sutaḥ somo vaneṣu viśvavit

translations.griffith: The men conduct him, Soma, Steer, Omniscient, and the Head of Heaven,  Effused into the vats of wood.

verses.sanskrit: एष गव्युरचिक्रदत पवमानो हिरण्ययुः इन्दुः सत्राजिदस्त्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa ghavyuracikradat pavamāno hiraṇyayuḥ induḥ satrājidastṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: Longing for kine, longing for gold hath Indu Pavamana lowed,  Still Conqueror, never overcome.

verses.sanskrit: एष सूर्येण हासते पवमानो अधि दयवि पवित्रे मत्सरो मदः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sūryeṇa hāsate pavamāno adhi dyavi pavitre matsaro madaḥ

translations.griffith: This Pavamana, gladdening draught, drops on the filtering cloth, and then  Mounts up with Sūrya to the sky.

verses.sanskrit: एष शुष्म्यसिष्यददन्तरिक्षे वर्षा हरिः पुनान इन्दुरिन्द्रमा |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa śuṣmyasiṣyadadantarikṣe vṛṣā hariḥ punāna indurindramā

translations.griffith: To Indra in the firmament this mighty tawny Steer hath flowed,  This Indu, being purified.

verses.sanskrit: एष वाजी हितो नर्भिर्विश्वविन मनसस पतिः अव्यो वारं वि धावति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa vājī hito nṛbhirviśvavin manasas patiḥ avyo vāraṃ vi dhāvati

translations.griffith: URGED by the men, this vigorous Steed, Lord of the mind, Omniscient,  Runs to the woollen straining-cloth.

verses.sanskrit: एष पवित्रे अक्षरत सोमो देवेभ्यः सुतः विश्वा धामान्याविशन |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa pavitre akṣarat somo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ viśvā dhāmānyāviśan

translations.griffith: Within the filter hath he flowed, this Soma for the Gods effused,  Entering all their essences.

verses.sanskrit: एष देवः शुभायते.अधि योनावमर्त्यः वर्त्रहा देववीतमः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa devaḥ śubhāyate.adhi yonāvamartyaḥ vṛtrahā devavītamaḥ

translations.griffith: He shines in beauty there, this God Immortal in his dwelling-place,  Foe-slayer, dearest to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: एष वर्षा कनिक्रदद दशभिर्जामिभिर्यतः अभि दरोणानि धावति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa vṛṣā kanikradad daśabhirjāmibhiryataḥ abhi droṇāni dhāvati

translations.griffith: Directed by the Sisters ten, bellowing on his way this Steer  Runs onward to the wooden vats.

verses.sanskrit: एष सूर्यमरोचयत पवमानो विचर्षणिः विश्वा धामानि विश्ववित |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sūryamarocayat pavamāno vicarṣaṇiḥ viśvā dhāmāni viśvavit

translations.griffith: This Pavamana, swiftand strong, Omniscient, gave spleudour to  The Sun and all his forms of light.

verses.sanskrit: एष शुष्म्यदाभ्यः सोमः पुनानो अर्षति देवावीरघशंसहा |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa śuṣmyadābhyaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati devāvīraghaśaṃsahā

translations.griffith: This Soma being purified, flows mighty and infallible,  Slayer of sinners, dear toGods.

verses.sanskrit: परास्य धारा अक्षरन वर्ष्णः सुतस्यौजसा देवाननु परभूषतः |||
verses.transliteration: prāsya dhārā akṣaran vṛṣṇaḥ sutasyaujasā devānanu prabhūṣataḥ

translations.griffith: FORWARD with mighty force have flowed the currents of this Steer effused,  Of him who sets him by the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: सप्तिं मर्जन्ति वेधसो गर्णन्तः कारवो गिरा जयोतिर्जज्ञानमुक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: saptiṃ mṛjanti vedhaso ghṛṇantaḥ kāravo ghirā jyotirjajñānamukthyam

translations.griffith: The singers praise him with their song, and learned priests adorn the Steed,  Brought forth as light that merits laud.

verses.sanskrit: सुषहा सोम तानि ते पुनानाय परभूवसो वर्धा समुद्रमुक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: suṣahā soma tāni te punānāya prabhūvaso vardhā samudramukthyam

translations.griffith: These things thou winnest lightly while purified, Soma, Lord of wealth:  Fill full the sea that claims our praise.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा वसूनि संजयन पवस्व सोम धारया इनु दवेषांसि सध्र्यक |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā vasūni saṃjayan pavasva soma dhārayā inu dveṣāṃsi sadhryak

translations.griffith: Winning all precious things at once, flow on, O Soma, with thy stream  Drive to one place our enemies.

verses.sanskrit: रक्षा सु नो अररुषः सवनात समस्य कस्य चित निदो यत्रमुमुच्महे |||
verses.transliteration: rakṣā su no araruṣaḥ svanāt samasya kasya cit nido yatramumucmahe

translations.griffith: Preserve us from the godless, from ill-omened voice of one and all,  That so we may be freed from blame.

verses.sanskrit: एन्दो पार्थिवं रयिं दिव्यं पवस्व धारया दयुमन्तं शुष्ममा भर |||
verses.transliteration: endo pārthivaṃ rayiṃ divyaṃ pavasva dhārayā dyumantaṃ śuṣmamā bhara

translations.griffith: O Indu, as thou flowest on bring us the wealth of earth and heaven,  And splendid vigour, in thy stream.

verses.sanskrit: पर धारा अस्य शुष्मिणो वर्था पवित्रे अक्षरन पुनानो वाचमिष्यति |||
verses.transliteration: pra dhārā asya śuṣmiṇo vṛthā pavitre akṣaran punāno vācamiṣyati

translations.griffith: STREAMS of this Potent One have flowed easily to the straining-cloth:  While he is cleansed he lifts his voice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुर्हियानः सोत्र्भिर्म्र्ज्यमानः कनिक्रदत इयर्ति वग्नुमिन्द्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: indurhiyānaḥ sotṛbhirmṛjyamānaḥ kanikradat iyarti vaghnumindriyam

translations.griffith: Indu, by pressers urged to speed, bellowing out while beautified.  Sends forth a very mighty sound.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः शुष्मं नर्षाह्यं वीरवन्तं पुरुस्प्र्हम पवस्व सोम धारया |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ śuṣmaṃ nṛṣāhyaṃ vīravantaṃ puruspṛham pavasva soma dhārayā

translations.griffith: Pour on us, Soma, with thy stream manconquering might which many crave,  Accompanied with hero sons.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोमो अति धारया पवमानो असिष्यदत अभि दरोणान्यासदम |||
verses.transliteration: pra somo ati dhārayā pavamāno asiṣyadat abhi droṇānyāsadam

translations.griffith: Hither hath Pavamana flowed, Soma flowed hither in a stream,  To settle in the vats of wood.

verses.sanskrit: अप्सु तवा मधुमत्तमं हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः इन्दविन्द्राय पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: apsu tvā madhumattamaṃ hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ indavindrāya pītaye

translations.griffith: To waters with the stones they drive thee tawny-hued, most rich in sweets,  O Indu, to be Indra's drink.

verses.sanskrit: सुनोता मधुमत्तमं सोममिन्द्राय वज्रिणे चारुं शर्धाय मत्सरम |||
verses.transliteration: sunotā madhumattamaṃ somamindrāya vajriṇe cāruṃ śardhāya matsaram

translations.griffith: For Indra, for the Thunderer press the Soma very rich in sweets,  Lovely, inspiriting, for strength.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोमासः सवाध्यः पवमानासो अक्रमुः रयिं कर्ण्वन्तिचेतनम |||
verses.transliteration: pra somāsaḥ svādhyaḥ pavamānāso akramuḥ rayiṃ kṛṇvanticetanam

translations.griffith: THE, Soma-drops, benevolent, come forth as they are purified,  Bestowing wealth which all may see.

verses.sanskrit: दिवस पर्थिव्या अधि भवेन्दो दयुम्नवर्धनः भवा वाजानां पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: divas pṛthivyā adhi bhavendo dyumnavardhanaḥ bhavā vājānāṃ patiḥ

translations.griffith: O Indu, high o’er heaven and earth be thou, increaser of our might:  The Master of all strength be thou.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं वाता अभिप्रियस्तुभ्यमर्षन्ति सिन्धवः सोम वर्धन्ति ते महः |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ vātā abhipriyastubhyamarṣanti sindhavaḥ soma vardhanti te mahaḥ

translations.griffith: The winds are gracious in their love to thee, the rivers flow to thee  Soma, they multiply thy power.

verses.sanskrit: आ पयायस्व समेतु ते विश्वतः सोम वर्ष्ण्यम भवा वाजस्य संगथे |||
verses.transliteration: ā pyāyasva sametu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam bhavā vājasya saṃghathe

translations.griffith: Soma, wax great. From every side may vigorous powers unite in thee:  Be in the gathering-Place of strength.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं गावो घर्तं पयो बभ्रो दुदुह्रे अक्षितम वर्षिष्ठे अधि सानवि |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ ghāvo ghṛtaṃ payo babhro duduhre akṣitam varṣiṣṭhe adhi sānavi

translations.griffith: For thee, brown-hued! the kine have poured imperishable oil and milk.  Aloft on the sublimest height.

verses.sanskrit: सवायुधस्य ते सतो भुवनस्य पते वयम इन्दो सखित्वमुश्मसि |||
verses.transliteration: svāyudhasya te sato bhuvanasya pate vayam indo sakhitvamuśmasi

translations.griffith: Friendship, O Indu, we desire with thee who bearest noble arms,  With thee, O Lord of all that is.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोमासो मदच्युतः शरवसे नो मघोनः सुता विदथे अक्रमुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra somāso madacyutaḥ śravase no maghonaḥ sutā vidathe akramuḥ

translations.griffith: THE rapture-shedding Soma-drops, effused in our assembly, have  Flowed forth to glorify our prince.

verses.sanskrit: आदीं तरितस्य योषणो हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः इन्दुमिन्द्राय पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ādīṃ tritasya yoṣaṇo hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ indumindrāya pītaye

translations.griffith: Then Trita's Maidens onward urge the Tawny-coloured with the stones,  Indu for Indra, for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: आदीं हंसो यथा गणं विश्वस्यावीवशन मतिम अत्योन गोभिरज्यते |||
verses.transliteration: ādīṃ haṃso yathā ghaṇaṃ viśvasyāvīvaśan matim atyona ghobhirajyate

translations.griffith: Now like a swan he maketh all the company sing each his hymn:  He, like a steed, is bathed in milk.

verses.sanskrit: उभे सोमावचाकशन मर्गो न तक्तो अर्षसि सीदन्न्र्तस्य योनिमा |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe somāvacākaśan mṛgho na takto arṣasi sīdannṛtasya yonimā

translations.griffith: O Soma, viewing heaven and earth, thou runncst like a darting deer  Set in the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: अभि गावो अनूषत योषा जारमिव परियम अगन्नाजिं यथा हितम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi ghāvo anūṣata yoṣā jāramiva priyam aghannājiṃ yathā hitam

translations.griffith: The cows have sung with joy to him, even as a woman to her love  He came as to a settled race.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे धेहि दयुमद यशो मघवद्भ्यश्च मह्यं च सनिं मेधामुत शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: asme dhehi dyumad yaśo maghavadbhyaśca mahyaṃ ca saniṃ medhāmuta śravaḥ

translations.griffith: Bestow illustrious fame on us, both on our liberal lords and me,  Glory, intelligence, and wealth.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोमासो विपश्चितो.अपां न यन्त्यूर्मयः वनानि महिषा इव |||
verses.transliteration: pra somāso vipaścito.apāṃ na yantyūrmayaḥ vanāni mahiṣā iva

translations.griffith: LIKE waves of waters, skilled in song the juices of the Soma speed  Onward, as buffaloes to woods.

verses.sanskrit: अभि दरोणानि बभ्रवः शुक्रा रतस्य धारया वाजं गोमन्तमक्षरन |||
verses.transliteration: abhi droṇāni babhravaḥ śukrā ṛtasya dhārayā vājaṃ ghomantamakṣaran

translations.griffith: With stream of sacrifice the brown bright drops have flowed with strength in store  Of kine into the wooden vats.

verses.sanskrit: सुता इन्द्राय वायवे वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यः सोमा अर्षन्ति विष्णवे |||
verses.transliteration: sutā indrāya vāyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ somā arṣanti viṣṇave

translations.griffith: To Indra, Vāyu, Varuṇa, to Viṣṇu, and the Maruts, flow  The drops of Soma juice effused.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो वाच उदीरते गावो मिमन्ति धेनवः हरिरेति कनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: tisro vāca udīrate ghāvo mimanti dhenavaḥ harireti kanikradat

translations.griffith: Three several words are uttered: kine are ]owing, cows who give their milk:  The Tawny-hued goes bellowing on.

verses.sanskrit: अभि बरह्मीरनूषत यह्वीरतस्य मातरः मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते दिवः शिशुम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi brahmīranūṣata yahvīrtasya mātaraḥ marmṛjyante divaḥ śiśum

translations.griffith: The young and sacred mothers of the holy rite have uttered praise:  They decorate the Child of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: रायः समुद्रांश्चतुरो.अस्मभ्यं सोम विश्वतः आ पवस्व सहस्रिणः |||
verses.transliteration: rāyaḥ samudrāṃścaturo.asmabhyaṃ soma viśvataḥ ā pavasva sahasriṇaḥ

translations.griffith: From every side, O Soma, for our profit, pour thou forth four seas  Filled full of riches thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit: पर सुवानो धारया तनेन्दुर्हिन्वानो अर्षति रुजद दर्ळ्हा वयोजसा |||
verses.transliteration: pra suvāno dhārayā tanendurhinvāno arṣati rujad dṛḷhā vyojasā

translations.griffith: THE drop of Soma juice effused flows onward with this stream impelled.  Rending strong places with its might.

verses.sanskrit: सुत इन्द्राय वायवे वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यः सोमो अर्षति विष्णवे |||
verses.transliteration: suta indrāya vāyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ somo arṣati viṣṇave

translations.griffith: Poured forth to Indra, Varuṇa, to Vāyu and the Marut hosts,  To Viṣṇu, flows the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षाणं वर्षभिर्यतं सुन्वन्ति सोममद्रिभिः दुहन्तिशक्मना पयः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣāṇaṃ vṛṣabhiryataṃ sunvanti somamadribhiḥ duhantiśakmanā payaḥ

translations.griffith: With stones they press the Soma forth, the Strong conducted by the strong:  They milk the liquor out with skill.

verses.sanskrit: भुवत तरितस्य मर्ज्यो भुवदिन्द्राय मत्सरः सं रूपैरज्यते हरिः |||
verses.transliteration: bhuvat tritasya marjyo bhuvadindrāya matsaraḥ saṃ rūpairajyate hariḥ

translations.griffith: ’Tis he whom Trita must refine, ’tis he who shall make Indra glad:  The Tawny One is decked with tints.

verses.sanskrit: अभीं रतस्य विष्टपं दुहते पर्श्निमातरः चारु परियतमं हविः |||
verses.transliteration: abhīṃ ṛtasya viṣṭapaṃ duhate pṛśnimātaraḥ cāru priyatamaṃ haviḥ

translations.griffith: Him do the Sons of Pṛśni milk, the dwelling-place of sacrifice,  Oblation lovely and most dear.

verses.sanskrit: समेनमह्रुता इमा गिरो अर्षन्ति सस्रुतः धेनूर्वाश्रोवीवशत |||
verses.transliteration: samenamahrutā imā ghiro arṣanti sasrutaḥ dhenūrvāśroavīvaśat

translations.griffith: To him in one unitcd stream th-,se songs flow on straight forward. he,  Loud voiced, hath made the milch-kine low.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः पवस्व धारया पवमान रयिं पर्थुम यया जयोतिर्विदासि नः |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ pavasva dhārayā pavamāna rayiṃ pṛthum yayā jyotirvidāsi naḥ

translations.griffith: Pour forth on us abundant wealth, O Pavamana, with thy stream.  Wherewith thou mayest find us light

verses.sanskrit: इन्दो समुद्रमीङखय पवस्व विश्वमेजय रायो धर्ता न ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: indo samudramīṅkhaya pavasva viśvamejaya rāyo dhartā na ojasā

translations.griffith: O Indu, swayer of the sea, shaker of all things, flow thou on,  Bearer of wealth to us with might.

verses.sanskrit: तवया वीरेण वीरवो.अभि षयाम पर्तन्यतः कषरा णो अभि वार्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā vīreṇa vīravo.abhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ kṣarā ṇo abhi vāryam

translations.griffith: With thee for Hero, Valiant One! may we subdue our enemies:  Let what is precious flow to us.

verses.sanskrit: पर वाजमिन्दुरिष्यति सिषासन वाजसा रषिः वरता विदान आयुधा |||
verses.transliteration: pra vājaminduriṣyati siṣāsan vājasā ṛṣiḥ vratā vidāna āyudhā

translations.griffith: Indu arouses strength the Sage who strives for victory, winning power,  Discovering holy works and means.

verses.sanskrit: तं गीर्भिर्वाचमीङखयं पुनानं वासयामसि सोमं जनस्य गोपतिम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ghīrbhirvācamīṅkhayaṃ punānaṃ vāsayāmasi somaṃ janasya ghopatim

translations.griffith: Mover of speech, we robe him with our songs as he is purified  Soma, the Guardian of the folk;

verses.sanskrit: विश्वो यस्य वरते जनो दाधार धर्मणस पतेः पुनानस्य परभूवसोः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvo yasya vrate jano dādhāra dharmaṇas pateḥ punānasya prabhūvasoḥ

translations.griffith: On whose way, Lord of Holy Law, most richi as he is purified.  The people all have set their hearts.

verses.sanskrit: असर्जि रथ्यो यथा पवित्रे चम्वोः सुतः कार्ष्मन वाजीन्यक्रमीत |||
verses.transliteration: asarji rathyo yathā pavitre camvoḥ sutaḥ kārṣman vājīnyakramīt

translations.griffith: FORTH from the mortar is the juice sent, like a car-horse, to the sieve:  The Steed steps forward to the goal.

verses.sanskrit: स वह्निः सोम जाग्र्विः पवस्व देववीरति अभि कोशं मधुश्चुतम |||
verses.transliteration: sa vahniḥ soma jāghṛviḥ pavasva devavīrati abhi kośaṃ madhuścutam

translations.griffith: Thus, Soma, watchful, bearing well, cheering the Gods, flow past the sieve,  Turned to the vat that drops with meath.

verses.sanskrit: स नो जयोतींषि पूर्व्य पवमान वि रोचय करत्वे दक्षायनो हिनु |||
verses.transliteration: sa no jyotīṃṣi pūrvya pavamāna vi rocaya kratve dakṣāyano hinu

translations.griffith: Excellent Pavamana, make the lights shine brightly out for us.  Speed us to mental power and skill.

verses.sanskrit: शुम्भमानो रतायुभिर्म्र्ज्यमानो गभस्त्योः पवते वारे अव्यये |||
