verses.transliteration: śumbhamāno ṛtāyubhirmṛjyamāno ghabhastyoḥ pavate vāre avyaye

translations.griffith: He, beautified by pious men, and coming from their hands adorned,  Flows through the fleecy straining-cloth.

verses.sanskrit: स विश्वा दाशुषे वसु सोमो दिव्यानि पार्थिवा पवतामान्तरिक्ष्या |||
verses.transliteration: sa viśvā dāśuṣe vasu somo divyāni pārthivā pavatāmāntarikṣyā

translations.griffith: May Soma pour all treasures of the heavens, the earth, the firmament  Upon the liberal worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: आ दिवस पर्ष्ठमश्वयुर्गव्ययुः सोम रोहसि वीरयुः शवसस पते |||
verses.transliteration: ā divas pṛṣṭhamaśvayurghavyayuḥ soma rohasi vīrayuḥ śavasas pate

translations.griffith: Thou mountest to the height of heaven, O Soma, seeking steeds and kine,  And seeking heroes, Lord of Strength!

verses.sanskrit: स सुतः पीतये वर्षा सोमः पवित्रे अर्षति विघ्नन रक्षांसि देवयुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa sutaḥ pītaye vṛṣā somaḥ pavitre arṣati vighnan rakṣāṃsi devayuḥ

translations.griffith: SOMA, the Steer, effused for draught, flows to the purifying sieve,  Slaying the fiends, loving the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स पवित्रे विचक्षणो हरिरर्षति धर्णसिः अभि योनिंकनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: sa pavitre vicakṣaṇo harirarṣati dharṇasiḥ abhi yoniṃkanikradat

translations.griffith: Far-sighted, tawny-coloured, he flows to the sieve, intelligent,  Bellowing, to his place of rest.

verses.sanskrit: स वाजी रोचना दिवः पवमानो वि धावति रक्षोहा वारमव्ययम |||
verses.transliteration: sa vājī rocanā divaḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati rakṣohā vāramavyayam

translations.griffith: This vigorous Pavamana runs forth to the luminous realm of heaven,  Fiend-slayer, through the fleecy sieve.

verses.sanskrit: स तरितस्याधि सानवि पवमानो अरोचयत जामिभिः सूर्यं सह |||
verses.transliteration: sa tritasyādhi sānavi pavamāno arocayat jāmibhiḥ sūryaṃ saha

translations.griffith: This Payamana up above Trita's high ridge hath made the Sun,  Together with the Sisters, shine.

verses.sanskrit: स वर्त्रहा वर्षा सुतो वरिवोविददाभ्यः सोमो वाजमिवासरत |||
verses.transliteration: sa vṛtrahā vṛṣā suto varivovidadābhyaḥ somo vājamivāsarat

translations.griffith: This Vṛtra-slaying Steer, effused, Soma room-giver, ne’er deceived,  Hath gone, as ’twere, to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: स देवः कविनेषितो.अभि दरोणानि धावति इन्दुरिन्द्रायमंहना |||
verses.transliteration: sa devaḥ kavineṣito.abhi droṇāni dhāvati indurindrāyamaṃhanā

translations.griffith: Urged onward by the sage, the God speeds forward to the casks of wood,  Indu to Indra willingly.

verses.sanskrit: एष उ सय वर्षा रथो.अव्यो वारेभिरर्षति गछन वाजं सहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa u sya vṛṣā ratho.avyo vārebhirarṣati ghachan vājaṃ sahasriṇam

translations.griffith: THIS Steer, this Chariot, rushes through the woollen filter, as he goes  To war that wins a thousand spoils.

verses.sanskrit: एतं तरितस्य योषणो हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः इन्दुमिन्द्राय पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ tritasya yoṣaṇo hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ indumindrāya pītaye

translations.griffith: The Dames of Trita with the stones onward impel this Tawny One  Indu to Indra for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: एतं तयं हरितो दश मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते अपस्युवः याभिर्मदाय शुम्भते |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ tyaṃ harito daśa marmṛjyante apasyuvaḥ yābhirmadāya śumbhate

translations.griffith: Ten active fingers carefully adorn him here; they make him bright  And beauteous for the gladdening draught.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय मानुषीष्वा शयेनो न विक्षु सीदति गछञ जारो न योषितम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya mānuṣīṣvā śyeno na vikṣu sīdati ghachañ jāro na yoṣitam

translations.griffith: He like a falcon settles down amid the families of men.  Speeding like lover to his love.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय मद्यो रसो.अव चष्टे दिवः शिशुः य इन्दुर्वारमाविशत |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya madyo raso.ava caṣṭe divaḥ śiśuḥ ya indurvāramāviśat

translations.griffith: This young exhilarating juice looks downward from its place in heaven,  This Soma-drop that pierced the sieve.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय पीतये सुतो हरिरर्षति धर्णसिः करन्दन योनिमभि परियम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya pītaye suto harirarṣati dharṇasiḥ krandan yonimabhi priyam

translations.griffith: Poured for the draught, this tawny juice  flows forth, intelligent, crying out,  Unto the well-beloved place.

verses.sanskrit: आशुरर्ष बर्हन्मते परि परियेण धाम्ना यत्र देवा इतिब्रवन |||
verses.transliteration: āśurarṣa bṛhanmate pari priyeṇa dhāmnā yatra devā itibravan

translations.griffith: FLOW On, O thou of lofty thought, flow swift in thy beloved form,  Saying, I go where dwell the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: परिष्क्र्ण्वन्ननिष्क्र्तं जनाय यातयन्निषः वर्ष्टिन्दिवः परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: pariṣkṛṇvannaniṣkṛtaṃ janāya yātayanniṣaḥ vṛṣṭindivaḥ pari srava

translations.griffith: Preparing what is unprepared, and bringing store of food to man,  Make thou the rain descend from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सुत एति पवित्र आ तविषिं दधान ओजसा विचक्षाणो विरोचयन |||
verses.transliteration: suta eti pavitra ā tviṣiṃ dadhāna ojasā vicakṣāṇo virocayan

translations.griffith: With might, bestowing power, thejuice enters the purifying sieve,  Far-seeing, sending forth its light.

verses.sanskrit: अयं स यो दिवस परि रघुयामा पवित्र आ सिन्धोरूर्मा वयक्षरत |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ sa yo divas pari raghuyāmā pavitra ā sindhorūrmā vyakṣarat

translations.griffith: This is it which in rapid course hath with the river's wave flowed down  From heaven upon the straining cloth.

verses.sanskrit: आविवासन परावतो अथो अर्वावतः सुतः इन्द्राय सिच्यतेमधु |||
verses.transliteration: āvivāsan parāvato atho arvāvataḥ sutaḥ indrāya sicyatemadhu

translations.griffith: Inviting him frorh far away, and even from near at hand, the juice  For Indra is poured forth as meath.

verses.sanskrit: समीचीना अनूषत हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः योनाव रतस्य सीदत |||
verses.transliteration: samīcīnā anūṣata hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ yonāv ṛtasya sīdata

translations.griffith: In union they have sung the hymn: with stones they urge the Tawny One.  Sit in the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानो अक्रमीदभि विश्वा मर्धो विचर्षणिः शुम्भन्ति विप्रं धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: punāno akramīdabhi viśvā mṛdho vicarṣaṇiḥ śumbhanti vipraṃ dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: THE Very Active hath assailed, while purified, all enemies:  They deck the Sage with holy songs.

verses.sanskrit: आ योनिमरुणो रुहद गमदिन्द्रं वर्षा सुतः धरुवे सदसि सीदति |||
verses.transliteration: ā yonimaruṇo ruhad ghamadindraṃ vṛṣā sutaḥ dhruve sadasi sīdati

translations.griffith: The Red hath mounted to his place; to India, goes the mighty juice:  He settles in his firm abode.

verses.sanskrit: नू नो रयिं महामिन्दो.अस्मभ्यं सोम विश्वतः आ पवस्वसहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: nū no rayiṃ mahāmindo.asmabhyaṃ soma viśvataḥ ā pavasvasahasriṇam

translations.griffith: O Indu, Soma, send us now great opulence from every side, Pour on us treasures thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा सोम पवमान दयुम्नानीन्दवा भर विदाः सहस्रिणीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā soma pavamāna dyumnānīndavā bhara vidāḥ sahasriṇīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: O Soma Pavamana, bring, Indu, all splcndours hitherward:  Find for us food in boundless store.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पुनान आ भर रयिं सतोत्रे सुवीर्यम जरितुर्वर्धया गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ punāna ā bhara rayiṃ stotre suvīryam jariturvardhayā ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: As thou art cleansed, bring hero strength and riches to thy worshipper,  And prosper thou the singer's hymns.

verses.sanskrit: पुनान इन्दवा भर सोम दविबर्हसं रयिम वर्षन्निन्दो नौक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: punāna indavā bhara soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim vṛṣannindo naukthyam

translations.griffith: O Indu, Soma, being cleansed, bring hither riches doublypiled,  Wealth, mighty Indu, meet for lauds.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये गावो न भूर्णयस्त्वेषा अयासो अक्रमुः घनन्तः कर्ष्णामप तवचम |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye ghāvo na bhūrṇayastveṣā ayāso akramuḥ ghnantaḥ kṛṣṇāmapa tvacam

translations.griffith: ACTIVE and bright have they come forth, impetuous in speed like bulls,  Driving the black skin far away.

verses.sanskrit: सुवितस्य मनामहे.अति सेतुं दुराव्यम साह्वांसो दस्युमव्रतम |||
verses.transliteration: suvitasya manāmahe.ati setuṃ durāvyam sāhvāṃso dasyumavratam

translations.griffith: Quelling the riteless Dasyu, may we think upon the bridge of bliss,  Leaving the bridge of woe behind.

verses.sanskrit: शर्ण्वे वर्ष्टेरिव सवनः पवमानस्य शुष्मिणः चरन्तिविद्युतो दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇve vṛṣṭeriva svanaḥ pavamānasya śuṣmiṇaḥ carantividyuto divi

translations.griffith: The mighty Pavamana's roar is heard as ’twere the rush of rain  Lightnings are flashing to the sky.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व महीमिषं गोमदिन्दो हिरण्यवत अश्वावद वाजवत सुतः |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva mahīmiṣaṃ ghomadindo hiraṇyavat aśvāvad vājavat sutaḥ

translations.griffith: Pour out on us abundant food, when thou art pressed, O Indu wealth  In kine and gold and steeds and spoil.

verses.sanskrit: स पवस्व विचर्षण आ मही रोदसी पर्ण उषाः सूर्यो न रश्मिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa pavasva vicarṣaṇa ā mahī rodasī pṛṇa uṣāḥ sūryo na raśmibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Flow on thy way, Most Active, thou. fill full the mighty heavens and earth,  As Dawn, as Sūrya with his beams.

verses.sanskrit: परि णः शर्मयन्त्या धारया सोम विश्वतः सरा रसेव विष्टपम |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṇaḥ śarmayantyā dhārayā soma viśvataḥ sarā raseva viṣṭapam

translations.griffith: On every side, O Soma, flow round us with thy protecting stream,  As Rasā flows around the world.

verses.sanskrit: जनयन रोचना दिवो जनयन्नप्सु सूर्यम वसानो गा अपोहरिः |||
verses.transliteration: janayan rocanā divo janayannapsu sūryam vasāno ghā apohariḥ

translations.griffith: ENGENDERING the Sun in floods, engendering heaven's lights, green-hued,  Robed in the waters and the milk,

verses.sanskrit: एष परत्नेन मन्मना देवो देवेभ्यस परि धारया पवते सुतः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa pratnena manmanā devo devebhyas pari dhārayā pavate sutaḥ

translations.griffith: According to primeval plan this Soma, with his stream, effused  Flows purely on, a God for Gods.

verses.sanskrit: वाव्र्धानाय तूर्वये पवन्ते वाजसातये सोमाः सहस्रपाजसः |||
verses.transliteration: vāvṛdhānāya tūrvaye pavante vājasātaye somāḥ sahasrapājasaḥ

translations.griffith: For him victorious, waxen great, the juices with a thousand powers  Are purified for winning spoil.

verses.sanskrit: दुहानः परत्नमित पयः पवित्रे परि षिच्यते करन्दन देवानजीजनत |||
verses.transliteration: duhānaḥ pratnamit payaḥ pavitre pari ṣicyate krandan devānajījanat

translations.griffith: Shedding the ancient fluid he is poured into the cleansing sieve:  He, thundering, hath produced the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अभि विश्वानि वार्याभि देवान रताव्र्धः सोमः पुनानोर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: abhi viśvāni vāryābhi devān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ somaḥ punānoarṣati

translations.griffith: Soma, while purifying, sends hither all things to be desired,  He sends the Gods who strengthen Law.

verses.sanskrit: गोमन नः सोम वीरवदश्वावद वाजवत सुतः पवस्व बर्हतीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: ghoman naḥ soma vīravadaśvāvad vājavat sutaḥ pavasva bṛhatīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, effused, pour on us wealth in kine, in heroes, steeds, and spoil,  Send us abundant store of food.

verses.sanskrit: यो अत्य इव मर्ज्यते गोभिर्मदाय हर्यतः तं गीर्भिर्वासयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: yo atya iva mṛjyate ghobhirmadāya haryataḥ taṃ ghīrbhirvāsayāmasi

translations.griffith: WE will enrobe with sacred song the Lovely One who, as a Steed,  Is decked with milk for rapturous joy.

verses.sanskrit: तं नो विश्वा अवस्युवो गिरः शुम्भन्ति पूर्वथा इन्दुमिन्द्राय पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ no viśvā avasyuvo ghiraḥ śumbhanti pūrvathā indumindrāya pītaye

translations.griffith: All songs of ours desiring grace adorn him in the ancient way,  Indu for Indra, for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानो याति हर्यतः सोमो गीर्भिः परिष्क्र्तः विप्रस्य मेध्यातिथेः |||
verses.transliteration: punāno yāti haryataḥ somo ghīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ viprasya medhyātitheḥ

translations.griffith: Soma flows on when purified, beloved and adorned with songs,  Songs of the sage Medhyātithi.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान विदा रयिमस्मभ्यं सोम सुश्रियम इन्दो सहस्रवर्चसम |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna vidā rayimasmabhyaṃ soma suśriyam indo sahasravarcasam

translations.griffith: O Soma Pavamana, find exceeding glorious wealth for us,  Wealth, Indu, fraught with boundless might.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुरत्यो न वाजस्र्त कनिक्रन्ति पवित्र आ यदक्षारति देवयुः |||
verses.transliteration: induratyo na vājasṛt kanikranti pavitra ā yadakṣārati devayuḥ

translations.griffith: Like courser racing to the prize Indu, the lover of the Gods,  Roars, as he passes, in the sieve.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व वाजसातये विप्रस्य गर्णतो वर्धे सोम रास्व सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva vājasātaye viprasya ghṛṇato vṛdhe soma rāsva suvīryam

translations.griffith: Flow on thy way to win us strength, to speed the sage who praises thee:  Soma, bestow heroic power.

verses.sanskrit: पर ण इन्दो महे तन ऊर्मिं न बिभ्रदर्षसि अभि देवानयास्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ṇa indo mahe tana ūrmiṃ na bibhradarṣasi abhi devānayāsyaḥ

translations.griffith: INDU, to us for this great rite, bearing as ’twere thy wave to Gods,  Unwearied, thou art flowing forQh.

verses.sanskrit: मती जुष्टो धिया हितः सोमो हिन्वे परावति विप्रस्य धारया कविः |||
verses.transliteration: matī juṣṭo dhiyā hitaḥ somo hinve parāvati viprasya dhārayā kaviḥ

translations.griffith: Pleased with the hymn, impelled by prayer, Soma is hurried far away,  The Wise One in the Singer's stream.,

verses.sanskrit: अयं देवेषु जाग्र्विः सुत एति पवित्र आ सोमो याति विचर्षणिः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ deveṣu jāghṛviḥ suta eti pavitra ā somo yāti vicarṣaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: Watchful among the. gods, this juice advances to the cleansing sieve  Soma, most active, travels on.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पवस्व वाजयुश्चक्राणश्चारुमध्वरम बर्हिष्माना विवासति |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pavasva vājayuścakrāṇaścārumadhvaram barhiṣmānā vivāsati

translations.griffith: Flow onward, seeking strength for us, embellishing the sacrifice:  The priest with trimmed grass calleth thee.

verses.sanskrit: स नो भगाय वायवे विप्रवीरः सदाव्र्धः सोमो देवेष्वा यमत |||
verses.transliteration: sa no bhaghāya vāyave vipravīraḥ sadāvṛdhaḥ somo deveṣvā yamat

translations.griffith: May Soma, ever bringing power to Bhaga and to Vāyu, Sage  And Hero, lead us to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स नो अद्य वसुत्तये करतुविद गातुवित्तमः वाजं जेषि शरवो बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: sa no adya vasuttaye kratuvid ghātuvittamaḥ vājaṃ jeṣi śravo bṛhat

translations.griffith: So, to increase our wealth to-day, Inspirer, best of Furtherers,  Win for us strength and high renown.

verses.sanskrit: स पवस्व मदाय कं नर्चक्षा देववीतये इन्दविन्द्रायपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: sa pavasva madāya kaṃ nṛcakṣā devavītaye indavindrāyapītaye

translations.griffith: FLOW, thou who viewest men, to give delight, to entertain the Gods,  Indu, to Indra for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: स नो अर्षाभि दूत्यं तवमिन्द्राय तोशसे देवान सखिभ्य आ वरम |||
verses.transliteration: sa no arṣābhi dūtyaṃ tvamindrāya tośase devān sakhibhya ā varam

translations.griffith: Stream to thine embassy for us: thou hastenest, for Indra, to  The Gods, O better than our friends.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवामरुणं वयं गोभिरञ्ज्मो मदाय कम वि नो राये दुरो वर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvāmaruṇaṃ vayaṃ ghobhirañjmo madāya kam vi no rāye duro vṛdhi

translations.griffith: We balm thee, red of hue, with milk to fit thee for the rapturous joy:  Unbar for us the doors of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अत्यू पवित्रमक्रमीद वाजी धुरं न यामनि इन्दुर्देवेषु पत्यते |||
verses.transliteration: atyū pavitramakramīd vājī dhuraṃ na yāmani indurdeveṣu patyate

translations.griffith: He through the sieve hath passed, as comes a courser to the pole, to run  Indu belongs unto the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: समी सखायो अस्वरन वने करीळन्तमत्यविम इन्दुं नावा अनूषत |||
verses.transliteration: samī sakhāyo asvaran vane krīḷantamatyavim induṃ nāvā anūṣata

translations.griffith: All friends have lauded him as he sports in the wood, beyond the fleece:  Singers have chanted Indu's praise.

verses.sanskrit: तया पवस्व धारया यया पीतो विचक्षसे इन्दो सतोत्रे सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tayā pavasva dhārayā yayā pīto vicakṣase indo stotre suvīryam

translations.griffith: Flow, Indu, with that stream wherein steeped thou announcest to the man  Who worships thee heroic strength.

verses.sanskrit: अस्र्ग्रन देववीतये.अत्यासः कर्त्व्या इव कषरन्तः पर्वताव्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: asṛghran devavītaye.atyāsaḥ kṛtvyā iva kṣarantaḥ parvatāvṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: LIKE able coursers they have been sent forth to be the feast of Gods,  joying in mountains, flowing on.

verses.sanskrit: परिष्क्र्तास इन्दवो योषेव पित्र्यावती वायुं सोमा अस्र्क्षत |||
verses.transliteration: pariṣkṛtāsa indavo yoṣeva pitryāvatī vāyuṃ somā asṛkṣata

translations.griffith: To Vāyu flow the Soma-streams, the drops of juice made beautiful  Like a bride dowered by her sire.

verses.sanskrit: एते सोमास इन्दवः परयस्वन्तः चमू सुताः इन्द्रं वर्धन्ति कर्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ete somāsa indavaḥ prayasvantaḥ camū sutāḥ indraṃ vardhanti karmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Pressed in the mortar, these, the drops of  juice, the Somas rich in food,  Give strength to Indra with their work.

verses.sanskrit: आ धावता सुहस्त्यः शुक्रा गर्भ्णीत मन्थिना गोभिः शरीणीत मत्सरम |||
verses.transliteration: ā dhāvatā suhastyaḥ śukrā ghṛbhṇīta manthinā ghobhiḥ śrīṇīta matsaram

translations.griffith: Deft-handed men, run hither, seize the brilliant juices blent with meal,  And cook with milk the gladdening draught.

verses.sanskrit: स पवस्व धनंजय परयन्ता राधसो महः अस्मभ्यं सोम गातुवित |||
verses.transliteration: sa pavasva dhanaṃjaya prayantā rādhaso mahaḥ asmabhyaṃ soma ghātuvit

translations.griffith: Thus, Soma, Conqueror of wealth! flow, finding furtherance for us,  Giver oF ample opulence.

verses.sanskrit: एतं मर्जन्ति मर्ज्यं पवमानं दश कषिपः इन्द्राय मत्सरं मदम |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ mṛjanti marjyaṃ pavamānaṃ daśa kṣipaḥ indrāya matsaraṃ madam

translations.griffith: This Pavamana, meet to be adorned, the fingers ten adorn,  The draught that shall make Indra glad.

verses.sanskrit: अया सोमः सुक्र्त्यया महश्चिदभ्यवर्धत मन्दान उद्व्र्षायते |||
verses.transliteration: ayā somaḥ sukṛtyayā mahaścidabhyavardhata mandāna udvṛṣāyate

translations.griffith: GREAT as he was, Soma hath gained strength by this high solemnity:  joyous he riseth like a bull.

verses.sanskrit: कर्तानीदस्य कर्त्वा चेतन्ते दस्युतर्हणा रणा च धर्ष्णुश्चयते |||
verses.transliteration: kṛtānīdasya kartvā cetante dasyutarhaṇā ṛṇā ca dhṛṣṇuścayate

translations.griffith: His task is done: his crushings of the Dasyus are made manifest:  He sternly reckoneth their debts.

verses.sanskrit: आत सोम इन्द्रियो रसो वज्रः सहस्रसा भुवत उक्थं यदस्य जायते |||
verses.transliteration: āt soma indriyo raso vajraḥ sahasrasā bhuvat ukthaṃ yadasya jāyate

translations.griffith: Soon as his song of praise is born, the Soma, Indra's juice, becomes  A thousand-winning thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: सवयं कविर्विधर्तरि विप्राय रत्नमिछति यदी मर्म्र्ज्यते धियः |||
verses.transliteration: svayaṃ kavirvidhartari viprāya ratnamichati yadī marmṛjyate dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Seer and Sustainer, he himself desireth riches for the sage  When he embellisheth his songs.

verses.sanskrit: सिषासतू रयीणां वाजेष्वर्वतामिव भरेषु जिग्युषामसि |||
verses.transliteration: siṣāsatū rayīṇāṃ vājeṣvarvatāmiva bhareṣu jighyuṣāmasi

translations.griffith: Fain would they both win riches as in races of the steeds. In war  Thou art upon the conquerors' side.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा नर्म्णानि बिभ्रतं सधस्थेषु महो दिवः चारुं सुक्र्त्ययेमहे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā nṛmṇāni bibhrataṃ sadhastheṣu maho divaḥ cāruṃ sukṛtyayemahe

translations.griffith: WITH sacrifice we seek to thee kind Cherisher of manly might  In mansions of the lofty heavens;

verses.sanskrit: संव्र्क्तध्र्ष्णुमुक्थ्यं महामहिव्रतं मदम शतं पुरो रुरुक्षणिम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃvṛktadhṛṣṇumukthyaṃ mahāmahivrataṃ madam śataṃ puro rurukṣaṇim

translations.griffith: Gladdening crusher of the bold, ruling with very mighty sway,  Destroyer of a hundred forts.

verses.sanskrit: अतस्त्वा रयिमभि राजानं सुक्रतो दिवः सुपर्णो अव्यथिर्भरत |||
verses.transliteration: atastvā rayimabhi rājānaṃ sukrato divaḥ suparṇo avyathirbharat

translations.griffith: Hence, Sapient One! the Falcon, strong of wing, unwearied, brought thee down,  Lord over riches, from the sky.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्मा इत सवर्द्र्शे साधारणं रजस्तुरम गोपां रतस्य विर्भरत |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasmā it svardṛśe sādhāraṇaṃ rajasturam ghopāṃ ṛtasya virbharat

translations.griffith: That each may see the light, the Bird brought us the guard of Law, the Friend  Of all, the speeder through the air.

verses.sanskrit: अधा हिन्वान इन्द्रियं जयायो महित्वमानशे अभिष्टिक्र्द्विचर्षणिः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā hinvāna indriyaṃ jyāyo mahitvamānaśe abhiṣṭikṛdvicarṣaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: And now, sent forth, it hath attained to mighty power and majesty,  Most active, ready to assist.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व वर्ष्टिमा सु नो.अपामूर्मिं दिवस परि अयक्ष्मा बर्हतीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva vṛṣṭimā su no.apāmūrmiṃ divas pari ayakṣmā bṛhatīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Poust down the rain upon us, pour a wave of waters from the sky,  And plenteous store of wholesome fbod.

verses.sanskrit: तया पवस्व धारया यया गाव इहागमन जन्यास उप नो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: tayā pavasva dhārayā yayā ghāva ihāghaman janyāsa upa no ghṛham

translations.griffith: Flow onward with that stream of thine, whereby the cows have come to us,  The kine of strangers to our home.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तं पवस्व धारया यज्ञेषु देववीतमः अस्मभ्यं वर्ष्टिमा पव |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtaṃ pavasva dhārayā yajñeṣu devavītamaḥ asmabhyaṃ vṛṣṭimā pava

translations.griffith: Chief Friend of Gods in sacred rites, pour on us fatness with thy stream,  Ppur down on us a flood of rain.

verses.sanskrit: स न ऊर्जे वयव्ययं पवित्रं धाव धारया देवासः शर्णवन हि कम |||
verses.transliteration: sa na ūrje vyavyayaṃ pavitraṃ dhāva dhārayā devāsaḥ śṛṇavan hi kam

translations.griffith: To give us vigour, with thy stream run through the fleecy straining-cloth  For verily the Gods will bear.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानो असिष्यदद रक्षांस्यपजङघनत परत्नवद रोचयन रुचः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāno asiṣyadad rakṣāṃsyapajaṅghanat pratnavad rocayan rucaḥ

translations.griffith: Onward hath Pavamana flowed and beaten off the Rākṣasas,  Flashing out splendour as of old.

verses.sanskrit: उत ते शुष्मास ईरते सिन्धोरूर्मेरिव सवनः वाणस्य चोदया पविम |||
verses.transliteration: ut te śuṣmāsa īrate sindhorūrmeriva svanaḥ vāṇasya codayā pavim

translations.griffith: LOUD as a river's roaring wave thy powers have lifted up themselves:  Urge on thine arrow's sharpened point.

verses.sanskrit: परसवे त उदीरते तिस्रो वाचो मखस्युवः यदव्य एषिसानवि |||
verses.transliteration: prasave ta udīrate tisro vāco makhasyuvaḥ yadavya eṣisānavi

translations.griffith: At thine effusion upward rise three voices full of joy, when thou  Flowest upon the fleecy ridge.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यो वारे परि परियं हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः पवमानम्मधुश्चुतम |||
verses.transliteration: avyo vāre pari priyaṃ hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ pavamānammadhuścutam

translations.griffith: On to the fleece they urge with stone the tawny well-beloved One,  Even Pavamana, dropping meath.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व मदिन्तम पवित्रं धारया कवे अर्कस्य योनिमासदम |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva madintama pavitraṃ dhārayā kave arkasya yonimāsadam

translations.griffith: Flow with thy current to the sieve, O Sage most powerful to cheer,  To seat thee in the place of song.

verses.sanskrit: स पवस्व मदिन्तम गोभिरञ्जानो अक्तुभिः इन्दविन्द्रायपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: sa pavasva madintama ghobhirañjāno aktubhiḥ indavindrāyapītaye

translations.griffith: Flow, Most Exhilarating! flow anointed with the milk for balm,  Indu, for Indra, for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यो अद्रिभिः सुतं सोमं पवित्र आ सर्ज पुनीहीन्द्राय पातवे |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryo adribhiḥ sutaṃ somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja punīhīndrāya pātave

translations.griffith: ADHVARYU, on the filter pour the Soma juice expressed with stones,  And make it pure for Indra's drink.

verses.sanskrit: दिवः पीयूषमुत्तमं सोममिन्द्राय वज्रिणे सुनोता मधुमत्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: divaḥ pīyūṣamuttamaṃ somamindrāya vajriṇe sunotā madhumattamam

translations.griffith: Pour out for Indra, Thunder-armed, the milk of heaven,, the Soma's juice,  Most excellent, most rich in sweets.

verses.sanskrit: तव तय इन्दो अन्धसो देवा मधोर्व्यश्नते पवमानस्य मरुतः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tya indo andhaso devā madhorvyaśnate pavamānasya marutaḥ

translations.griffith: These Gods and all the Marut host, Indu enjoy this juice of thine,  This Pavamana's flowing meath.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि सोम वर्धयन सुतो मदाय भूर्णये वर्षन सतोतारमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi soma vardhayan suto madāya bhūrṇaye vṛṣan stotāramūtaye

translations.griffith: For, Soma, thou hast been effused, strengthening for the wild carouse,  O Steer, the singer, for our help.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यर्ष विचक्षण पवित्रं धारया सुतः अभि वाजमुत शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: abhyarṣa vicakṣaṇa pavitraṃ dhārayā sutaḥ abhi vājamuta śravaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow with thy stream, Far-sighted One, effused, into the cleansing sieve:  Flow on to give us strength and fame.

verses.sanskrit: परि दयुक्षः सनद्रयिर्भरद वाजं नो अन्धसा सुवानोर्ष पवित्र आ |||
verses.transliteration: pari dyukṣaḥ sanadrayirbharad vājaṃ no andhasā suvānoarṣa pavitra ā

translations.griffith: WEALTH-WINNER, dwelling in the sky, bringing us vigour with the juice,  Flow to the filter when effused.

verses.sanskrit: तव परत्नेभिरध्वभिरव्यो वारे परि परियः सहस्रधारो यात तना |||
verses.transliteration: tava pratnebhiradhvabhiravyo vāre pari priyaḥ sahasradhāro yāt tanā

translations.griffith: So, in thine ancient ways, may he, beloved, with a thousand streams  Run o’er the fleecy straining-cloth.

verses.sanskrit: चरुर्न यस्तमीङखयेन्दो न दानमीङखय वधैर्वधस्नवीङखय |||
verses.transliteration: carurna yastamīṅkhayendo na dānamīṅkhaya vadhairvadhasnavīṅkhaya

translations.griffith: Him who is like a caldron shake: O Indu, shake thy gift to us  Shake it, armed Warrior! with thine arms.

verses.sanskrit: नि शुष्ममिन्दवेषां पुरुहूत जनानाम यो अस्मानादिदेशति |||
verses.transliteration: ni śuṣmamindaveṣāṃ puruhūta janānām yo asmānādideśati

translations.griffith: Indu, invoked with many a prayer, bring down the vigour of these men,  Of him who threatens us with war.

verses.sanskrit: शतं न इन्द ऊतिभिः सहस्रं वा शुचीनाम पवस्व मंहयद्रयिः |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ na inda ūtibhiḥ sahasraṃ vā śucīnām pavasva maṃhayadrayiḥ

translations.griffith: Indu, Wealth-giver, with thine help pour out for us a hundred, yea,  A thousand of thy pure bright streams.

verses.sanskrit: उत ते शुष्मासो अस्थू रक्षो भिन्दन्तो अद्रिवः नुदस्व याः परिस्प्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: ut te śuṣmāso asthū rakṣo bhindanto adrivaḥ nudasva yāḥ parispṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: O THOU with stones for arms, thy powers, crushing the fiends, have raised themselves:  Chase thou the foes who compass us.

verses.sanskrit: अया निजघ्निरोजसा रथसंगे धने हिते सतवा अबिभ्युषा हर्दा |||
verses.transliteration: ayā nijaghnirojasā rathasaṃghe dhane hite stavā abibhyuṣā hṛdā

translations.griffith: Thou conquerest thus with might when car meets car, and when the prize is staked:  With fearless heart will I sing praise.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य वरतानि नाध्र्षे पवमानस्य दूढ्या रुज यस्त्वाप्र्तन्यति |||
verses.transliteration: asya vratāni nādhṛṣe pavamānasya dūḍhyā ruja yastvāpṛtanyati

translations.griffith: No one with evil thought assails this Pavamana's holy laws:  Crush him who fain would fight with thee.

verses.sanskrit: तं हिन्वन्ति मदच्युतं हरिं नदीषु वाजिनम इन्दुमिन्द्राय मत्सरम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ hinvanti madacyutaṃ hariṃ nadīṣu vājinam indumindrāya matsaram

translations.griffith: For Indra to the streams they drive the tawny rapture-dropping Steed,  Indu the bringer of delight.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य परत्नामनु दयुतं शुक्रं दुदुह्रे अह्रयः पयः सहस्रसां रषिम |||
verses.transliteration: asya pratnāmanu dyutaṃ śukraṃ duduhre ahrayaḥ payaḥ sahasrasāṃ ṛṣim

translations.griffith: AFTER his ancient splendour, they, the bold, have drawn the bright milk from  The Sage who wins a thousand gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सूर्य इवोपद्र्गयं सरांसि धावति सप्त परवता दिवम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ sūrya ivopadṛghayaṃ sarāṃsi dhāvati sapta pravataā divam

translations.griffith: In aspect he is like the Sun; he runneth forward to the lakes,  Seven currents flowing through the sky.

verses.sanskrit: अयं विश्वानि तिष्ठति पुनानो भुवनोपरि सोमो देवो नसूर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ viśvāni tiṣṭhati punāno bhuvanopari somo devo nasūryaḥ

translations.griffith: He, shining in his splendour, stands high over all things that exist-  Soma, a God as Sūrya is.

verses.sanskrit: परि णो देववीतये वाजानर्षसि गोमतः पुनान इन्दविन्द्रयुः |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṇo devavītaye vājānarṣasi ghomataḥ punāna indavindrayuḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Indu, in thy brilliancy, pourest on us, as Indra's Friend,  Wealth from the kine to feast the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यवं-यवं नो अन्धसा पुष्टम-पुष्टं परि सरव सोम विश्वा च सौभगा |||
verses.transliteration: yavaṃ-yavaṃ no andhasā puṣṭam-puṣṭaṃ pari srava soma viśvā ca saubhaghā

translations.griffith: POUR on us with thy juice all kinds of corn, each sort of nourishment,  And, Soma, all felicities.

verses.sanskrit: ईन्दो यथा तव सतवो यथा ते जातमन्धसः नि बर्हिषि परिये सदः |||
verses.transliteration: īndo yathā tava stavo yathā te jātamandhasaḥ ni barhiṣi priye sadaḥ

translations.griffith: As thine, O Indu, is the praise, and thine what springeth from the juice,  Seat thee on the dear sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो गोविदश्ववित पवस्व सोमान्धसा मक्षूतमेभिरहभिः |||
verses.transliteration: uta no ghovidaśvavit pavasva somāndhasā makṣūtamebhirahabhiḥ

translations.griffith: And, finding for us kine and steeds, O Soma, with thy juice flow on  Through days that fly most rapidly.

verses.sanskrit: यो जिनाति न जीयते हन्ति शत्रुमभीत्य स पवस्व सहस्रजित |||
verses.transliteration: yo jināti na jīyate hanti śatrumabhītya sa pavasva sahasrajit

translations.griffith: As one who conquers, ne’er subdued, attacks and stays the enemy,  Thus, Vanquisher of thousands! flow.

verses.sanskrit: परि सोम रतं बर्हदाशुः पवित्रे अर्षति विघ्नन रक्षांसि देवयुः |||
verses.transliteration: pari soma ṛtaṃ bṛhadāśuḥ pavitre arṣati vighnan rakṣāṃsi devayuḥ

translations.griffith: SWIFT to the purifying sieve flows Soma as exalted Law,  Slaying the fiends, loving the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यत सोमो वाजमर्षति शतं धारा अपस्युवः इन्द्रस्यसख्यमाविशन |||
verses.transliteration: yat somo vājamarṣati śataṃ dhārā apasyuvaḥ indrasyasakhyamāviśan

translations.griffith: When Soma pours the strengthening food a hundred ever-active streams  To Indra's friendship win theirway.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा योषणो दश जारं न कन्यानूषत मर्ज्यसे सोम सातये |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā yoṣaṇo daśa jāraṃ na kanyānūṣata mṛjyase soma sātaye

translations.griffith: Ten Dames have sung to welcome thee, even as a maiden greets her love:  O Soma, thou art decked to win.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्राय विष्णवे सवादुरिन्दो परि सरव नॄन सतोतॄन्पाह्यंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindrāya viṣṇave svādurindo pari srava nṝn stotṝnpāhyaṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow hitherward, O Indu, sweet to Indra and to Viṣṇu: guard  The men, the singers, from distress.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते धारा असश्चतो दिवो न यन्ति वर्ष्टयः अछा वाजं सहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: pra te dhārā asaścato divo na yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ achā vājaṃ sahasriṇam

translations.griffith: THY streams that never fail or waste flow forth like showers of rain from heaven,  To bring a thousand stores of strength.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परियाणि काव्या विश्वा चक्षाणो अर्षति हरिस्तुञ्जान आयुधा |||
verses.transliteration: abhi priyāṇi kāvyā viśvā cakṣāṇo arṣati haristuñjāna āyudhā

translations.griffith: He flows beholding on his way all wellbeloved sacred lore,  Green-tinted, brandishing his, arms.

verses.sanskrit: स मर्म्र्जान आयुभिरिभो राजेव सुव्रतः शयेनो न वंसु षीदति |||
verses.transliteration: sa marmṛjāna āyubhiribho rājeva suvrataḥ śyeno na vaṃsu ṣīdati

translations.griffith: He, when the people deck him like a docile king of elephants.  Sits as a falcon in the, wood.

verses.sanskrit: स नो विश्वा दिवो वसूतो पर्थिव्या अधि पुनान इन्दवाभर |||
verses.transliteration: sa no viśvā divo vasūto pṛthivyā adhi punāna indavābhara

translations.griffith: So bring thou hitherward to us, Indu, while thou art purified,  All treasures both of heaven and earth.

verses.sanskrit: तरत स मन्दी धावति धारा सुतस्यान्धसः तरत स मन्दी धावति |||
verses.transliteration: tarat sa mandī dhāvati dhārā sutasyāndhasaḥ tarat sa mandī dhāvati

translations.griffith: SWIFT runs this giver of delight, even the stream of flowing juice:  Swift runs this giver of delight.

verses.sanskrit: उस्रा वेद वसूनां मर्तस्य देव्यवसः तरत स मन्दी धावति |||
verses.transliteration: usrā veda vasūnāṃ martasya devyavasaḥ tarat sa mandī dhāvati

translations.griffith: The Morning knows all precious things, the Goddess knows her grace to man:  Swift runs this giver of delight.

verses.sanskrit: धवस्रयोः पुरुषन्त्योरा सहस्राणि दद्महे तरत स मन्दी धावति |||
verses.transliteration: dhvasrayoḥ puruṣantyorā sahasrāṇi dadmahe tarat sa mandī dhāvati

translations.griffith: We have accepted thousands from Dhvasra's and Puruṣanti's hands:  Swift runs this giver of delight.

verses.sanskrit: आ ययोस्त्रिंशतं तना सहस्राणि च दद्महे तरत समन्दी धावति |||
verses.transliteration: ā yayostriṃśataṃ tanā sahasrāṇi ca dadmahe tarat samandī dhāvati

translations.griffith: From whom we have accepted thus thousands and three times ten beside:  Swift runs this giver of delight.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व गोजिदश्वजिद विश्वजित सोम रण्यजित परजावद रत्नमा भर |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva ghojidaśvajid viśvajit soma raṇyajit prajāvad ratnamā bhara

translations.griffith: FLOW onward, Soma, winning kine, and steeds, and all that gives delight:  Bring hither wealth with progeny.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्वाद्भ्यो अदाभ्यः पवस्वौषधीभ्यः पवस्व धिषणाभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasvādbhyo adābhyaḥ pavasvauṣadhībhyaḥ pavasva dhiṣaṇābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward from the waters, flow, inviolable, from the plants:  Flow onward from the pressing-boards.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम पवमानो विश्वानि दुरिता तर कविः सीद नि बर्हिषि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma pavamāno viśvāni duritā tara kaviḥ sīda ni barhiṣi

translations.griffith: Soma, as Pavamana, pass over all trouble and distress:  Sit on the sacred grass, a Sage.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान सवर्विदो जायमानो.अभवो महान इन्दो विश्वानभीदसि |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna svarvido jāyamāno.abhavo mahān indo viśvānabhīdasi

translations.griffith: Thou, Pavamana, foundest light; thou at thy birth becamest great:  O Indu, thou art over all.

verses.sanskrit: पर गायत्रेण गायत पवमानं विचर्षणिम इन्दुं सहस्रचक्षसम |||
verses.transliteration: pra ghāyatreṇa ghāyata pavamānaṃ vicarṣaṇim induṃ sahasracakṣasam

translations.griffith: SING forth and laud with sacred song most active Pavamana, laud  Indu who sees with thousand eyes.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा सहस्रचक्षसमथो सहस्रभर्णसम अति वारमपाविषुः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā sahasracakṣasamatho sahasrabharṇasam ati vāramapāviṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Thee who hast thousand eyes to see, bearer of thousand burthens, they  Have filtered through the fleecy cloth.

verses.sanskrit: अति वारान पवमानो असिष्यदत कलशानभि धावति इन्द्रस्य हार्द्याविशन |||
verses.transliteration: ati vārān pavamāno asiṣyadat kalaśānabhi dhāvati indrasya hārdyāviśan

translations.griffith: He, Pavamana, hath streamed through the fleece then: he runs into the jars,  Finding his way to Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य सोम राधसे शं पवस्व विचर्षणे परजावद रेता भर |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya soma rādhase śaṃ pavasva vicarṣaṇe prajāvad retaā bhara

translations.griffith: That Indra may be bounteous, flow, most active Soma, for our weal:  Bring genial seed with progeny.

verses.sanskrit: अया वीती परि सरव यस्त इन्दो मदेष्वा अवाहन नवतीर्नव |||
verses.transliteration: ayā vītī pari srava yasta indo madeṣvā avāhan navatīrnava

translations.griffith: FLOW onward, Indu, with this food for him who in thy wild delight  Battered the nine-and-ninety down,

verses.sanskrit: पुरः सद्य इत्थाधिये दिवोदासाय शम्बरम अध तयं तुर्वशं यदुम |||
verses.transliteration: puraḥ sadya itthādhiye divodāsāya śambaram adha tyaṃ turvaśaṃ yadum

translations.griffith: Smote swiftly forts, and gambara, then Yadu and that Turvaga,  For pious Divodāsa's sake.

verses.sanskrit: परि णो अश्वमश्वविद गोमदिन्दो हिरण्यवत कषरा सहस्रिणीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṇo aśvamaśvavid ghomadindo hiraṇyavat kṣarā sahasriṇīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Finder of horses, pour on us horses and  wealth in kine and gold,  And, Indu, food in boundless store.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानस्य ते वयं पवित्रमभ्युन्दतः सखित्वमा वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānasya te vayaṃ pavitramabhyundataḥ sakhitvamā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: We seek to win thy friendly love, even Pavamana's flowing o’er  The limit of the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit: ये ते पवित्रमूर्मयो.अभिक्षरन्ति धारया तेभिर्नः सोम मर्ळय |||
verses.transliteration: ye te pavitramūrmayo.abhikṣaranti dhārayā tebhirnaḥ soma mṛḷaya

translations.griffith: With those same waves which in their stream oyerflow the purifying sieve,  Soma; be gracious unto us.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पुनान आ भर रयिं वीरवतीमिषम ईशानःसोम विश्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ punāna ā bhara rayiṃ vīravatīmiṣam īśānaḥsoma viśvataḥ

translations.griffith: O Soma, being purified, bring us from all sides,—for thou canst,—  Riches and food with hero sons.

verses.sanskrit: एतमु तयं दश कषिपो मर्जन्ति सिन्धुमातरम समादित्येभिरख्यत |||
verses.transliteration: etamu tyaṃ daśa kṣipo mṛjanti sindhumātaram samādityebhirakhyata

translations.griffith: Him here, the Child whom streams have borne, the ten swift fingers beautify  With the Ādityas is he seen.

verses.sanskrit: समिन्द्रेणोत वायुना सुत एति पवित्र आ सं सूर्यस्यरश्मिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: samindreṇota vāyunā suta eti pavitra ā saṃ sūryasyaraśmibhiḥ

translations.griffith: With Indra and with Vāyu he, effused, flows onward with,the beams  Of Sūrya to the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit: स नो भगाय वायवे पूष्णे पवस्व मधुमान चारुर्मित्रे वरुणे च |||
verses.transliteration: sa no bhaghāya vāyave pūṣṇe pavasva madhumān cārurmitre varuṇe ca

translations.griffith: Flow rich in sweets and lovely for our Bhaga, Vāyu, Pūṣan flow  For Mitra and for Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: उच्चा ते जातमन्धसो दिवि षद भूम्या ददे उग्रं शर्म महि शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: uccā te jātamandhaso divi ṣad bhūmyā dade ughraṃ śarma mahi śravaḥ

translations.griffith: High is thy juice's birth: though set in heaven, on earth it hath obtained  Strong sheltering power and great renown.

verses.sanskrit: एना विश्वान्यर्य आ दयुम्नानि मानुषाणाम सिषासन्तो वनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: enā viśvānyarya ā dyumnāni mānuṣāṇām siṣāsanto vanāmahe

translations.griffith: Striving to win, with him we gain all wealth from the ungodly man,  Yea, all the glories of mankind.

verses.sanskrit: स न इन्द्राय यज्यवे वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यः वरिवोवित परिस्रव |||
verses.transliteration: sa na indrāya yajyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ varivovit parisrava

translations.griffith: Finder of room and freedom, flow for Indra whom we must adore,  For Varuṇa and the Marut host.

verses.sanskrit: उपो षु जातमप्तुरं गोभिर्भङगं परिष्क्र्तम इन्दुं देवा अयासिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: upo ṣu jātamapturaṃ ghobhirbhaṅghaṃ pariṣkṛtam induṃ devā ayāsiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods have come to Indu well-descended, beautified with milk,  The active crusher of the foe.

verses.sanskrit: तमिद वर्धन्तु नो गिरो वत्सं संशिश्वरीरिव य इन्द्रस्य हर्दंसनिः |||
verses.transliteration: tamid vardhantu no ghiro vatsaṃ saṃśiśvarīriva ya indrasya hṛdaṃsaniḥ

translations.griffith: Even as mother cows their calf, so let our praise-songs strengthen him,  Yea, him who winneth Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit: अर्षा णः सोम शं गवे धुक्षस्व पिप्युषीमिषम वर्धा समुद्रमुक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: arṣā ṇaḥ soma śaṃ ghave dhukṣasva pipyuṣīmiṣam vardhā samudramukthyam

translations.griffith: Soma, pour blessings on our kine, pour forth the food that streams with milk  Increase the sea that merits laud.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानो अजीजनद दिवश्चित्रं न तन्यतुम जयोतिर्वैश्वानरं बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāno ajījanad divaścitraṃ na tanyatum jyotirvaiśvānaraṃ bṛhat

translations.griffith: From heaven hath Pavamana made, as ’twere, the marvellous thunder, and  The lofty light of all mankind.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानस्य ते रसो मदो राजन्नदुछुनः वि वारमव्यमर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānasya te raso mado rājannaduchunaḥ vi vāramavyamarṣati

translations.griffith: The gladdening and auspicious juice of thee, of Pavamana, King!  Flows o’er the woollen straining-cloth.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान रसस्तव दक्षो वि राजति दयुमान जयोतिर्विश्वं सवर्द्र्शे |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna rasastava dakṣo vi rājati dyumān jyotirviśvaṃ svardṛśe

translations.griffith: Thy juice, O Pavamana, sends its rays abroad like splendid skill,  Like lustre, all heaven's light, to see.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते मदो वरेण्यस्तेना पवस्वान्धसा देवावीरघशंसहा |||
verses.transliteration: yaste mado vareṇyastenā pavasvāndhasā devāvīraghaśaṃsahā

translations.griffith: Flow onward with that juice of thine most excellent, that brings delight,  Slaying the wicked, dear to Gods.

verses.sanskrit: जघ्निर्व्र्त्रममित्रियं सस्निर्वाजं दिवे-दिवे गोषा उ अश्वसा असि |||
verses.transliteration: jaghnirvṛtramamitriyaṃ sasnirvājaṃ dive-dive ghoṣā u aśvasā asi

translations.griffith: Killing the foeman and his hate, and winning booty every day,  Gainer art thou of steeds and kine.

verses.sanskrit: सम्मिश्लो अरुषो भव सूपस्थाभिर्न धेनुभिः सीदञ्छ्येनो न योनिमा |||
verses.transliteration: sammiślo aruṣo bhava sūpasthābhirna dhenubhiḥ sīdañchyeno na yonimā

translations.griffith: Red-hued, be blended with the milk that seems to yield its lovely breast,  Falcon-like resting in thine home.

verses.sanskrit: स पवस्व य आविथेन्द्रं वर्त्राय हन्तवे वव्रिवांसं महीरपः |||
verses.transliteration: sa pavasva ya āvithendraṃ vṛtrāya hantave vavrivāṃsaṃ mahīrapaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward thou who strengthenedst Indra to slaughter Vṛtra who  Compassed and stayed the mighty floods.

verses.sanskrit: सुवीरासो वयं धना जयेम सोम मीढ्वः पुनानो वर्धनो गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: suvīrāso vayaṃ dhanā jayema soma mīḍhvaḥ punāno vardhano ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Soma who rainest gifts, may we win riches with our hero sons:  Strengthen, as thou art cleansed, our hymns.

verses.sanskrit: तवोतासस्तवावसा सयाम वन्वन्त आमुरः सोम वरतेषुजाग्र्हि |||
verses.transliteration: tvotāsastavāvasā syāma vanvanta āmuraḥ soma vrateṣujāghṛhi

translations.griffith: Aided by thee, and through thy grace, may we be slayers when we war:  Watch, Soma, at our solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit: अपघ्नन पवते मर्धो.अप सोमो अराव्णः गछन्निन्द्रस्य निष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: apaghnan pavate mṛdho.apa somo arāvṇaḥ ghachannindrasya niṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: Chasing our foemen, driving off the godless, Soma flowcth on,  Going to Indra's special place.

verses.sanskrit: महो नो राय आ भर पवमान जही मर्धः रास्वेन्दो वीरवद यशः |||
verses.transliteration: maho no rāya ā bhara pavamāna jahī mṛdhaḥ rāsvendo vīravad yaśaḥ

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, hither bring great riches, and destroy our foes:  O Indu, grant heroic fame.

verses.sanskrit: न तवा शतं चन हरुतो राधो दित्सन्तमा मिनन यत पुनानो मखस्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: na tvā śataṃ cana hruto rādho ditsantamā minan yat punāno makhasyase

translations.griffith: A hundred obstacles have ne’er checked  thee when fain to give thy boons,  When, being cleansed, thou combatest.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्वेन्दो वर्षा सुतः कर्धी नो यशसो जने विश्वा अपद्विषो जहि |||
verses.transliteration: pavasvendo vṛṣā sutaḥ kṛdhī no yaśaso jane viśvā apadviṣo jahi

translations.griffith: Indu, flow on, a mighty juice; glorify us among the folk:  Drive all our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य ते सख्ये वयं तवेन्दो दयुम्न उत्तमे सासह्याम पर्तन्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: asya te sakhye vayaṃ tavendo dyumna uttame sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ

translations.griffith: Indu, in this thy friendship most lofty and glorious may we  Subdue all those who war with us.

verses.sanskrit: या ते भीमान्यायुधा तिग्मानि सन्ति धूर्वणे रक्षा समस्य नो निदः |||
verses.transliteration: yā te bhīmānyāyudhā tighmāni santi dhūrvaṇe rakṣā samasya no nidaḥ

translations.griffith: Those awful weapons that thou hast, sharpened at point to strike men down-  Guard us therewith from every foe.

verses.sanskrit: एते अस्र्ग्रमिन्दवस्तिरः पवित्रमाशवः विश्वान्यभिसौभगा |||
verses.transliteration: ete asṛghramindavastiraḥ pavitramāśavaḥ viśvānyabhisaubhaghā

translations.griffith: THESE rapid Soma-drops have been poured through the purifying sieve  To bring us all felicities.

verses.sanskrit: विघ्नन्तो दुरिता पुरु सुगा तोकाय वाजिनः तना कर्ण्वन्तो अर्वते |||
verses.transliteration: vighnanto duritā puru sughā tokāya vājinaḥ tanā kṛṇvanto arvate

translations.griffith: Dispelling manifold mishap, giving the courser's progeny,  Yea, and the warrior steed, success.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ण्वन्तो वरिवो गवे.अभ्यर्षन्ति सुष्टुतिम इळामस्मभ्यं संयतम |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṇvanto varivo ghave.abhyarṣanti suṣṭutim iḷāmasmabhyaṃ saṃyatam

translations.griffith: Bringing prosperity to kine, they make perpetual Iḷā flow  To us for noble eulogy.

verses.sanskrit: असाव्यंशुर्मदायाप्सु दक्षो गिरिष्ठाः शयेनो न योनिमासदत |||
verses.transliteration: asāvyaṃśurmadāyāpsu dakṣo ghiriṣṭhāḥ śyeno na yonimāsadat

translations.griffith: Strong, mountain-born, the stalk hath been  pressed in the streams for rapturous joy:  Hawk-like he settles in his home.

verses.sanskrit: शुभ्रमन्धो देववातमप्सु धूतो नर्भिः सुतः सवदन्ति गावः पयोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: śubhramandho devavātamapsu dhūto nṛbhiḥ sutaḥ svadanti ghāvaḥ payobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Fair is the God-loved juice; the plant is washed in waters, pressed by men  The milch-kine sweeten it with milk.

verses.sanskrit: आदीमश्वं न हेतारो.अशूशुभन्नम्र्ताय मध्वो रसं सधमादे |||
verses.transliteration: ādīmaśvaṃ na hetāro.aśūśubhannamṛtāya madhvo rasaṃ sadhamāde

translations.griffith: As drivers deck a courser, so have they adorned the meath's juice for  Ambrosia, for the festival.

verses.sanskrit: यास्ते धारा मधुश्चुतो.अस्र्ग्रमिन्द ऊतये ताभिः पवित्रमासदः |||
verses.transliteration: yāste dhārā madhuścuto.asṛghraminda ūtaye tābhiḥ pavitramāsadaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Indu, with thy streams that drop sweet juices, which were poured for  help,  Hast settled in the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit: सो अर्षेन्द्राय पीतये तिरो रोमाण्यव्यया सीदन योना वनेष्वा |||
verses.transliteration: so arṣendrāya pītaye tiro romāṇyavyayā sīdan yonā vaneṣvā

translations.griffith: So flow thou onward through the fleece, for Indra flow, to be his drink,  Finding thine home in vats of wood.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्दो परि सरव सवादिष्ठो अङगिरोभ्यः वरिवोविद घर्तं पयः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindo pari srava svādiṣṭho aṅghirobhyaḥ varivovid ghṛtaṃ payaḥ

translations.griffith: As giving room and freedom, as most sweet, pour butter forth and milk,  O Indu, for the Aṅgirases.

verses.sanskrit: अयं विचर्षणिर्हितः पवमानः स चेतति हिन्वान आप्यं बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vicarṣaṇirhitaḥ pavamānaḥ sa cetati hinvāna āpyaṃ bṛhat

translations.griffith: Most active and benevolent, this Pavamana, sent to us  For lofty friendship, meditates.

verses.sanskrit: एष वर्षा वर्षव्रतः पवमानो अशस्तिहा करद वसूनि दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa vṛṣā vṛṣavrataḥ pavamāno aśastihā karad vasūni dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Queller of curses, mighty, with strong sway, this Pavamana shall  Bring treasures to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व सहस्रिणं रयिं गोमन्तमश्विनम पुरुश्चन्द्रम्पुरुस्प्र्हम |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ ghomantamaśvinam puruścandrampuruspṛham

translations.griffith: Pour thou upon us thousandfold possessions, both of kine and steeds,  Exceeding glorious, much-desired.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय परि षिच्यते मर्म्र्ज्यमान आयुभिः उरुगायः कविक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya pari ṣicyate marmṛjyamāna āyubhiḥ urughāyaḥ kavikratuḥ

translations.griffith: Wandering far, with wise designs, the juice here present is effused,  Made beautiful by living men.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रोतिः शतामघो विमानो रजसः कविः इन्द्राय पवते मदः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasrotiḥ śatāmagho vimāno rajasaḥ kaviḥ indrāya pavate madaḥ

translations.griffith: For Indra flows the gladdening drink, the measurer of the region, Sage,  With countless wealth and endless help.

verses.sanskrit: गिरा जात इह सतुत इन्दुरिन्द्राय धीयते विर्योना वसताविव |||
verses.transliteration: ghirā jāta iha stuta indurindrāya dhīyate viryonā vasatāviva

translations.griffith: Born on the inountain, lauded here, Indu for Indra is set down,  As in her sheltering nest a bird.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानः सुतो नर्भिः सोमो वाजमिवासरत चमूषु शक्मनासदम |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānaḥ suto nṛbhiḥ somo vājamivāsarat camūṣu śakmanāsadam

translations.griffith: Pressed by the men, as ’twere to war hath Soma Pavamana sped,  To test with might within the vats.

verses.sanskrit: तं तरिप्र्ष्ठे तरिवन्धुरे रथे युञ्जन्ति यातवे रषीणां सप्त धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tripṛṣṭhe trivandhure rathe yuñjanti yātave ṛṣīṇāṃ sapta dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: That he may move, they yoke him to the three-backed triple-seated car  By the Seven Ṛṣis’ holy songs.

verses.sanskrit: तं सोतारो धनस्प्र्तमाशुं वाजाय यातवे हरिं हिनोत वाजिनम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ sotāro dhanaspṛtamāśuṃ vājāya yātave hariṃ hinota vājinam

translations.griffith: Drive ye that Tawny Courser, O ye pressers, on his way to war,  Swift Steed who carries off the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: आविशन कलशं सुतो विश्वा अर्षन्नभि शरियः शूरोन गोषु तिष्ठति |||
verses.transliteration: āviśan kalaśaṃ suto viśvā arṣannabhi śriyaḥ śūrona ghoṣu tiṣṭhati

translations.griffith: Pouring all glories hither, he, effused and entering the jar,  Stands like a hero mid the kine.

verses.sanskrit: आ त इन्दो मदाय कं पयो दुहन्त्यायवः देवा देवेभ्यो मधु |||
verses.transliteration: ā ta indo madāya kaṃ payo duhantyāyavaḥ devā devebhyo madhu

translations.griffith: Indu, the living men milk out the juice to make the rapturous draught:  Gods for the Gods milk out the meath.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः सोमं पवित्र आ सर्जता मधुमत्तमम देवेभ्यो देवश्रुत्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ somaṃ pavitra ā sṛjatā madhumattamam devebhyo devaśruttamam

translations.griffith: Pour for the Gods into the sieve our Soma very rich in sweets,  Him whom the Gods most gladly hear.

verses.sanskrit: एते सोमा अस्र्क्षत गर्णानाः शरवसे महे मदिन्तमस्य धारया |||
verses.transliteration: ete somā asṛkṣata ghṛṇānāḥ śravase mahe madintamasya dhārayā

translations.griffith: Into his stream who gladdens best these Soma juices have been poured,  Lauded with songs for lofty fame.

verses.sanskrit: अभि गव्यानि वीतये नर्म्णा पुनानो अर्षसि सनद्वाजः परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: abhi ghavyāni vītaye nṛmṇā punāno arṣasi sanadvājaḥ pari srava

translations.griffith: Thou flowest to enjoy the milk, and bringest valour, being cleansed:  Winning the spoil flow hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो गोमतीरिषो विश्वा अर्ष परिष्टुभः गर्णानो जमदग्निना |||
verses.transliteration: uta no ghomatīriṣo viśvā arṣa pariṣṭubhaḥ ghṛṇāno jamadaghninā

translations.griffith: And, hymned by Jamadagnis, let all nourishment that kine supply,  And general praises, flow to us.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व वाचो अग्रियः सोम चित्राभिरूतिभिः अभि विश्वानि काव्या |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva vāco aghriyaḥ soma citrābhirūtibhiḥ abhi viśvāni kāvyā

translations.griffith: Soma, as leader of the song flow onward with thy wondrous aids,  For holy lore of every kind.

verses.sanskrit: तवं समुद्रिया अपो.अग्रियो वाच ईरयन पवस्व विश्वमेजय |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ samudriyā apo.aghriyo vāca īrayan pavasva viśvamejaya

translations.griffith: Do thou as leader of the song, stirring the waters of the sea,  Flow onward, thou who movest all.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्येमा भुवना कवे महिम्ने सोम तस्थिरे तुभ्यमर्षन्तिसिन्धवः |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyemā bhuvanā kave mahimne soma tasthire tubhyamarṣantisindhavaḥ

translations.griffith: O Soma, O thou Sage, these worlds stand ready to attest thy might:  For thy behoof the rivers flow.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते दिवो न वर्ष्टयो धारा यन्त्यसश्चतः अभि शुक्रामुपस्तिरम |||
verses.transliteration: pra te divo na vṛṣṭayo dhārā yantyasaścataḥ abhi śukrāmupastiram

translations.griffith: Like showers of rain that fall from heaven thy streams perpetually flow  To the bright fleece spread under them.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रायेन्दुं पुनीतनोग्रं दक्षाय साधनम ईशानं वीतिराधसम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāyenduṃ punītanoghraṃ dakṣāya sādhanam īśānaṃ vītirādhasam

translations.griffith: For potent Indra purify Indu effectual and strong,  Enjoyment-giver, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान रतः कविः सोमः पवित्रमासदत दधत सतोत्रेसुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna ṛtaḥ kaviḥ somaḥ pavitramāsadat dadhat stotresuvīryam

translations.griffith: Soma, true, Pavamana, Sage, is seated in the cleansing sieve,  Giving his praiser hero strength.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व सहस्रिणं रयिं सोम सुवीर्यम अस्मे शरवांसिधारय |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ soma suvīryam asme śravāṃsidhāraya

translations.griffith: POUR hitherward, O Soma, wealth in thousands and heroic strength,  And keep renown secure for us.

verses.sanskrit: इषमूर्जं च पिन्वस इन्द्राय मत्सरिन्तमः चमूष्वा नि षीदसि |||
verses.transliteration: iṣamūrjaṃ ca pinvasa indrāya matsarintamaḥ camūṣvā ni ṣīdasi

translations.griffith: Thou makest food and vigour swell for Indra, best of gladdeners!  Within the cups thou seatest thee.

verses.sanskrit: सुत इन्द्राय विष्णवे सोमः कलशे अक्षरत मधुमानस्तुवायवे |||
verses.transliteration: suta indrāya viṣṇave somaḥ kalaśe akṣarat madhumānastuvāyave

translations.griffith: For Indra and for Viṣṇu poured, Soma hath flowed into the jar:  May Vāyu find it rich in sweets.

verses.sanskrit: एते अस्र्ग्रमाशवो.अति हवरांसि बभ्रवः सोमा रतस्य धारया |||
verses.transliteration: ete asṛghramāśavo.ati hvarāṃsi babhravaḥ somā ṛtasya dhārayā

translations.griffith: These Somas swift and brown of hue, in stream of solemn sacrifice  Have flowed through twisted obstacles,

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तो अप्तुरः कर्ण्वन्तो विश्वमार्यम अपघ्नन्तो अराव्णः |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vardhanto apturaḥ kṛṇvanto viśvamāryam apaghnanto arāvṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Performing every noble work, active, augmenting Indra's strength,  Driving away the godless ones.

verses.sanskrit: सुता अनु सवमा रजो.अभ्यर्षन्ति बभ्रवः इन्द्रं गछन्त इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: sutā anu svamā rajo.abhyarṣanti babhravaḥ indraṃ ghachanta indavaḥ

translations.griffith: Brown Soma-drops, effused that seek Indra, to their appropriate place  Flow through the region hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: अया पवस्व धारया यया सूर्यमरोचयः हिन्वानो मानुषीरपः |||
verses.transliteration: ayā pavasva dhārayā yayā sūryamarocayaḥ hinvāno mānuṣīrapaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward with that stream of thine wherewith thou gavest Sūrya light,  Urging on waters good to men.

verses.sanskrit: अयुक्त सूर एतशं पवमानो मनावधि अन्तरिक्षेण यातवे |||
verses.transliteration: ayukta sūra etaśaṃ pavamāno manāvadhi antarikṣeṇa yātave

translations.griffith: He, Pavamana, high o’er man yoked the Sun's courser Etaśa  To travel through the realm of air.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया हरितो दश सूरो अयुक्त यातवे इन्दुरिन्द्र इतिब्रुवन |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā harito daśa sūro ayukta yātave indurindra itibruvan

translations.griffith: And those ten Coursers, tawny-hued, he harnessed that the Sun might come  Indu, he said, is Indra's self.

verses.sanskrit: परीतो वायवे सुतं गिर इन्द्राय मत्सरम अव्यो वारेषुसिञ्चत |||
verses.transliteration: parīto vāyave sutaṃ ghira indrāya matsaram avyo vāreṣusiñcata

translations.griffith: Hence, singers, pour the gladdeningjuice to Vāyu and to Indra, pour  The drops upon the fleecy cloth.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान विदा रयिमस्मभ्यं सोम दुष्टरम यो दूणाशो वनुष्यता |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna vidā rayimasmabhyaṃ soma duṣṭaram yo dūṇāśo vanuṣyatā

translations.griffith: O Soma Pavamana, find wealth for us not to be assailed,  Wealth which the foeman may not win.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यर्ष सहस्रिणं रयिं गोमन्तमश्विनम अभि वाजमुत शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: abhyarṣa sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ ghomantamaśvinam abhi vājamuta śravaḥ

translations.griffith: Send riches hither with thy stream in thousands, both of steeds and kine,  Send spoil of war and high renown.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो देवो न सूर्यो.अद्रिभिः पवते सुतः दधानः कलशे रसम |||
verses.transliteration: somo devo na sūryo.adribhiḥ pavate sutaḥ dadhānaḥ kalaśe rasam

translations.griffith: Soma the God, expressed with stones, like Sūrya, floweth on his way,  Pouring the juice within the jar.

verses.sanskrit: एते धामान्यार्या शुक्रा रतस्य धारया वाजं गोमन्तमक्षरन |||
verses.transliteration: ete dhāmānyāryā śukrā ṛtasya dhārayā vājaṃ ghomantamakṣaran

translations.griffith: These brilliant drops have poured for us, in stream of solemn sacrifice,  Worshipful laws and strength in kine.

verses.sanskrit: सुता इन्द्राय वज्रिणे सोमासो दध्याशिरः पवित्रमत्यक्षरन |||
verses.transliteration: sutā indrāya vajriṇe somāso dadhyāśiraḥ pavitramatyakṣaran

translations.griffith: Over the cleansing sieve have flowed the Somas, blent with curdled milk,  Effused for Indra Thunder-armed.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोम मधुमत्तमो राये अर्ष पवित्र आ मदो यो देववीतमः |||
verses.transliteration: pra soma madhumattamo rāye arṣa pavitra ā mado yo devavītamaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, do thou most rich in sweets, a gladdening drink most dear to Gods,  Flow to the sieve to bring us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तमी मर्जन्त्यायवो हरिं नदीषु वाजिनम इन्दुमिन्द्रायमत्सरम |||
verses.transliteration: tamī mṛjantyāyavo hariṃ nadīṣu vājinam indumindrāyamatsaram

translations.griffith: For Indra, living men adorn the Tawny Courser in the streams, Indu, the giver of delight.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व हिरण्यवदश्वावत सोम वीरवत वाजं गोमन्तमा भर |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva hiraṇyavadaśvāvat soma vīravat vājaṃ ghomantamā bhara

translations.griffith: Pour for us, Soma, wealth in gold, in horses and heroic sons,  Bring hither strength in herds of kine.

verses.sanskrit: परि वाजे न वाजयुमव्यो वारेषु सिञ्चत इन्द्राय मधुमत्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: pari vāje na vājayumavyo vāreṣu siñcata indrāya madhumattamam

translations.griffith: For Indra pour ye on the fleece him very sweet to taste, who longs.  For battle as it were in war.

verses.sanskrit: कविं मर्जन्ति मर्ज्यं धीभिर्विप्रा अवस्यवः वर्षा कनिक्रदर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: kaviṃ mṛjanti marjyaṃ dhībhirviprā avasyavaḥ vṛṣā kanikradarṣati

translations.griffith: The singers, seeking help, adorn the Sage who must be decked with songs:  Loud bellowing the Steer comes on,

verses.sanskrit: वर्षणं धीभिरप्तुरं सोमं रतस्य धारया मती विप्राः समस्वरन |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣaṇaṃ dhībhirapturaṃ somaṃ ṛtasya dhārayā matī viprāḥ samasvaran

translations.griffith: The singers with their thoughts and hymns have, in the stream of sacrifice,  Caused Soma, active Steer, to roar.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व देवायुषगिन्द्रं गछतु ते मदः वायुमा रोह धर्मणा |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva devāyuṣaghindraṃ ghachatu te madaḥ vāyumā roha dharmaṇā

translations.griffith: God, working with mankind, flow on; to Indra go thy gladdening juice:  To Vāyu mount as Law commands

verses.sanskrit: पवमान नि तोशसे रयिं सोम शरवाय्यम परियः समुद्रमा विश |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna ni tośase rayiṃ soma śravāyyam priyaḥ samudramā viśa

translations.griffith: O Soma, Pavamana, thou pourest out wealth that brings renown:  Enter the lake, as one we love.

verses.sanskrit: अपघ्नन पवसे मर्धः करतुवित सोम मत्सरः नुदस्वादेवयुं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: apaghnan pavase mṛdhaḥ kratuvit soma matsaraḥ nudasvādevayuṃ janam

translations.griffith: Soma thou flowest chasing foes and bringing wisdom and delight:  Drive off the folk who love not Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पवमाना अस्र्क्षत सोमाः शुक्रास इन्दवः अभि विश्वानिकाव्या |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānā asṛkṣata somāḥ śukrāsa indavaḥ abhi viśvānikāvyā

translations.griffith: The Pavamanas have been poured, the brilliant drops of Soma juice,  For holy lore of every kind.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानास आशवः शुभ्रा अस्र्ग्रमिन्दवः घनन्तो विश्वा अप दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānāsa āśavaḥ śubhrā asṛghramindavaḥ ghnanto viśvā apa dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: The Pavamanas have been shed, the beautiful swift Soma-drops,  Driving all enemies afar.

verses.sanskrit: पवमना दिवस पर्यन्तरिक्षादस्र्क्षत पर्थिव्या अधि सानवि |||
verses.transliteration: pavamanā divas paryantarikṣādasṛkṣata pṛthivyā adhi sānavi

translations.griffith: From, heaven, from out the firmament, hath Pavamana been effused  Upon the summit of the earth.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानः सोम धारयेन्दो विश्वा अप सरिधः जहि रक्षांसि सुक्रतो |||
verses.transliteration: punānaḥ soma dhārayendo viśvā apa sridhaḥ jahi rakṣāṃsi sukrato

translations.griffith: O Soma, Indu, very wise, drive, being purified, with thy stream  All foes, all Rākṣasas away.

verses.sanskrit: अपघ्नन सोम रक्षसो.अभ्यर्ष कनिक्रदत दयुमन्तं शुष्ममुत्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: apaghnan soma rakṣaso.abhyarṣa kanikradat dyumantaṃ śuṣmamuttamam

translations.griffith: Driving the Rākṣasas afar, O Soma, bellowing, pour for us  Most excellent and splendid strength.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे वसूनि धारय सोम दिव्यानि पार्थिवा इन्दो विश्वानिवार्या |||
verses.transliteration: asme vasūni dhāraya soma divyāni pārthivā indo viśvānivāryā

translations.griffith: Soma, do thou secure for us the treasures of the earih and heaven,  Indu, all boons to be desired.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा सोम दयुमानसि वर्षा देव वर्षव्रतः वर्षा धर्माणि दधिषे |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā soma dyumānasi vṛṣā deva vṛṣavrataḥ vṛṣā dharmāṇi dadhiṣe

translations.griffith: Soma, thou art a splendid Steer, a Steer, O God, with steerlike sway:  Thou as a Steer ordainest laws.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्णस्ते वर्ष्ण्यं शवो वर्षा वनं वर्षा मदः सत्यं वर्षन वर्षेदसि |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇaste vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo vṛṣā vanaṃ vṛṣā madaḥ satyaṃ vṛṣan vṛṣedasi

translations.griffith: Steer-strong thy might is as a steer's, steerstrong thywood, steer-like thy drink  A Steer indeed, O Steer, art thou.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वो न चक्रदो वर्षा सं गा इन्दो समर्वतः वि नो राये दुरो वर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: aśvo na cakrado vṛṣā saṃ ghā indo samarvataḥ vi no rāye duro vṛdhi

translations.griffith: Thou, Indu, as a vigorous horse, hast neighed together steeds and kine:  Unbar for us the doors to wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अस्र्क्षत पर वाजिनो गव्या सोमासो अश्वया शुक्रासो वीरयाशवः |||
verses.transliteration: asṛkṣata pra vājino ghavyā somāso aśvayā śukrāso vīrayāśavaḥ

translations.griffith: Out of desire of cows and steeds and horses. potent Soma-drops,  Brilliant and swift, have been effused.

verses.sanskrit: शुम्भमाना रतायुभिर्म्र्ज्यमाना गभस्त्योः पवन्ते वारेव्यये |||
verses.transliteration: śumbhamānā ṛtāyubhirmṛjyamānā ghabhastyoḥ pavante vāreavyaye

translations.griffith: They purified in both the hands, made beautiful by holy men,  Flow onward to the fleecy cloth.

verses.sanskrit: ते विश्वा दाशुषे वसु सोमा दिव्यानि पार्थिवा पवन्तामान्तरिक्ष्या |||
verses.transliteration: te viśvā dāśuṣe vasu somā divyāni pārthivā pavantāmāntarikṣyā

translations.griffith: These Soma juices shall pour forth all treasures for the worshipper  From heaven and earth and firmament.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानस्य विश्ववित पर ते सर्गा अस्र्क्षत सूर्यस्येव न रश्मयः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānasya viśvavit pra te sarghā asṛkṣata sūryasyeva na raśmayaḥ

translations.griffith: The streams of Pavamana, thine, Finder of all, have been effused,  Even as Sūrya's rays of light.

verses.sanskrit: केतुं कर्ण्वन दिवस परि विश्वा रूपाभ्यर्षसि समुद्रः सोम पिन्वसे |||
verses.transliteration: ketuṃ kṛṇvan divas pari viśvā rūpābhyarṣasi samudraḥ soma pinvase

translations.griffith: Making the light that shines from heaven thou flowest on to every form  Soma, thou swellest like a sea.

verses.sanskrit: हिन्वानो वाचमिष्यसि पवमान विधर्मणि अक्रान देवो नसूर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: hinvāno vācamiṣyasi pavamāna vidharmaṇi akrān devo nasūryaḥ

translations.griffith: Urged on thou sendest out thy voice, O Pavamana; thou hast moved,  Like the God Sūrya, to the sieve.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुः पविष्ट चेतनः परियः कवीनां मती सर्जदश्वं रथीरिव |||
verses.transliteration: induḥ paviṣṭa cetanaḥ priyaḥ kavīnāṃ matī sṛjadaśvaṃ rathīriva

translations.griffith: Indu, Enlightener, Friend, hath been purified by the sages' hymns:  So starts the charioteer his steed-

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्मिर्यस्ते पवित्र आ देवावीः पर्यक्षरत सीदन्न्र्तस्य योनिमा |||
verses.transliteration: ūrmiryaste pavitra ā devāvīḥ paryakṣarat sīdannṛtasya yonimā

translations.griffith: Thy God-delighting wave which hath flowed to purifying seive,  Alighting in the home of Law.

verses.sanskrit: स नो अर्ष पवित्र आ मदो यो देववीतमः इन्दविन्द्रायपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: sa no arṣa pavitra ā mado yo devavītamaḥ indavindrāyapītaye

translations.griffith: Flow to our sieve, a gladdening draught that hath most intercourse with Gods,  Indu, to Indra for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: इषे पवस्व धारया मर्ज्यमानो मनीषिभिः इन्दो रुचाभिगा इहि |||
verses.transliteration: iṣe pavasva dhārayā mṛjyamāno manīṣibhiḥ indo rucābhighā ihi

translations.griffith: Flow onward with a stream for food, made beautiful by sapient men:  Indu with sheen approach the milk.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानो वरिवस कर्ध्यूर्जं जनाय गिर्वणः हरे सर्जानाशिरम |||
verses.transliteration: punāno varivas kṛdhyūrjaṃ janāya ghirvaṇaḥ hare sṛjānaāśiram

translations.griffith: While thou art cleansed, Song-Lover, bring comfort and vigour to the folk,  Poured, Tawny One! on milk and curds.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानो देववीतय इन्द्रस्य याहि निष्क्र्तम दयुतानो वाजिभिर्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: punāno devavītaya indrasya yāhi niṣkṛtam dyutāno vājibhiryataḥ

translations.griffith: Purified for the feast of Gods, go thou to Indra's special place,  Resplendent, guided by the strong.

verses.sanskrit: पर हिन्वानास इन्दवो.अछा समुद्रमाशवः धिया जूता अस्र्क्षत |||
verses.transliteration: pra hinvānāsa indavo.achā samudramāśavaḥ dhiyā jūtā asṛkṣata

translations.griffith: Accelerated by the hymn, the rapid drops of Soma juice  Have flowed, urged onward, to the lake.

verses.sanskrit: मर्म्र्जानास आयवो वर्था समुद्रमिन्दवः अग्मन्न्र्तस्य योनिमा |||
verses.transliteration: marmṛjānāsa āyavo vṛthā samudramindavaḥ aghmannṛtasya yonimā

translations.griffith: Easily have the living drops, made beautiful, approached the lake,  Yea, to the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: परि णो याह्यस्मयुर्विश्वा वसून्योजसा पाहि नः शर्म वीरवत |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṇo yāhyasmayurviśvā vasūnyojasā pāhi naḥ śarma vīravat

translations.griffith: Compass about, our faithful Friend, all our possessions with thy might:  Guard, hero like, our sheltering home.

verses.sanskrit: मिमाति वह्निरेतशः पदं युजान रक्वभिः पर यत समुद्र आहितः |||
verses.transliteration: mimāti vahniretaśaḥ padaṃ yujāna ṛkvabhiḥ pra yat samudra āhitaḥ

translations.griffith: Loud neighs the Courser Etaśa, with singers, harnessed for the place,  Guided for travel to the lake.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद योनिं हिरण्ययमाशुरतस्य सीदति जहात्यप्रचेतसः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad yoniṃ hiraṇyayamāśurtasya sīdati jahātyapracetasaḥ

translations.griffith: What time the Swift One resteth in the golden place of sacrifice,  He leaves the foolish far away.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वेना अनूषतेयक्षन्ति परचेतसः मज्जन्त्यविचेतसः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi venā anūṣateyakṣanti pracetasaḥ majjantyavicetasaḥ

translations.griffith: The friends have sung in unison, the prudent wish to sacrifice:  Down sink the unintelligent.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रायेन्दो मरुत्वते पवस्व मधुमत्तमः रतस्य योनिमासदम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāyendo marutvate pavasva madhumattamaḥ ṛtasya yonimāsadam

translations.griffith: For Indra girt by Maruts, flow, thou Indu, very rich in sweets,  To sit in place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा विप्रा वचोविदः परिष कर्ण्वन्ति वेधसः सं तवा मर्जन्त्यायवः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā viprā vacovidaḥ pariṣ kṛṇvanti vedhasaḥ saṃ tvā mṛjantyāyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Controlling priests and sages skilled in holy song adorn thee well:  The living make thee beautiful.

verses.sanskrit: रसं ते मित्रो अर्यमा पिबन्ति वरुनः कवे पवमानस्य मरुतः |||
verses.transliteration: rasaṃ te mitro aryamā pibanti varunaḥ kave pavamānasya marutaḥ

translations.griffith: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa drink Pavamana's juice, yea, thine:  O Sage, the Maruts drink thereof.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम विपश्चितं पुनानो वाचमिष्यसि इन्दो सहस्रभर्णसम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma vipaścitaṃ punāno vācamiṣyasi indo sahasrabharṇasam

translations.griffith: O Soma, Indu, thou while thou art purified urgest onward speech.  Thousandfold, with the lore of hymns.

verses.sanskrit: उतो सहस्रभर्णसं वाचं सोम मखस्युवम पुनान इन्दवा भर |||
verses.transliteration: uto sahasrabharṇasaṃ vācaṃ soma makhasyuvam punāna indavā bhara

translations.griffith: Yea, Soma, Indu, while thou art purified do thou bring to us  Speech thousandfold that longs for war.

verses.sanskrit: पुनान इन्दवेषां पुरुहूत जनानाम परियः समुद्रमा विश |||
verses.transliteration: punāna indaveṣāṃ puruhūta janānām priyaḥ samudramā viśa

translations.griffith: O Indu, Much-invoked, while thou art purifying, as the Friend.  Of these men enter thou the lake.

verses.sanskrit: दविद्युतत्या रुचा परिष्टोभन्त्या कर्पा सोमाः शुक्रा गवाशिरः |||
verses.transliteration: davidyutatyā rucā pariṣṭobhantyā kṛpā somāḥ śukrā ghavāśiraḥ

translations.griffith: Bright are these Somas blent with milk, with light that flashes brilliantly. And form that utters loud acclaim.

verses.sanskrit: हिन्वानो हेत्र्भिर्यत आ वाजं वाज्यक्रमीत सीदन्तो वनुषो यथा |||
verses.transliteration: hinvāno hetṛbhiryata ā vājaṃ vājyakramīt sīdanto vanuṣo yathā

translations.griffith: Led by his drivers, and sent forth, the Strong Steed hath come nigh for spoil,  Like warriors when they stand arrayed.

verses.sanskrit: रधक सोम सवस्तये संजग्मानो दिवः कविः पवस्व सूर्योद्र्शे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛdhak soma svastaye saṃjaghmāno divaḥ kaviḥ pavasva sūryodṛśe

translations.griffith: Specially, Soma, coming as a Sage from heaven to prosper us,  Flow like the Sun for us to see.

verses.sanskrit: हिन्वन्ति सूरमुस्रयः सवसारो जामयस पतिम महामिन्दुं महीयुवः |||
verses.transliteration: hinvanti sūramusrayaḥ svasāro jāmayas patim mahāminduṃ mahīyuvaḥ

translations.griffith: THE, glittering maids send Sūra forth, the glorious sisters, close-allied,  Send Indu forth, their mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान रुचा-रुचा देवो देवेभ्यस परि विश्वा वसून्याविश |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna rucā-rucā devo devebhyas pari viśvā vasūnyāviśa

translations.griffith: Pervade, O Pavamana, all our treasures with repeated light,  God, coming hither from the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवमान सुष्टुतिं वर्ष्टिं देवेभ्यो दुवः इषे पवस्व संयतम |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavamāna suṣṭutiṃ vṛṣṭiṃ devebhyo duvaḥ iṣe pavasva saṃyatam

translations.griffith: Pour on us, Pavamana, rain, as service and rain praise for Gods:  Pour all to be our nourishment.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा हयसि भानुना दयुमन्तं तवा हवामहे पवमान सवाध्यः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā hyasi bhānunā dyumantaṃ tvā havāmahe pavamāna svādhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou art a Steer by lustre: we, O Pavamana, faithfully  Call upon thee the Splendid One.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व सुवीर्यं मन्दमानः सवायुध इहो षविन्दवा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva suvīryaṃ mandamānaḥ svāyudha iho ṣvindavā ghahi

translations.griffith: Do thou, rejoicing, nobly-armed! pour upon us heroic strength:  O Indu, come thou bitherward.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्भिः परिषिच्यसे मर्ज्यमानो गभस्त्योः दरुणा सधस्थमश्नुषे |||
verses.transliteration: yadadbhiḥ pariṣicyase mṛjyamāno ghabhastyoḥ druṇā sadhasthamaśnuṣe

translations.griffith: When thou art cleansed with both the hands and dipped in waters, with the wood.  Thou comest to the gathering-place.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोमाय वयश्ववत पवमानाय गायत महे सहस्रचक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: pra somāya vyaśvavat pavamānāya ghāyata mahe sahasracakṣase

translations.griffith: Sing forth your songs, as Vyaśva sang, to Soma Pavamana, to,  The Mighty One with thousand eyes;

verses.sanskrit: यस्य वर्णं मधुश्चुतं हरिं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः इन्दुमिन्द्राय पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: yasya varṇaṃ madhuścutaṃ hariṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ indumindrāya pītaye

translations.griffith: Whose coloured sap they drive with stones, the yellow meath-distilling juice,  Indu for Indra, for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: तस्य ते वाजिनो वयं विश्वा धनानि जिग्युषः सखित्वमा वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tasya te vājino vayaṃ viśvā dhanāni jighyuṣaḥ sakhitvamā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: We seek to gain the friendly love of thee that Strong and Mighty One,  Of thee the winner of all wealth.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा पवस्व धारया मरुत्वते च मत्सरः विश्वा दधान ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā pavasva dhārayā marutvate ca matsaraḥ viśvā dadhāna ojasā

translations.griffith: Flow onward with thy stream, a Steer, inspiriting the Maruts’ Lord,  Winning all riches by thy might.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा धर्तारमोण्योः पवमान सवर्द्र्शम हिन्वे वाजेषु वाजिनम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā dhartāramoṇyoḥ pavamāna svardṛśam hinve vājeṣu vājinam

translations.griffith: I send thee forth to battle from the press, O Pavamana, Strong,  Sustainer, looker on the light.

verses.sanskrit: अया चित्तो विपानया हरिः पवस्व धारया युजं वाजेषु चोदय |||
verses.transliteration: ayā citto vipānayā hariḥ pavasva dhārayā yujaṃ vājeṣu codaya

translations.griffith: Acknowledged by this song of mine, flow, tawny-coloured, with thy stream  Incite to battle thine ally.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्दो महीमिषं पवस्व विश्वदर्शतः अस्मभ्यं सोम गातुवित |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indo mahīmiṣaṃ pavasva viśvadarśataḥ asmabhyaṃ soma ghātuvit

translations.griffith: O Indu, visible to all pour out for us abundant food:  Soma, be thou our prosperer.

verses.sanskrit: आ कलशा अनूषतेन्दो धाराभिरोजसा एन्द्रस्य पीतयेविश |||
verses.transliteration: ā kalaśā anūṣatendo dhārābhirojasā endrasya pītayeviśa

translations.griffith: The pitchers, Indu, with thy streams have sung aloud in vigorous might  Enter them, and let Indra drink.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य ते मद्यं रसं तीव्रं दुहन्त्यद्रिभिः स पवस्वाभिमातिहा |||
verses.transliteration: yasya te madyaṃ rasaṃ tīvraṃ duhantyadribhiḥ sa pavasvābhimātihā

translations.griffith: O thou whose potent gladdening juice they milk out with the stones, flow on,  Destroyer of our enemies.

verses.sanskrit: राजा मेधाभिरीयते पवमानो मनावधि अन्तरिक्षेण यातवे |||
verses.transliteration: rājā medhābhirīyate pavamāno manāvadhi antarikṣeṇa yātave

translations.griffith: King Pavamana is implored with holy songs, on man's behalf,  To travel through the firmament.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्दो शतग्विनं गवां पोषं सवश्व्यम वहा भगत्तिमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indo śataghvinaṃ ghavāṃ poṣaṃ svaśvyam vahā bhaghattimūtaye

translations.griffith: Bring us, O Indu, hundredfold increase of kine, and noble steeds,  The gift of fortune for our help.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः सोम सहो जुवो रूपं न वर्चसे भर सुष्वाणो देववीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ soma saho juvo rūpaṃ na varcase bhara suṣvāṇo devavītaye

translations.griffith: Pressed for the banquet of the Gods, O Soma, bring us might, and speed,  Like beauty for a brilliant show.

verses.sanskrit: अर्षा सोम दयुमत्तमो.अभि दरोणानि रोरुवत सीदञ्छ्येनोन योनिमा |||
verses.transliteration: arṣā soma dyumattamo.abhi droṇāni roruvat sīdañchyenona yonimā

translations.griffith: Soma, flow on exceeding bright with loud roar to the wooden vats,  Falcon-like resting in thine home.

verses.sanskrit: अप्सा इन्द्राय वायवे वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यः सोमो अर्षति विष्णवे |||
verses.transliteration: apsā indrāya vāyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ somo arṣati viṣṇave

translations.griffith: Soma, the Water-winner flows to Indra, Vāyu, Varuṇa,  To Viṣṇu and the Marut host.

verses.sanskrit: इषं तोकाय नो दधदस्मभ्यं सोम विश्वतः आ पवस्वसहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: iṣaṃ tokāya no dadhadasmabhyaṃ soma viśvataḥ ā pavasvasahasriṇam

translations.griffith: Soma , bestowing food upon our progeny, from every sides,  Pour on us riches thousandfold

verses.sanskrit: ये सोमासः परावति ये अर्वावति सुन्विरे ये वादः शर्यणावति |||
verses.transliteration: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire ye vādaḥ śaryaṇāvati

translations.griffith: The Soma juices which have been expressed afar or near at hand,  Or there on Śaryaṇāvān's bank,

verses.sanskrit: य आर्जीकेषु कर्त्वसु ये मध्ये पस्त्यानाम ये वा जनेषुपञ्चसु |||
verses.transliteration: ya ārjīkeṣu kṛtvasu ye madhye pastyānām ye vā janeṣupañcasu

translations.griffith: Those pressed among Arjikas, pressed among the active, in men's homes,  Or pressed among the Races Five-

verses.sanskrit: ते नो वर्ष्टिं दिवस परि पवन्तामा सुवीर्यम सुवाना देवास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: te no vṛṣṭiṃ divas pari pavantāmā suvīryam suvānā devāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: May these celestial drops, expressed, pour forth upon us, as they flow,  Rain from the heavens apd hero strength.

verses.sanskrit: पवते हर्यतो हरिर्ग्र्णानो जमदग्निना हिन्वानो गोरधित्वचि |||
verses.transliteration: pavate haryato harirghṛṇāno jamadaghninā hinvāno ghoradhitvaci

translations.griffith: Urged forward o’er the ox-hide flows the Lovely One of tawny hue,  Lauded by Jamadagni's song.

verses.sanskrit: पर शुक्रासो वयोजुवो हिन्वानासो न सप्तयः शरीणानाप्सु मर्ञ्जत |||
verses.transliteration: pra śukrāso vayojuvo hinvānāso na saptayaḥ śrīṇānāapsu mṛñjata

translations.griffith: Like horses urged to speed, the drops, bright, stirring vital power, when blent  With milk, are beautified in streams.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा सुतेष्वाभुवो हिन्विरे देवतातये स पवस्वानया रुचा |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā suteṣvābhuvo hinvire devatātaye sa pavasvānayā rucā

translations.griffith: So they who toil with juices send thee forward for the Gods’ repast:  So with this splendour flow thou on.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते दक्षं मयोभुवं वह्निमद्या वर्णीमहे पान्तमापुरुस्प्र्हम |||
verses.transliteration: ā te dakṣaṃ mayobhuvaṃ vahnimadyā vṛṇīmahe pāntamāpuruspṛham

translations.griffith: We choose to-day that chariot-steed of thine, the Strong, that brings us bliss,  The Guardian, the desire of all,

verses.sanskrit: आ मन्द्रमा वरेण्यमा विप्रमा मनीषिणम पान्तमा पुरुस्प्र्हम |||
verses.transliteration: ā mandramā vareṇyamā vipramā manīṣiṇam pāntamā puruspṛham

translations.griffith: The Excellent, the Gladdener, the Sage with heart that understands,  The Guardian, the desire of all;
