verses.sanskrit: आ रयिमा सुचेतुनमा सुक्रतो तनूष्वा पान्तमा पुरुस्प्र्हम |||
verses.transliteration: ā rayimā sucetunamā sukrato tanūṣvā pāntamā puruspṛham

translations.griffith: Who for ourselves, O thou Most Wise, is wealth and fair intelligence,  The Guardian, the desire of all.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व विश्वचर्षणे.अभि विश्वानि काव्या सखा सखिभ्य ईड्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva viśvacarṣaṇe.abhi viśvāni kāvyā sakhā sakhibhya īḍyaḥ

translations.griffith: FOR holy lore of every sort, flow onward thou whom all men love.  A Friend to be besought by friends.

verses.sanskrit: ताभ्यां विश्वस्य राजसि ये पवमान धामनी परतीची सोम तस्थतुः |||
verses.transliteration: tābhyāṃ viśvasya rājasi ye pavamāna dhāmanī pratīcī soma tasthatuḥ

translations.griffith: O'er all thou rulest with these Two which, Soma Pavamana, stand,  Turned, as thy stations, hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: परि धामानि यानि ते तवं सोमासि विश्वतः पवमान रतुभिः कवे ||
verses.transliteration: pari dhāmāni yāni te tvaṃ somāsi viśvataḥ pavamāna ṛtubhiḥ kave

translations.griffith: Wise Soma Pavamana, thou encompassest on every side  Thy stations as the seasons come.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व जनयन्निषो.अभि विश्वानि वार्या सखा सखिभ्य ऊतये |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva janayanniṣo.abhi viśvāni vāryā sakhā sakhibhya ūtaye

translations.griffith: Flow onward, generating food, for precious boons of every kind,  A Friend for friends, to be our help.

verses.sanskrit: तव शुक्रासो अर्चयो दिवस पर्ष्ठे वि तन्वते पवित्रं सोम धामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tava śukrāso arcayo divas pṛṣṭhe vi tanvate pavitraṃ soma dhāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Upon the lofty ridge of heaven thy bright rays with their essences,  Soma, spread purifying power.

verses.sanskrit: तवेमे सप्त सिन्धवः परशिषं सोम सिस्रते तुभ्यं धावन्ति धेनवः |||
verses.transliteration: taveme sapta sindhavaḥ praśiṣaṃ soma sisrate tubhyaṃ dhāvanti dhenavaḥ

translations.griffith: O Soma, these Seven Rivers flow, as being thine, to give command:  The Streams of milk run forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोम याहि धारया सुत इन्द्राय मत्सरः दधानो अक्षिति शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: pra soma yāhi dhārayā suta indrāya matsaraḥ dadhāno akṣiti śravaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward, Soma in a stream, effused to gladden Indra's heart,  Bringing imperishable fame.

verses.sanskrit: समु तवा धीभिरस्वरन हिन्वतीः सप्त जामयः विप्रमाजा विवस्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: samu tvā dhībhirasvaran hinvatīḥ sapta jāmayaḥ vipramājā vivasvataḥ

translations.griffith: Driving thee in Vivasvān's course, the Seven Sisters with their hymns  Made melody round thee the Sage.

verses.sanskrit: मर्जन्ति तवा समग्रुवो.अव्ये जीरावधि षवनि रेभो यदज्यसे वने |||
verses.transliteration: mṛjanti tvā samaghruvo.avye jīrāvadhi ṣvani rebho yadajyase vane

translations.griffith: The virgins deck thee o’er fresh streams to drive thee to the sieve when thou,  A singer, bathest in the wood.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानस्य ते कवे वाजिन सर्गा अस्र्क्षत अर्वन्तो न शरवस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānasya te kave vājin sarghā asṛkṣata arvanto na śravasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: The streams of Pavamana, thine, Sage, Mighty One, have pouredthem forth.  Like coursers eager for renown.

verses.sanskrit: अछा कोशं मधुश्चुतमस्र्ग्रं वारे अव्यये अवावशन्तधीतयः |||
verses.transliteration: achā kośaṃ madhuścutamasṛghraṃ vāre avyaye avāvaśantadhītayaḥ

translations.griffith: They have been poured upon the fleece towards the meath-distilling vat:  The holy songs have sounded forth.

verses.sanskrit: अछा समुद्रमिन्दवो.अस्तं गावो न धेनवः अग्मन्न्र्तस्य योनिमा |||
verses.transliteration: achā samudramindavo.astaṃ ghāvo na dhenavaḥ aghmannṛtasya yonimā

translations.griffith: Like milch-kine coming home, the drops of Soma juice have reached the lake,  Have reached the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: पर ण इन्दो महे रण आपो अर्षन्ति सिन्धवः यद गोभिर्वासयिष्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: pra ṇa indo mahe raṇa āpo arṣanti sindhavaḥ yad ghobhirvāsayiṣyase

translations.griffith: O Indu, to our great delight the running waters flow to us,  When thou wilt robe thyself in milk.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य ते सख्ये वयमियक्षन्तस्त्वोतयः इन्दो सखित्वमुश्मसि |||
verses.transliteration: asya te sakhye vayamiyakṣantastvotayaḥ indo sakhitvamuśmasi

translations.griffith: In this thy friendship, and with thee to help us, fain to sacrifice,  Indu, we crave thy friendly love.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व गविष्टये महे सोम नर्चक्षसे एन्द्रस्य जठरेविश |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva ghaviṣṭaye mahe soma nṛcakṣase endrasya jaṭhareviśa

translations.griffith: Flow on, O Soma, for the great Viewer of men, for gain of Idne  Enter thou into Indra's throat.

verses.sanskrit: महानसि सोम जयेष्ठ उग्राणामिन्द ओजिष्ठः युध्वा सञ्छश्वज्जिगेथ |||
verses.transliteration: mahānasi soma jyeṣṭha ughrāṇāminda ojiṣṭhaḥ yudhvā sañchaśvajjighetha

translations.griffith: Best art thou, Soma, of the great, Strongest of strong ones, Indu: thou  As Warrior ever hast prevailed.

verses.sanskrit: य उग्रेभ्यश्चिदोजीयाञ्छूरेभ्यश्चिच्छूरतरः भूरिदाभ्यश्चिन मंहीयान |||
verses.transliteration: ya ughrebhyaścidojīyāñchūrebhyaścicchūrataraḥ bhūridābhyaścin maṃhīyān

translations.griffith: Mightier even than the strong, more valiant even than the brave,  More libpral than the bountiful,

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम सूर एषस्तोकस्य साता तनूनाम वर्णीमहे सख्याय वर्णीमहे युज्याय |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma sūra eṣastokasya sātā tanūnām vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya vṛṇīmahe yujyāya

translations.griffith: Soma, as Sūra, bring us food, win offspring of our bodies: we  Elect thee for our friendship, we elect thee for companionship.

verses.sanskrit: अग्न आयूंषि पवस आ सुवोर्जमिषं च नः आरे बाधस्व दुछुनाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghna āyūṃṣi pavasa ā suvorjamiṣaṃ ca naḥ āre bādhasva duchunām

translations.griffith: Agni, thou pourest life; send down upon us food and vigorous strength;  Drive thou misfortune far away,

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरषिः पवमानः पाञ्चजन्यः पुरोहितः तमीमहेमहागयम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirṣiḥ pavamānaḥ pāñcajanyaḥ purohitaḥ tamīmahemahāghayam

translations.griffith: Agni is Pavamana, Sage, Chief Priest of all the Races Five:  To him whose wealth is great we pray.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने पवस्व सवपा अस्मे वर्चः सुवीर्यम दधद रयिं मयि पोषम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne pavasva svapā asme varcaḥ suvīryam dadhad rayiṃ mayi poṣam

translations.griffith: Skilled in thy task, O Agni, pour splendour with hero strength on us,  Granting me wealth that nourishes.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानो अति सरिधो.अभ्यर्षति सुष्टुतिम सूरो न विश्वदर्शतः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāno ati sridho.abhyarṣati suṣṭutim sūro na viśvadarśataḥ

translations.griffith: Beyond his enemies away to sweet praise Pavamana flows,  Like Sūrya visible to all.

verses.sanskrit: स मर्म्र्जान आयुभिः परयस्वान परयसे हितः इन्दुरत्योविचक्षणः |||
verses.transliteration: sa marmṛjāna āyubhiḥ prayasvān prayase hitaḥ induratyovicakṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Adorned by living men, set forth for entertainment, rich in food,  Far-sighted Indu is a Steed.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान रतं बर्हच्छुक्रं जयोतिरजीजनत कर्ष्णा तमांसि जङघनत |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna ṛtaṃ bṛhacchukraṃ jyotirajījanat kṛṣṇā tamāṃsi jaṅghanat

translations.griffith: He, Pavamana, hath produced the lofty Law, the brilliant light,  Destroying darkness black of hue.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानस्य जङघनतो हरेश्चन्द्रा अस्र्क्षत जीरा अजिरशोचिषः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānasya jaṅghnato hareścandrā asṛkṣata jīrā ajiraśociṣaḥ

translations.griffith: From tawny Pavamana, the Destroyer, radiant streams have sprung,  Quick streams from him whose gleams are swift.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानो रथीतमः शुभ्रेभिः शुभ्रशस्तमः हरिश्चन्द्रो मरुद्गणः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāno rathītamaḥ śubhrebhiḥ śubhraśastamaḥ hariścandro marudghaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Best rider of the chariot, praised with fairest praise mid beauteous ones,  Gold-gleaming with the Marut host,

verses.sanskrit: पवमानो वयश्नवद रश्मिभिर्वाजसातमः दधत सतोत्रेसुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāno vyaśnavad raśmibhirvājasātamaḥ dadhat stotresuvīryam

translations.griffith: May Pavamana, best to win the booty, penetrate with rays,  Giving the singer hero strength.

verses.sanskrit: पर सुवान इन्दुरक्षाः पवित्रमत्यव्ययम पुनान इन्दुरिन्द्रमा |||
verses.transliteration: pra suvāna indurakṣāḥ pavitramatyavyayam punāna indurindramā

translations.griffith: Over the fleecy sieve hath flowed the drop effused: to Indra comes  Indu while he is purified

verses.sanskrit: एष सोमो अधि तवचि गवां करीळत्यद्रिभिः इन्द्रं मदाय जोहुवत |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa somo adhi tvaci ghavāṃ krīḷatyadribhiḥ indraṃ madāya johuvat

translations.griffith: This Soma, through the pressing-stones, is sporting on the oxhide, and  Summoning Indra to the draught.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य ते दयुम्नवत पयः पवमानाभ्र्तं दिवः तेन नो मर्ळ जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: yasya te dyumnavat payaḥ pavamānābhṛtaṃ divaḥ tena no mṛḷa jīvase

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, bless us, so that we may live, with that bright milk  Of thine which hath been brought from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोमासि धारयुर्मन्द्र ओजिष्ठो अध्वरे पवस्व मंहयद्रयिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ somāsi dhārayurmandra ojiṣṭho adhvare pavasva maṃhayadrayiḥ

translations.griffith: THOU, Soma, hast a running stream, joyous, most strong at sacrifice:  Flow bounteously bestowing wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सुतो नर्मादनो दधन्वान मत्सरिन्तमः इन्द्राय सूरिरन्धसा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ suto nṛmādano dadhanvān matsarintamaḥ indrāya sūrirandhasā

translations.griffith: Effused as cheerer of the men, flowing best gladdener, thou art  A Prince to Indra with thy juice.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सुष्वाणो अद्रिभिरभ्यर्ष कनिक्रदत दयुमन्तं शुष्ममुत्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ suṣvāṇo adribhirabhyarṣa kanikradat dyumantaṃ śuṣmamuttamam

translations.griffith: Poured forth by pressing-stones, do thou with loud roar send us in a stream  Most excellent illustrious might.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुर्हिन्वानो अर्षति तिरो वाराण्यव्यया हरिर्वाजमचिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: indurhinvāno arṣati tiro vārāṇyavyayā harirvājamacikradat

translations.griffith: Indu, urged forward, floweth through the fleecy cloth: the Tawny One  With his loud roar hath brought as strength.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दो वयव्यमर्षसि वि शरवांसि वि सौभगा वि वाजांसोम गोमतः |||
verses.transliteration: indo vyavyamarṣasi vi śravāṃsi vi saubhaghā vi vājāṃsoma ghomataḥ

translations.griffith: Indu, thou flowest through the fleece, bringing felicities and fame,  And, Soma, spoil and wealth in kine.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्दो शतग्विनं रयिं गोमन्तमश्विनम भरा सोम सहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indo śataghvinaṃ rayiṃ ghomantamaśvinam bharā soma sahasriṇam

translations.griffith: Hither, O Indu, bring us wealth in steeds and cattle hundredfold:  Bring wealth, O Soma, thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानास इन्दवस्तिरः पवित्रमाशवः इन्द्रं यामेभिराशत |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānāsa indavastiraḥ pavitramāśavaḥ indraṃ yāmebhirāśata

translations.griffith: In purifying, through the sieve the rapid drops of'Soma juice  Come nigh to Indra in their course.

verses.sanskrit: ककुहः सोम्यो रस इन्दुरिन्द्राय पूर्व्यः आयुः पवत आयवे |||
verses.transliteration: kakuhaḥ somyo rasa indurindrāya pūrvyaḥ āyuḥ pavata āyave

translations.griffith: For Indra floweth excellent Indu, the noblest Soma juice  The Living for the Living One.

verses.sanskrit: हिन्वन्ति सूरमुस्रयः पवमानं मधुश्चुतम अभि गिरा समस्वरन |||
verses.transliteration: hinvanti sūramusrayaḥ pavamānaṃ madhuścutam abhi ghirā samasvaran

translations.griffith: The glittering maids send Sūra forth they with their song have sung aloud  To Pavamana dropping meath.

verses.sanskrit: अविता नो अजाश्वः पूषा यामनि-यामनि आ भक्षत कन्यासु नः |||
verses.transliteration: avitā no ajāśvaḥ pūṣā yāmani-yāmani ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ

translations.griffith: May Pūṣan, drawn by goats, be our protector, and on all his paths  Bestow on us our share of maids.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सोमः कपर्दिने घर्तं न पवते मधु आ भक्षत कन्यासु नः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ somaḥ kapardine ghṛtaṃ na pavate madhu ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ

translations.griffith: This Soma flows like gladdening oil for him who wears the braided locks:  He shall give us our share of maids.

verses.sanskrit: अयं त आघ्र्णे सुतो घर्तं न पवते शुचि आ भक्षत कन्यासु नः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ ta āghṛṇe suto ghṛtaṃ na pavate śuci ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ

translations.griffith: This Soma juice, O glowing God, flows like pure oil, effused for thee:  He shall give us our share of maids.

verses.sanskrit: वाचो जन्तुः कवीनां पवस्व सोम धारया देवेषु रत्नधा असि |||
verses.transliteration: vāco jantuḥ kavīnāṃ pavasva soma dhārayā deveṣu ratnadhā asi

translations.griffith: Flow onward, Soma, in thy stream, begetter of the sages' speech:  Wealth-giver among Gods art thou.

verses.sanskrit: आ कलशेषु धावति शयेनो वर्म वि गाहते अभि दरोणा कनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati śyeno varma vi ghāhate abhi droṇā kanikradat

translations.griffith: The Falcon dips within the jars: he wrapḥim in his robe and goes  Loud roaring to the vats of wood.

verses.sanskrit: परि पर सोम ते रसो.असर्जि कलशे सुतः शयेनो न तक्तोर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: pari pra soma te raso.asarji kalaśe sutaḥ śyeno na taktoarṣati

translations.griffith: Soma, thy juice hath been effused and poured into the pitcher: like  A rapid hawk it rushes on.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम मन्दयन्निन्द्राय मधुमत्तमः ||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma mandayannindrāya madhumattamaḥ

translations.griffith: For Indra flow most rich in sweets, O Soma, bringing him delight.

verses.sanskrit: अस्र्ग्रन देववीतये वाजयन्तो रथा इव ||
verses.transliteration: asṛghran devavītaye vājayanto rathā iva

translations.griffith: They were sent forth to feast the Gods, like chariots that display their strength.

verses.sanskrit: ते सुतासो मदिन्तमाः शुक्रा वायुमस्र्क्षत ||
verses.transliteration: te sutāso madintamāḥ śukrā vāyumasṛkṣata

translations.griffith: Brilliant, best givers of delight, these juices have sent Vāyu forth.

verses.sanskrit: गराव्णा तुन्नो अभिष्टुतः पवित्रं सोम गछसि दधत सतोत्रे सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvṇā tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitraṃ soma ghachasi dadhat stotre suvīryam

translations.griffith: Bruised by the press-stones and extolled, Soma, thou goest to the sieve,  Giving the worshipper hero strength.

verses.sanskrit: एष तुन्नो अभिष्टुतः पवित्रमति गाहते रक्षोहा वारमव्ययम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitramati ghāhate rakṣohā vāramavyayam

translations.griffith: This juice bruised by the pressing-stones and lauded passes through the sieve,  Slayer of demons, through the fleece.

verses.sanskrit: यदन्ति यच्च दूरके भयं विन्दति मामिह पवमानवि तज्जहि |||
verses.transliteration: yadanti yacca dūrake bhayaṃ vindati māmiha pavamānavi tajjahi

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, drive away the danger, whether near at hand  Or far remote, that finds me here.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानः सो अद्य नः पवित्रेण विचर्षणिः यः पोतास पुनातु नः |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānaḥ so adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ yaḥ potāsa punātu naḥ

translations.griffith: This day may Pavamana cleanse us with his purifying power,  Most active purifying Priest.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते पवित्रमर्चिष्यग्ने विततमन्तरा बरह्म तेन पुनीहि नः |||
verses.transliteration: yat te pavitramarciṣyaghne vitatamantarā brahma tena punīhi naḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, with the cleansing light diffused through all thy fiery glow,  Purify thou this prayer of ours.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते पवित्रमर्चिवदग्ने तेन पुनीहि नः बरह्मसवैः पुनीहि नः |||
verses.transliteration: yat te pavitramarcivadaghne tena punīhi naḥ brahmasavaiḥ punīhi naḥ

translations.griffith: Cleanse us with thine own cleansing power, O Agni, that is bright with flame,  And by libations poured to thee.

verses.sanskrit: उभाभ्यां देव सवितः पवित्रेण सवेन च मां पुनीहि विश्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: ubhābhyāṃ deva savitaḥ pavitreṇa savena ca māṃ punīhi viśvataḥ

translations.griffith: Savitar, God, by both of these, libation, purifying power,  Purify me on every side.

verses.sanskrit: तरिभिष टवं देव सवितर्वर्षिष्ठैः सोम धामभिः अग्ने दक्षैः पुनीहि नः |||
verses.transliteration: tribhiṣ ṭvaṃ deva savitarvarṣiṣṭhaiḥ soma dhāmabhiḥ aghne dakṣaiḥ punīhi naḥ

translations.griffith: Cleanse us, God Savitar, with Three, O Soma, with sublimest forms,  Agni, with forms of power and might.

verses.sanskrit: पुनन्तु मां देवजनाः पुनन्तु वसवो धिया विश्वे देवाः पुनीत मा जातवेदः पुनीहि मा |||
verses.transliteration: punantu māṃ devajanāḥ punantu vasavo dhiyā viśve devāḥ punīta mā jātavedaḥ punīhi mā

translations.griffith: May the Gods’ company make me clean, and Vasus make rue pure by song.  Purify me, ye General Gods; O Jātavedas, make me pure.

verses.sanskrit: पर पयायस्व पर सयन्दस्व सोम विश्वेभिरंशुभिः देवेभ्य उत्तमं हविः |||
verses.transliteration: pra pyāyasva pra syandasva soma viśvebhiraṃśubhiḥ devebhya uttamaṃ haviḥ

translations.griffith: Fill thyself full of juice, flow forth, O Soma, thou with all thy stalks,  The best oblation to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: उप परियं पनिप्नतं युवानमाहुतीव्र्धम अगन्म बिभ्रतोनमः |||
verses.transliteration: upa priyaṃ panipnataṃ yuvānamāhutīvṛdham aghanma bibhratonamaḥ

translations.griffith: We with our homage have approached the Friend who seeks our wondering praise,  Young, strengthener of the solemn rite.

verses.sanskrit: अलाय्यस्य परशुर्ननाश तमा पवस्व देव सोम आखुं चिदेव देव सोम |||
verses.transliteration: alāyyasya paraśurnanāśa tamā pavasva deva soma ākhuṃ cideva deva soma

translations.griffith: Lost is Alayya's axe. O Soma, God do thou send it back hither in thy flow  Even, Soma, God, if ’twere a mole.

verses.sanskrit: यः पावमानीरध्येत्य रषिभिः सम्भ्र्तं रसम सर्वंस पूतमश्नाति सवदितं मातरिश्वना |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ pāvamānīradhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam sarvaṃsa pūtamaśnāti svaditaṃ mātariśvanā

translations.griffith: The man who reads the essence stored by saints, the Pavamani hymns,  Tastes food completely purified, made sweet by Mātariśvan's touch.

verses.sanskrit: पावमानीर्यो अध्येत्य रषिभिः सम्भ्र्तं रसम तस्मै सरस्वती दुहे कषीरं सर्पिर्मधूदकम |||
verses.transliteration: pāvamānīryo adhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam tasmai sarasvatī duhe kṣīraṃ sarpirmadhūdakam

translations.griffith: Whoever reads the essence stored by saints, the Pavamani hymns,  Sarasvatī draws forth for him water and butter, milk and meath.

verses.sanskrit: पर देवमछा मधुमन्त इन्दवो.असिष्यदन्त गाव आ न धेनवः बर्हिषदो वचनावन्त ऊधभिः परिस्रुतमुस्रियानिर्णिजं धिरे |||
verses.transliteration: pra devamachā madhumanta indavo.asiṣyadanta ghāva ā na dhenavaḥ barhiṣado vacanāvanta ūdhabhiḥ parisrutamusriyānirṇijaṃ dhire

translations.griffith: THE drops of Soma juice like cows who yield their milk have flowed forth, rich in meath, unto the Shining One,  And, seated on the grass, raising their voice, assumed the milk, the covering robe wherewith the udders stream.

verses.sanskrit: स रोरुवदभि पूर्वा अचिक्रददुपारुहः शरथयन सवादतेहरिः तिरः पवित्रमप्रियन्नुरु जरयो नि शर्याणि दधते देव आ वरम |||
verses.transliteration: sa roruvadabhi pūrvā acikradadupāruhaḥ śrathayan svādatehariḥ tiraḥ pavitramapriyannuru jrayo ni śaryāṇi dadhate deva ā varam

translations.griffith: He bellows with a roar arourd the highest twigs: the Tawny One is sweetened as he breaks them up.  Then passing through the sieve into the ample room, the God throws off the dregs according to his wish.

verses.sanskrit: वि यो ममे यम्या संयती मदः साकंव्र्धा पयसा पिन्वदक्षिता मही अपारे रजसी विवेविददभिव्रजन्नक्षितं पाज आ ददे |||
verses.transliteration: vi yo mame yamyā saṃyatī madaḥ sākaṃvṛdhā payasā pinvadakṣitā mahī apāre rajasī vivevidadabhivrajannakṣitaṃ pāja ā dade

translations.griffith: The gladdening drink that measured out the meeting Twins fills full with milk the Eternal Ever-waxing Pair.  Bringing to light the Two great Regions limitless, moving above them he gained sheen that never fades.

verses.sanskrit: स मातरा विचरन वाजयन्नपः पर मेधिरः सवधया पिन्वते पदम अंशुर्यवेन पिपिशे यतो नर्भिः सं जामिभिर्नसते रक्षते शिरः |||
verses.transliteration: sa mātarā vicaran vājayannapaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam aṃśuryavena pipiśe yato nṛbhiḥ saṃ jāmibhirnasate rakṣate śiraḥ

translations.griffith: Wandering through, the Parents, strengthening the floods, the Sage makes his place swell with his own native might.  The stalk is mixed with grain: he comes led by the men together with the sisters, and preserves the Head.

verses.sanskrit: सं दक्षेण मनसा जायते कविरतस्य गर्भो निहितो यमा परः यूना ह सन्ता परथमं वि जज्ञतुर्गुहा हितं जनिम नेममुद्यतम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kavirtasya gharbho nihito yamā paraḥ yūnā ha santā prathamaṃ vi jajñaturghuhā hitaṃ janima nemamudyatam

translations.griffith: With energetic intellect the Sage is born, deposited as germ of Law, far from the Twins.  They being young at first showed visibly distinct the Creature that is half-concealed and half-exposed.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रस्य रूपं विविदुर्मनीषिणः शयेनो यदन्धो अभरत परावतः तं मर्जयन्त सुव्र्धं नदीष्वा उशन्तमंशुं परियन्तं रग्मियम |||
verses.transliteration: mandrasya rūpaṃ vividurmanīṣiṇaḥ śyeno yadandho abharat parāvataḥ taṃ marjayanta suvṛdhaṃ nadīṣvā uśantamaṃśuṃ pariyantaṃ ṛghmiyam

translations.griffith: The sages knew the form of him the Gladdener, what time the Falcon brought the plant from far away.  Him who assures success they beautified in streams, the stalk who yearned therefor, mighty and meet for praise.

verses.sanskrit: तवां मर्जन्ति दश योषणः सुतं सोम रषिभिर्मतिभिर्धीतिभिर्हितम अव्यो वारेभिरुत देवहूतिभिर्न्र्भिर्यतोवाजमा दर्षि सातये |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutaṃ soma ṛṣibhirmatibhirdhītibhirhitam avyo vārebhiruta devahūtibhirnṛbhiryatovājamā darṣi sātaye

translations.griffith: Together with the Ṛṣis, with their prayers and hymns ten women deck thee, Soma, friendly when effused.  Led by the men, with invocations of the Gods, through the fleece, thou hast given us strength to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: परिप्रयन्तं वय्यं सुषंसदं सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत सतुभः यो धारया मधुमानूर्मिणा दिव इयर्ति वाचं रयिषाळ अमर्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pariprayantaṃ vayyaṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubhaḥ yo dhārayā madhumānūrmiṇā diva iyarti vācaṃ rayiṣāḷ amartyaḥ

translations.griffith: Songs resonant with praise have celebrated him. Soma, Friend, springing forth with his fair company.  Even him who rich in meath, with undulating stream, Winnner of Wealth, Immortal, sends his voice from heaven,

verses.sanskrit: अयं दिव इयर्ति विश्वमा रजः सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सीदति अद्भिर्गोभिर्म्र्ज्यते अद्रिभिः सुतः पुनान इन्दुर्वरिवो विदत परियम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ diva iyarti viśvamā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati adbhirghobhirmṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punāna indurvarivo vidat priyam

translations.griffith: He sends it into all the region forth from heaven. Soma, while he is filtcred, settles in the jars.  With milk and waters is he decked when pressed with stones: Indu, when purified, shall find sweet rest and room.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नः सोम परिषिच्यमानो वयो दधच्चित्रतमं पवस्व अद्वेषे दयावाप्र्थिवी हुवेम देवा धत्त रयिमस्मे सुवीरम |||
verses.transliteration: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāno vayo dadhaccitratamaṃ pavasva adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayimasme suvīram

translations.griffith: Even thus poured forth How on thy way, O Soma, vouchsafing us most manifold lively vigour.  We will invoke benevolent Earth and Heaven. Give us, ye Gods, riches with noble heroes.

verses.sanskrit: इषुर्न धन्वन परति धीयते मतिर्वत्सो न मातुरुप सर्ज्यूधनि उरुधारेव दुहे अग्र आयत्यस्य वरतेष्वपि सोम इष्यते |||
verses.transliteration: iṣurna dhanvan prati dhīyate matirvatso na māturupa sarjyūdhani urudhāreva duhe aghra āyatyasya vrateṣvapi soma iṣyate

translations.griffith: LAID like an arrow on the bow the hymn hath been loosed like a young calf to the udder of its dam.  As one who cometh first with full stream she is milked the Soma is impelled to this man's holy rites.

verses.sanskrit: उपो मतिः पर्च्यते सिच्यते मधु मन्द्राजनी चोदते अन्तरासनि पवमानः सन्तनिः परघ्नतामिव मधुमान दरप्सः परि वारमर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: upo matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antarāsani pavamānaḥ santaniḥ praghnatāmiva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāramarṣati

translations.griffith: The thought is deeply fixed; the savoury juice is shed; the tongue with joyous sound is stirring in the mouth;  And Pavamana, like the shout of combatants, the drop rising in sweet juice, is flowing through the fleece.

verses.sanskrit: अव्ये वधूयुः पवते परि तवचि शरथ्नीते नप्तीरदितेरतं यते हरिरक्रान यजतः संयतो मदो नर्म्णा शिशानो महिषो न शोभते |||
verses.transliteration: avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīraditertaṃ yate harirakrān yajataḥ saṃyato mado nṛmṇā śiśāno mahiṣo na śobhate

translations.griffith: He flows about the sheep-skin, longing for a bride: he looses Aditi's Daughters for the worshipper.  The sacred drink hath come, gold-tinted, well-restrained: like a strong Bull he shines, whetting his manly might.

verses.sanskrit: उक्षा मिमाति परति यन्ति धेनवो देवस्य देवीरुप यन्ति निष्क्र्तम अत्यक्रमीदर्जुनं वारमव्ययमत्कं न निक्तम्परि सोमो अव्यत |||
verses.transliteration: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavo devasya devīrupa yanti niṣkṛtam atyakramīdarjunaṃ vāramavyayamatkaṃ na niktampari somo avyata

translations.griffith: The Bull is bellowing; the Cows are coming nigh: the Goddesses approach the God's own resting-place.  Onward hath Soma passed through the sheep's fair bright fleece, and hath, as ’twere, endued a garment newly washed.

verses.sanskrit: अम्र्क्तेन रुशता वाससा हरिरमर्त्यो निर्णिजानः परि वयत दिवस पर्ष्ठं बर्हणा निर्णिजे कर्तोपस्तरणं चम्वोर्नभस्मयम |||
verses.transliteration: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā hariramartyo nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata divas pṛṣṭhaṃ barhaṇā nirṇije kṛtopastaraṇaṃ camvornabhasmayam

translations.griffith: The golden-hued, Immortal, newly bathed, puts on a brightly shining vesture that is never harmed.  He made the ridge of heaven to be his radiant robe, by sprinkling of the bowls from moisture of the sky.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यस्येव रश्मयो दरावयित्नवो मत्सरासः परसुपः साकमीरते तन्तुं ततं परि सर्गास आशवो नेन्द्राद रते पवते धाम किं चन |||
verses.transliteration: sūryasyeva raśmayo drāvayitnavo matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākamīrate tantuṃ tataṃ pari sarghāsa āśavo nendrād ṛte pavate dhāma kiṃ cana

translations.griffith: Even as the beams of Sūrya, urging men to speed, that cheer and send to sleep, together rush they forth,  These swift outpourings in long course of holy rites: no form save only Indra shows itself so pure.

verses.sanskrit: सिन्धोरिव परवणे निम्न आशवो वर्षच्युता मदासो गातुमाशत शं नो निवेशे दविपदे चतुष्पदे.अस्मे वाजः सोम तिष्ठन्तु कर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: sindhoriva pravaṇe nimna āśavo vṛṣacyutā madāso ghātumāśata śaṃ no niveśe dvipade catuṣpade.asme vājaḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: As down the steep slope of a river to the vale, drawn from the Steer the swift strong draughts have found a way.  Well be it with the men and cattle in our home. May powers, O Soma, may the people stay with us.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः पवस्व वसुमद धिरण्यवदश्वावद गोमद यवमत सुवीर्यम यूयं हि सोम पितरो मम सथन दिवो मूर्धानःप्रस्थिता वयस्क्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavadaśvāvad ghomad yavamat suvīryam yūyaṃ hi soma pitaro mama sthana divo mūrdhānaḥprasthitā vayaskṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: Pour out upon us wealth in goods, in gold, in steeds, in cattle and in corn, and great heroic strength.  Ye, Soma, are my Fathers, lifted up on high as heads of heaven and makers of the strength of life.

verses.sanskrit: एते सोमाः पवमानास इन्द्रं रथा इव पर ययुः सातिमछ सुताः पवित्रमति यन्त्यव्यं हित्वी वव्रिं हरितोव्र्ष्तिमछ |||
verses.transliteration: ete somāḥ pavamānāsa indraṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sātimacha sutāḥ pavitramati yantyavyaṃ hitvī vavriṃ haritovṛṣtimacha

translations.griffith: These Pavamanas here, these drops of Soma, to Indra have sped forth like cars to booty.  Effused, they pass the cleansing fleece, while, gold-hued, they cast their covering off to pour the rain down.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दविन्द्राय बर्हते पवस्व सुम्र्ळीको अनवद्यो रिशादाः भरा चन्द्राणि गर्णते वसूनि देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी परावतं नः |||
verses.transliteration: indavindrāya bṛhate pavasva sumṛḷīko anavadyo riśādāḥ bharā candrāṇi ghṛṇate vasūni devairdyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: O Indu, flow thou on for lofty Indra, flow blameless, very gracious, foe-destroyer.  Bring splendid treasures to the man who lauds thee. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods protect. us.

verses.sanskrit: तरिरस्मै सप्त धेनवो दुदुह्रे सत्यामाशिरं पूर्व्ये वयोमनि चत्वार्यन्या भुवनानि निर्णिजे चारूणि चक्रे यद रतैरवर्धत |||
verses.transliteration: trirasmai sapta dhenavo duduhre satyāmāśiraṃ pūrvye vyomani catvāryanyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yad ṛtairavardhata

translations.griffith: THE three times seven Milch-kine in the eastern heaven have for this Soma poured the genuine milky draught.  Four other beauteous Creatures hath he made for his adornment, when he waxed in strength through holy rites.

verses.sanskrit: स भिक्षमाणो अम्र्तस्य चारुण उभे दयावा काव्येना वि शश्रथे तेजिष्ठा अपो मंहना परि वयत यदी देवस्य शरवसा सदो विदुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa bhikṣamāṇo amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe dyāvā kāvyenā vi śaśrathe tejiṣṭhā apo maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sado viduḥ

translations.griffith: Longing for lovely Amṛta, by his wisdom he divided, each apart from other, earth and heaven.  He gladly wrapped himself in the most lucid floods, when through their glory they found the God's resting-place.

verses.sanskrit: ते अस्य सन्तु केतवो.अम्र्त्यवो.अदाभ्यासो जनुषी उभे अनु येभिर्न्र्म्णा च देव्या च पुनत आदिद राजानं मनना अग्र्भ्णत |||
verses.transliteration: te asya santu ketavo.amṛtyavo.adābhyāso januṣī ubhe anu yebhirnṛmṇā ca devyā ca punata ādid rājānaṃ mananā aghṛbhṇata

translations.griffith: May those his brilliant rays he ever free from death, inviolate, for both classes of created things,—  Rays wherewith powers of men and Gods are purified. Yea, even for this have sageswelcomed him as King.

verses.sanskrit: स मर्ज्यमानो दशभिः सुकर्मभिः पर मध्यमासु मात्र्षुप्रमे सचा वरतानि पानो अम्र्तस्व चारुण उभे नर्चक्षानु पश्यते विशौ |||
verses.transliteration: sa mṛjyamāno daśabhiḥ sukarmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣuprame sacā vratāni pāno amṛtasva cāruṇa ubhe nṛcakṣāanu paśyate viśau

translations.griffith: He, while he is adorned by the ten skilful ones, that he too in the Midmost Mothers may create,  While he is watching o’er the lovely Amṛta's ways, looks on both races as Beholder of mankind.

verses.sanskrit: स मर्म्र्जान इन्द्रियाय धायस ओभे अन्ता रोदसी हर्षते हितः वर्षा शुष्मेण बाधते वि दुर्मतीरादेदिशानः शर्यहेव शुरुधः |||
verses.transliteration: sa marmṛjāna indriyāya dhāyasa obhe antā rodasī harṣate hitaḥ vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīrādediśānaḥ śaryaheva śurudhaḥ

translations.griffith: He, while he is adorned to stream forth mighty strength, rejoices in his place between the earth and heaven.  The Steer dispels the evil-hearted with his might, aiming at offerings as an archer at the game.

verses.sanskrit: स मातरा न दद्र्शान उस्रियो नानददेति मरुतामिव सवनः जानन्न्र्तं परथमं यत सवर्णरं परशस्तये कमव्र्णीत सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa mātarā na dadṛśāna usriyo nānadadeti marutāmiva svanaḥ jānannṛtaṃ prathamaṃ yat svarṇaraṃ praśastaye kamavṛṇīta sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Beholding, as it were, Two Mother Cows, the Steer goes roaring on his way even as the Maruts roar.  Knowing Eternal Law, the earliest light of heaven, he, passing wise, was chosen out to tell it forth.

verses.sanskrit: रुवति भीमो वर्षभस्तविष्यया शर्ङगे शिशानो हरिणीविचक्षणः आ योनिं सोमः सुक्र्तं नि षीदति गव्ययीत्वग भवति निर्णिगव्ययी |||
verses.transliteration: ruvati bhīmo vṛṣabhastaviṣyayā śṛṅghe śiśāno hariṇīvicakṣaṇaḥ ā yoniṃ somaḥ sukṛtaṃ ni ṣīdati ghavyayītvagh bhavati nirṇighavyayī

translations.griffith: The fearful Bull is bellowing with violent might, far-sighted, sharpening his yellowcoloured horns.  Soma assumes his seat in the well-fashioned place: the cowhide and the sheepskin are his ornament.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिः पुनानस्तन्वमरेपसमव्ये हरिर्न्यधाविष्ट सानवि जुष्टो मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे तरिधातु मधु करियते सुकर्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: śuciḥ punānastanvamarepasamavye harirnyadhāviṣṭa sānavi juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave tridhātu madhu kriyate sukarmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Bright, making pure his body free from spot and stain, on the sheep's back the Golden-coloured hath flowed down.  Acceptable to Mitra, Vāyu, Varuṇa, he is prepared as threefold meal by skilful men.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम देववीतये वर्षेन्द्रस्य हार्दि सोमधानमा विश पुरा नो बाधाद दुरिताति पारय कषेत्रविद धि दिश आहा विप्र्छते |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma devavītaye vṛṣendrasya hārdi somadhānamā viśa purā no bādhād duritāti pāraya kṣetravid dhi diśa āhā vipṛchate

translations.griffith: Flow on for the God's banquet, Soma, as a Steer, and enter Indra's heart, the Soma's reservoir.  Bear us beyond misfortune ere we be oppres. sed. the man who knows the land directs the man who asks.

verses.sanskrit: हितो न सप्तिरभि वाजमर्षेन्द्रस्येन्दो जठरमा पवस्व नावा न सिन्धुमति पर्षि विद्वाञ्छूरो न युध्यन्नव नो निद सपः |||
verses.transliteration: hito na saptirabhi vājamarṣendrasyendo jaṭharamā pavasva nāvā na sindhumati parṣi vidvāñchūro na yudhyannava no nida spaḥ

translations.griffith: Urged like a car-steed flow to strength, O Soma: Indu, flow onward to the throat of Indra.  Skilled, bear us past, as in a boat o’er water: as battling Hero save us from the foeman.

verses.sanskrit: आ दक्षिणा सर्ज्यते शुष्म्यासदं वेति दरुहो रक्षसः पाति जाग्र्विः हरिरोपशं कर्णुते नभस पय उपस्तिरे चम्वोर्ब्रह्म निर्णिजे |||
verses.transliteration: ā dakṣiṇā sṛjyate śuṣmyāsadaṃ veti druho rakṣasaḥ pāti jāghṛviḥ hariropaśaṃ kṛṇute nabhas paya upastire camvorbrahma nirṇije

translations.griffith: THE guerdon is bestowed: the Mighty takes his Seat, and, ever-Watchful, guards from fiend and evil sprite.  Gold-hued, he makes the cloud his diadem, the milk his carpet in both worlds, and prayer his robe of state.

verses.sanskrit: पर करिष्टिहेव शूष एति रोरुवदसुर्यं वर्णं नि रिणीते अस्य तम जहाति वव्रिं पितुरेति निष्क्र्तमुपप्रुतं कर्णुते निर्णिजं तना |||
verses.transliteration: pra kriṣṭiheva śūṣa eti roruvadasuryaṃ varṇaṃ ni riṇīte asya tam jahāti vavriṃ pitureti niṣkṛtamupaprutaṃ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ tanā

translations.griffith: Strong, bellowing, he goes, like one who slays the folk; he lets this hue of Asuras flow off from him,  Throws off his covering, seeks his father's meeting-place, and thus makes for himself the bright robe he assumes.

verses.sanskrit: अद्रिभिः सुतः पवते गभस्त्योर्व्र्षायते नभसा वेपते मती स मोदते नसते साधते गिरा नेनिक्ते अप्सु यजते परीमणि |||
verses.transliteration: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate ghabhastyorvṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī sa modate nasate sādhate ghirā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi

translations.griffith: Onward he flows, from both the hands, pressed out with stones: excited by the prayer, the water makes him wild.  He frolics and draws near, completes his work with song, and bathes in streams to satisfy the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: परि दयुक्षं सहसः पर्वताव्र्धं मध्वः सिञ्चन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिम आ यस्मिन गावः सुहुताद ऊधनि मूर्धंछ्रीणन्त्यग्रियं वरीमभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pari dyukṣaṃ sahasaḥ parvatāvṛdhaṃ madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim ā yasmin ghāvaḥ suhutāda ūdhani mūrdhaṃchrīṇantyaghriyaṃ varīmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: They pour out meath around the Master of the house, Celestial Strengthener of the mountain that gives might;  In whom, through his great powers, oblation-eating cows in their uplifted udder mix their choicest milk.

verses.sanskrit: समी रथं न भुरिजोरहेषत दश सवसारो अदितेरुपस्थ आ जिगादुप जरयति गोरपीच्यं पदं यदस्य मतुथा अजीजनन |||
verses.transliteration: samī rathaṃ na bhurijoraheṣata daśa svasāro aditerupastha ā jighādupa jrayati ghorapīcyaṃ padaṃ yadasya matuthā ajījanan

translations.griffith: They, the ten sisters, on the lap of Aditi, have sent him forward like a car from both the arms.  He wanders and comes near the Cow's mysterious place, even the place which his inventions have produced.

verses.sanskrit: शयेनो न योनिं सदनं धिया कर्तं हिरण्ययमासदं देव एषति ए रिणन्ति बर्हिषि परियं गिराश्वो न देवानप्येति यज्ञियः |||
verses.transliteration: śyeno na yoniṃ sadanaṃ dhiyā kṛtaṃ hiraṇyayamāsadaṃ deva eṣati e riṇanti barhiṣi priyaṃ ghirāśvo na devānapyeti yajñiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Like as a falcon to his home, so speeds the God to his own golden wisely-tashioned place to rest.  With song they urge the darling to the sacred grass: the Holy One goes like a courser to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: परा वयक्तो अरुषो दिवः कविर्व्र्षा तरिप्र्ष्ठो अनविष्टगा अभि सहस्रणीतिर्यतिः परायती रेभो न पूर्वीरुषसो वि राजति |||
verses.transliteration: parā vyakto aruṣo divaḥ kavirvṛṣā tripṛṣṭho anaviṣṭaghā abhi sahasraṇītiryatiḥ parāyatī rebho na pūrvīruṣaso vi rājati

translations.griffith: From far away, from heaven, the redhued noted Sage, Steer of the triple height, hath sung unto the kine.  With thousand guidings he, leading this way and that, shines, as a singer, splendidly through many a morn.

verses.sanskrit: तवेषं रूपं कर्णुते वर्णो अस्य स यत्राशयत सम्र्ता सेधति सरिधः अप्सा याति सवधया दैव्यं जनं सं सुष्टुती नसते सं गोग्रया |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute varṇo asya sa yatrāśayat samṛtā sedhati sridhaḥ apsā yāti svadhayā daivyaṃ janaṃ saṃ suṣṭutī nasate saṃ ghoaghrayā

translations.griffith: His covering assumes a radiant hue; where’er he comes into the fight he drives the foe afar.  The Winner of the Floods, with food he seeks the host of heaven, he comes to praises glorified with milk.

verses.sanskrit: उक्षेव यूथा परियन्नरावीदधि तविषीरधित सूर्यस्य दिव्यः सुपर्णो.अव चक्षत कषां सोमः परि करतुना पश्यते जाः |||
verses.transliteration: ukṣeva yūthā pariyannarāvīdadhi tviṣīradhita sūryasya divyaḥ suparṇo.ava cakṣata kṣāṃ somaḥ pari kratunā paśyate jāḥ

translations.griffith: Like a bull roaming round the herds he bellows: he hath assumed the brilliancy of Sūrya.  Down to the earth hath looked the heavenly Falcon: Soma with wisdom views all living creatures.

verses.sanskrit: हरिं मर्जन्त्यरुषो न युज्यते सं धेनुभिः कलशे सोमो अज्यते उद वाचमीरयति हिन्वते मती पुरुष्टुतस्य कति चित्परिप्रियः |||
verses.transliteration: hariṃ mṛjantyaruṣo na yujyate saṃ dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somo ajyate ud vācamīrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati citparipriyaḥ

translations.griffith: THEY cleanse the Gold-hued: like a red Steed is he yoked, and Soma in the jar is mingled with the milk.  He sendeth out his voice, and many loving friends of him the highly lauded hasten with their songs.

verses.sanskrit: साकं वदन्ति बहवो मनीषिण इन्द्रस्य सोमं जठरे यदादुहुः यदी मर्जन्ति सुगभस्तयो नरः सनीळाभिर्दशभिः काम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: sākaṃ vadanti bahavo manīṣiṇa indrasya somaṃ jaṭhare yadāduhuḥ yadī mṛjanti sughabhastayo naraḥ sanīḷābhirdaśabhiḥ kāmyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: The many sages utter words in unison, while into Indra's throat they pour the Soma juice,  When, with the ten that dwell together closely joined, the men whose hands are skilful cleanse the lovely meath.

verses.sanskrit: अरममाणो अत्येति गा अभि सूर्यस्य परियं दुहितुस्तिरो रवम अन्वस्मै जोषमभरद विनंग्र्सः सं दवयीभिः सवस्र्भिः कषेति जामिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: aramamāṇo atyeti ghā abhi sūryasya priyaṃ duhitustiro ravam anvasmai joṣamabharad vinaṃghṛsaḥ saṃ dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ

translations.griffith: He goes upon his way, unresting, to the cows, over the roaring sound which Sarya's Daughter loves.  The Falcon brought it to him for his own delight: now with the twofold kindred sisters is his home.

verses.sanskrit: नर्धूतो अद्रिषुतो बर्हिषि परियः पतिर्गवां परदिव इन्दुरतवियः पुरन्धिवान मनुषो यज्ञसाधनः शुचिर्धियापवते सोम इन्द्र ते |||
verses.transliteration: nṛdhūto adriṣuto barhiṣi priyaḥ patirghavāṃ pradiva indurtviyaḥ purandhivān manuṣo yajñasādhanaḥ śucirdhiyāpavate soma indra te

translations.griffith: Washed by the men, stone-pressed, dear on the holy grass, faithful to seasons, Lord of cattle from of old,  Most liberal, completing sacrifice for men, O Indra, pure bright Soma, Indu, flows for thee.

verses.sanskrit: नर्बाहुभ्यां चोदितो धारया सुतो.अनुष्वधं पवते सोम इन्द्र ते आप्राः करतून समजैरध्वरे मतीर्वेर्न दरुषच्चम्वोरासदद धरिः |||
verses.transliteration: nṛbāhubhyāṃ codito dhārayā suto.anuṣvadhaṃ pavate soma indra te āprāḥ kratūn samajairadhvare matīrverna druṣaccamvorāsadad dhariḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, urged by arms of men and poured in streams, Soma flows on for thee afterḥis Godlike kind.  Plans thou fulfillest, gatherest thoughts for sacrifice: in the bowls sits the Gold-hued like a roosting bird.

verses.sanskrit: अंशुं दुहन्ति सतनयन्तमक्षितं कविं कवयो.अपसो मनीषिणः समी गावो मतयो यन्ति संयत रतस्य योना सदने पुनर्भुवः |||
verses.transliteration: aṃśuṃ duhanti stanayantamakṣitaṃ kaviṃ kavayo.apaso manīṣiṇaḥ samī ghāvo matayo yanti saṃyata ṛtasya yonā sadane punarbhuvaḥ

translations.griffith: Sages well-skilled in work, intelligent, drain out the stalk that roars, the Sage, the Everlasting One.  The milk, the hymns unite them with him in the place of sacrifice, his seat who is produced anew.

verses.sanskrit: नाभा पर्थिव्या धरुणो महो दिवो.अपामूर्मौ सिन्धुष्वन्तरुक्षितः इन्द्रस्य वज्रो वर्षभो विभूवसुः सोमो हर्देपवते चारु मत्सरः |||
verses.transliteration: nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divo.apāmūrmau sindhuṣvantarukṣitaḥ indrasya vajro vṛṣabho vibhūvasuḥ somo hṛdepavate cāru matsaraḥ

translations.griffith: Earth's central point, sustainer of the mighty heavens, distilled into the streams, into the waters' wave,  As Indra's thunderbolt, Steer with farspreading wealth, Soma is flowing on to make the heart rejoice.

verses.sanskrit: स तू पवस्व परि पार्थिवं रज सतोत्रे शिक्षन्नाधून्वते च सुक्रतो मा नो निर्भाग वसुनः सादनस्प्र्शो रयिं पिशङगं बहुलं वसीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṃ raja stotre śikṣannādhūnvate ca sukrato mā no nirbhāgh vasunaḥ sādanaspṛśo rayiṃ piśaṅghaṃ bahulaṃ vasīmahi

translations.griffith: Over the earthly region flow thou on thy way, helping the praiser and the pourer, thou Most Wise.  Let us not lack rich treasure reaching to our home, and may we clothe ourselves in manifold bright wealth.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू न इन्दो शतदात्वश्व्यं सहस्रदातु पशुमद धिरण्यवत उप मास्व बर्हती रेवतीरिषो.अधि सतोत्रस्य पवमान नो गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū na indo śatadātvaśvyaṃ sahasradātu paśumad dhiraṇyavat upa māsva bṛhatī revatīriṣo.adhi stotrasya pavamāna no ghahi

translations.griffith: Hither, O Indu, unto us a hundred gifts of steeds, a thousand gifts of cattle and of gold,  Measure thou forth, yea, splendid ample strengthening food do thou, O Pavamana, heed this laud of ours.

verses.sanskrit: सरक्वे दरप्सस्य धमतः समस्वरन्न्र्तस्य योना समरन्तनाभयः तरीन स मूर्ध्नो असुरश्चक्र आरभे सत्यस्यनावः सुक्र्तमपीपरन |||
verses.transliteration: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ samasvarannṛtasya yonā samarantanābhayaḥ trīn sa mūrdhno asuraścakra ārabhe satyasyanāvaḥ sukṛtamapīparan

translations.griffith: THEY from the spouting drop have sounded at the rim: naves speed together to the place of sacrifice.  That Asura hath formed, to seize, three lofty heights. The ships of truth have borne the pious man across.

verses.sanskrit: सम्यक सम्यञ्चो महिषा अहेषत सिन्धोरूर्मावधि वेना अवीविपन मधोर्धाराभिर्जनयन्तो अर्कमित परियामिन्द्रस्य तन्वमवीव्र्धन |||
verses.transliteration: samyak samyañco mahiṣā aheṣata sindhorūrmāvadhi venā avīvipan madhordhārābhirjanayanto arkamit priyāmindrasya tanvamavīvṛdhan

translations.griffith: The strong Steers, gathering, have duly stirred themselves,and over the stream's wave the friends sent forth the song.  Engendering the hymn, with flowing streams of meath, Indra's dear body have they caused to wax in strength.

verses.sanskrit: पवित्रवन्तः परि वाचमासते पितैषां परत्नो अभि रक्षति वरतम महः समुद्रं वरुणस्तिरो दधे धीरा इच्छेकुर्धरुणेष्वारभम |||
verses.transliteration: pavitravantaḥ pari vācamāsate pitaiṣāṃ pratno abhi rakṣati vratam mahaḥ samudraṃ varuṇastiro dadhe dhīrā icchekurdharuṇeṣvārabham

translations.griffith: With sanctifying gear they sit around the song: their ancient Father guards their holy work from harm.  Varuṇa hath o’erspread the mighty sea of air. Sages had power to hold him in sustaining floods.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रधारे.अव ते समस्वरन दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतः अस्य सपशो न नि मिषन्ति भूर्णयः पदे-पदे पाशिनः सन्ति सेतवः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasradhāre.ava te samasvaran divo nāke madhujihvā asaścataḥ asya spaśo na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ pade-pade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ

translations.griffith: Sweet-tongued, exhaustless, they have sent their voices down togetlier, in heaven's vault that pours a thousand streams.  His wildly-restless warders never close an eye: in every place are found the bonds that bind man last.

verses.sanskrit: पितुर्मातुरध्या ये समस्वरन्न्र्चा शोचन्तः सन्दहन्तो अव्रतान इन्द्रद्विष्टामप धमन्ति मायया तवचमसिक्नीं भूमनो दिवस परि |||
verses.transliteration: piturmāturadhyā ye samasvarannṛcā śocantaḥ sandahanto avratān indradviṣṭāmapa dhamanti māyayā tvacamasiknīṃ bhūmano divas pari

translations.griffith: O'er Sire and Mother they have roared in unison bright with the verse of praise, burning up riteless men,  Blowing away with supernatural might from earth and from the heavens the swarthy skin which Indra hates.

verses.sanskrit: परत्नान मानादध्या ये समस्वरञ्छ्लोकयन्त्रासो रभसस्य मन्तवः अपानक्षासो बधिरा अहासत रतस्य पन्थां न तरन्ति दुष्क्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: pratnān mānādadhyā ye samasvarañchlokayantrāso rabhasasya mantavaḥ apānakṣāso badhirā ahāsata ṛtasya panthāṃ na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: Those which, as guides of song and counsellors of speed, were manifested from their ancient dwelling place,—  From these the eyeless and the deaf have turned aside: the wicked travel not the pathway of the Law.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रधारे वितते पवित्र आ वाचं पुनन्ति कवयो मनीषिणः रुद्रास एषामिषिरासो अद्रुह सपशः सवञ्चः सुद्र्शो नर्चक्षसः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasradhāre vitate pavitra ā vācaṃ punanti kavayo manīṣiṇaḥ rudrāsa eṣāmiṣirāso adruha spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśo nṛcakṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: What time the filter with a thousand streams is stretched, the thoughtful sages purify their song therein.  Bright-coloured are their spies, vigorous, void of guile, excellent, fair to see, beholders of mankind.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य गोपा न दभाय सुक्रतुस्त्री ष पवित्रा हर्द्यन्तरा दधे विद्वान स विश्वा भुवनाभि पश्यत्यवाजुष्टान विध्यति कर्ते अव्रतान |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya ghopā na dabhāya sukratustrī ṣa pavitrā hṛdyantarā dadhe vidvān sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paśyatyavājuṣṭān vidhyati karte avratān

translations.griffith: Guardian of Law, most wise, he may not be deceived: three Purifiers hath he set within his heart.  With wisdom he beholds all creatures that exist: he drives into the pit the hated riteliess ones.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य तन्तुर्विततः पवित्र आ जिह्वाया अग्रे वरुणस्य मायया धीराश्चित तत समिनक्षन्त आशतात्रा कर्तमव पदात्यप्रभुह |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya tanturvitataḥ pavitra ā jihvāyā aghre varuṇasya māyayā dhīrāścit tat saminakṣanta āśatātrā kartamava padātyaprabhuh

translations.griffith: The thread of sacrifice spun in the cleansing sieve, on Varuṇa's tongue-tip, by supernatural might,—  This, by their striving, have the prudent ones attained: he who hath not this power shall sink into the pit.

verses.sanskrit: शिशुर्न जातो.अव चक्रदद वने सवर्यद वाज्यरुषः सिषासति दिवो रेतसा सचते पयोव्र्धा तमीमहे सुमती शर्म सप्रथः |||
verses.transliteration: śiśurna jāto.ava cakradad vane svaryad vājyaruṣaḥ siṣāsati divo retasā sacate payovṛdhā tamīmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ

translations.griffith: BORN like a youngling he hath clamoured in the wood, when he, the Red, the Strong, would win the light of heaven.  He comes with heavenly seed that makes the water swell: him for wide-spreading shelter we implore with prayer.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो य सकम्भो धरुणः सवातत आपूर्णो अंशुः पर्येतिविश्वतः सेमे मही रोदसी यक्षदाव्र्ता समीचीने दाधार समिषः कविः |||
verses.transliteration: divo ya skambho dharuṇaḥ svātata āpūrṇo aṃśuḥ paryetiviśvataḥ seme mahī rodasī yakṣadāvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra samiṣaḥ kaviḥ

translations.griffith: A far-extended pillar that supports the sky the Soma-stalk, filled full, moves itself every way.  He shall bring both these great worlds while the rite proceeds: the Sage holds these who move! together and all food.

verses.sanskrit: महि पसरः सुक्र्तं सोम्यं मधूर्वी गव्यूतिरदितेरतं यते ईशे यो वर्ष्टेरित उस्रियो वर्षापां नेता य इतूतिरगमियः |||
verses.transliteration: mahi psaraḥ sukṛtaṃ somyaṃ madhūrvī ghavyūtiraditertaṃ yate īśe yo vṛṣṭerita usriyo vṛṣāpāṃ netā ya itaūtirghmiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Wide space hath he who follows Aditi's right path, and mighty, well-made food, meath blent with Soma juice;  He who from hence commands the rain, Steer of the kine, Leader of floods, who helps us hence, who claims our laud.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मन्वन नभो दुह्यते घर्तं पय रतस्य नाभिरम्र्तं विजायते समीचीनाः सुदानवः परीणन्ति तं नरो हितमव मेहन्ति पेरवः |||
verses.transliteration: ātmanvan nabho duhyate ghṛtaṃ paya ṛtasya nābhiramṛtaṃ vijāyate samīcīnāḥ sudānavaḥ prīṇanti taṃ naro hitamava mehanti peravaḥ

translations.griffith: Butter and milk are drawn from animated cloud; thence Amṛta is produced, centre of sacrifice.  Hini the Most Bounteous Ones, ever united, love; him as ouir Friend the Men who make all swell rain down.

verses.sanskrit: अरावीदंशुः सचमान ऊर्मिणा देवाव्यं मनुषे पिन्वतित्वचम दधाति गर्भमदितेरुपस्थ आ येन तोकं च तनयं च धामहे |||
verses.transliteration: arāvīdaṃśuḥ sacamāna ūrmiṇā devāvyaṃ manuṣe pinvatitvacam dadhāti gharbhamaditerupastha ā yena tokaṃ ca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe

translations.griffith: The Soma-stalk hath roared, following with the wave: he swells with sap for man the skin which Gods enjoy.  Upon the lap of Aditi he lays the germ, by means whereof we gain children and progeny.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रधारे.अव ता असश्चतस्त्र्तीये सन्तु रजसि परजावतीः चतस्रो नाभो निहिता अवो दिवो हविर्भरन्त्यम्र्तं घर्तश्चुतः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasradhāre.ava tā asaścatastṛtīye santu rajasi prajāvatīḥ catasro nābho nihitā avo divo havirbharantyamṛtaṃ ghṛtaścutaḥ

translations.griffith: In the third region which distils a thousand streams, may the Exhaustless Ones descend with procreant power.  The kindred Four have been sent downward from the heavens: dropping with oil they bring Amṛta and sacred gifts.

verses.sanskrit: शवेतं रूपं कर्णुते यत सिषासति सोमो मीढ्वानसुरो वेद भूमनः धिया शमी सचते सेमभि परवद दिवस कवन्धमव दर्षदुद्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: śvetaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute yat siṣāsati somo mīḍhvānasuro veda bhūmanaḥ dhiyā śamī sacate semabhi pravad divas kavandhamava darṣadudriṇam

translations.griffith: Soma assumes white colour when he strives to gain: the bounteous Asura knows full many a precious boon.  Down the steep slope, through song, he comes to sacrifice, and he will burst the water-holding cask of heaven,

verses.sanskrit: अध शवेतं कलशं गोभिरक्तं कार्ष्मन्ना वाज्यक्रमीत ससवान आ हिन्विरे मनसा देवयन्तः कक्षीवते शतहिमाय गोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ ghobhiraktaṃ kārṣmannā vājyakramīt sasavān ā hinvire manasā devayantaḥ kakṣīvate śatahimāya ghonām

translations.griffith: Yea, to the shining milk-anointed beaker, as to his goal, hath stepped the conquering Courser.  Pious-souled men have sent their giffi of cattle unto Kakṣīvān of the hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit: अद्भिः सोम पप्र्चानस्य ते रसो.अव्यो वारं वि पवमान धावति स मर्ज्यमानः कविभिर्मदिन्तम सवदस्वेन्द्राय पवमान पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: adbhiḥ soma papṛcānasya te raso.avyo vāraṃ vi pavamāna dhāvati sa mṛjyamānaḥ kavibhirmadintama svadasvendrāya pavamāna pītaye

translations.griffith: Soma, thy juice when thou art blended with the streams, flows, Pavamana, through the long wool of the sheep.  So, cleansed by sages. O best giver of delight, grow sweet for Indra, Pavamana! for his drink.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परियाणि पवते चनोहितो नामानि यह्वो अधि येषु वर्धते आ सूर्यस्य बर्हतो बर्हन्नधि रथं विष्वञ्चमरुहद विचक्षणः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohito nāmāni yahvo adhi yeṣu vardhate ā sūryasya bṛhato bṛhannadhi rathaṃ viṣvañcamaruhad vicakṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: GRACIOUSLY-MINDED he is flowing on his way to win dear names o’er which the Youthful One grows great.  The Mighty and Far-seeing One hath mounted now the mighty Sūrya's car which moves to every side.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य जिह्वा पवते मधु परियं वक्ता पतिर्धियो अस्या अदाभ्यः दधाति पुत्रः पित्रोरपीच्यं नाम तर्तीयमधि रोचने दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya jihvā pavate madhu priyaṃ vaktā patirdhiyo asyā adābhyaḥ dadhāti putraḥ pitrorapīcyaṃ nāma tṛtīyamadhi rocane divaḥ

translations.griffith: The Speaker, unassailable Master of this hymn, the Tongue of sacrifice pours forth the pleasant meath.  Within the lustrous region of the heavens the Son makes the third secret name of Mother and of Sire.

verses.sanskrit: अव दयुतानः कलशानचिक्रदन नर्भिर्येमानः कोश आ हिरण्यये अभीं रतस्य दोहना अनूषताधि तरिप्र्ष्ठ उषसो वि राजति |||
verses.transliteration: ava dyutānaḥ kalaśānacikradan nṛbhiryemānaḥ kośa ā hiraṇyaye abhīṃ ṛtasya dohanā anūṣatādhi tripṛṣṭha uṣaso vi rājati

translations.griffith: Sending forth flashes he hath bellowed to the jars, led by the men into the golden reservoir.  The milky streams of sacrifice have sung to him: he of the triple height shines brightly through the morns.

verses.sanskrit: अद्रिभिः सुतो मतिभिश्चनोहितः पररोचयन रोदसी मातराशुचिः रोमाण्यव्या समया वि धावति मधोर्धारा पिन्वमाना दिवे-दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: adribhiḥ suto matibhiścanohitaḥ prarocayan rodasī mātarāśuciḥ romāṇyavyā samayā vi dhāvati madhordhārā pinvamānā dive-dive

translations.griffith: Pressed by the stones, with hymns, and graciously inclined, illuminating both the Parents, Heaven and Earth,  He flows in ordered season onward through the flee, a current of sweet juice still swelling day by day.

verses.sanskrit: परि सोम पर धन्वा सवस्तये नर्भिः पुनानो अभि वासयाशिरम ये ते मदा आहनसो विहायसस्तेभिरिन्द्रं चोदय दातवे मघम |||
verses.transliteration: pari soma pra dhanvā svastaye nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vāsayāśiram ye te madā āhanaso vihāyasastebhirindraṃ codaya dātave magham

translations.griffith: Flow onward, Soma, flow to bring prosperity: cleansed by the men, invest thee with the milky draught.  What gladdening drinks thou hast, foaming, exceeding strong, even with these incite Indra to give us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: धर्ता दिवः पवते कर्त्व्यो रसो दक्षो देवानामनुमाद्यो नर्भिः हरिः सर्जानो अत्यो न सत्वभिर्व्र्था पाजांसि कर्णुते नदीष्वा |||
verses.transliteration: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso dakṣo devānāmanumādyo nṛbhiḥ hariḥ sṛjāno atyo na satvabhirvṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣvā

translations.griffith: ON flows the potent juice, sustainer of the heavens, the strength of Gods, whom men must hail with shouts of joy.  The Gold-hued, started like a courser by brave men, impetuously winneth splendour in the streams.

verses.sanskrit: शूरो न धत्त आयुधा गभस्त्योः सवः सिषासन रथिरो गविष्टिषु इन्द्रस्य शुष्ममीरयन्नपस्युभिरिन्दुर्हिन्वानो अज्यते मनीषिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: śūro na dhatta āyudhā ghabhastyoḥ svaḥ siṣāsan rathiro ghaviṣṭiṣu indrasya śuṣmamīrayannapasyubhirindurhinvāno ajyate manīṣibhiḥ

translations.griffith: He takes his weapons, like a hero, in his hands, fain to win light, car-borne, in forays for the kine.  Indu, while stimulating India's might, is urged forward and balmed by sages skilful in their task.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य सोम पवमान ऊर्मिणा तविष्यमाणो जठरेष्वाविश पर णः पिन्व विद्युदभ्रेव रोदसी धिया न वाजानुप मासि शश्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya soma pavamāna ūrmiṇā taviṣyamāṇo jaṭhareṣvāviśa pra ṇaḥ pinva vidyudabhreva rodasī dhiyā na vājānupa māsi śaśvataḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, as thou art purified with flowing wave, exhibiting thy strength enter thou Indra's throat.  Make both worlds stream for us, as lightning doth the clouds: mete out exhaustless powers for us, as ’twere through song.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्य राजा पवते सवर्द्र्श रतस्य धीतिं रषिषाळ अवीवशत यः सूर्यस्यासिरेण मर्ज्यते पिता मतीनामसमष्टकाव्यः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasya rājā pavate svardṛśa ṛtasya dhītiṃ ṛṣiṣāḷ avīvaśat yaḥ sūryasyāsireṇa mṛjyate pitā matīnāmasamaṣṭakāvyaḥ

translations.griffith: Onward he flows, the King of all that sees the light: the Ṛṣis’ Lord hath raised the song of sacrifice;  Even he who is adorned with Sūrya's arrowy beam, Father of hymns, whose wisdom is beyond our reach.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षेव यूथा परि कोशमर्षस्यपामुपस्थे वर्षभः कनिक्रदत स इन्द्राय पवसे मत्सरिन्तमो यथा जेषाम समिथे तवोतयः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośamarṣasyapāmupasthe vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat sa indrāya pavase matsarintamo yathā jeṣāma samithe tvotayaḥ

translations.griffith: Like as a bull to herds, thou flowest to the pail, bellowing as a steer upon the water's lap.  So, best of Cheerers, thou for Indra flowest on that we, with thy protection, may o’ercome in fight.

verses.sanskrit: एष पर कोशे मधुमानचिक्रददिन्द्रस्य वज्रो वपुषो वपुष्टरः अभीं रतस्य सुदुघा घर्तश्चुतो वाश्रा अर्षन्तिपयसेव धेनवः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa pra kośe madhumānacikradadindrasya vajro vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraḥ abhīṃ ṛtasya sudughā ghṛtaścuto vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ

translations.griffith: MORE beauteous than the beautiful, as Indra's bolt, this Soma, rich in sweets, hath clamoured in the vat.  Dropping with oil, abundant, streams of sacrifice flow unto him like milch-kine, lowing, with their milk.

verses.sanskrit: स पूर्व्यः पवते यं दिवस परि शयेनो मथायदिषितस्तिरो रजः स मध्व आ युवते वेविजान इत कर्शानोरस्तुर्मनसाह बिभ्युषा |||
verses.transliteration: sa pūrvyaḥ pavate yaṃ divas pari śyeno mathāyadiṣitastiro rajaḥ sa madhva ā yuvate vevijāna it kṛśānorasturmanasāha bibhyuṣā

translations.griffith: On flows that Ancient One whom, hitherward, from heaven, sped through the region of the air, the Falcon snatched.  He, quivering with alarm and terrified in heart before bow-armed Kṛśānu, holdeth fast the sweet.

verses.sanskrit: ते नः पूर्वास उपरास इन्दवो महे वाजाय धन्वन्तु गोमते ईक्षेण्यासो अह्यो न चारवो बरह्म-बरह्म ये जुजुषुर्हविर हविः |||
verses.transliteration: te naḥ pūrvāsa uparāsa indavo mahe vājāya dhanvantu ghomate īkṣeṇyāso ahyo na cāravo brahma-brahma ye jujuṣurhavir haviḥ

translations.griffith: May those first freshest drops of Soma juice effused flow on, their way to bring us mighty strength in kine.  Beauteous as serpents, worthy to be looked upon, they whom each sacred gift and all our prayers have pleased.

verses.sanskrit: अयं नो विद्वान वनवद वनुष्यत इन्दुः सत्राचा मनसा पुरुष्टुतः इनस्य यः सदने गर्भमादधे गवामुरुब्जमभ्यर्षति वरजम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ no vidvān vanavad vanuṣyata induḥ satrācā manasā puruṣṭutaḥ inasya yaḥ sadane gharbhamādadhe ghavāmurubjamabhyarṣati vrajam

translations.griffith: May that much-lauded Indu, with a heart inclined to us, well-knowing, fight against our enemies.  He who hath brought the germ beside the Strong One's seat moves onward to the widely-opcned stall of kine.

verses.sanskrit: चक्रिर्दिवः पवते कर्त्व्यो रसो महानदब्धो वरुणो हुरुग्यते असावि मित्रो वर्जनेषु यज्ञियो.अत्यो न यूथे वर्षयुः कनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: cakrirdivaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso mahānadabdho varuṇo hurughyate asāvi mitro vṛjaneṣu yajñiyo.atyo na yūthe vṛṣayuḥ kanikradat

translations.griffith: The active potent juice of heaven is flowing on, great Varuṇa whom the forward man can ne’er deceive.  Mitra, the Holy, hath been pressed for troubled times, neighing like an impatient horse amid the herd,

verses.sanskrit: पर राजा वाचं जनयन्नसिष्यददपो वसानो अभि गा इयक्षति गर्भ्णाति रिप्रमविरस्य तान्वा शुद्धो देवानामुप याति निष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: pra rājā vācaṃ janayannasiṣyadadapo vasāno abhi ghā iyakṣati ghṛbhṇāti ripramavirasya tānvā śuddho devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: RAISING his voice the King hath flowed upon his way: invested with the waters he would win the kine.  The fleece retains his solid parts as though impure, and bright and cleansed he seeks the special place of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम परि षिच्यसे नर्भिर्न्र्चक्षा ऊर्मिः कविरज्यसे वने पूर्वीर्हि ते सरुतयः सन्ति यातवे सहस्रमश्वा हरयश्चमूषदः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya soma pari ṣicyase nṛbhirnṛcakṣā ūrmiḥ kavirajyase vane pūrvīrhi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasramaśvā harayaścamūṣadaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Soma, art effused for Indra by the men, balmed in the wood as wave, Sage, Viewer of mankind.  Full many are the paths whereon thou mayest go: a thousand bay steeds hast thou resting in the bowls.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रिया अप्सरसो मनीषिणमासीना अन्तरभि सोममक्षरन ता ईं हिन्वन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिं याचन्ते सुम्नं पवमानमक्षितम |||
verses.transliteration: samudriyā apsaraso manīṣiṇamāsīnā antarabhi somamakṣaran tā īṃ hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇiṃ yācante sumnaṃ pavamānamakṣitam

translations.griffith: Apsarases who dwell in waters of the sea, sitting within, have flowed to Soma wise of heart.  They urge the Master of the house upon his way, and to the Eternal Pavamana pray for bliss.

verses.sanskrit: गोजिन नः सोमो रथजिद धिरण्यजित सवर्जिदब्जित पवते सहस्रजित यं देवासश्चक्रिरे पीतये मदं सवादिष्ठं दरप्समरुणं मयोभुवम |||
verses.transliteration: ghojin naḥ somo rathajid dhiraṇyajit svarjidabjit pavate sahasrajit yaṃ devāsaścakrire pītaye madaṃ svādiṣṭhaṃ drapsamaruṇaṃ mayobhuvam

translations.griffith: Soma flows on for u's as winner of the kine, winner of thousands, cars, water, and light, and gold;  He whom the Gods have made a gladdening draught to drink, the drop most sweet to taste, weal-bringing, red of hue.

verses.sanskrit: एतानि सोम पवमानो अस्मयुः सत्यानि कर्ण्वन दरविणान्यर्षसि जहि शत्रुमन्तिके दूरके च य उर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं च नस कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: etāni soma pavamāno asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇānyarṣasi jahi śatrumantike dūrake ca ya urvīṃ ghavyūtimabhayaṃ ca nas kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Soma, as Pavamana thou, our faithful Friend, making for us these real treasures, flowest on.  Slay thou the enemy both near and,far away: grant us security and ample pasturage.

verses.sanskrit: अचोदसो नो धन्वन्त्विन्दवः पर सुवानासो बर्हद्दिवेषु हरयः वि च नशन न इषो अरातयो.अर्यो नशन्त सनिषन्त नो धियः |||
verses.transliteration: acodaso no dhanvantvindavaḥ pra suvānāso bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ vi ca naśan na iṣo arātayo.aryo naśanta saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: SPONTANEOUS let our drops of Soma juice flow on, pressed, golden-hued, among the Gods of lofty heaven.  Perish among us they who give no gifts of food! perish the godless! May our prayers obtain success.

verses.sanskrit: पर णो धन्वन्त्विन्दवो मदच्युतो धना वा येभिरर्वतो जुनीमसि तिरो मर्तस्य कस्य चित परिह्व्र्तिं वयं धनानि विश्वधा भरेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: pra ṇo dhanvantvindavo madacyuto dhanā vā yebhirarvato junīmasi tiro martasya kasya cit parihvṛtiṃ vayaṃ dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi

translations.griffith: Forward to us the drops, distilling meath, shall flow, like riches for whose sake we urge the horses on.  Beyond the crafty hindering of all mortal men may we continually bear precious wealth away.

verses.sanskrit: उत सवस्या अरात्या अरिर्हि ष उतान्यस्या अरात्या वर्को हि षः धन्वन न तर्ष्णा समरीत तानभि सोम जहिपवमान दुराध्यः |||
verses.transliteration: uta svasyā arātyā arirhi ṣa utānyasyā arātyā vṛko hi ṣaḥ dhanvan na tṛṣṇā samarīta tānabhi soma jahipavamāna durādhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, yerily, foe of hate shown to himself is he, yea, verity, destroyer too of other hate.  As thirst subdueth in the desert, conquer thou, O Soma Pavarnana, men of evil thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि ते नाभा परमो य आददे पर्थिव्यास्ते रुरुहुः सानविक्षिपः अद्रयस्त्वा बप्सति गोरधि तवच्यप्सु तवा हस्तैर्दुदुहुर्मनीषिणः |||
verses.transliteration: divi te nābhā paramo ya ādade pṛthivyāste ruruhuḥ sānavikṣipaḥ adrayastvā bapsati ghoradhi tvacyapsu tvā hastairduduhurmanīṣiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Near kin to thee is he, raised loftiest in the heavens: upon the earth's high ridge thy scions have grown forth.  The press-stones chew and crunch thee on the ox's hide: sages have milked thee with their hands into the streams.

verses.sanskrit: एवा त इन्दो सुभ्वं सुपेशसं रसं तुञ्जन्ति परथमा अभिश्रियः निदं-निदं पवमान नि तारिष आविस्ते शुष्मो भवतु परियो मदः |||
verses.transliteration: evā ta indo subhvaṃ supeśasaṃ rasaṃ tuñjanti prathamā abhiśriyaḥ nidaṃ-nidaṃ pavamāna ni tāriṣa āviste śuṣmo bhavatu priyo madaḥ

translations.griffith: So do they hurry on thy strong and beauteous juice, O Indu, as the first ingredient of the draught.  Bring low, thou Pavamana, every single foe, and be thy might shown forth as sweet and gladdening drink.

verses.sanskrit: सोमस्य धारा पवते नर्चक्षस रतेन देवान हवते दिवस परि बर्हस्पते रवथेना वि दिद्युते समुद्रासो न सवनानि विव्यचुः |||
verses.transliteration: somasya dhārā pavate nṛcakṣasa ṛtena devān havate divas pari bṛhaspate ravathenā vi didyute samudrāso na savanāni vivyacuḥ

translations.griffith: ON flows the stream of Soma who beholds mankind: by everlasting Law he calls the Gods from heaven.  He lightens with the roaring of Br aspati: h the lakes have not contained the pourings of juice.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा वाजिन्नघ्न्या अभ्यनूषतायोहतं योनिमा रोहसि दयुमान मघोनामायुः परतिरन महि शरव इन्द्राय सोमपवसे वर्षा मदः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā vājinnaghnyā abhyanūṣatāyohataṃ yonimā rohasi dyumān maghonāmāyuḥ pratiran mahi śrava indrāya somapavase vṛṣā madaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, powerful Soma, thou to whom the cows have -lowed, ascendest bright with sheen, thine iron-fashioned home.  Thou, lengthening our princes' life and high renown, flowest for Indra as his might to gladdening drink.

verses.sanskrit: एन्द्रस्य कुक्षा पवते मदिन्तम ऊर्जं वसानः शरवसे सुमङगलः परत्यं स विश्वा भुवनाभि पप्रथे करीळन हरिरत्यः सयन्दते वर्षा |||
verses.transliteration: endrasya kukṣā pavate madintama ūrjaṃ vasānaḥ śravase sumaṅghalaḥ pratyaṃ sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paprathe krīḷan hariratyaḥ syandate vṛṣā

translations.griffith: Best giver of delight, he flows to Indra's throat, robing himself in might, Auspicious One, for fame.  He spreads himself abroad to meet all things that be: the vigorous Tawny Steed flows sporting on his way.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमं नरः सहस्रधारं दुहते दश कषिपः नर्भिः सोम परच्युतो गरावभिः सुतो विश्वान्देवाना पवस्वा सहस्रजित |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā devebhyo madhumattamaṃ naraḥ sahasradhāraṃ duhate daśa kṣipaḥ nṛbhiḥ soma pracyuto ghrāvabhiḥ suto viśvāndevānā pavasvā sahasrajit

translations.griffith: The men, the ten swift fingers, milk thee out for Gods, even thee most rich in meath, with thousand flowing streams.  Soma who winnest thousands, driven by the men, expressed with stones, bring, as thou flowest, all the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा हस्तिनो मधुमन्तमद्रिभिर्दुहन्त्यप्सु वर्षभन्दश कषिपः इन्द्रं सोम मादयन दैव्यं जनं सिन्धोरिवोर्मिः पवमानो अर्षसि |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā hastino madhumantamadribhirduhantyapsu vṛṣabhandaśa kṣipaḥ indraṃ soma mādayan daivyaṃ janaṃ sindhorivormiḥ pavamāno arṣasi

translations.griffith: Deft-handed men with stones, the ten swift fingers, drain thee into waters, thee, the Steer enriched with sweets.  Thou, Soma, gladdening Indra, and the Heavenly Host, flowest as Pavamana like a river's wave.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोमस्य पवमानस्योर्मय इन्द्रस्य यन्ति जठरं सुपेशसः दध्ना यदीमुन्नीता यशसा गवां दानाय शूरमुदमन्दिषुः सुताः |||
verses.transliteration: pra somasya pavamānasyormaya indrasya yanti jaṭharaṃ supeśasaḥ dadhnā yadīmunnītā yaśasā ghavāṃ dānāya śūramudamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ

translations.griffith: ONWARD to Indra's throat move, beauteously adorned, the waves of Soma as he purifies himself,  When they, brought forward with the lovely curd of kine, effused, have cheered the Hero to bestow his gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अछा हि सोमः कलशानसिष्यददत्यो न वोळ्हा रघुवर्तनिर्व्र्षा अथा देवानामुभयस्य जन्मनो विद्वानश्नोत्यमुत इतश्च यत |||
verses.transliteration: achā hi somaḥ kalaśānasiṣyadadatyo na voḷhā raghuvartanirvṛṣā athā devānāmubhayasya janmano vidvānaśnotyamuta itaśca yat

translations.griffith: Hither hath Soma flowed unto the beakers, like a chariot-horse, a stallion swift upon his way.  Thus, knowing both the generations, he obtains the rights and dues of Gods from yonder and from hence.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः सोम पवमानः किरा वस्विन्दो भव मघवा राधसो महः शिक्षा वयोधो वसवे सु चेतुना मा नो गयमारे अस्मत परा सिचः |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ soma pavamānaḥ kirā vasvindo bhava maghavā rādhaso mahaḥ śikṣā vayodho vasave su cetunā mā no ghayamāre asmat parā sicaḥ

translations.griffith: While thou art cleansed, O Soma, scatter wealth on us; Indu, bestow great bounty as a liberal Prince.  Giver of life, with wisdom help to opulence; strew not our home possessions far away from us.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः पूषा पवमानः सुरातयो मित्रो गछन्तु वरुणः सजोषसः बर्हस्पतिर्मरुतो वायुरश्विना तवष्टा सविता सुयमा सरस्वती |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ pūṣā pavamānaḥ surātayo mitro ghachantu varuṇaḥ sajoṣasaḥ bṛhaspatirmaruto vāyuraśvinā tvaṣṭā savitā suyamā sarasvatī

translations.griffith: Hither let Pūṣan Pavamana come to us, Varuṇa, Mitra, bountiful, of one accord,  The Maruts, Aśvins, Vāyu, and Bṛhaspati, Savitar, Tvaṣṭar, tractable Sarasvatī.

verses.sanskrit: उभे दयावाप्र्थिवी विश्वमिन्वे अर्यमा देवो अदितिर्विधाता भगो नर्शंस उर्वन्तरिक्षं विश्वे देवाः पवमानंजुषन्त |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaminve aryamā devo aditirvidhātā bhagho nṛśaṃsa urvantarikṣaṃ viśve devāḥ pavamānaṃjuṣanta

translations.griffith: Both Heaven and Earth, the all-invigorating Pair, Vidhatar, Aditi, and Aryaman the God,  Bhaga who blesses men, the spacious Firmament,—let all the Gods in Pavamana take delight.

verses.sanskrit: असावि सोमो अरुषो वर्षा हरी राजेव दस्मो अभि गा अचिक्रदत पुनानो वारं पर्येत्यव्ययं शयेनो न योनिं घर्तवन्तमासदम |||
verses.transliteration: asāvi somo aruṣo vṛṣā harī rājeva dasmo abhi ghā acikradat punāno vāraṃ paryetyavyayaṃ śyeno na yoniṃ ghṛtavantamāsadam

translations.griffith: EVEN as a King hath Soma, red and tawny Bull, been pressed: the Wondrous One hath bellowed to the kine.  While purified he passes through the filtering fleece to seat him hawk-like on the place that drops with oil.

verses.sanskrit: कविर्वेधस्या पर्येषि माहिनमत्यो न मर्ष्टो अभि वाजमर्षसि अपसेधन दुरिता सोम मर्ळय घर्तं वसानः परियासि निर्णिजम |||
verses.transliteration: kavirvedhasyā paryeṣi māhinamatyo na mṛṣṭo abhi vājamarṣasi apasedhan duritā soma mṛḷaya ghṛtaṃ vasānaḥ pariyāsi nirṇijam

translations.griffith: To glory goest thou, Sage with disposing skill, like a groomed steed thou rusbest forward to the prize.  O Soma, be thou gracious, driving off distress: thou goest, clothed in butter, to a robe of state.

verses.sanskrit: पर्जन्यः पिता महिषस्य पर्णिनो नाभा पर्थिव्या गिरिषुक्षयं दधे सवसार आपो अभि गा उतासरन सं गरावभिर्नसते वीते अध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇino nābhā pṛthivyā ghiriṣukṣayaṃ dadhe svasāra āpo abhi ghā utāsaran saṃ ghrāvabhirnasate vīte adhvare

translations.griffith: Parjanya is the Father of the Mighty Bird: on mountains, in earth's centre hath he made his home.  The waters too have flowed, the Sisters, to the kine: he meets the pressing-stones at the beloved rite.

verses.sanskrit: जायेव पत्यावधि शेव मंहसे पज्राया गर्भ शर्णुहि बरवीमि ते अन्तर्वाणीषु पर चरा सु जीवसे.अनिन्द्यो वर्जने सोम जाग्र्हि |||
verses.transliteration: jāyeva patyāvadhi śeva maṃhase pajrāyā gharbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te antarvāṇīṣu pra carā su jīvase.anindyo vṛjane soma jāghṛhi

translations.griffith: Thou givest pleasure as a wife delights her lord. Listen, O Child of Pajri, for to thee I speak.  Amid the holy songs go on that we may live: in time of trouble, Soma, watch thou free from blame.

verses.sanskrit: यथा पूर्वेभ्यः शतसा अम्र्ध्रः सहस्रसाः पर्यया वाजमिन्दो एवा पवस्व सुविताय नव्यसे तव वरतमन्वापः सचन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ śatasā amṛdhraḥ sahasrasāḥ paryayā vājamindo evā pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratamanvāpaḥ sacante

translations.griffith: As to the men of old thou camest, Indu unharmed, to strengthen, winning hundreds, thousands,  So now for new felicity flow onward: the waters follow as thy law ordaineth.

verses.sanskrit: पवित्रं ते विततं बरह्मणस पते परभुर्गात्राणि पर्येषिविश्वतः अतप्ततनूर्न तदामो अश्नुते शर्तास इद वहन्तस्तत समाशत |||
verses.transliteration: pavitraṃ te vitataṃ brahmaṇas pate prabhurghātrāṇi paryeṣiviśvataḥ ataptatanūrna tadāmo aśnute śṛtāsa id vahantastat samāśata

translations.griffith: SPREAD is thy cleansing filter, Brahmaṇaspati: as Prince, thou enterest its limbs from every side.  The raw, whose mass hath not been heated gains not this: they only which are dressed, which bear, attain to it.

verses.sanskrit: तपोष पवित्रं विततं दिवस पदे शोचन्तो अस्य तन्तवो वयस्थिरन अवन्त्यस्य पवीतारमाशवो दिवस पर्ष्ठमधितिष्ठन्ति चेतसा |||
verses.transliteration: tapoṣ pavitraṃ vitataṃ divas pade śocanto asya tantavo vyasthiran avantyasya pavītāramāśavo divas pṛṣṭhamadhitiṣṭhanti cetasā

translations.griffith: High in the seat of heaven is spread the Scorcher's sieve: its threads are standing separate, glittering with light.  The Swift Ones favour him who purifieth this: with consciousness they stand upon the height of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अरूरुचदुषसः पर्श्निरग्रिय उक्षा बिभर्ति भुवनानि वाजयुः मायाविनो ममिरे अस्य मायया नर्चक्षसः पितरो गर्भमा दधुः |||
verses.transliteration: arūrucaduṣasaḥ pṛśniraghriya ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ māyāvino mamire asya māyayā nṛcakṣasaḥ pitaro gharbhamā dadhuḥ

translations.griffith: The foremost spotted Steer hath made the Mornings shine, and yearning after strength sustains all things that be.  By his high wisdom have the mighty Sages wrought: the Fathers who behold mankind laid down the germ,

verses.sanskrit: गन्धर्व इत्था पदमस्य रक्षति पाति देवानां जनिमान्यद्भुतः गर्भ्णाति रिपुं निधया निधापतिः सुक्र्त्तमा मधुनो भक्षमाशत |||
verses.transliteration: ghandharva itthā padamasya rakṣati pāti devānāṃ janimānyadbhutaḥ ghṛbhṇāti ripuṃ nidhayā nidhāpatiḥ sukṛttamā madhuno bhakṣamāśata

translations.griffith: Gandharva verily protects his dwellingplace; Wondrous, he guards the generations of the Gods.  Lord of the snare, he takes the foeman with the snare: those who are most devout have gained a share of meath.

verses.sanskrit: हविर्हविष्मो महि सद्म दैव्यं नभो वसानः परि यास्यध्वरम राजा पवित्ररथो वाजमारुहः सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिर्जयसि शरवो बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: havirhaviṣmo mahi sadma daivyaṃ nabho vasānaḥ pari yāsyadhvaram rājā pavitraratho vājamāruhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭirjayasi śravo bṛhat

translations.griffith: Rich in oblations! robed in cloud, thou corapassest oblation, sacrifice, the mighty seat of Gods.  King, on thy chariot-sieve thou goest up to war, and with a thousand weapons winnest lofty fame.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व देवमादनो विचर्षणिरप्सा इन्द्राय वरुणाय वायवे कर्धी नो अद्य वरिवः सवस्तिमदुरुक्षितौ गर्णीहि दैव्यं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva devamādano vicarṣaṇirapsā indrāya varuṇāya vāyave kṛdhī no adya varivaḥ svastimadurukṣitau ghṛṇīhi daivyaṃ janam

translations.griffith: FLOW, cheering Gods, most active, winner of the flood, for Indra, and for Vāyu, and for Varuṇa.  Bestow on us to-day wide room with happiness, and in tbine ample dwelling laud the Host of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आ यस्तस्थौ भुवनान्यमर्त्यो विश्वानि सोमः परि तान्यर्षति कर्ण्वन संच्र्तं विच्र्तमभिष्टय इन्दुः सिषक्त्युषसं न सूर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yastasthau bhuvanānyamartyo viśvāni somaḥ pari tānyarṣati kṛṇvan saṃcṛtaṃ vicṛtamabhiṣṭaya induḥ siṣaktyuṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ

translations.griffith: He who hath come anear to creatures that have life, Immortal Soma flows onward to all of them.  Effecting, for our aid, both union and release, Indu, like Sūrya, follows closely after Dawn.

verses.sanskrit: आ यो गोभिः सर्ज्यत ओषधीष्वा देवानां सुम्न इषयन्नुपावसुः आ विद्युता पवते धारया सुत इन्द्रं सोमो मादयन दैव्यं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yo ghobhiḥ sṛjyata oṣadhīṣvā devānāṃ sumna iṣayannupāvasuḥ ā vidyutā pavate dhārayā suta indraṃ somo mādayan daivyaṃ janam

translations.griffith: He who is poured with milk, he who within the plants hastes bringing treasure for the happiness of Gods,  He, poured forth in a stream flows with the lightning's flash, Soma who gladdens Indra and the Host of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय सोमः पवते सहस्रजिद धिन्वानो वाचमिषिरामुषर्बुधम इन्दुः समुद्रमुदियर्ति वायुभिरेन्द्रस्य हार्दिकलशेषु सीदति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya somaḥ pavate sahasrajid dhinvāno vācamiṣirāmuṣarbudham induḥ samudramudiyarti vāyubhirendrasya hārdikalaśeṣu sīdati

translations.griffith: Winner of thousands, he, this Soma, flows along, raising a vigorous voice that wakens with the dawn.  Indu with winds drives on the ocean of the air, he sinks within the jars, he rests in Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तयं गावः पयसा पयोव्र्धं सोमं शरीणन्ति मतिभिः सवर्विदम धनंजयः पवते कर्त्व्यो रसो विप्रः कविःकाव्येना सवर्चनाः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tyaṃ ghāvaḥ payasā payovṛdhaṃ somaṃ śrīṇanti matibhiḥ svarvidam dhanaṃjayaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso vipraḥ kaviḥkāvyenā svarcanāḥ

translations.griffith: The kine with milk dress him who makes the milk increase, Soma, amid the songs, who finds the light of heaven.  Winner of wealth, the effectual juice is flowing on, Singer and Sage by wisdom, dear as heaven itself.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम सुषुतः परि सरवापामीवा भवतु रक्षसा सह मा ते रसस्य मत्सत दवयाविनो दरविणस्वन्त इह सन्त्विन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari sravāpāmīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvino draviṇasvanta iha santvindavaḥ

translations.griffith: FLOW on to Indra, Soma, carefully effused: let sickness stay afar together with the fiends.  Let not the double-tongued delight them with thy juice. here be thy flowing drops laden with opulence.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मान समर्ये पवमान चोदय दक्षो देवानामसि हि परियो मदः जहि शत्रून्रभ्या भन्दनायतः पिबेन्द्र सोममव नो मर्धो जहि |||
verses.transliteration: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣo devānāmasi hi priyo madaḥ jahi śatrūnrabhyā bhandanāyataḥ pibendra somamava no mṛdho jahi

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, urge us forward in the fight thou art the vigour of the Gods, the well-loved drink.  Smite thou our enemies who raise the shout of joy: Indra, drink Soma juice, and drive away our foes.

verses.sanskrit: अदब्ध इन्दो पवसे मदिन्तम आत्मेन्द्रस्य भवसि धासिरुत्तमः अभि सवरन्ति बहवो मनीषिणो राजानमस्य भुवनस्यनिंसते |||
verses.transliteration: adabdha indo pavase madintama ātmendrasya bhavasi dhāsiruttamaḥ abhi svaranti bahavo manīṣiṇo rājānamasya bhuvanasyaniṃsate

translations.griffith: Unharmed, best Cheerer, thou, O Indu, flowest on: thou, even thou thyself, art Indra's noblest food.  Full many a wise man lifts to thee the song of praise, and hails thee with a kiss as Sovran of this world.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रणीथः शतधारो अद्भुत इन्द्रायेन्दुः पवते काम्यं मधु जयन कषेत्रमभ्यर्षा जयन्नप उरुं नो गातुं कर्णु सोम मीढ्वः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasraṇīthaḥ śatadhāro adbhuta indrāyenduḥ pavate kāmyaṃ madhu jayan kṣetramabhyarṣā jayannapa uruṃ no ghātuṃ kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ

translations.griffith: Wondrous, with hundred streams, hymned in a thousand songs, Indu pours out for Indra his delightrul meath.  Winning us land and waters, flow thou hitherward: Rainer of bounties, Soma, make broad way for us.
