verses.sanskrit: कनिक्रदत कलशे गोभिरज्यसे वयव्ययं समया वारमर्षसि मर्म्र्ज्यमानो अत्यो न सानसिरिन्द्रस्य सोम जठरे समक्षरः |||
verses.transliteration: kanikradat kalaśe ghobhirajyase vyavyayaṃ samayā vāramarṣasi marmṛjyamāno atyo na sānasirindrasya soma jaṭhare samakṣaraḥ

translations.griffith: Roaring within the beaker thou art balmed with milk: thou passest through the fleecy filter all at once.  Carefully cleansed and decked like a prizewinning steed, O Soma, thou hast flowed down within Indra's throat.

verses.sanskrit: सवादुः पवस्व दिव्याय जन्मने सवादुरिन्द्राय सुहवीतुनाम्ने सवादुर्मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे बर्हस्पतये मधुमानदाभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svādurindrāya suhavītunāmne svādurmitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhumānadābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward sweet of flavour for the Heavenly Race, for Indra sweet, whose name is easily invoked:  Flow sweet for Mitra, Varuṇa, and Vāyu, rich in meath, inviolable for Bṛhaspati.

verses.sanskrit: अत्यं मर्जन्ति कलशे दश कषिपः पर विप्राणां मतयो वाच ईरते पवमाना अभ्यर्षन्ति सुष्टुतिमेन्द्रं विशन्तिमदिरास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: atyaṃ mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇāṃ matayo vāca īrate pavamānā abhyarṣanti suṣṭutimendraṃ viśantimadirāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: Ten rapid fingers deck the Courser in the jar: with hymns the holy singers send their voices forth.  The filtering juices hasten to their eulogy, the drops that gladden find their way to Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit: पवमानो अभ्यर्षा सुवीर्यमुर्वीं गव्यूतिं महि शर्म सप्रथः माकिर्नो अस्य परिषूतिरीशतेन्दो जयेम तवयाधनं-धनम |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāno abhyarṣā suvīryamurvīṃ ghavyūtiṃ mahi śarma saprathaḥ mākirno asya pariṣūtirīśatendo jayema tvayādhanaṃ-dhanam

translations.griffith: While thou art purified pour on us hero strength, great, far-extended shelter, spacious pasturage.  Let no oppression master this our holy work: may we, O Indu, gain all opulence through thee.

verses.sanskrit: अधि दयामस्थाद वर्षभो विचक्षणो.अरूरुचद वि दिवो रोचना कविः राजा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवद दिवः पीयूषन्दुहते नर्चक्षसः |||
verses.transliteration: adhi dyāmasthād vṛṣabho vicakṣaṇo.arūrucad vi divo rocanā kaviḥ rājā pavitramatyeti roruvad divaḥ pīyūṣanduhate nṛcakṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: The Steer who sees afar hath risen above the sky: the Sage hath caused the lights of heaven to give their shine.  The. King is passing through the filter with a roar: they drain the milk of heaven from him who looks on men.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतो वेना दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम अप्सु दरप्सं वाव्र्धानं समुद्र आ सिन्धोरूर्मामधुमन्तं पवित्र आ |||
verses.transliteration: divo nāke madhujihvā asaścato venā duhantyukṣaṇaṃ ghiriṣṭhām apsu drapsaṃ vāvṛdhānaṃ samudra ā sindhorūrmāmadhumantaṃ pavitra ā

translations.griffith: High in the vault of heaven, unceasing, honey-tongued, the Loving Ones drain out the mountain-haunting Steer,—  The drop that hath grown great in waters, in the lake meath-rich, in the stream's wave and in the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit: नाके सुपर्णमुपपप्तिवांसं गिरो वेनानामक्र्पन्त पूर्वीः शिशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतं हिरण्ययं शकुनं कषामणि सथाम |||
verses.transliteration: nāke suparṇamupapaptivāṃsaṃ ghiro venānāmakṛpanta pūrvīḥ śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ hiraṇyayaṃ śakunaṃ kṣāmaṇi sthām

translations.griffith: The Loving Ones besought with many voices the Eagle who had flown away to heaven.  Hymns kiss the Youngling worthy of laudation, resting on earth, the Bird of golden colour.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो गन्धर्वो अधि नाके अस्थाद विश्वा रूपा परतिचक्षाणो अस्य भानुः शुक्रेण शोचिषा वयद्यौत परारूरुचद रोदसी मातरा शुचिः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo ghandharvo adhi nāke asthād viśvā rūpā praticakṣāṇo asya bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā vyadyaut prārūrucad rodasī mātarā śuciḥ

translations.griffith: High to heaven's vault hath the Gandharva risen, beholding all his varied forms and figures.  His ray hath shone abroad with gleaming splendour: pure, he hath lighted both the worlds, the Parents.

verses.sanskrit: पर त आशवः पवमान धीजवो मदा अर्षन्ति रघुजा इव तमना दिव्याः सुपर्णा मधुमन्त इन्दवो मदिन्तमासः परि कोशमासते |||
verses.transliteration: pra ta āśavaḥ pavamāna dhījavo madā arṣanti raghujā iva tmanā divyāḥ suparṇā madhumanta indavo madintamāsaḥ pari kośamāsate

translations.griffith: THY gladdening draughts, O Pavamana, urged by song flow swiftly of themselves like sons of fleet-foot mares.  The drops of Soma juice, those eagles of the heavens, most cheering, rich in meath, rest in the reservoir.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते मदासो मदिरास आशवो.अस्र्क्षत रथ्यासो यथा पर्थक धेनुर्न वत्सं पयसाभि वज्रिणमिन्द्रमिन्दवो मधुमन्त ऊर्मयः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te madāso madirāsa āśavo.asṛkṣata rathyāso yathā pṛthak dhenurna vatsaṃ payasābhi vajriṇamindramindavo madhumanta ūrmayaḥ

translations.griffith: As rapid chariot-steeds, so turned in several ways have thine exhilarating juices darted forth,  Soma-drops rich in meath, waves, to the Thunder-armed, to Indra, like milch-kine who seek their calf with milk.

verses.sanskrit: अत्यो न हियानो अभि वाजमर्ष सवर्वित कोशं दिवो अद्रिमातरम वर्षा पवित्रे अधि सानो अव्यये सोमः पुनान इन्द्रियाय धायसे |||
verses.transliteration: atyo na hiyāno abhi vājamarṣa svarvit kośaṃ divo adrimātaram vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punāna indriyāya dhāyase

translations.griffith: Like a steed urged to battle, finder of the light; speed onward to the cloud-born reservoir of heaven,  A Steer that o’er the woolly surface seeks the sieve, Soma while purified for Indra's nourishment.

verses.sanskrit: पर त आश्विनीः पवमान धीजुवो दिव्या अस्र्ग्रन पयसा धरीमणि परान्तरषयः सथाविरीरस्र्क्षत ये तवा मर्जन्त्य रषिषाण वेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ta āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhījuvo divyā asṛghran payasā dharīmaṇi prāntarṣayaḥ sthāvirīrasṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanty ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Fleet as swift steeds, thy drops, divine, thought-swift, have been, O Pavamana, poured with milk into the vat.  The Ṛṣis have poured in continuous Soma drops, ordainers who adorn thee, Friend whom Ṛṣis love.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा धामानि विश्वचक्ष रभ्वसः परभोस्ते सतः परियन्ति केतवः वयानशिः पवसे सोम धर्मभिः पतिर्विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसि |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā dhāmāni viśvacakṣa ṛbhvasaḥ prabhoste sataḥ pariyanti ketavaḥ vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patirviśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi

translations.griffith: O thou who seest all things, Sovran as thou art and passing strong, thy rays encompass all abodes.  Pervading with thy natural powers thou flowest on, and as the whole world's Lord, O Soma, thou art King.

verses.sanskrit: उभयतः पवमानस्य रश्मयो धरुवस्य सतः परि यन्ति केतवः यदी पवित्रे अधि मर्ज्यते हरिः सत्ता नि योना कलशेषु सीदति |||
verses.transliteration: ubhayataḥ pavamānasya raśmayo dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati

translations.griffith: The beams of Pavamana, sent from earth and heaven, his ensigns who is ever steadfast, travel round.  When on the sieve the Golden-hued is cleansed, he rests within the vats as one who seats him in his place.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञस्य केतुः पवते सवध्वरः सोमो देवानामुप याति निष्क्र्तम सहस्रधारः परि कोशमर्षति वर्षा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवत |||
verses.transliteration: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate svadhvaraḥ somo devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam sahasradhāraḥ pari kośamarṣati vṛṣā pavitramatyeti roruvat

translations.griffith: Served with fair rites he flows, ensign of sacrifice: Soma advances to the special place of Gods.  He speeds with thousand currents to the reservoir, and passes through the filter bellowing as a bull.

verses.sanskrit: राजा समुद्रं नद्यो वि गाहते.अपामूर्मिं सचते सिन्धुषु शरितः अध्यस्थात सानु पवमानो अव्ययं नाभा पर्थिव्या धरुणो महो दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: rājā samudraṃ nadyo vi ghāhate.apāmūrmiṃ sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ adhyasthāt sānu pavamāno avyayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divaḥ

translations.griffith: The Sovran dips him in the seain and the streams, and set in rivers with the waters' wave moves on.  High heaven's Sustainer at the central point of earth, raised on the fleecy surface Pavamana stands.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो न सानु सतनयन्नचिक्रदद दयौश्च यस्य पर्थिवी च धर्मभिः इन्द्रस्य सख्यं पवते विवेविदत सोमः पुनानःकलशेषु सीदति |||
verses.transliteration: divo na sānu stanayannacikradad dyauśca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ indrasya sakhyaṃ pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥkalaśeṣu sīdati

translations.griffith: He on whose high decree the heavens and earth depend nath roared and thundered like the summit of the sky.  Soma flows on obtaining Indra's friendly love, and, as they purify him, settles in the jars.

verses.sanskrit: जयोतिर्यज्ञस्य पवते मधु परियं पिता देवानां जनिता विभूवसुः दधाति रत्नं सवधयोरपीच्यं मदिन्तमो मत्सर इन्द्रियो रसः |||
verses.transliteration: jyotiryajñasya pavate madhu priyaṃ pitā devānāṃ janitā vibhūvasuḥ dadhāti ratnaṃ svadhayorapīcyaṃ madintamo matsara indriyo rasaḥ

translations.griffith: He, light of sacrifice distils delicious meath, most wealthy, Father and begetter of the Gods.  He, gladdening, best of Cheerers, juice!hat Indra loves, enriches with mysterious treasure earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अभिक्रन्दन कलशं वाज्यर्षति पतिर्दिवः शतधारो विचक्षणः हरिर्मित्रस्य सदनेषु सीदति मर्म्र्जानो.अविभिःसिन्धुभिर्व्र्षा |||
verses.transliteration: abhikrandan kalaśaṃ vājyarṣati patirdivaḥ śatadhāro vicakṣaṇaḥ harirmitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjāno.avibhiḥsindhubhirvṛṣā

translations.griffith: The vigorous and far-seeing one, the Lord of heaven, flows, shouting to the beaker, with his thousand streams.  Coloured like gold he rests in seats where Mitra dwells, the Steer made beautiful by rivers and by sheep.

verses.sanskrit: अग्रे सिन्धूनां पवमानो अर्षत्यग्रे वाचो अग्रियो गोषु गछति अग्रे वाजस्य भजते महाधनं सवायुधः सोत्र्भिः पूयते वर्षा |||
verses.transliteration: aghre sindhūnāṃ pavamāno arṣatyaghre vāco aghriyo ghoṣu ghachati aghre vājasya bhajate mahādhanaṃ svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā

translations.griffith: In forefront of the rivers Pavamana speeds, in forefront of the hymn, foremost among the kine.  He shares the mighty booty in the van of war: the well-armed Steer is purified by worshippers.

verses.sanskrit: अयं मतवाञ्छकुनो यथा हितो.अव्ये ससार पवमान ऊर्मिणा तव करत्वा रोदसी अन्तरा कवे शुचिर्धिया पवते सोम इन्द्र ते |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ matavāñchakuno yathā hito.avye sasāra pavamāna ūrmiṇā tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śucirdhiyā pavate soma indra te

translations.griffith: This heedful Pavamana, like a bird sent forth, hath with his wave flowed onward to the fleecy sieve.  O Indra, through thy wisdom, b thy thought, O Sage, Soma flows bright and pure between the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: दरापिं वसानो यजतो दिविस्प्र्शमन्तरिक्षप्रा भुवनेष्वर्पितः सवर्जज्ञानो नभसाभ्यक्रमीत परत्नमस्य पितरमा विवासति |||
verses.transliteration: drāpiṃ vasāno yajato divispṛśamantarikṣaprā bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ svarjajñāno nabhasābhyakramīt pratnamasya pitaramā vivāsati

translations.griffith: He, clad in mail that reaches heaven, the Holy One, filling the firmament stationed amid the worlds,  Knowing. the realm of light, hath come to us in rain: he summons to himself his own primeval Sire.

verses.sanskrit: सो अस्य विशे महि शर्म यछति यो अस्य धाम परथमं वयानशे पदं यदस्य परमे वयोमन्यतो विश्वा अभि संयाति संयतः |||
verses.transliteration: so asya viśe mahi śarma yachati yo asya dhāma prathamaṃ vyānaśe padaṃ yadasya parame vyomanyato viśvā abhi saṃyāti saṃyataḥ

translations.griffith: He who was first of all to penetrate his form bestowed upon his race wide shelter and defence.  From that high station which he hath in loftiest heaven he comes victorious to all encounters here.

verses.sanskrit: परो अयासीदिन्दुरिन्द्रस्य निष्क्र्तं सखा सख्युर्न पर मिनाति संगिरम मर्य इव युवतिभिः समर्षति सोमः कलशे शतयाम्ना पथा |||
verses.transliteration: pro ayāsīdindurindrasya niṣkṛtaṃ sakhā sakhyurna pra mināti saṃghiram marya iva yuvatibhiḥ samarṣati somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmnā pathā

translations.griffith: Indu hath started for Indra's special place and slights not as a Friend the promise of his Friend.  Soma speeds onward like a youth to youtlitial maids, and gains the beaker by a course of bundred paths.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो धियो मन्द्रयुवो विपन्युवः पनस्युवः संवसनेष्वक्रमुः सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत सतुभो.अभि धेनवः पयसेमशिश्रयुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo dhiyo mandrayuvo vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṃvasaneṣvakramuḥ somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubho.abhi dhenavaḥ payasemaśiśrayuḥ

translations.griffith: Your songs, exhilarating, tuneful, uttering praise, are come into the placns where the people meet.  Worshippers have exalted Soma with their hymns, and milch kine have come near to meet him with their milk.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः सोम संयतं पिप्युशीमिषमिन्दो पवस्व पवमानोस्रिधम या नो दोहते तरिरहन्नसश्चुषी कषुमद वाजवन मधुमद सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ soma saṃyataṃ pipyuśīmiṣamindo pavasva pavamānoasridham yā no dohate trirahannasaścuṣī kṣumad vājavan madhumad suvīryam

translations.griffith: O Soma, Indu, while they cleanse thee, pour on us accumulateds Plentiful, nutritious food,  Which, ceaseless, thrice a day shall yield us hero power enriched with store of nourishment, and strength, and Meath.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा मतीनां पवते विचक्षणः सोमो अह्नः परतरीतोषसो दिवः कराणा सिन्धूनां कलशानवीवशदिन्द्रस्य हार्द्याविशन मनीषिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā matīnāṃ pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somo ahnaḥ pratarītoṣaso divaḥ krāṇā sindhūnāṃ kalaśānavīvaśadindrasya hārdyāviśan manīṣibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Far-seeing Soma flows, the Steer, the Lord of hymns, the Furtherer of day, of morning, and of heaven.  Mixt with the streams he caused the beakers to resound, and with the singers' aid they entered Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit: मनीषिभिः पवते पूर्व्यः कविर्न्र्भिर्यतः परि कोशानचिक्रदत तरितस्य नाम जनयन मधु कषरदिन्द्रस्य वायोः सख्याय कर्तवे |||
verses.transliteration: manīṣibhiḥ pavate pūrvyaḥ kavirnṛbhiryataḥ pari kośānacikradat tritasya nāma janayan madhu kṣaradindrasya vāyoḥ sakhyāya kartave

translations.griffith: On, with the prudent singers, flows the ancient Sage and guided by the men hath roared about the vats.  Producing Trita's name, may he pour forth the meath, that Vāyu and that Indra may become his Friends.

verses.sanskrit: अयं पुनान उषसो वि रोचयदयं सिन्धुभ्यो अभवदु लोकक्र्त अयं तरिः सप्त दुदुहान आशिरं सोमो हर्दे पवते चारु मत्सरः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ punāna uṣaso vi rocayadayaṃ sindhubhyo abhavadu lokakṛt ayaṃ triḥ sapta duduhāna āśiraṃ somo hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ

translations.griffith: He, being purified, hath made the Mornings shine: this, even this is he who gave the rivers room.  He made the Three Times Seven pour out the milky flow: Soma, the Cheerer, yields whate’er the heart finds sweet.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम दिव्येषु धामसु सर्जान इन्दो कलशे पवित्र आ सीदन्निन्द्रस्य जठरे कनिक्रदन नर्भिर्यतः सूर्यमारोहयो दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma divyeṣu dhāmasu sṛjāna indo kalaśe pavitra ā sīdannindrasya jaṭhare kanikradan nṛbhiryataḥ sūryamārohayo divi

translations.griffith: Flow, onward, Soma, in thine own celestial forms, flow, Indu, poured within the beaker and the sieve.  Sinking into the throat of Indra with a roar, led by the men thou madest Sūrya mount to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अद्रिभिः सुतः पवसे पवित्र आ इन्दविन्द्रस्य जठरेष्वाविशन तवं नर्चक्षा अभवो विचक्षण सोम गोत्रमङगिरोभ्यो.अव्र्णोरप |||
verses.transliteration: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavase pavitra ā indavindrasya jaṭhareṣvāviśan tvaṃ nṛcakṣā abhavo vicakṣaṇa soma ghotramaṅghirobhyo.avṛṇorapa

translations.griffith: Pressed out with stones thou flowest onward to the sieve, O Indu, entering the depths of Indra's throat.  Far-sighted Soma, now thou lookest on mankind: thou didst unbar the cowstall for the Aṅgirases.

verses.sanskrit: तवां सोम पवमानं सवाध्यो.अनु विप्रासो अमदन्नवस्यवः तवां सुपर्ण आभरद दिवस परीन्दो विश्वाभिर्मतिभिः परिष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ soma pavamānaṃ svādhyo.anu viprāso amadannavasyavaḥ tvāṃ suparṇa ābharad divas parīndo viśvābhirmatibhiḥ pariṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: In thee, O Soma, while thou purifitedst thee, high-thoughted sages, seeking favour, have rejoiced.  Down from the heavens the Falcon brought thee hitherward, even thee, O Indu, thee whom all our hymns adorn.

verses.sanskrit: अव्ये पुनानं परि वार ऊर्मिणा हरिं नवन्ते अभि सप्त धेनवः अपामुपस्थे अध्यायवः कविं रतस्य योना महिषा अहेषत |||
verses.transliteration: avye punānaṃ pari vāra ūrmiṇā hariṃ navante abhi sapta dhenavaḥ apāmupasthe adhyāyavaḥ kaviṃ ṛtasya yonā mahiṣā aheṣata

translations.griffith: Seven Milch-kine glorify the Tawny-coloured One while with his wave in wool he purifies himself.  The living men, the mighty, have impelled the Sage into the waters' lap, the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुः पुनानो अति गाहते मर्धो विश्वानि कर्ण्वन सुपथानि यज्यवे गाः कर्ण्वानो निर्णिजं हर्यतः कविरत्यो न करीळन परि वारमर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: induḥ punāno ati ghāhate mṛdho viśvāni kṛṇvan supathāni yajyave ghāḥ kṛṇvāno nirṇijaṃ haryataḥ kaviratyo na krīḷan pari vāramarṣati

translations.griffith: Indu, attaining purity, plunges through the foe, making Ilis ways all easy for the pious man.  Making the kine his mantle, he, the lovely Sage, runs like a sporting courser onward through the fleece.

verses.sanskrit: असश्चतः शतधारा अभिश्रियो हरिं नवन्ते.अव ता उदन्युवः कषिपो मर्जन्ति परि गोभिराव्र्तं तर्तीये पर्ष्ठे अधि रोचने दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: asaścataḥ śatadhārā abhiśriyo hariṃ navante.ava tā udanyuvaḥ kṣipo mṛjanti pari ghobhirāvṛtaṃ tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ

translations.griffith: The ceaseless watery fountains with their hundred streams sing, as they hasten near, to him the Golden-hued  Him, clad in robes of milk, swift fingers beautify on the third height and in the luminous realm of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तवेमाः परजा दिव्यस्य रेतसस्त्वं विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसि अथेदं विश्वं पवमान ते वशे तवमिन्दो परथमोधामधा असि |||
verses.transliteration: tavemāḥ prajā divyasya retasastvaṃ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi athedaṃ viśvaṃ pavamāna te vaśe tvamindo prathamodhāmadhā asi

translations.griffith: These are thy generations of celestial seed thou art the Sovran Lord of all the world of life.  This universe, O Pavamana, owns thy sway; thou, Indu, art the first establisher of Law.

verses.sanskrit: तवं समुद्रो असि विश्ववित कवे तवेमाः पञ्च परदिशो विधर्मणि तवं दयां च पर्थिवीं चाति जभ्रिषे तव जयोतींषि पवमान सूर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ samudro asi viśvavit kave tavemāḥ pañca pradiśo vidharmaṇi tvaṃ dyāṃ ca pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe tava jyotīṃṣi pavamāna sūryaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou art the sea, O Sage who bringest alf to light: under thy Law are these five regions of the world.  Tlou reachest out beyond the earth, beyond the heavens: thine are the lights, O Pavamana, thine the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: तवं पवित्रे रजसो विधर्मणि देवेभ्यः सोम पवमान पूयसे तवामुशिजः परथमा अग्र्भ्णत तुभ्येमा विश्वा भुवनानि येमिरे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ pavitre rajaso vidharmaṇi devebhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase tvāmuśijaḥ prathamā aghṛbhṇata tubhyemā viśvā bhuvanāni yemire

translations.griffith: Thou in the filter, Soma Pavamana, art purified to support the region for the Gods.  The chief, the longing ones have sought to hold thee fast, and all these living creatures have been turned to thee.

verses.sanskrit: पर रेभ एत्यति वारमव्ययं वर्षा वनेष्वव चक्रदद्धरिः सं धीतयो वावशाना अनूषत शिशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतम |||
verses.transliteration: pra rebha etyati vāramavyayaṃ vṛṣā vaneṣvava cakradaddhariḥ saṃ dhītayo vāvaśānā anūṣata śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam

translations.griffith: Onward the Singer travels o’er the fleecy sieve. the Tawny Steer hath bellowed in the wooden vats.  Hymns have been sung aloud in resonant harmony, and holy songs kiss him, the Child who claims our praise.

verses.sanskrit: स सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः परि वयत तन्तुं तन्वानस्त्रिव्र्तंयथा विदे नयन्न्र्तस्य परशिषो नवीयसीः पतिर्जनीनामुप याति निष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: sa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ pari vyata tantuṃ tanvānastrivṛtaṃyathā vide nayannṛtasya praśiṣo navīyasīḥ patirjanīnāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: He hath assumed the rays of Sūrya for his robe, spinning, as he knows bow, the triply-twisted thread.  He, guiding to the newest rules of Holy Law, comes as the Women's Consort to the special place.

verses.sanskrit: राजा सिन्धूनां पवते पतिर्दिव रतस्य याति पथिभिः कनिक्रदत सहस्रधारः परि षिच्यते हरिः पुनानो वाचं जनयन्नुपावसुः |||
verses.transliteration: rājā sindhūnāṃ pavate patirdiva ṛtasya yāti pathibhiḥ kanikradat sahasradhāraḥ pari ṣicyate hariḥ punāno vācaṃ janayannupāvasuḥ

translations.griffith: On flows the King of rivers and the Lord of heaven: he follows with a shout the paths of Holy Law.  The Golden-hued is poured forth, with his hundred streams, Wealth-bringer, lifting up his voice while purified.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान मह्यर्णो वि धावसि सूरो न चित्रो अव्ययानि पव्यया गभस्तिपूतो नर्भिरद्रिभिः सुतो महे वाजाय धन्याय धन्वसि |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna mahyarṇo vi dhāvasi sūro na citro avyayāni pavyayā ghabhastipūto nṛbhiradribhiḥ suto mahe vājāya dhanyāya dhanvasi

translations.griffith: Fain to be cleansed, thou, Pavamana, pourest out, like wondrous Sūrya, through the fleece, an ample sea.  Purified with the hands, pressed by the men with stones, thou speedest on to mighty booty-bringing war.

verses.sanskrit: इषमूर्जं पवमानाभ्यर्षसि शयेनो न वंसु कलशेषुसीदसि इन्द्राय मद्वा मद्यो मदः सुतो दिवो विष्टम्भ उपमो विचक्षणः |||
verses.transliteration: iṣamūrjaṃ pavamānābhyarṣasi śyeno na vaṃsu kalaśeṣusīdasi indrāya madvā madyo madaḥ suto divo viṣṭambha upamo vicakṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Pavamana, sendest food and power in streams. thou sittest in the beakers as a hawk on trees,  For Indra poured as cheering juice to make him glad, as nearest and farseeing bearer-up of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त सवसारो अभि मातरः शिशुं नवं जज्ञानं जेन्यं विपश्चितम अपां गन्धर्वं दिव्यं नर्चक्षसं सोमंविश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसे |||
verses.transliteration: sapta svasāro abhi mātaraḥ śiśuṃ navaṃ jajñānaṃ jenyaṃ vipaścitam apāṃ ghandharvaṃ divyaṃ nṛcakṣasaṃ somaṃviśvasya bhuvanasya rājase

translations.griffith: The Sisters Seven, the Mothers, stand around the Babe, the noble, new-born Infant, skilled in holy song,  Gandharva of the floods, divine, beholding men, Soma, that he may reign as King of all the world.

verses.sanskrit: ईशान इमा भुवनानि वीयसे युजान इन्दो हरितः सुपर्ण्यः तास्ते कषरन्तु मधुमद घर्तं पयस्तव वरते सोम तिष्ठन्तु कर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: īśāna imā bhuvanāni vīyase yujāna indo haritaḥ suparṇyaḥ tāste kṣarantu madhumad ghṛtaṃ payastava vrate soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: As Sovran Lord thereof thou Passest through these worlds, O Indu, harnessing thy tawny well-winged Mares.  May they pour forth for thee milk and oil rich in sweets: O Soma, let the folk abide in thy decree.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नर्चक्षा असि सोम विश्वतः पवमान वर्षभ ता वि धावसि स नः पवस्व वसुमद धिरण्यवद वयं सयाम भुवनेषु जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā asi soma viśvataḥ pavamāna vṛṣabha tā vi dhāvasi sa naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavad vayaṃ syāma bhuvaneṣu jīvase

translations.griffith: O Soma, thou beholdest men from every side: O Pavamana, Steer, thou wanderest through these.  Pour out upon us wealth in treasure and in gold: may we have strength to live among the things that be.

verses.sanskrit: गोवित पवस्व वसुविद धिरण्यविद रेतोधा इन्दो भुवनेष्वर्पितः तवं सुवीरो असि सोम विश्ववित तं तवा विप्रा उप गिरेम आसते |||
verses.transliteration: ghovit pavasva vasuvid dhiraṇyavid retodhā indo bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ tvaṃ suvīro asi soma viśvavit taṃ tvā viprā upa ghirema āsate

translations.griffith: Winner of gold and goods and cattle flow thou on, set as impregner, Indu, mid the worlds of life.  Rich in brave men art thou, Soma, who winnest all: these holy singers wait upon thee with the song.

verses.sanskrit: उन मध्व ऊर्मिर्वनना अतिष्ठिपदपो वसानो महिषो वि गाहते राजा पवित्ररथो वाजमारुहत सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिर्जयति शरवो बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: un madhva ūrmirvananā atiṣṭhipadapo vasāno mahiṣo vi ghāhate rājā pavitraratho vājamāruhat sahasrabhṛṣṭirjayati śravo bṛhat

translations.griffith: The wave of flowing meath hath wakened up desires: the Steer enrobed in milk plunges into the streams.  Borne on his chariot-sieve the King hath risen to war, and with a thousand rays hath won him high renown.

verses.sanskrit: स भन्दना उदियर्ति परजावतीर्विश्वायुर्विश्वाः सुभरा अहर्दिवि बरह्म परजावद रयिमश्वपस्त्यं पीत इन्दविन्द्रमस्मभ्यं याचतात |||
verses.transliteration: sa bhandanā udiyarti prajāvatīrviśvāyurviśvāḥ subharā ahardivi brahma prajāvad rayimaśvapastyaṃ pīta indavindramasmabhyaṃ yācatāt

translations.griffith: Dear to all life, he sends triumphant praises forth, abundant, bringing offspring, each succeeding day.  From Indra crave for us, Indu, when thou art quaffed, the blessing that gives children, wealth that harbours steeds.

verses.sanskrit: सो अग्रे अह्नां हरिर्हर्यतो मदः पर चेतसा चेतयते अनुद्युभिः दवा जना यातयन्नन्तरीयते नरा च शंसं दैव्यं च धर्तरि |||
verses.transliteration: so aghre ahnāṃ harirharyato madaḥ pra cetasā cetayate anudyubhiḥ dvā janā yātayannantarīyate narā ca śaṃsaṃ daivyaṃ ca dhartari

translations.griffith: When days begin, the strong juice, lovely, golden-hued, is recognized by wisdom more and more each day,  He, stirring both the Races, goes between the two, the bearer of the word of men and word of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अञ्जते वयञ्जते समञ्जते करतुं रिहन्ति मधुनाभ्यञ्जते सिन्धोरुच्छ्वासे पतयन्तमुक्षणं हिरण्यपावाः पशुमासु गर्भ्णते |||
verses.transliteration: añjate vyañjate samañjate kratuṃ rihanti madhunābhyañjate sindhorucchvāse patayantamukṣaṇaṃ hiraṇyapāvāḥ paśumāsu ghṛbhṇate

translations.griffith: They balm him, balm him over balm him thoroughly, caress the mighty strength and balm it with the meath.  They seize the flying Steer at the stream's breathing-place: cleansing with gold they grasp the Animal herein.

verses.sanskrit: विपश्चिते पवमानाय गायत मही न धारात्यन्धो अर्षति अहिर्न जूर्णामति सर्पति तवचमत्यो न करीळन्नसरद वर्षा हरिः |||
verses.transliteration: vipaścite pavamānāya ghāyata mahī na dhārātyandho arṣati ahirna jūrṇāmati sarpati tvacamatyo na krīḷannasarad vṛṣā hariḥ

translations.griffith: Sing forth to Pavamana skilled in holy song: the juice is flowing onward like a mighty stream.  He.glideth like a serpent from his ancient skin, and like a playful horse the Tawny Steer hath run.

verses.sanskrit: अग्रेगो राजाप्यस्तविष्यते विमानो अह्नां भुवनेष्वर्पितः हरिर्घ्र्तस्नुः सुद्र्शीको अर्णवो जयोतीरथः पवते राय ओक्यः |||
verses.transliteration: aghregho rājāpyastaviṣyate vimāno ahnāṃ bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ harirghṛtasnuḥ sudṛśīko arṇavo jyotīrathaḥ pavate rāya okyaḥ

translations.griffith: Dweller in floods, King, foremost, he displays his might, set among living things as measurer of days.  Distilling oil he flows, fair, billowy, golden-hued, borne on a car of light, sharing one hom-e with wealth.

verses.sanskrit: असर्जि सकम्भो दिव उद्यतो मदः परि तरिधातुर्भुवनान्यर्षति अंशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतं गिरा यदि निर्णिजं रग्मिणो ययुः |||
verses.transliteration: asarji skambho diva udyato madaḥ pari tridhāturbhuvanānyarṣati aṃśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ ghirā yadi nirṇijaṃ ṛghmiṇo yayuḥ

translations.griffith: Loosed is the heavens! support, the uplifted cheering juice: the triply-mingled draught flows round into the worlds.  The holy hymns caress the stalk that claims our praise, when singers have approached his beauteous robe with song.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते धारा अत्यण्वानि मेष्यः पुनानस्य संयतो यन्तिरंहयः यद गोभिरिन्दो चम्वोः समज्यस आ सुवानः सोम कलशेषु सीदसि |||
verses.transliteration: pra te dhārā atyaṇvāni meṣyaḥ punānasya saṃyato yantiraṃhayaḥ yad ghobhirindo camvoḥ samajyasa ā suvānaḥ soma kalaśeṣu sīdasi

translations.griffith: Thy strearns that flow forth rapidly collected run over the fine fleece of the sheep as thou art cleansed.  When, Indu, thou art. balmed with milk within the bowl, thou sinkest in the jars, O Soma, when expressed.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम करतुविन न उक्थ्यो.अव्यो वारे परि धाव मधु परियम जहि विश्वान रक्षस इन्दो अत्रिणो बर्हद वदेम विदथेसुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma kratuvin na ukthyo.avyo vāre pari dhāva madhu priyam jahi viśvān rakṣasa indo atriṇo bṛhad vadema vidathesuvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Winner of power, flow, Soma, worthy of our laud: run onward to the fleece as well-beloved meath.  Destroy, O Indu, all voracious Rākṣasas. With brave sons in the assembly let our speech be bold.

verses.sanskrit: पर तु दरव परि कोशं नि षीद नर्भिः पुनानो अभि वाजमर्ष अश्वं न तवा वाजिनं मर्जयन्तो.अछा बर्ही रशनाभिर्नयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: pra tu drava pari kośaṃ ni ṣīda nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vājamarṣa aśvaṃ na tvā vājinaṃ marjayanto.achā barhī raśanābhirnayanti

translations.griffith: RUN onward to the reservoir and seat thee: cleansed by the men speed forward to the battle.  Making thee beauteous like an able courser, forth to the sacred grass with reins they lead thee.

verses.sanskrit: सवायुधः पवते देव इन्दुरशस्तिहा वर्जनं रक्षमाणः पिता देवानां जनिता सुदक्षो विष्टम्भो दिवो धरुणः पर्थिव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: svāyudhaḥ pavate deva induraśastihā vṛjanaṃ rakṣamāṇaḥ pitā devānāṃ janitā sudakṣo viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ

translations.griffith: Indu, the well-armed God, is flowing onward, who quells the curse and guards from treacherous onslaught,  Father, begetter of the Gods, most skilful, the buttress of the heavens and earth's supporter.

verses.sanskrit: रषिर्विप्रः पुरेता जनानां रभुर्धीर उशना काव्येन स चिद विवेद निहितं यदासामपीच्यं गुह्यं नाम गोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣirvipraḥ puraetā janānāṃ ṛbhurdhīra uśanā kāvyena sa cid viveda nihitaṃ yadāsāmapīcyaṃ ghuhyaṃ nāma ghonām

translations.griffith: Ṛṣi and Sage, the Champion of the people, cleft and sagacious, Uśanā in wisdom,  He hath discovered even their hidden nature, the Cows' concealed and most mysterious title.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय ते मधुमानिन्द्र सोमो वर्षा वर्ष्णे परि पवित्रे अक्षाः सहस्रसाः शतसा भूरिदावा शश्वत्तमं बर्हिरा वाज्यस्थात |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya te madhumānindra somo vṛṣā vṛṣṇe pari pavitre akṣāḥ sahasrasāḥ śatasā bhūridāvā śaśvattamaṃ barhirā vājyasthāt

translations.griffith: This thine own Soma rich in meath, O Indra, Steer for the Steer, hath flowed into the filter.  The strong Free-giver, winning hundreds, thousands, hath reached the holy grass that never fails him.

verses.sanskrit: एते सोमा अभि गव्या सहस्रा महे वाजायाम्र्ताय शरवांसि पवित्रेभिः पवमाना अस्र्ग्रञ्छ्रवस्यवो न पर्तनाजो अत्याः |||
verses.transliteration: ete somā abhi ghavyā sahasrā mahe vājāyāmṛtāya śravāṃsi pavitrebhiḥ pavamānā asṛghrañchravasyavo na pṛtanājo atyāḥ

translations.griffith: These Somas are for wealth of countless cattle, renown therefor, and mighty strength immortal.  These have been sent forth, urified by strainers, like steeds who rusg to battle fain for glory.

verses.sanskrit: परि हि षमा पुरुहूतो जनानां विश्वासरद भोजना पूयमानः अथा भर शयेनभ्र्त परयांसि रयिं तुञ्जानो अभि वाजमर्ष |||
verses.transliteration: pari hi ṣmā puruhūto janānāṃ viśvāsarad bhojanā pūyamānaḥ athā bhara śyenabhṛta prayāṃsi rayiṃ tuñjāno abhi vājamarṣa

translations.griffith: He, while he cleanses him, invoked of many, hath flowed to give the people all enjoyment.  Thou whom the Falcon brought, bring, dainty viands, bestir thyself and send us wealth and booty.

verses.sanskrit: एष सुवानः परि सोमः पवित्रे सर्गो न सर्ष्टो अदधावदर्वा तिग्मे शिशानो महिषो न शर्ङगे गा गव्यन्नभिशूरो न सत्वा |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa suvānaḥ pari somaḥ pavitre sargho na sṛṣṭo adadhāvadarvā tighme śiśāno mahiṣo na śṛṅghe ghā ghavyannabhiśūro na satvā

translations.griffith: This Soma, pressed into the cleansing filter, hath run as ’twere a host let loose, the Courser;  Like a strong bull who whets his horns kpen-pointed, like a brave warrior in the fray for cattle.

verses.sanskrit: एषा ययौ परमादन्तरद्रेः कूचित सतीरूर्वे गा विवेद दिवो न विद्युत सतनयन्त्यभ्रैः सोमस्य ते पवत इन्द्रधारा |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā yayau paramādantaradreḥ kūcit satīrūrve ghā viveda divo na vidyut stanayantyabhraiḥ somasya te pavata indradhārā

translations.griffith: He issued forth from out the loftiest mountain, and found kine hidden somewhere in a stable.  Soma's stream clears itself for thee, O Indra, like lightning thundering through the clouds of heaven,

verses.sanskrit: उत सम राशिं परि यासि गोनामिन्द्रेण सोम सरथं पुनानः पूर्वीरिषो बर्हतीर्जीरदानो शिक्षा शचीवस्तव ता उपष्टुत |||
verses.transliteration: uta sma rāśiṃ pari yāsi ghonāmindreṇa soma sarathaṃ punānaḥ pūrvīriṣo bṛhatīrjīradāno śikṣā śacīvastava tā upaṣṭut

translations.griffith: Cleansing thyselr, and borne along with Indra, Soma, thou goest round the herd of cattle.  May thy praise help us, Mighty One, prompt Giver, to the full ample food which thou bestowest.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सोम इन्द्र तुभ्यं सुन्वे तुभ्यं पवते तवमस्य पाहि तवं ह यं चक्र्षे तवं वव्र्ष इन्दुं मदाय युज्याय सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunve tubhyaṃ pavate tvamasya pāhi tvaṃ ha yaṃ cakṛṣe tvaṃ vavṛṣa induṃ madāya yujyāya somam

translations.griffith: FOR thee this Soma is effused, O Indra: drink of this juice; for thee the stream is flowing-  Soma, which thou thyself hast made and chosen, even Indu, for thy special drink to cheer thee.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं रथो न भुरिषाळ अयोजि महः पुरूणि सातये वसूनि आदीं विश्वा नहुष्याणि जाता सवर्षाता वन ऊर्ध्वा नवन्त |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ ratho na bhuriṣāḷ ayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni ādīṃ viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vana ūrdhvā navanta

translations.griffith: Like a capacious car hath it been harnessed, the Mighty; to acquire abundant treasures.  Then in the sacrifice they celebrated all triumphs won by Nahus -n the battle.

verses.sanskrit: वायुर्न यो नियुत्वानिष्टयामा नासत्येव हव आ शम्भविष्ठः विश्ववारो दरविणोदा इव तमन पूषेव धीजवनो.असि सोम |||
verses.transliteration: vāyurna yo niyutvāniṣṭayāmā nāsatyeva hava ā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ viśvavāro draviṇodā iva tman pūṣeva dhījavano.asi soma

translations.griffith: Like Vāyu with his team, moving at pleasure, most gracious when invoked like both Nāsatyas,  Thou art thyself like the Wealth-Giver, Soma! who grants all boons, like song-inspiring Pūṣan.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो न यो महा कर्माणि चक्रिर्हन्ता वर्त्राणामसि सोमपूर्भित पैद्वो न हि तवमहिनाम्नां हन्ता विश्वस्यासिसोम दस्योः |||
verses.transliteration: indro na yo mahā karmāṇi cakrirhantā vṛtrāṇāmasi somapūrbhit paidvo na hi tvamahināmnāṃ hantā viśvasyāsisoma dasyoḥ

translations.griffith: Like Indra who hath done great deeds, thou, Soma, art slayer of the Vṛtras, Fort-destroyer.  Like Pedu's horse who killed the brood of serpents, thus thou, O Soma, slayest every Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्न यो वन आ सर्ज्यमानो वर्था पाजांसि कर्णुते नदीषु जनो न युध्वा महत उपब्दिरियर्ति सोमः पवमानूर्मिम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirna yo vana ā sṛjyamāno vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣu jano na yudhvā mahata upabdiriyarti somaḥ pavamānaūrmim

translations.griffith: Like Agni loosed amid the forest, fiercely he winneth splendour in the running waters.  Like one who fights, the roaring of the mighty, thus Soma Pavamana sends his current.

verses.sanskrit: एते सोमा अति वाराण्यव्या दिव्या न कोशासो अभ्रवर्षाः वर्था समुद्रं सिन्धवो न नीचीः सुतासो अभि कलशानस्र्ग्रन |||
verses.transliteration: ete somā ati vārāṇyavyā divyā na kośāso abhravarṣāḥ vṛthā samudraṃ sindhavo na nīcīḥ sutāso abhi kalaśānasṛghran

translations.griffith: These Somas passing through the fleecy filter, like rain descending from the clouds of heaven,  Have been effused and poured into the beakers, swiftly like rivers running lowly seaward.

verses.sanskrit: शुष्मी शर्धो न मारुतं पवस्वानभिशस्ता दिव्या यथाविट आपो न मक्षू सुमतिर्भवा नः सहस्राप्साः पर्तनाषाण न यज्ञः |||
verses.transliteration: śuṣmī śardho na mārutaṃ pavasvānabhiśastā divyā yathāviṭ āpo na makṣū sumatirbhavā naḥ sahasrāpsāḥ pṛtanāṣāṇ na yajñaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward like the potent band of Maruts, like that Celestial Host whom none revileth.  Quickly be gracious unto us like waters, like sacrifice victorious, thousand-fashioned.

verses.sanskrit: राज्ञो नु ते वरुणस्य वरतानि ... ||
verses.transliteration: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni ...

translations.griffith: Thine are King Varuṇa's eternal statutes, lofty and deep, O Soma, is thy glory.  All-pure art thou like Mitra the beloved, adorable, like Aryaman, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit: परो सय वह्निः पथ्याभिरस्यान दिवो न वर्ष्टिः पवमानोक्षाः सहस्रधारो असदन नयस्मे मातुरुपस्थे वन आच सोमः |||
verses.transliteration: pro sya vahniḥ pathyābhirasyān divo na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamānoakṣāḥ sahasradhāro asadan nyasme māturupasthe vana āca somaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS Chariot-horse hath moved along the pathways, and Pavamana flowed like rain from heaven.  With us hath Soma with a thousand currents sunk in the wood, upon his Mother's bosom.

verses.sanskrit: राजा सिन्धूनामवसिष्ट वास रतस्य नावमारुहद रजिष्ठाम अप्सु दरप्सो वाव्र्धे शयेनजूतो दुह ईं पिता दुह ईं पितुर्जाम |||
verses.transliteration: rājā sindhūnāmavasiṣṭa vāsa ṛtasya nāvamāruhad rajiṣṭhām apsu drapso vāvṛdhe śyenajūto duha īṃ pitā duha īṃ piturjām

translations.griffith: King, he hath clothed him in the robe of rivers, mounted the straightest-going ship of Order.  Sped by the Hawk the drop hath waxed in waters: the father drains it, drains the Father's offspring.

verses.sanskrit: सिंहं नसन्त मध्वो अयासं हरिमरुषं दिवो अस्य पतिम शूरो युत्सु परथमः पर्छते गा अस्य चक्षसा परि पात्युक्षा |||
verses.transliteration: siṃhaṃ nasanta madhvo ayāsaṃ harimaruṣaṃ divo asya patim śūro yutsu prathamaḥ pṛchate ghā asya cakṣasā pari pātyukṣā

translations.griffith: They come to him, red, tawny, Lord of Heaven, the watchful Guardian of the meath, the Lion.  First, Hero in the fight, he seeks the cattle, and with his eye the Steer is our protector.

verses.sanskrit: मधुप्र्ष्ठं घोरमयासमश्वं रथे युञ्जन्त्युरुचक्रर्ष्वम सवसार ईं जामयो मर्जयन्ति सनाभयो वाजिनमूर्जयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: madhupṛṣṭhaṃ ghoramayāsamaśvaṃ rathe yuñjantyurucakraṛṣvam svasāra īṃ jāmayo marjayanti sanābhayo vājinamūrjayanti

translations.griffith: They harness to the broad-wheeled car the mighty Courser whose back bears meath, unwearied, awful.  The twins, the sisters brighten him, and strengthen-these children of one damethe vigorous Racer.

verses.sanskrit: चतस्र ईं घर्तदुहः सचन्ते समाने अन्तर्धरुणे निषत्ताः ता ईमर्षन्ति नमसा पुनानास्ता ईं विश्वतः परि षन्ति पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: catasra īṃ ghṛtaduhaḥ sacante samāne antardharuṇe niṣattāḥ tā īmarṣanti namasā punānāstā īṃ viśvataḥ pari ṣanti pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: Four pouring out the holy oil attend him, sitting together in the same container.  To him they flow, when purified, with homage, and still, from every side, are first about him.

verses.sanskrit: विष्टम्भो दिवो धरुणः पर्थिव्या विश्वा उत कषितयो हस्ते अस्य असत त उत्सो गर्णते नियुत्वान मध्वो अंशुः पवतैन्द्रियाय |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyā viśvā uta kṣitayo haste asya asat ta utso ghṛṇate niyutvān madhvo aṃśuḥ pavataindriyāya

translations.griffith: He is the buttress of the heavens, supporter of earth, and in his hand are all the people.  Be the team's Lord a well to thee the singer: cleansed is the sweet plant's stalk for deed of glory.

verses.sanskrit: वन्वन्नवातो अभि देववीतिमिन्द्राय सोम वर्त्रहा पवस्व शग्धि महः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः सुवीर्यस्य पतयः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: vanvannavāto abhi devavītimindrāya soma vṛtrahā pavasva śaghdhi mahaḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Fighting, uninjured come where Gods are feasted; Soma, as Vitra-slayer flow for Indra.  Vouchsafe us ample riches very splendid may we be masters of heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit: पर हिन्वानो जनिता रोदस्यो रथो न वाजं सनिष्यन्नयासीत इन्द्रं गछन्नायुधा संशिशानो विश्वा वसु हस्तयोरादधानः |||
verses.transliteration: pra hinvāno janitā rodasyo ratho na vājaṃ saniṣyannayāsīt indraṃ ghachannāyudhā saṃśiśāno viśvā vasu hastayorādadhānaḥ

translations.griffith: URGED On, the Father of the Earth and Heaven hath gone forth like a car to gather booty,  Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, and in his hand containing every treasure.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठं वर्षणं वयोधामाङगूषाणामवावशन्त वाणीः वना वसानो वरुणो न सिन्धून वि रत्नधा दयते वार्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vayodhāmāṅghūṣāṇāmavāvaśanta vāṇīḥ vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūn vi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi

translations.griffith: To him the tones of sacred song have sounded, Steer of the triple height, the Life-bestower.  Dwelling in wood as Varuṇa in rivers, lavishing treasure he distributes blessings

verses.sanskrit: शूरग्रामः सर्ववीरः सहावाञ जेता पवस्व सनिता धनानि तिग्मायुधः कषिप्रधन्वा समत्स्वषाळ्हः साह्वान्प्र्तनासु शत्रून |||
verses.transliteration: śūraghrāmaḥ sarvavīraḥ sahāvāñ jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni tighmāyudhaḥ kṣipradhanvā samatsvaṣāḷhaḥ sāhvānpṛtanāsu śatrūn

translations.griffith: Great Conqueror, warnor-girt, Lord of all heroes, flow on thy way as he who winneth riches;  With sharpened. arms, with swift bow, never vanquished in battle, vanquishing in fight the foemen.

verses.sanskrit: उरुगव्यूतिरभयानि कर्ण्वन समीचीने आ पवस्वा पुरन्धी अपः सिषासन्नुषसः सवर्गाः सं चिक्रदो महो अस्मभ्यं वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: urughavyūtirabhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasvā purandhī apaḥ siṣāsannuṣasaḥ svarghāḥ saṃ cikrado maho asmabhyaṃ vājān

translations.griffith: Giving security, Lord of wide dominion, send us both earth and heaven with all their fulness.  Striving to win the Dawns, the light, the waters, and cattle, call to us abundant vigour.

verses.sanskrit: मत्सि सोम वरुणं मत्सि मित्रं मत्सीन्द्रमिन्दो पवमान विष्णुम मत्सि शर्धो मारुतं मत्सि देवान मत्सि महामिन्द्रमिन्दो मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: matsi soma varuṇaṃ matsi mitraṃ matsīndramindo pavamāna viṣṇum matsi śardho mārutaṃ matsi devān matsi mahāmindramindo madāya

translations.griffith: O Soma, gladden Varuṇa and Mitra; cheer, Indu Pavamana! Indra, Viṣṇu.  Cheer thou the Gods, the Company of Maruts: Indu, cheer mighty Indra to rejoicing.

verses.sanskrit: एवा राजेव करतुमानमेन विश्वा घनिघ्नद दुरिता पवस्व इन्दो सूक्ताय वचसे वयो धा यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: evā rājeva kratumānamena viśvā ghanighnad duritā pavasva indo sūktāya vacase vayo dhā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Thus like a wise and potent King flow onward, destroying with thy vigour all misfortunes.  For our well-spoken hymn give life, O Indu. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: असर्जि वक्वा रथ्ये यथाजौ धिया मनोता परथमो मनीषी दश सवसारो अधि सानो अव्ये.अजन्ति वह्निं सदनान्यछ |||
verses.transliteration: asarji vakvā rathye yathājau dhiyā manotā prathamo manīṣī daśa svasāro adhi sāno avye.ajanti vahniṃ sadanānyacha

translations.griffith: As for a chariot-race, the skilful Speaker, Chief, Sage, Inventor, hath, with song, been started.  The sisters ten upon the fleecy summit drive on the Car-horse to the resting places.

verses.sanskrit: वीती जनस्य दिव्यस्य कव्यैरधि सुवानो नहुष्येभिरिन्दुः पर यो नर्भिरम्र्तो मर्त्येभिर्मर्म्र्जानो.अविभिर्गोभिरद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: vītī janasya divyasya kavyairadhi suvāno nahuṣyebhirinduḥ pra yo nṛbhiramṛto martyebhirmarmṛjāno.avibhirghobhiradbhiḥ

translations.griffith: The drop of Soma, pressed by wise Nahusyas, becomes the banquet of the Heavenly People-  Indu, by hands of mortal men made beauteous, immortal, with the sheep and cows and waters.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा वर्ष्ने रोरुवदंशुरस्मै पवमानो रुशदीर्ते पयोगोः सहस्रं रक्वा पथिभिर्वचोविदध्वस्मभिः सूरो अण्वं वि याति |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣne roruvadaṃśurasmai pavamāno ruśadīrte payoghoḥ sahasraṃ ṛkvā pathibhirvacovidadhvasmabhiḥ sūro aṇvaṃ vi yāti

translations.griffith: Steer roaring unto Steer, this Pavamana, this juice runs to the white milk of the milch-cow.  Through thousand fine hairs goes the tuneful Singer, like Sūra by his fair and open pathways.

verses.sanskrit: रुजा दर्ळ्हा चिद रक्षसः सदांसि पुनान इन्द ऊर्णुहि विवाजान वर्श्चोपरिष्टात तुजता वधेन ये अन्ति दूरादुपनायमेषाम |||
verses.transliteration: rujā dṛḷhā cid rakṣasaḥ sadāṃsi punāna inda ūrṇuhi vivājān vṛścopariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrādupanāyameṣām

translations.griffith: Break down the, strong seats even of the demons: cleansing thee, Indu, robd thyself in vigour.  Rend with thy swift bolt, coming from above them, those who are near and those who yet are distant.

verses.sanskrit: स परत्नवन नव्यसे विश्ववार सूक्ताय पथः कर्णुहि पराचः ये दुःषहासो वनुषा बर्हन्तस्तांस्ते अश्याम पुरुक्र्त पुरुक्षो |||
verses.transliteration: sa pratnavan navyase viśvavāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ ye duḥṣahāso vanuṣā bṛhantastāṃste aśyāma purukṛt purukṣo

translations.griffith: Prepare the forward paths in ancient manner for the new bymn, thou Giver of all bounties.  Those which are high and hard for foes to conquer may we gain from thee, Active! Food-bestower!

verses.sanskrit: एवा पुनानो अपः सवर्गा अस्मभ्यं तोका तनयानि भूरि शं नः कषेत्रमुरु जयोतींषि सोम जयों नः सूर्यन्द्र्शये रिरीहि |||
verses.transliteration: evā punāno apaḥ svarghā asmabhyaṃ tokā tanayāni bhūri śaṃ naḥ kṣetramuru jyotīṃṣi soma jyoṃ naḥ sūryandṛśaye rirīhi

translations.griffith: So purifying thee vouchsafe us waters, heaven's light, and cows, offipring and many children.  Give us health, ample land, and lights, O Soma, and grant us long to look upon the sunshine.

verses.sanskrit: परि सुवानो हरिरंशुः पवित्रे रथो न सर्जि सनये हियानः आपच्छ्लोकमिन्द्रियं पूयमानः परति देवानजुषत परयोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pari suvāno hariraṃśuḥ pavitre ratho na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ āpacchlokamindriyaṃ pūyamānaḥ prati devānajuṣata prayobhiḥ

translations.griffith: THE gold-hued juice, poured out upon the filter, is started like a car sent forth to conquer.  He hath gained song and vigour while they cleansed him, and hath rejoiced the Gods with entertainments.

verses.sanskrit: अछा नर्चक्षा असरत पवित्रे नाम दधानः कविरस्य योनौ सीदन होतेव सदने चमूषूपेमग्मन्न्र्षयः सप्त विप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: achā nṛcakṣā asarat pavitre nāma dadhānaḥ kavirasya yonau sīdan hoteva sadane camūṣūpemaghmannṛṣayaḥ sapta viprāḥ

translations.griffith: He who beholdeth man hath reached the filter: bearing his name, the Sage hath sought his dwelling.  The Ṛṣis came to him, seven holy singers, when in the bowls he settled as Invoker.

verses.sanskrit: पर सुमेधा गातुविद विश्वदेवः सोमः पुनानः सद एति नित्यम भुवद विश्वेषु काव्येषु रन्तानु जनान यतते पञ्च धीरः |||
verses.transliteration: pra sumedhā ghātuvid viśvadevaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ sada eti nityam bhuvad viśveṣu kāvyeṣu rantānu janān yatate pañca dhīraḥ

translations.griffith: Shared by all Gods, mobt wise, propitious, Soma goes, while they cleanse him, to his constant station.  Let him rejoice in all his lofty wisdom to the Five Tribes the Sage attains with labour.

verses.sanskrit: तव तये सोम पवमान निण्ये विश्वे देवास्त्रय एकादशासः दश सवधाभिरधि सानो अव्ये मर्जन्ति तवा नद्यः सप्त यह्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tye soma pavamāna niṇye viśve devāstraya ekādaśāsaḥ daśa svadhābhiradhi sāno avye mṛjanti tvā nadyaḥ sapta yahvīḥ

translations.griffith: In thy mysterious place, O Pavamana Soma, are all the Gods, the Thrice-Eleven.  Ten on the fleecy height, themselves, self-prompted, and seven fresh rivers, brighten and adorn thee.

verses.sanskrit: तन नु सत्यं पवमानस्यास्तु यत्र विश्वे कारवः संनसन्त जयोतिर्यदह्ने अक्र्णोदु लोकं परावन मनुं दस्यवे करभीकम |||
verses.transliteration: tan nu satyaṃ pavamānasyāstu yatra viśve kāravaḥ saṃnasanta jyotiryadahne akṛṇodu lokaṃ prāvan manuṃ dasyave karabhīkam

translations.griffith: Now let this be the truth of Pavamana, there where all singers gather them together,  That he hath given us room and made the daylight, hath holpen Manu and repelled the Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit: परि सद्मेव पशुमान्ति होता राजा न सत्यः समितीरियानः सोमः पुनानः कलशानयासीत सीदन मर्गो न महिषो वनेषु |||
verses.transliteration: pari sadmeva paśumānti hotā rājā na satyaḥ samitīriyānaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśānayāsīt sīdan mṛgho na mahiṣo vaneṣu

translations.griffith: As the priest seeks the station rich in cattle, like a true King who goes to great assemblies,  Soma hath sought the beakers while they cleansed him, and like a wild bull, in the wood hath settled.

verses.sanskrit: साकमुक्षो मर्जयन्त सवसारो दश धीरस्य धीतयो धनुत्रीः हरिः पर्यद्रवज्जाः सूर्यस्य दरोणं ननक्षे अत्यो न वाजी |||
verses.transliteration: sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ hariḥ paryadravajjāḥ sūryasya droṇaṃ nanakṣe atyo na vājī

translations.griffith: TEN sisters, pouring out the rain together, swift-moving thinkers of the sage, adorn him.  Hither hath run the gold-hued Child of Sūrya and reached the vat like a fleet vigorous courser.

verses.sanskrit: सं मात्र्भिर्न शिशुर्वावशानो वर्षा दधन्वे पुरुवारोद्भिः मर्यो न योषामभि निष्क्र्तं यन सं गछते कलश उस्रियाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ mātṛbhirna śiśurvāvaśāno vṛṣā dadhanve puruvāroadbhiḥ maryo na yoṣāmabhi niṣkṛtaṃ yan saṃ ghachate kalaśa usriyābhiḥ

translations.griffith: Even as a youngling crying to his mothers, the bounteous Steer hath flowed along to waters.  As youth to damsel, so with milk he hastens on to the. chose meeting-place, the beaker.

verses.sanskrit: उत पर पिप्य ऊधरघ्न्याया इन्दुर्धाराभिः सचते सुमेधाः मूर्धानं गावः पयसा चमूष्वभि शरीणन्ति वसुभिर्न निक्तैः |||
verses.transliteration: uta pra pipya ūdharaghnyāyā indurdhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ mūrdhānaṃ ghāvaḥ payasā camūṣvabhi śrīṇanti vasubhirna niktaiḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, swollen is the udder of the milch-cow: thither in streams goes very sapient Indu.  The kine make ready, as with new-washed treasures, the Head and Chief with milk within the vessels.

verses.sanskrit: स नो देवेभिः पवमान रदेन्दो रयिमश्विनं वावशानः रथिरायतामुशती पुरन्धिरस्मद्र्यगा दावने वसूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: sa no devebhiḥ pavamāna radendo rayimaśvinaṃ vāvaśānaḥ rathirāyatāmuśatī purandhirasmadryaghā dāvane vasūnām

translations.griffith: With all the Gods, O Indu Pavamana, while thou art roaring send us wealth in horses.  Hither upon her car come willing Plenty, inclined to us, to give us of her treasures.

verses.sanskrit: नू नो रयिमुप मास्व नर्वन्तं पुनानो वाताप्यं विश्वश्चन्द्रम पर वन्दितुरिन्दो तार्यायुः परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात |||
verses.transliteration: nū no rayimupa māsva nṛvantaṃ punāno vātāpyaṃ viśvaścandram pra vanditurindo tāryāyuḥ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjaghamyāt

translations.griffith: Now unto us mete riches, while they cleansethee, all-glorious, swelling wealth, with store of heroes.  Long be his life who worships, thee, O Indu. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit: अधि यदस्मिन वाजिनीव शुभ सपर्धन्ते धियः सूर्ये नविशः अपो वर्णानः पवते कवीयन वरजं न पशुवर्धनाय मन्म |||
verses.transliteration: adhi yadasmin vājinīva śubha spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye naviśaḥ apo vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajaṃ na paśuvardhanāya manma

translations.griffith: WHEN beauties strive for him as for a charger, then strive the songs like soldiers for the sunlight.  Acting the Sage, he flows enrobed in waters and song as ’twere a stall that kine may prosper.

verses.sanskrit: दविता वयूर्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य धाम सवर्विदे भुवनानि परथन्त धियः पिन्वानाः सवसरे न गाव रतायन्तीरभि वावश्र इन्दुम |||
verses.transliteration: dvitā vyūrṇvannamṛtasya dhāma svarvide bhuvanāni prathanta dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na ghāva ṛtāyantīrabhi vāvaśra indum

translations.griffith: The worlds expand to hirn who from aforetime found light to spread the law of life eternal.  The swelling songs, like kine within the stable, in deep devotion call aloud on Indu.

verses.sanskrit: परि यत कविः काव्या भरते शूरो न रथो भुवनानि विश्वा देवेषु यशो मर्ताय भूषन दक्षाय रायः पुरुभूषु नव्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūro na ratho bhuvanāni viśvā deveṣu yaśo martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ purubhūṣu navyaḥ

translations.griffith: When the sage bears his holy wisdom round him, like a car visiting all worlds, the Hero,  Becoming fame, mid Gods, unto the mortal, wealth to the skilled, worth praise mid the Ever-present,

verses.sanskrit: शरिये जातः शरिय आ निरियाय शरियं वयो जरित्र्भ्यो दधाति शरियं वसाना अम्र्तत्वमायन भवन्ति सत्या समिथा मितद्रौ |||
verses.transliteration: śriye jātaḥ śriya ā niriyāya śriyaṃ vayo jaritṛbhyo dadhāti śriyaṃ vasānā amṛtatvamāyan bhavanti satyā samithā mitadrau

translations.griffith: For glory born be hath come forth to glory: he giveth life and glory to the singers.  They, clothed in glory, have become immortal. He, measured in his course, makes frays successful.

verses.sanskrit: इषमूर्जमभ्यर्षाश्वं गामुरु जयोतिः कर्णुहि मत्सि देवान विश्वानि हि सुषहा तानि तुभ्यं पवमान बाधसेसोम शत्रून |||
verses.transliteration: iṣamūrjamabhyarṣāśvaṃ ghāmuru jyotiḥ kṛṇuhi matsi devān viśvāni hi suṣahā tāni tubhyaṃ pavamāna bādhasesoma śatrūn

translations.griffith: Stream to us food and vigour, kine and horses: give us broad lights and fill thGods with rapture.  All ther are easy things for thee to master thou, Pavamana Soma, quellest foemen.

verses.sanskrit: कनिक्रन्ति हरिरा सर्ज्यमानः सीदन वनस्य जठरे पुनानः नर्भिर्यतः कर्णुते निर्णिजं गा अतो मतीर्जनयतस्वधाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: kanikranti harirā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ nṛbhiryataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ ghā ato matīrjanayatasvadhābhiḥ

translations.griffith: Loud neighs the Tawny Steed when started, settling deep in the wooden vessel while they cleanse him.  Led by the men he takes the milk for raiment: then shall he, through his powers, engender praise-songs.

verses.sanskrit: हरिः सर्जानः पथ्यां रतस्येयर्ति वाचमरितेव नावम देवो देवानां गुह्यानि नामाविष कर्णोति बर्हिषि परवाचे |||
verses.transliteration: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyāṃ ṛtasyeyarti vācamariteva nāvam devo devānāṃ ghuhyāni nāmāviṣ kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce

translations.griffith: As one who rows drives on his boat, he, Gold-hued, sends forth his voice, loosed on the path of Order.  As God, the secret names of Gods he utters, to be declared on sacred grass more widely.

verses.sanskrit: अपामिवेदूर्मयस्तर्तुराणाः पर मनीषा ईरते सोममछ नमस्यन्तीरुप च यन्ति सं चा च विशन्त्युशतीरुशन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: apāmivedūrmayastarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣā īrate somamacha namasyantīrupa ca yanti saṃ cā ca viśantyuśatīruśantam

translations.griffith: Hastening onward like the waves of waters, our holy hymns are pressing nigh to Soma.  To him they come with lowly adoration, and, longing, enter him who longs to meet them.

verses.sanskrit: तं मर्म्र्जानं महिषं न सानावंशुं दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम तं वावशानं मतयः सचन्ते तरितो बिभर्ति वरुणं समुद्रे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ marmṛjānaṃ mahiṣaṃ na sānāvaṃśuṃ duhantyukṣaṇaṃ ghiriṣṭhām taṃ vāvaśānaṃ matayaḥ sacante trito bibharti varuṇaṃ samudre

translations.griffith: They drain the stalk, the Steer who dwells on mountains, even as a Bull who decks him on the upland.  Hymns follow and attend him as he bellows: Trita bears Varuṇa aloft in ocean.

verses.sanskrit: इष्यन वाचमुपवक्तेव होतुः पुनान इन्दो वि षया मनीषाम इन्द्रश्च यत कषयथः सौभगाय सुवीर्यस्य पतयःस्याम |||
verses.transliteration: iṣyan vācamupavakteva hotuḥ punāna indo vi ṣyā manīṣām indraśca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhaghāya suvīryasya patayaḥsyāma

translations.griffith: Sending thy voice out as Director, loosen the Invoker's thought, O Indu, as they cleanse thee.  While thou and Indra rule for our advantage, may we be masters of heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit: पर सेनानीः शूरो अग्रे रथानां गव्यन्नेति हर्षते अस्य सेना भद्रान कर्ण्वन्निन्द्रहवान सखिभ्य आ सोमो वस्त्रा रभसानि दत्ते |||
verses.transliteration: pra senānīḥ śūro aghre rathānāṃ ghavyanneti harṣate asya senā bhadrān kṛṇvannindrahavān sakhibhya ā somo vastrā rabhasāni datte

translations.griffith: IN forefront of the cars forth goes the Hero, the Leader, winning spoil: his host rejoices.  Soma endues his robes of lasting colours, and blesses, for his friends, their calls on Indra.

verses.sanskrit: समस्य हरिं हरयो मर्जन्त्यश्वहयैरनिशितं नमोभिः आ तिष्ठति रथमिन्द्रस्य सखा विद्वानेना सुमतिं यात्यछ |||
verses.transliteration: samasya hariṃ harayo mṛjantyaśvahayairaniśitaṃ namobhiḥ ā tiṣṭhati rathamindrasya sakhā vidvānenā sumatiṃ yātyacha

translations.griffith: Men decked with gold adorn his golden tendril, incessantly with steed-impelling homage.  The Friend of Indra mounts his car well-knowing, he comes thereon to meet the prayer we offer.

verses.sanskrit: स नो देव देवताते पवस्व महे सोम पसरस इन्द्रपानः कर्ण्वन्नपो वर्षयन दयामुतेमामुरोरा नो वरिवस्या पुनानः |||
verses.transliteration: sa no deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarasa indrapānaḥ kṛṇvannapo varṣayan dyāmutemāmurorā no varivasyā punānaḥ

translations.griffith: O God, for service of the Gods flow onward, for food sublime, as Indra's drink, O Soma.  Making the floods, bedewing earth and heaven, come from the vast, comfort us while we cleanse thee

verses.sanskrit: अजीतये.अहतये पवस्व सवस्तये सर्वतातये बर्हते तदुशन्ति विश्व इमे सखायस्तदहं वश्मि पवमान सोम |||
verses.transliteration: ajītaye.ahataye pavasva svastaye sarvatātaye bṛhate taduśanti viśva ime sakhāyastadahaṃ vaśmi pavamāna soma

translations.griffith: Flow for prosperity and constant Vigour, flow on for happiness and high perfection.  This is the wish of these friends assembled: this is my wish, O Soma Pavamana.

verses.sanskrit: सोमः पवते जनिता मतीनां जनिता दिवो जनिता पर्थिव्याः जनिताग्नेर्जनिता सूर्यस्य जनितेन्द्रस्य जनितोत विष्णोः |||
verses.transliteration: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnāṃ janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ janitāghnerjanitā sūryasya janitendrasya janitota viṣṇoḥ

translations.griffith: Father of holy hymns, Soma flows onward the Father of the earth, Father of heaven:  Father of Agni, Sūrya's generator, the Father who begat Indra and Viṣṇu.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मा देवानां पदवीः कवीनां रषिर्विप्राणां महिषोम्र्गाणाम शयेनो गर्ध्राणां सवधितिर्वनानां सोमः पवित्रमत्येति रेभन |||
verses.transliteration: brahmā devānāṃ padavīḥ kavīnāṃ ṛṣirviprāṇāṃ mahiṣomṛghāṇām śyeno ghṛdhrāṇāṃ svadhitirvanānāṃ somaḥ pavitramatyeti rebhan

translations.griffith: Brahman of Gods, the Leader of the poets, Ṛṣi of sages, Bull of savage creatures,  Falcon amid the vultures, Axe of forests, over the cleansing sieve goes Soma singing.

verses.sanskrit: परावीविपद वाच ऊर्मिं न सिन्धुर्गिरः सोमः पवमानोमनीषाः अन्तः पश्यन वर्जनेमावराण्या तिष्ठति वर्षभो गोषु जानन |||
verses.transliteration: prāvīvipad vāca ūrmiṃ na sindhurghiraḥ somaḥ pavamānomanīṣāḥ antaḥ paśyan vṛjanemāvarāṇyā tiṣṭhati vṛṣabho ghoṣu jānan

translations.griffith: He, Soma Pavamana, like a river, hath stirred the wave of voice, our songs and praises.  Beholding these inferior powers in cattle, he rests among them as a Steer well-knowing.

verses.sanskrit: स मत्सरः पर्त्सु वन्वन्नवातः सहस्ररेता अभि वाजमर्ष इन्द्रायेन्दो पवमानो मनीष्यंशोरूर्मिमीरय गा इषण्यन |||
verses.transliteration: sa matsaraḥ pṛtsu vanvannavātaḥ sahasraretā abhi vājamarṣa indrāyendo pavamāno manīṣyaṃśorūrmimīraya ghā iṣaṇyan

translations.griffith: As Gladdener, Warrior never harmed in battle, with thousand genial streams, pour strength and vigour.  As thoughtful Pavamana, urge O Indu, speeding the kine, the plant's wave on to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: परि परियः कलशे देववात इन्द्राय सोमो रण्यो मदाय सहस्रधारः शतवाज इन्दुर्वाजी न सप्तिः समना जिगाति |||
verses.transliteration: pari priyaḥ kalaśe devavāta indrāya somo raṇyo madāya sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja indurvājī na saptiḥ samanā jighāti

translations.griffith: Dear, grateful to the Gods, on to the beaker moves Soma, sweet to Indra, to delight him.  With hundred powers, with thousand currents, Indu, like a strong car-horse, goes to the assembly.

verses.sanskrit: स पूर्व्यो वसुविज्जायमानो मर्जानो अप्सु दुदुहानो अद्रौ अभिशस्तिपा भुवनस्य राजा विदद गातुं बरह्मणे पूयमानः |||
verses.transliteration: sa pūrvyo vasuvijjāyamāno mṛjāno apsu duduhāno adrau abhiśastipā bhuvanasya rājā vidad ghātuṃ brahmaṇe pūyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Born in old time as finder-out of treasures, drained with the stone, decking himself in waters,  Warding off curses, King of all existence, he shall find way for prayer the while they cleanse him.

verses.sanskrit: तवया हि नः पितरः सोम पूर्वे कर्माणि चक्रुः पवमानधीराः वन्वन्नवातः परिधीन्रपोर्णु वीरेभिरश्वैर्मघवा भवा नः |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamānadhīrāḥ vanvannavātaḥ paridhīnraporṇu vīrebhiraśvairmaghavā bhavā naḥ

translations.griffith: For our sage fathers, Soma Pavamana, of old performed, by thee, their sacred duties.  Fighting unvanquished, open the enclosures: enrich us with large gifts of steeds and heroes.

verses.sanskrit: यथापवथा मनवे वयोधा अमित्रहा वरिवोविद धविष्मान एवा पवस्व दरविणं दधान इन्द्रे सं तिष्ठ जनयायुधानि |||
verses.transliteration: yathāpavathā manave vayodhā amitrahā varivovid dhaviṣmān evā pavasva draviṇaṃ dadhāna indre saṃ tiṣṭha janayāyudhāni

translations.griffith: As thou didst flow for Manu Life-bestowing, Foe-queller, Comforter, rich in oblations,  Even thus flow onward now conferring riches: combine with Indra, and bring forth thy weapons.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम मधुमान रतावापो वसानो अधि सानो अव्ये अव दरोणानि घर्तवान्ति सीद मदिन्तमो मत्सर इन्द्रपानः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma madhumān ṛtāvāpo vasāno adhi sāno avye ava droṇāni ghṛtavānti sīda madintamo matsara indrapānaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward, Soma, rich in sweets and holy,. enrobed in waters on the fleecy summit.  Settle in vessels that are full of fatness, as cheering and most gladdening drink for Indra.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्टिं दिवः शतधारः पवस्व सहस्रसा वाजयुर्देववीतौ सं सिन्धुभिः कलशे वावशानः समुस्रियाभिःप्रतिरन न आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ śatadhāraḥ pavasva sahasrasā vājayurdevavītau saṃ sindhubhiḥ kalaśe vāvaśānaḥ samusriyābhiḥpratiran na āyuḥ

translations.griffith: Pour, hundred-streamed, winner of thousands, mighty at the Gods’ banquet, Pour the rain of heaven,  While thou with rivers roarest in the beaker, and blent with milk prolongest our existence.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय सोमो मतिभिः पुनानो.अत्यो न वाजी तरतीदरातीः पयो न दुग्धमदितेरिषिरमुर्विव गातुः सुयमोन वोळहा |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya somo matibhiḥ punāno.atyo na vājī taratīdarātīḥ payo na dughdhamaditeriṣiramurviva ghātuḥ suyamona voḷhā

translations.griffith: Purified with our holy hymns, this Soma o’ertakes malignities like some strong charger,  Like fresh milk poured by Aditi, like passage in ample room, or like a docile car-horse.

verses.sanskrit: सवायुधः सोत्र्भिः पूयमानो.अभ्यर्ष गुह्यं चारु नाम अभि वाजं सप्तिरिव शरवस्याभि वायुमभि गा देवसोम |||
verses.transliteration: svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyamāno.abhyarṣa ghuhyaṃ cāru nāma abhi vājaṃ saptiriva śravasyābhi vāyumabhi ghā devasoma

translations.griffith: Cleansed by the pressers, armed with noble weapons, stream to us the fair secret name thou bearest.  Pour booty, like a horse, for love of glory God, Soma, send us kine, and send us Vāyu.

verses.sanskrit: शिशुं जज्ञानं हर्यतं मर्जन्ति शुम्भन्ति वह्निं मरुतो गणेन कविर्गीर्भिः काव्येना कविः सन सोमः पवित्रमत्येति रेभन |||
verses.transliteration: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ haryataṃ mṛjanti śumbhanti vahniṃ maruto ghaṇena kavirghīrbhiḥ kāvyenā kaviḥ san somaḥ pavitramatyeti rebhan

translations.griffith: They deck him at his birth, the lovely Infant, the Maruts with their troop adorn the Car-horse.  By songs a Poet and a Sage by wisdom, Soma joes singing through the cleansing filter.

verses.sanskrit: रषिमना य रषिक्र्त सवर्षाः सहस्रणीथः पदवीः कवीनाम तर्तीयं धाम महिषः सिषासन सोमो विराजमनुराजति षटुप |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣimanā ya ṛṣikṛt svarṣāḥ sahasraṇīthaḥ padavīḥ kavīnām tṛtīyaṃ dhāma mahiṣaḥ siṣāsan somo virājamanurājati ṣṭup

translations.griffith: Light-winner, Ṛṣi-mindcd, Ṛṣi-maker, hymned in a thousand hymns, Leader of sages,  A Steer who strives to gain his third form, Soma is, like Virāj, resplendent as a Singer.

verses.sanskrit: चमूषच्छ्येनः शकुनो विभ्र्त्वा गोविन्दुर्द्रप्स आयुधानिबिभ्रत अपामूर्मिं सचमानः समुद्रं तुरीयं धाममहिषो विवक्ति |||
verses.transliteration: camūṣacchyenaḥ śakuno vibhṛtvā ghovindurdrapsa āyudhānibibhrat apāmūrmiṃ sacamānaḥ samudraṃ turīyaṃ dhāmamahiṣo vivakti

translations.griffith: Hawk seated in the bowls, Bird wide-extended, the Banner seeking kine and wielding weapons,  Following close the sea, the wave of waters, the great Bull tells his fourth form and declares it.

verses.sanskrit: मर्यो न शुभ्रस्तन्वं मर्जानो.अत्यो न सर्त्वा सनये धनानाम वर्षेव यूथा परि कोशमर्षन कनिक्रदच्चम्वोराविवेश |||
verses.transliteration: maryo na śubhrastanvaṃ mṛjāno.atyo na sṛtvā sanaye dhanānām vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośamarṣan kanikradaccamvorāviveśa

translations.griffith: Like a fair youth who decorates his body, a courser rushing to the gain of riches,  A steer to herds, so, flowing to the pitcher, he with a roar hath passed into the beakers.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्वेन्दो पवमानो महोभिः कनिक्रदत परि वाराण्यर्ष करीळञ्चम्वोरा विश पूयमान इन्द्रं ते रसो मदिरो ममत्तु |||
verses.transliteration: pavasvendo pavamāno mahobhiḥ kanikradat pari vārāṇyarṣa krīḷañcamvorā viśa pūyamāna indraṃ te raso madiro mamattu

translations.griffith: Flow on with might as Pavamana, Indu flow loudly roaring through the fleecy filter.  Enter the beakers sporting, as they cleanse thee, and let thy gladdening juice make Indra joyful.

verses.sanskrit: परास्य धारा बर्हतीरस्र्ग्रन्नक्तो गोभिः कलशाना विवेश साम कर्ण्वन सामन्यो विपश्चित करन्दन्नेत्यभि सख्युर्न जामिम |||
verses.transliteration: prāsya dhārā bṛhatīrasṛghrannakto ghobhiḥ kalaśānā viveśa sāma kṛṇvan sāmanyo vipaścit krandannetyabhi sakhyurna jāmim

translations.griffith: His streams have been effused in all their fulness, and he hath entered, balmed with milk, the goblets.  Singing his psalm, well-skilled in song, a Chanter, be comes as ’twere to his friend's sister roaring.

verses.sanskrit: अपघ्नन्नेषि पवमान शत्रून परियां न जारो अभिगीत इन्दुः सीदन वनेषु शकुनो न पत्वा सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सत्ता |||
verses.transliteration: apaghnanneṣi pavamāna śatrūn priyāṃ na jāro abhighīta induḥ sīdan vaneṣu śakuno na patvā somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sattā

translations.griffith: Chasing our foes thou comest, Pavamana Indu, besting, as lover to his darling.  As a bird flies and settles in the forest, thus Soma settles, purified, in goblets.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते रुचः पवमानस्य सोम योषेव यन्ति सुदुघाः सुधाराः हरिरानीतः पुरुवारो अप्स्वचिक्रदत कलशे देवयूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā te rucaḥ pavamānasya soma yoṣeva yanti sudughāḥ sudhārāḥ harirānītaḥ puruvāro apsvacikradat kalaśe devayūnām

translations.griffith: With full stream and abundant milk, O Soma, thy beams come, like a woman, as they cleanse thee.  He, gold-hued, rich in boons, brought to the waters, hath roared within the goblet of the pious.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य परेषा हेमना पूयमानो देवो देवेभिः समप्र्क्त रसम सुतः पवित्रं पर्येति रेभन मितेव सद्म पशुमान्ति होता |||
verses.transliteration: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam sutaḥ pavitraṃ paryeti rebhan miteva sadma paśumānti hotā

translations.griffith: MADE pure by this man's urgent zeal and impulse the God hath to the Gods his juice imparted.  He goes, effused and singing, to the filter, like priest to measured seats supplied with cattle.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रा वस्त्रा समन्या वसानो महान कविर्निवचनानि शंसन आ वच्यस्व चम्वोः पूयमानो विचक्षणो जाग्र्विर्देववीतौ |||
verses.transliteration: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasāno mahān kavirnivacanāni śaṃsan ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamāno vicakṣaṇo jāghṛvirdevavītau

translations.griffith: Robed in fair raiment meet to wear in battle, a mighty Sage pronouncing invocations.  Roll onward to the beakers as they cleanse thee, far-seeing at the feast of Gods, and watchful.

verses.sanskrit: समु परियो मर्ज्यते सानो अव्ये यशस्तरो यशसां कषैतो अस्मे अभि सवर धन्वा पूयमानो यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: samu priyo mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaro yaśasāṃ kṣaito asme abhi svara dhanvā pūyamāno yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Dear, he is brightened on the fleecy summit, a Prince among us, nobler than the noble.  Roar out as thou art purified, run forward. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर गायताभ्यर्चाम देवान सोमं हिनोत महते धनाय सवादुः पवाते अति वारमव्यमा सीदाति कलशं देवयुर्नः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ghāyatābhyarcāma devān somaṃ hinota mahate dhanāya svāduḥ pavāte ati vāramavyamā sīdāti kalaśaṃ devayurnaḥ

translations.griffith: Let us sing praises to the Gods: sing loudly, send ye the Soma forth for mighty riches.  Let him flow, sweetly-flavoured, through the filter, and let our pious one rest in the pitcher.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुर्देवानामुप सख्यमायन सहस्रधारः पवते मदाय नर्भिः सतवानो अनु धाम पूर्वमगन्निन्द्रं महते सौभगाय |||
verses.transliteration: indurdevānāmupa sakhyamāyan sahasradhāraḥ pavate madāya nṛbhiḥ stavāno anu dhāma pūrvamaghannindraṃ mahate saubhaghāya

translations.griffith: Winning the friendship of the Deities, Indu flows in a thousand streams to make them joyful.  Praised by the men after the ancient statute, he hath come nigh, for our great bliss, to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: सतोत्रे राये हरिरर्षा पुनान इन्द्रं मदो गछतु ते भराय देवैर्याहि सरथं राधो अछा यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: stotre rāye harirarṣā punāna indraṃ mado ghachatu te bharāya devairyāhi sarathaṃ rādho achā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Flow, Gold-hued, cleansing thee, to enrich the singer: let thy juice go to Indra to support him.  Come nigh, together with the Gods, for bounty. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर काव्यमुशनेव बरुवाणो देवो देवानां जनिमा विवक्ति महिव्रतः शुचिबन्धुः पावकः पदा वराहो अभ्येति रेभन |||
verses.transliteration: pra kāvyamuśaneva bruvāṇo devo devānāṃ janimā vivakti mahivrataḥ śucibandhuḥ pāvakaḥ padā varāho abhyeti rebhan

translations.griffith: The God declares the Deities' generations, like Uśanā, proclaiming lofty wisdom.  With brilliant kin, far-ruling, sanctifying, the Boar advances, singing, to the places.

verses.sanskrit: पर हंसासस्त्र्पलं मन्युमछामादस्तं वर्षगणा अयासुः आङगूष्यं पवमानं सखायो दुर्मर्षं साकं परवदन्ति वाणम |||
verses.transliteration: pra haṃsāsastṛpalaṃ manyumachāmādastaṃ vṛṣaghaṇā ayāsuḥ āṅghūṣyaṃ pavamānaṃ sakhāyo durmarṣaṃ sākaṃ pravadanti vāṇam

translations.griffith: The Swans, the Vrsaganas from anear us have brought their restless spirit to our dwelling.  Friends come to Pavamana meet for praises, and sound in concert their resistless music.

verses.sanskrit: स रंहत उरुगायस्य जूतिं वर्था करीळन्तं मिमते न गावः परीणसं कर्णुते तिग्मश्र्ङगो दिवा हरिर्दद्र्शे नक्तं रज्रः |||
verses.transliteration: sa raṃhata urughāyasya jūtiṃ vṛthā krīḷantaṃ mimate na ghāvaḥ parīṇasaṃ kṛṇute tighmaśṛṅgho divā harirdadṛśe naktaṃ ṛjraḥ

translations.griffith: He follows the Wide-strider's rapid movement: cows low, as ’twere, to him who sports at pleasure.  He with the sharpened horns brings forth abundance: the Silvery shines by night, by day the Golden.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुर्वाजी पवते गोन्योघा इन्द्रे सोमः सह इन्वन मदाय हन्ति रक्षो बाधते पर्यरातीर्वरिवः कर्ण्वन वर्जनस्य राजा |||
verses.transliteration: indurvājī pavate ghonyoghā indre somaḥ saha invan madāya hanti rakṣo bādhate paryarātīrvarivaḥ kṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā

translations.griffith: Strong Indu, bathed in milk, flows on for Indra, Soma exciting strength, to make him joyful.  He quells malignities and slays the demons, the King of mighty power who brings us comfort.

verses.sanskrit: अध धारया मध्वा पर्चानस्तिरो रोम पवते अद्रिदुग्धः इन्दुरिन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुषाणो देवो देवस्य मत्सरो मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: adha dhārayā madhvā pṛcānastiro roma pavate adridughdhaḥ indurindrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇo devo devasya matsaro madāya

translations.griffith: Then in a stream he flows, milked out with press-stones, mingled with sweetness, through the fleecy filter-  Indu rejoicing in the love of Indra, the God who gladdens, for the God's enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परियाणि पवते पुनानो देवो देवान सवेन रसेन पर्ञ्चन इन्दुर्धर्माण्य रतुथा वसानो दश कषिपो अव्यत सानो अव्ये |||
verses.transliteration: abhi priyāṇi pavate punāno devo devān svena rasena pṛñcan indurdharmāṇy ṛtuthā vasāno daśa kṣipo avyata sāno avye

translations.griffith: As he is purified he pours out treasures, a God bedewing Gods with his own juices.  Indu hath, wearing qualities by seasons, on the raised fleece engaged, the ten swift fingers.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा शोणो अभिकनिक्रदद गा नदयन्नेति पर्थिवीमुत दयाम इन्द्रस्येव वग्नुरा शर्ण्व आजौ परचेतयन्नर्षति वाचमेमाम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā śoṇo abhikanikradad ghā nadayanneti pṛthivīmuta dyām indrasyeva vaghnurā śṛṇva ājau pracetayannarṣati vācamemām

translations.griffith: The Red Bull bellowing to the kine advances, causing the heavens and earth to roar and tbunder.  Well is he beard like Indra's shout in battle: letting this voice be known he hastens hither.

verses.sanskrit: रसाय्यः पयसा पिन्वमान ईरयन्नेषि मधुमन्तमंशुम पवमानः सन्तनिमेषि कर्ण्वन्निन्द्राय सोम परिषिच्यमानः |||
verses.transliteration: rasāyyaḥ payasā pinvamāna īrayanneṣi madhumantamaṃśum pavamānaḥ santanimeṣi kṛṇvannindrāya soma pariṣicyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Swelling with milk, abounding in sweet flavours, urging the meath-rich plant thou goest onward.  Raising a shout thou flowest as they cleanse thee, when thou, O Soma, art effused for Indra.

verses.sanskrit: एवा पवस्व मदिरो मदायोदग्राभस्य नमयन वधस्नैः परि वर्णं भरमाणो रुशन्तं गव्युर्नो अर्ष परि सोम सिक्तः |||
verses.transliteration: evā pavasva madiro madāyodaghrābhasya namayan vadhasnaiḥ pari varṇaṃ bharamāṇo ruśantaṃ ghavyurno arṣa pari soma siktaḥ

translations.griffith: So flow thou on inspiriting, for rapture, aiming deatb-shafts at him who stays the waters,  Flow to us wearing thy resplendent colour, effused and eager for the kine, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit: जुष्ट्वी न इन्दो सुपथा सुगान्युरौ पवस्व वरिवांसि कर्ण्वन घनेव विष्वग दुरितानि विघ्नन्नधि षणुना धन्व सानो अव्ये |||
verses.transliteration: juṣṭvī na indo supathā sughānyurau pavasva varivāṃsi kṛṇvan ghaneva viṣvagh duritāni vighnannadhi ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye

translations.griffith: Pleased with us, Indu, send us as thou flowest good easy paths in ample space and comforts.  Dispelling, as ’twere with a club, misfortunes, run o’er the height, run o’er the fleecy summit.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्टिं नो अर्ष दिव्यां जिगत्नुमिळावतीं शंगयीं जीरदानुम सतुकेव वीता धन्वा विचिन्वन बन्धून्रिमानवरानिन्दो वायून |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṭiṃ no arṣa divyāṃ jighatnumiḷāvatīṃ śaṃghayīṃ jīradānum stukeva vītā dhanvā vicinvan bandhūnrimānavarānindo vāyūn

translations.griffith: Pour on us rain celestial, quickly streaming, refreshing, fraught with health and ready bounty.  Flow, Indu, send these Winds thy lower kinsmen, setting them free like locks of hair unbraided.

verses.sanskrit: गरन्थिं न वि षय गरथितं पुनान रजुं च गातुं वर्जिनं च सोम अत्यो न करदो हरिरा सर्जानो मर्यो देव धन्व पस्त्यावान |||
verses.transliteration: ghranthiṃ na vi ṣya ghrathitaṃ punāna ṛjuṃ ca ghātuṃ vṛjinaṃ ca soma atyo na krado harirā sṛjāno maryo deva dhanva pastyāvān

translations.griffith: Part, like a knotted tangle, while they cleanse thee, O Soma, righteous and unrighteous conduct.  Neigh like a tawny courser who is loosened, come like a youth, O God, a house-possessor.

verses.sanskrit: जुष्टो मदाय देवतात इन्दो परि षणुना धन्व सानो अव्ये सहस्रधारः सुरभिरदब्धः परि सरव वाजसातौ नर्षह्ये |||
verses.transliteration: juṣṭo madāya devatāta indo pari ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye sahasradhāraḥ surabhiradabdhaḥ pari srava vājasātau nṛṣahye

translations.griffith: For the God's service, for delight, O Indu, run o’er the height, run o'ver the fleecy summit.  With thousand streams, inviolate, sweet-scented, flow on for gain of strength that conquers heroes.

verses.sanskrit: अरश्मानो ये.अरथा अयुक्ता अत्यासो न सस्र्जानास आजौ एते शुक्रासो धन्वन्ति सोमा देवासस्तानुप याता पिबध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: araśmāno ye.arathā ayuktā atyāso na sasṛjānāsa ājau ete śukrāso dhanvanti somā devāsastānupa yātā pibadhyai

translations.griffith: Without a car, without a rein to guide them, unyoked, like coursers started in the contest,  These brilliant drops of Soma juice run forward. Do ye, O Deities, come nigh to drink them.

verses.sanskrit: एवा न इन्दो अभि देववीतिं परि सरव नभो अर्णश्चमूषु सोमो अस्मभ्यं काम्यं बर्हन्तं रयिं ददातु वीरवन्तमुग्रम |||
verses.transliteration: evā na indo abhi devavītiṃ pari srava nabho arṇaścamūṣu somo asmabhyaṃ kāmyaṃ bṛhantaṃ rayiṃ dadātu vīravantamughram

translations.griffith: So for our banquet of the Gods, O Indu, pour down the rain of heaven into the vessels.  May Soma grant us riches sought with longing, mighty, exceeding strong, with store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit: तक्षद यदी मनसो वेनतो वाग जयेष्ठस्य वा धर्मणि कषोरनीके आदीमायन वरमा वावशाना जुष्टं पतिं कलशे गाव इन्दुम |||
verses.transliteration: takṣad yadī manaso venato vāgh jyeṣṭhasya vā dharmaṇi kṣoranīke ādīmāyan varamā vāvaśānā juṣṭaṃ patiṃ kalaśe ghāva indum

translations.griffith: What time the loving spirit's word had formed him Chief of all food, by statute of the Highest,  Then loudly lowing came the cows to Indu, the chosen, well-loved Master in the beaker.

verses.sanskrit: पर दानुदो दिव्यो दानुपिन्व रतं रताय पवते सुमेधाः धर्मा भुवद वर्जन्यस्य राजा पर रश्मिभिर्दशभिर्भारि भूम |||
verses.transliteration: pra dānudo divyo dānupinva ṛtaṃ ṛtāya pavate sumedhāḥ dharmā bhuvad vṛjanyasya rājā pra raśmibhirdaśabhirbhāri bhūma

translations.griffith: The Sage, Celestial, liberal, raining bounties, pours as he flows the Genuine for the Truthful.  The King shall be effectual strength's upholder: he by the ten bright reins is mostly guided.

verses.sanskrit: पवित्रेभिः पवमानो नर्चक्षा राजा देवानामुत मर्त्यानाम दविता भुवद रयिपती रयीणां रतं भरत सुभ्र्तं चार्विन्दुः |||
verses.transliteration: pavitrebhiḥ pavamāno nṛcakṣā rājā devānāmuta martyānām dvitā bhuvad rayipatī rayīṇāṃ ṛtaṃ bharat subhṛtaṃ cārvinduḥ

translations.griffith: He who beholds mankind, made pure with filters, the King supreme of Deities and mortals,  From days of old is Treasure-Lord of riches: he, Indu, cherishes fair well-kept Order.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वानिव शरवसे सातिमछेन्द्रस्य वायोरभि वीतिमर्ष स नः सहस्रा बर्हतीरिषो दा भवा सोम दरविणोवित पुनानः |||
verses.transliteration: arvāniva śravase sātimachendrasya vāyorabhi vītimarṣa sa naḥ sahasrā bṛhatīriṣo dā bhavā soma draviṇovit punānaḥ

translations.griffith: Haste, like a steed, to vittory for glory, to Indra's and to Vāyu's entertainment.  Give us food ample, thousandfold: be, Soma, the finder-out of riches when they cleanse thee.

verses.sanskrit: देवाव्यो नः परिषिच्यमानाः कषयं सुवीरं धन्वन्तु सोमाः आयज्यवः सुमतिं विश्ववारा होतारो न दिवियजो मन्द्रतमाः |||
verses.transliteration: devāvyo naḥ pariṣicyamānāḥ kṣayaṃ suvīraṃ dhanvantu somāḥ āyajyavaḥ sumatiṃ viśvavārā hotāro na diviyajo mandratamāḥ

translations.griffith: Effused by us let God-delighting Somas bring as they flow a home with noble heroes.  Rich in all boons like priests acquiring favour, the worshippers of heaven, the best of Cheerers.

verses.sanskrit: एवा देव देवताते पवस्व महे सोम पसरसे देवपानः महश्चिद धि षमसि हिताः समर्ये कर्धि सुष्ठाने रोदसी पुनानः |||
verses.transliteration: evā deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase devapānaḥ mahaścid dhi ṣmasi hitāḥ samarye kṛdhi suṣṭhāne rodasī punānaḥ

translations.griffith: So, God, for service of the Gods flow onward, flow, drink of Gods, for ample food, O Soma.  For we go forth to war against the mighty make heaven and earth well stablished by thy cleansing.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वो नो करदो वर्षभिर्युजानः सिंहो न भीमो मनसो जवीयान अर्वाचीनैः पथिभिर्ये रजिष्ठा आ पवस्व सौमनसं न इन्दो |||
