verses.transliteration: aśvo no krado vṛṣabhiryujānaḥ siṃho na bhīmo manaso javīyān arvācīnaiḥ pathibhirye rajiṣṭhā ā pavasva saumanasaṃ na indo

translations.griffith: Thou, yoked by strong men, neighest like a courser, swifter than thought is, like an awful lion.  By paths directed hitherward, the straightest, send thou us happiness, Indu, while they cleanse thee.

verses.sanskrit: शतं धारा देवजाता अस्र्ग्रन सहस्रमेनाः कवयो मर्जन्ति इन्दो सनित्रं दिव आ पवस्व पुरेतासि महतो धनस्य |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ dhārā devajātā asṛghran sahasramenāḥ kavayo mṛjanti indo sanitraṃ diva ā pavasva puraetāsi mahato dhanasya

translations.griffith: Sprung from the Gods, a hundred streams, a thousand, have been effused: sages prepare and purge them.  Bring us from heaven the means of winnning, Indu; thou art-forerunnner of abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो न सर्गा असस्र्ग्रमह्नां राजा न मित्रं पर मिनातिधीरः पितुर्न पुत्रः करतुभिर्यतान आ पवस्व विशेस्या अजीतिम |||
verses.transliteration: divo na sarghā asasṛghramahnāṃ rājā na mitraṃ pra minātidhīraḥ piturna putraḥ kratubhiryatāna ā pavasva viśeasyā ajītim

translations.griffith: The streams of days, were poured as ’twere from heaven: the wise King doth not treat his friend unkindly.  Like a son following his father's wishes, grant to this family success and safety.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते धारा मधुमतीरस्र्ग्रन वारान यत पूतो अत्येष्यव्यान पवमान पवसे धाम गोनां जज्ञानः सूर्यमपिन्वो अर्कैः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te dhārā madhumatīrasṛghran vārān yat pūto atyeṣyavyān pavamāna pavase dhāma ghonāṃ jajñānaḥ sūryamapinvo arkaiḥ

translations.griffith: Now are thy streams poured forth with all their sweetness, when, purified. thou goest through the filter.  The race of kine is thy gift, Pavarridna: when born thou madest Sūrya rich with brightness.

verses.sanskrit: कनिक्रददनु पन्थां रतस्य शुक्रो वि भास्यम्र्तस्य धाम स इन्द्राय पवसे मत्सरवान हिन्वानो वाचं मतिभिः कवीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: kanikradadanu panthāṃ ṛtasya śukro vi bhāsyamṛtasya dhāma sa indrāya pavase matsaravān hinvāno vācaṃ matibhiḥ kavīnām

translations.griffith: Bright, bellowing aiong the path of Order, thou shinest as the form of life eternal.  Thou flowest on as gladdening drink for Indra, sending thy voice out with the hymns of sages.

verses.sanskrit: दिव्यः सुपर्णो.अव चक्षि सोम पिन्वन धाराः कर्मणा देववीतौ एन्दो विश कलशं सोमधानं करन्दन्निहि सूर्यस्योप रश्मिम |||
verses.transliteration: divyaḥ suparṇo.ava cakṣi soma pinvan dhārāḥ karmaṇā devavītau endo viśa kalaśaṃ somadhānaṃ krandannihi sūryasyopa raśmim

translations.griffith: Pouring out streams at the Gods’ feast with service, thou, Soma, lookest down, a heavenly Eagle.  Enter the Soma-holding beaker, Indu, and with a roar approach the ray of Sarya.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो वाच ईरयति पर वह्निरतस्य धीतिं बरह्मणो मनीषाम गावो यन्ति गोपतिं पर्छमानाः सोमं यन्ति मतयो वावशानाः |||
verses.transliteration: tisro vāca īrayati pra vahnirtasya dhītiṃ brahmaṇo manīṣām ghāvo yanti ghopatiṃ pṛchamānāḥ somaṃ yanti matayo vāvaśānāḥ

translations.griffith: Three are the voices that the Courser utters: he speaks the thought of prayer, the law of Order.  To the Cow's Master come the Cows inquiring: the hymns with eager longing come to Soma.

verses.sanskrit: सोमं गावो धेनवो वावशानाः सोमं विप्रा मतिभिः पर्छमानाः सोमः सुतः पूयते अज्यमानः सोमे अर्कास्त्रिष्टुभिः सं नवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: somaṃ ghāvo dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ somaṃ viprā matibhiḥ pṛchamānāḥ somaḥ sutaḥ pūyate ajyamānaḥ some arkāstriṣṭubhiḥ saṃ navante

translations.griffith: To Soma come the Cows, the Milch-kine longing, to Soma sages with their hvmns inquiring.  Soma, effused, is purified and blended our hymns and Tṛṣṭup songs unite in Soma.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नः सोम परिषिच्यमान आ पवस्व पूयमानः सवस्ति इन्द्रमा विश बर्हता रवेण वर्धया वाचं जनया पुरन्धिम |||
verses.transliteration: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāna ā pavasva pūyamānaḥ svasti indramā viśa bṛhatā raveṇa vardhayā vācaṃ janayā purandhim

translations.griffith: Thus, Soma, as we pour thee into vessels, while thou art purified flow for our welfare.  Pass into Indra with a mighty roaring make the voice swell, and generate abundance.

verses.sanskrit: आ जाग्र्विर्विप्र रता मतीनां सोमः पुनानो असदच्चमूषु सपन्ति यं मिथुनासो निकामा अध्वर्यवो रथिरासः सुहस्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: ā jāghṛvirvipra ṛtā matīnāṃ somaḥ punāno asadaccamūṣu sapanti yaṃ mithunāso nikāmā adhvaryavo rathirāsaḥ suhastāḥ

translations.griffith: Singer of true songs, ever-watchful, Soma hath settled in the ladles when they cleanse him.  Him the Adhvaryus, paired and eager, follow, leaders of sacrifice and skilful-handed.

verses.sanskrit: स पुनान उप सूरे न धातोभे अप्रा रोदसी वि ष आवः परिया चिद यस्य परियसास ऊती स तू धनं कारिणेन पर यंसत |||
verses.transliteration: sa punāna upa sūre na dhātobhe aprā rodasī vi ṣa āvaḥ priyā cid yasya priyasāsa ūtī sa tū dhanaṃ kāriṇena pra yaṃsat

translations.griffith: Cleansed near the Sun as ’twere he as Creator hath filled full heaven and earth, and hath disclosed them.  He by whose dear help men gain all their wishes shall yield the precious meed as to a victor.

verses.sanskrit: स वर्धिता वर्धनः पूयमानः सोमो मीढ्वानभि नो जयोतिषावीत येना नः पूर्वे पितरः पदज्ञाः सवर्विदो अभि गा अद्रिमुष्णन |||
verses.transliteration: sa vardhitā vardhanaḥ pūyamānaḥ somo mīḍhvānabhi no jyotiṣāvīt yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñāḥ svarvido abhi ghā adrimuṣṇan

translations.griffith: He, being cleansed, the Strengthener and Increaser, Soma the Bounteous, helped us with his lustre,  Wherewith our sires of old who knew the footsteps found light and stole the cattle from the mountain.

verses.sanskrit: अक्रान समुद्रः परथमे विधर्मञ जनयन परजा भुवनस्यराजा वर्षा पवित्रे अधि सानो अव्ये बर्हत सोमो वाव्र्धे सुवान इन्दुः |||
verses.transliteration: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmañ janayan prajā bhuvanasyarājā vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somo vāvṛdhe suvāna induḥ

translations.griffith: In the first vault of heaven loud roared the Ocean, King of all being, generating creatures.  Steer, in the filter, on the fleecy summit, Soma, the Drop effused, hath waxen mighty.

verses.sanskrit: महत तत सोमो महिषश्चकारापां यद गर्भो.अव्र्णीत देवान अदधादिन्द्रे पवमान ओजो.अजनयत सूर्ये जयोतिरिन्दुः |||
verses.transliteration: mahat tat somo mahiṣaścakārāpāṃ yad gharbho.avṛṇīta devān adadhādindre pavamāna ojo.ajanayat sūrye jyotirinduḥ

translations.griffith: Soma the Steer, in that as Child of Waters he chose the Gods, performed that great achievement.  He, Pavamana, granted strength to Indra; he, Indu, generated light in Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: मत्सि वायुमिष्टये राधसे च मत्सि मित्रावरुणा पूयमानः मत्सि शर्धो मारुतं मत्सि देवान मत्सि दयावाप्र्थिवी देव सोम |||
verses.transliteration: matsi vāyumiṣṭaye rādhase ca matsi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ matsi śardho mārutaṃ matsi devān matsi dyāvāpṛthivī deva soma

translations.griffith: Make Vāyu glad,, for furtherance and bounty: cheer Varuṇa and Mitra, as they cleanse thee.  Gladden the Gods, gladden the host of Maruts: make Heaven and Earth rejoice, O God, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit: रजुः पवस्व वर्जिनस्य हन्तापामीवां बाधमानो मर्धश्च अभिश्रीणन पयः पयसाभि गोनामिन्द्रस्य तवं तव वयं सखायः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjuḥ pavasva vṛjinasya hantāpāmīvāṃ bādhamāno mṛdhaśca abhiśrīṇan payaḥ payasābhi ghonāmindrasya tvaṃ tava vayaṃ sakhāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow onward righteous slayer of the wicked, driving away our enemies and sickness,  Blending thy milk with milk which cows afford us. We are thy friends, thou art the Friend of Indra.

verses.sanskrit: मध्वः सूदं पवस्व वस्व उत्सं वीरं च न आ पवस्वा भगं च सवदस्वेन्द्राय पवमान इन्दो रयिं च न आ पवस्वा समुद्रात |||
verses.transliteration: madhvaḥ sūdaṃ pavasva vasva utsaṃ vīraṃ ca na ā pavasvā bhaghaṃ ca svadasvendrāya pavamāna indo rayiṃ ca na ā pavasvā samudrāt

translations.griffith: Pour us a fount of meath, a spring of treasure; send us a hero son and happy fortune.  Be sweet to India when they cleanse thee, Indu, and pour down riches on us from the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: सोमः सुतो धारयात्यो न हित्वा सिन्धुर्न निम्नमभि वाज्यक्षाः आ योनिं वन्यमसदत पुनानः समिन्दुर्गोभिरसरत समद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: somaḥ suto dhārayātyo na hitvā sindhurna nimnamabhi vājyakṣāḥ ā yoniṃ vanyamasadat punānaḥ samindurghobhirasarat samadbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Strong Soma, pressed, like an impetuous courser, hath flowed in stream as a flood speeding downward.  Cleansed, he hath settled in his wooden dwelling: Indu hath flowed with milk and with the waters.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय ते पवत इन्द्र सोमश्चमूषु धीर उशते तवस्वान सवर्चक्षा रथिरः सत्यशुष्मः कामो न यो देवयतामसर्जि |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya te pavata indra somaścamūṣu dhīra uśate tavasvān svarcakṣā rathiraḥ satyaśuṣmaḥ kāmo na yo devayatāmasarji

translations.griffith: Strong, wise, for thee who longest for his coming this Soma here flows to the bowls, O Indra.  He, chariot-borne, sun-bright, and truly potent, was poured forth like the longing of the pious.

verses.sanskrit: एष परत्नेन वयसा पुनानस्तिरो वर्पांसि दुहितुर्दधानः वसानः शर्म तरिवरूथमप्सु होतेव याति समनेषुरेभन |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa pratnena vayasā punānastiro varpāṃsi duhiturdadhānaḥ vasānaḥ śarma trivarūthamapsu hoteva yāti samaneṣurebhan

translations.griffith: He, purified with ancient vital vigour, pervading all his Daughter's forms and figures,  Finding his threefold refuge in the waters, goes singing, as a priest, to the assemblies.

verses.sanskrit: नू नस्त्वं रथिरो देव सोम परि सरव चम्वोः पूयमानः अप्सु सवादिष्ठो मधुमान रतावा देवो न यः सविता सत्यमन्मा |||
verses.transliteration: nū nastvaṃ rathiro deva soma pari srava camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ apsu svādiṣṭho madhumān ṛtāvā devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā

translations.griffith: Now, chariot-borne, flow unto us, God Soma, as thou art purified flow to the saucers,  Sweetest in waters, rich in meath, and holy, as Savitar the God is, truthfulminded.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वायुं वीत्यर्षा गर्णानो.अभि मित्रावरुणा पूयमानः अभी नरं धीजवनं रथेष्ठामभीन्द्रं वर्षणं वज्रबाहुम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vāyuṃ vītyarṣā ghṛṇāno.abhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ abhī naraṃ dhījavanaṃ ratheṣṭhāmabhīndraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhum

translations.griffith: To feast him, flow mid song and hymn, to Vāyu, flow purified to Varuṇa and Mitra.  Flow to the song-inspiring car-borne Hero, to mighty Indra, him who wields the thunder.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वस्त्रा सुवसनान्यर्षाभि धेनूः सुदुघाः पूयमानः अभि चन्द्रा भर्तवे नो हिरण्याभ्यश्वान रथिनो देव सोम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vastrā suvasanānyarṣābhi dhenūḥ sudughāḥ pūyamānaḥ abhi candrā bhartave no hiraṇyābhyaśvān rathino deva soma

translations.griffith: Pour on us garments that shall clothe us meetly, send, purified, miIch-kine, abundant yielders.  God Soma, send us chariot-drawing horses that they may bring us treasures bright and golden.

verses.sanskrit: अभी नो अर्ष दिव्या वसून्यभि विश्वा पार्थिवा पूयमानः अभि येन दरविणमश्नवामाभ्यर्षेयं जमदग्निवन्नः |||
verses.transliteration: abhī no arṣa divyā vasūnyabhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ abhi yena draviṇamaśnavāmābhyarṣeyaṃ jamadaghnivannaḥ

translations.griffith: Send to us in a stream celestial riches, send us, when thou art cleansed, what earth containeth,  So that thereby we may acquire possessions and Rsihood in Jamadagni's manner.

verses.sanskrit: अया पवा पवस्वैना वसूनि मांश्चत्व इन्दो सरसि पर धन्व बरध्नश्चिदत्र वातो न जातः पुरुमेधश्चित तकवे नरं दात |||
verses.transliteration: ayā pavā pavasvainā vasūni māṃścatva indo sarasi pra dhanva bradhnaścidatra vāto na jātaḥ purumedhaścit takave naraṃ dāt

translations.griffith: Pour forth this wealth with this purification: flow onward to the yellow lake, O Indu.  Here, too, the Ruddy, wind-swift, full of wisdom, Shall give a son to him who cometh quickly.

verses.sanskrit: उत न एना पवया पवस्वाधि शरुते शरवाय्यस्य तीर्थे षष्टिं सहस्रा नैगुतो वसूनि वर्क्षं न पक्वं धूनवद रणाय |||
verses.transliteration: uta na enā pavayā pavasvādhi śrute śravāyyasya tīrthe ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā naighuto vasūni vṛkṣaṃ na pakvaṃ dhūnavad raṇāya

translations.griffith: Flow on for us with this purification to the famed ford of thee whose due is glory.  May the Foe-queller shake us down, for triumph, like a tree's ripe fruit, sixty thousand treasures.

verses.sanskrit: महीमे अस्य वर्षनाम शूषे मांश्चत्वे वा पर्शने वा वधत्रे अस्वापयन निगुतः सनेहयच्चापामित्रानपाचितो अचेतः |||
verses.transliteration: mahīme asya vṛṣanāma śūṣe māṃścatve vā pṛśane vā vadhatre asvāpayan nighutaḥ snehayaccāpāmitrānapācito acetaḥ

translations.griffith: Eagerly do we pray for those two exploits, at the blue lake and Prsana, wrought in battle.  He sent our enemies to sleep and slew thern, and turned away the foolish and unfriendly.

verses.sanskrit: सं तरी पवित्रा विततान्येष्यन्वेकं धावसि पूयमानः असि भगो असि दात्रस्य दातासि मघवा मघवद्भ्य इन्दो |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ trī pavitrā vitatānyeṣyanvekaṃ dhāvasi pūyamānaḥ asi bhagho asi dātrasya dātāsi maghavā maghavadbhya indo

translations.griffith: Thou comest unto three extended filters, and hasteriest through each one as they cleanse thee.  Thou art the giver of the gift, a Bhaga, a Maghavan for liberal lords, O Indu.

verses.sanskrit: एष विश्ववित पवते मनीषी सोमो विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा दरप्सानीरयन विदथेष्विन्दुर्वि वारमव्यं समयाति याति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa viśvavit pavate manīṣī somo viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā drapsānīrayan vidatheṣvindurvi vāramavyaṃ samayāti yāti

translations.griffith: This Soma here, the Wise, the All-obtainer, flows on his way as King of all existence.  Driving the drops at our assemblies, Indu completely traverses the fleecy filter.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुं रिहन्ति महिषा अदब्धाः पदे रेभन्ति कवयो न गर्ध्राः हिन्वन्ति धीरा दशभिः कषिपाभिः समञ्जते रूपमपां रसेन |||
verses.transliteration: induṃ rihanti mahiṣā adabdhāḥ pade rebhanti kavayo na ghṛdhrāḥ hinvanti dhīrā daśabhiḥ kṣipābhiḥ samañjate rūpamapāṃ rasena

translations.griffith: The Great Inviolate are kissing Indu, and singing in his place like eager sages.  The wise men send him forth with ten swift fingers, and balm his form with essence of the waters.

verses.sanskrit: तवया वयं पवमानेन सोम भरे कर्तं वि चिनुयाम शश्वत तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्तामदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थिवीुत दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ pavamānena soma bhare kṛtaṃ vi cinuyāma śaśvat tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantāmaditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivīuta dyauḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, may we, with thee as Pavamana, pile up together all our spoil in battle.  This boon vouchsafe us Varuṇa and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अभि नो वाजसातमं रयिमर्ष पुरुस्प्र्हम इन्दो सहस्रभर्णसं तुविद्युम्नं विभ्वासहम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi no vājasātamaṃ rayimarṣa puruspṛham indo sahasrabharṇasaṃ tuvidyumnaṃ vibhvāsaham

translations.griffith: STREAM on us riches that are sought by many, best at winning strength  Riches, O Indu, thousandfold, glorious, conquering the great.

verses.sanskrit: परि षय सुवानो अव्ययं रथे न वर्माव्यत इन्दुरभिद्रुणा हितो हियानो धाराभिरक्षाः |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṣya suvāno avyayaṃ rathe na varmāvyata indurabhidruṇā hito hiyāno dhārābhirakṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Effused, he hath, as on a car, invested him in fleecy mail:  Onward hath Indu flowed in streams, impelled, surrounded by the wood.

verses.sanskrit: परि षय सुवानो अक्षा इन्दुरव्ये मदच्युतः धारा य ऊर्ध्वो अध्वरे भराजा नैति गव्ययुः |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṣya suvāno akṣā induravye madacyutaḥ dhārā ya ūrdhvo adhvare bhrājā naiti ghavyayuḥ

translations.griffith: Effused, this Indu hath flowed on, distilling rapture, to the fleece:  He goes erect, as seeking kine in stream, with light, to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: स हि तवं देव शश्वते वसु मर्ताय दाशुषे इन्दो सहस्रिणं रयिं शतात्मानं विवाससि |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi tvaṃ deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe indo sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ śatātmānaṃ vivāsasi

translations.griffith: For thou thyself, O Indu, God, to every mortal worshipper  Attractest riches thousandfold, made manifest in hundred forms.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते अस्य वर्त्रहन वसो वस्वः पुरुस्प्र्हः नि नेदिष्ठतमा इषः सयाम सुम्नस्याध्रिगो |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te asya vṛtrahan vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ ni nediṣṭhatamā iṣaḥ syāma sumnasyādhrigho

translations.griffith: Good Vṛtra-slayer, may we be still nearest to this wealth of thine  Which many crave, nearest to food and happiness, Resistless One!

verses.sanskrit: दविर्यं पञ्च सवयशसं सवसारो अद्रिसंहतम परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यं परस्नापयन्त्यूर्मिणम |||
verses.transliteration: dviryaṃ pañca svayaśasaṃ svasāro adrisaṃhatam priyamindrasya kāmyaṃ prasnāpayantyūrmiṇam

translations.griffith: Whom, bright with native splendour, crushed between the pair of pressingstones-  The wavy Friend whom Indra loves-the twice-five sisters dip and bathe,

verses.sanskrit: परि तयं हर्यतं हरिं बभ्रुं पुनन्ति वारेण यो देवान विश्वानित परि मदेन सह गछति |||
verses.transliteration: pari tyaṃ haryataṃ hariṃ babhruṃ punanti vāreṇa yo devān viśvānit pari madena saha ghachati

translations.griffith: Him with the fleece they purify, brown, golden-hued, beloved of all,  Who with exhilarating juice goes forth to all the Deities.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य वो हयवसा पान्तो दक्षसाधनम यः सूरिषु शरवोब्र्हद दधे सवर्ण हर्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: asya vo hyavasā pānto dakṣasādhanam yaḥ sūriṣu śravobṛhad dadhe svarṇa haryataḥ

translations.griffith: Through longing for this sap of yours ye drink what brings ability,  Even him who, dear as heaven's own light, gives to our princes high renown.

verses.sanskrit: स वां यज्ञेषु मानवी इन्दुर्जनिष्ट रोदसी देवो देवी गिरिष्ठा अस्रेधन तं तुविष्वणि |||
verses.transliteration: sa vāṃ yajñeṣu mānavī indurjaniṣṭa rodasī devo devī ghiriṣṭhā asredhan taṃ tuviṣvaṇi

translations.griffith: Indu at holy rites produced you, Heaven and Earth, the Friends of men,  Hill-haunting God the Goddesses. They bruised him where the roar was loud.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे वर्त्रघ्ने परि षिच्यसे नरे च दक्षिणावते देवाय सदनासदे |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya soma pātave vṛtraghne pari ṣicyase nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade

translations.griffith: For Vṛtra-slaying Indra, thou, Soma, art poured that he may drink,  Poured for the guerdon-giving man, poured for the God who sitteth there.

verses.sanskrit: ते परत्नासो वयुष्टिषु सोमाः पवित्रे अक्षरन अपप्रोथन्तः सनुतर्हुरश्चितः परातस्तानप्रचेतसः |||
verses.transliteration: te pratnāso vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran apaprothantaḥ sanutarhuraścitaḥ prātastānapracetasaḥ

translations.griffith: These ancient Somas, at the break of day, have flowed into the sieve,  Snorting away at early morn these foolish evil-hearted ones.

verses.sanskrit: तं सखायः पुरोरुचं यूयं वयं च सूरयः अश्याम वाजगन्ध्यं सनेम वाजपस्त्यम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ sakhāyaḥ purorucaṃ yūyaṃ vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ aśyāma vājaghandhyaṃ sanema vājapastyam

translations.griffith: Friends, may the princes, ye and we, obtain this Most Resplendent One.  Gain him who hath the smell of strength, win him whose home is very strength.

verses.sanskrit: आ हर्यताय धर्ष्णवे धनुस्तन्वन्ति पौंस्यम शुक्रांवयन्त्यसुराय निर्णिजं विपामग्रे महीयुवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanustanvanti pauṃsyam śukrāṃvayantyasurāya nirṇijaṃ vipāmaghre mahīyuvaḥ

translations.griffith: THEY for the Bold and Lovely One ply manly vigour like a bow:  joyous, in front of songs they weave bright raiment for the Lord Divine.

verses.sanskrit: अध कषपा परिष्क्र्तो वाजानभि पर गाहते यदी विवस्वतो धियो हरिं हिन्वन्ति यातवे |||
verses.transliteration: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛto vājānabhi pra ghāhate yadī vivasvato dhiyo hariṃ hinvanti yātave

translations.griffith: And he, made beautiful by night, dips forward into strengthening food',  What time the sacrificer's thoughts speed on his way the Golden-hued.

verses.sanskrit: तमस्य मर्जयामसि मदो य इन्द्रपातमः यं गाव आसभिर्दधुः पुरा नूनं च सूरयः |||
verses.transliteration: tamasya marjayāmasi mado ya indrapātamaḥ yaṃ ghāva āsabhirdadhuḥ purā nūnaṃ ca sūrayaḥ

translations.griffith: We cleanse this gladdening drink of his the juice which Indra chiefly drinks—-  That which kine took into their mouths, of old, and princes take it now.

verses.sanskrit: तं गाथया पुराण्या पुनानमभ्यनूषत उतो कर्पन्तधीतयो देवानां नाम बिभ्रतीः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ghāthayā purāṇyā punānamabhyanūṣata uto kṛpantadhītayo devānāṃ nāma bibhratīḥ

translations.griffith: To him, while purifying, they have raised the ancient psalm of praise:  And sacred songs which bear the names of Gods have supplicated him.

verses.sanskrit: तमुक्षमाणमव्यये वारे पुनन्ति धर्णसिम दूतं न पूर्वचित्तय आ शासते मनीषिणः |||
verses.transliteration: tamukṣamāṇamavyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim dūtaṃ na pūrvacittaya ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: They purify him as he drops, courageous, in the fleecy sieve.  Him they instruct as messenger to bear the sage's morning prayer.

verses.sanskrit: स पुनानो मदिन्तमः सोमश्चमूषु सीदति पशौ न रेत आदधत पतिर्वचस्यते धियः |||
verses.transliteration: sa punāno madintamaḥ somaścamūṣu sīdati paśau na reta ādadhat patirvacasyate dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, best Cheerer, takes his seat, the while they cleanse him in the bowls.  He as it were impregns the cow, and babbles on, the Lord of Song.

verses.sanskrit: स मर्ज्यते सुकर्मभिर्देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः विदे यदासु सन्ददिर्महीरपो वि गाहते |||
verses.transliteration: sa mṛjyate sukarmabhirdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ vide yadāsu sandadirmahīrapo vi ghāhate

translations.griffith: He is effused and beautified, a God for Gods, by skilful men.  He penetrates the mighty floods collecting all he knows therein.

verses.sanskrit: सुत इन्दो पवित्र आ नर्भिर्यतो वि नीयसे इन्द्राय मत्सरिन्तमश्चमूष्वा नि षीदसि |||
verses.transliteration: suta indo pavitra ā nṛbhiryato vi nīyase indrāya matsarintamaścamūṣvā ni ṣīdasi

translations.griffith: Pressed, Indu, guided by the men, thou art led to the cleaning sieve.  Thou, yielding Indra highest joy, takest thy seat within the bowls.

verses.sanskrit: अभी नवन्ते अद्रुहः परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यम वत्सं न पूर्व आयुनि जातं रिहन्ति मातरः |||
verses.transliteration: abhī navante adruhaḥ priyamindrasya kāmyam vatsaṃ na pūrva āyuni jātaṃ rihanti mātaraḥ

translations.griffith: THE Guileless Ones are singing praise to Indra's well beloved Friend,  As, in the morning of its life, the mothers lick the new-born calf.

verses.sanskrit: पुनान इन्दवा भर सोम दविबर्हसं रयिम तवं वसूनिपुष्यसि विश्वानि दाशुषो गर्हे |||
verses.transliteration: punāna indavā bhara soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim tvaṃ vasūnipuṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣo ghṛhe

translations.griffith: O Indu, while they cleanse thee bring, O Soma, doubly-waxing wealth  Thou in the worshipper's abode causest all treasures to increase.

verses.sanskrit: तवं धियं मनोयुजं सर्जा वर्ष्टिं न तन्यतुः तवं वसूनि पार्थिवा दिव्या च सोम पुष्यसि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dhiyaṃ manoyujaṃ sṛjā vṛṣṭiṃ na tanyatuḥ tvaṃ vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi

translations.griffith: Set free the. song which mind hath yoked, even as thunder frees the rain:  All treasures of the earth and heaven, O Soma, thou dost multiply.

verses.sanskrit: परि ते जिग्युषो यथा धारा सुतस्य धावति रंहमाणाव्यव्ययं वारं वाजीव सानसिः |||
verses.transliteration: pari te jighyuṣo yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati raṃhamāṇāvyavyayaṃ vāraṃ vājīva sānasiḥ

translations.griffith: Thy stream when thou art pressed runs on like some victorious warrior's steed  Hastening onward through the fleece like a fierce horse who wins the prize.

verses.sanskrit: करत्वे दक्षाय नः कवे पवस्व सोम धारया इन्द्राय पातवे सुतो मित्राय वरुणाय च |||
verses.transliteration: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā indrāya pātave suto mitrāya varuṇāya ca

translations.griffith: Flow on, Sage Soma, with thy stream to give us mental power and strength,  Effused for Indra, for his drink, for Mitra and for Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व वाजसातमः पवित्रे धारया सुतः इन्द्राय सोमविष्णवे देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva vājasātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ indrāya somaviṣṇave devebhyo madhumattamaḥ

translations.griffith: Flow to the filter with thy stream, effused, best winner, thou, of spoil,  O Soma, as most rich in sweets for Indra, Viṣṇu, and the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तवां रिहन्ति मातरो हरिं पवित्रे अद्रुहः वत्सं जातंन धेनवः पवमान विधर्मणि |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ rihanti mātaro hariṃ pavitre adruhaḥ vatsaṃ jātaṃna dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi

translations.griffith: The mothers, void of guiles, caress thee Golden-coloured, in the sieve,  As cows, O Pavamana, lick the new-born calf, as Law commands.

verses.sanskrit: पवमान महि शरवश्चित्रेभिर्यासि रश्मिभिः शर्धन तमांसि जिघ्नसे विश्वानि दाशुषो गर्हे |||
verses.transliteration: pavamāna mahi śravaścitrebhiryāsi raśmibhiḥ śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase viśvāni dāśuṣo ghṛhe

translations.griffith: Thou, Pavamana, movest on with wondrous rays to great renown.  Striving within the votary's house thou drivest all the glooms away.

verses.sanskrit: तवं दयां च महिव्रत पर्थिवीं चाति जभ्रिषे परति दरापिममुञ्चथाः पवमान महित्वना |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dyāṃ ca mahivrata pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe prati drāpimamuñcathāḥ pavamāna mahitvanā

translations.griffith: Lord of great sway, thou liftest thee above the heavens, above the earth.  Thou, Pavamana hast assumed thy coat of mail in majesty.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोजिती वो अन्धसः सुताय मादयित्नवे अप शवानं शनथिष्टन सखायो दीर्घजिह्व्यम |||
verses.transliteration: purojitī vo andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave apa śvānaṃ śnathiṣṭana sakhāyo dīrghajihvyam

translations.griffith: FOR first possession of your juice, for the exhilarating drink,  Drive ye away the dog, my friends, drive ye the long-tongued dog away.

verses.sanskrit: यो धारया पावकया परिप्रस्यन्दते सुतः इन्दुरश्वो न कर्त्व्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yo dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ induraśvo na kṛtvyaḥ

translations.griffith: He who with purifying stream, effused, comes flowing hitherward,  Indu, is like an able steed.

verses.sanskrit: तं दुरोषमभी नरः सोमं विश्वाच्या धिया यज्ञं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ duroṣamabhī naraḥ somaṃ viśvācyā dhiyā yajñaṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ

translations.griffith: The men with all-pervading song send unassailable Soma forth,  By pressing-stones, to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: सुतासो मधुमत्तमाः सोमा इन्द्राय मन्दिनः पवित्रवन्तोक्षरन देवान गछन्तु वो मदाः |||
verses.transliteration: sutāso madhumattamāḥ somā indrāya mandinaḥ pavitravantoakṣaran devān ghachantu vo madāḥ

translations.griffith: The Somas, very rich in sweets, for which the sieve is destined, flow,  Effused, the source of Indra's joy: may your strong juices reach the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुरिन्द्राय पवत इति देवासो अब्रुवन वाचस पतिर्मखस्यते विश्वस्येशान ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: indurindrāya pavata iti devāso abruvan vācas patirmakhasyate viśvasyeśāna ojasā

translations.griffith: Indu flows on for Indra's sake: thus have the Deities declared.  The Lord of Speech exerts himself, Ruler of all, because of might.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रधारः पवते समुद्रो वाचमीङखयः सोमः पती रयीणां सखेन्द्रस्य दिवे-दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ pavate samudro vācamīṅkhayaḥ somaḥ patī rayīṇāṃ sakhendrasya dive-dive

translations.griffith: Inciter of the voice of song, with thousand streams the ocean flows,  Even Soma, Lord of opulence, the Friend of Indra, day by day.

verses.sanskrit: अयं पूषा रयिर्भगः सोमः पुनानो अर्षति पतिर्विश्वस्य भूमनो वयख्यद रोदसी उभे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ pūṣā rayirbhaghaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati patirviśvasya bhūmano vyakhyad rodasī ubhe

translations.griffith: As Pūṣan, Fortune, Bhaga, comes this Soma while they make him pure.  He, Lord of the multitude, hath looked upon the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: समु परिया अनूषत गावो मदाय घर्ष्वयः सोमासः कर्ण्वते पथः पवमानास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: samu priyā anūṣata ghāvo madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: The dear cows lowed in joyful mood together to the gladdening drink.  The drops as they were purified, the Soma juices, made then paths.

verses.sanskrit: य ओजिष्ठस्तमा भर पवमन शरवाय्यम यः पञ्चचर्षणीरभि रयिं येन वनामहै |||
verses.transliteration: ya ojiṣṭhastamā bhara pavamana śravāyyam yaḥ pañcacarṣaṇīrabhi rayiṃ yena vanāmahai

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, bring the juice, the mightiest, worthy to be famed,  Which the Five Tribes have over them, whereby we may win opulence.

verses.sanskrit: सोमाः पवन्त इन्दवो.अस्मभ्यं गातुवित्तमः मित्राः सुवाना अरेपसः सवाध्यः सवर्विदः |||
verses.transliteration: somāḥ pavanta indavo.asmabhyaṃ ghātuvittamaḥ mitrāḥ suvānā arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svarvidaḥ

translations.griffith: For us the Soma juices flow, the drops best furtherers of our weal,  Effused as friends without a spot, benevolent, finders of the light.

verses.sanskrit: सुष्वाणासो वयद्रिभिश्चिताना गोरधि तवचि इषमस्मभ्यमभितः समस्वरन वसुविदः |||
verses.transliteration: suṣvāṇāso vyadribhiścitānā ghoradhi tvaci iṣamasmabhyamabhitaḥ samasvaran vasuvidaḥ

translations.griffith: Effused by means of pressing-stones, upon the ox-hide visible,  They, treasure-finders, have announced food unto us from every side.

verses.sanskrit: एते पूता विपश्चितः सोमासो दध्याशिरः सूर्यासो न दर्शतासो जिगत्नवो धरुवा घर्ते |||
verses.transliteration: ete pūtā vipaścitaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ sūryāso na darśatāso jighatnavo dhruvā ghṛte

translations.griffith: Tlese Soma juices, skilled in song, purified, blent with milk and curd,  When moving and when firmly laid in oil, resemble lovely Suns.

verses.sanskrit: पर सुन्वानस्यान्धसो मर्तो न वर्त तद वचः अप शवानमराधसं हता मखं न भर्गवः |||
verses.transliteration: pra sunvānasyāndhaso marto na vṛta tad vacaḥ apa śvānamarādhasaṃ hatā makhaṃ na bhṛghavaḥ

translations.griffith: Let not the power of men restrain the voice of the outpouring juice:  As Bhṛgu's sons chased Makha, so drive ye the greedy hound away.

verses.sanskrit: आ जामिरत्के अव्यत भुजे न पुत्र ओण्योः सरज्जारो न योषणां वरो न योनिमासदम |||
verses.transliteration: ā jāmiratke avyata bhuje na putra oṇyoḥ sarajjāro na yoṣaṇāṃ varo na yonimāsadam

translations.griffith: The Friend hath wrapped him in his robe, as in his parents arms, a son.  He went, as lover to a dame, to take his station suitor-like.

verses.sanskrit: स वीरो दक्षसाधनो वि यस्तस्तम्भ रोदसी हरिः पवित्रे अव्यत वेधा न योनिमासदम |||
verses.transliteration: sa vīro dakṣasādhano vi yastastambha rodasī hariḥ pavitre avyata vedhā na yonimāsadam

translations.griffith: That Hero who produces strength, he who hath propped both worlds apart,  Gold-hued, hath wrapped him in the sieve, to settle, priest-like, in his place.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यो वारेभिः पवते सोमो गव्ये अधि तवचि कनिक्रदद वर्षा हरिरिन्द्रस्याभ्येति निष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: avyo vārebhiḥ pavate somo ghavye adhi tvaci kanikradad vṛṣā haririndrasyābhyeti niṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: Soma upon the ox's skin through the sheep's wool flows purified.  Bellowing out, the Tawny Steer goes on to Indra's special place.

verses.sanskrit: कराणा शिशुर्महीनां हिन्वन्न्र्तस्य दीधितिम विश्वापरि परिया भुवदध दविता |||
verses.transliteration: krāṇā śiśurmahīnāṃ hinvannṛtasya dīdhitim viśvāpari priyā bhuvadadha dvitā

translations.griffith: THE Child, when blended with the streams, speeding the plan of sacrifice,  Surpasses all things that are dear, yea, from of old.

verses.sanskrit: उप तरितस्य पाष्योरभक्त यद गुहा पदम यज्ञस्य सप्त धामभिरध परियम |||
verses.transliteration: upa tritasya pāṣyorabhakta yad ghuhā padam yajñasya sapta dhāmabhiradha priyam

translations.griffith: The place, near the two pressing-stones of Trita, hath he occupied,  Secret and dear through seven lights of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि तरितस्य धारया पर्ष्ठेष्वेरया रयिम मिमीते अस्य योजना वि सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi tritasya dhārayā pṛṣṭheṣverayā rayim mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Urge to three courses, on the heights of Trita, riches in a stream.  He who is passing wise measures his courses out.

verses.sanskrit: जज्ञानं सप्त मातरो वेधामशासत शरिये अयं धरुवो रयीणां चिकेत यत |||
verses.transliteration: jajñānaṃ sapta mātaro vedhāmaśāsata śriye ayaṃ dhruvo rayīṇāṃ ciketa yat

translations.griffith: Even at his birth the Mothers Seven taught him, for glory, like a sage,  So that he, firm and sure, hath set his mind on wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य वरते सजोषसो विश्वे देवासो अद्रुहः सपार्हा भवन्ति रन्तयो जुषन्त यत |||
verses.transliteration: asya vrate sajoṣaso viśve devāso adruhaḥ spārhā bhavanti rantayo juṣanta yat

translations.griffith: Under his sway, of one accord, are all the guileless Deities:  Warriors to be envied, they, when they are pleased.

verses.sanskrit: यमी गर्भं रताव्र्धो दर्शे चारुमजीजनन कविं मंहिष्ठमध्वरे पुरुस्प्र्हम |||
verses.transliteration: yamī gharbhaṃ ṛtāvṛdho dṛśe cārumajījanan kaviṃ maṃhiṣṭhamadhvare puruspṛham

translations.griffith: The Babe whom they who strengthen Law have generated fair to see,  Much longed for at the sacrifice, most liberal Sage,—

verses.sanskrit: समीचीने अभि तमना यह्वी रतस्य मातरा तन्वाना यज्ञमानुषग यदञ्जते |||
verses.transliteration: samīcīne abhi tmanā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā tanvānā yajñamānuṣagh yadañjate

translations.griffith: To him, united, of themselves, come the young Parents of the rite,  When they adorn him, duly weaving sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: करत्वा शुक्रेभिरक्षभिरणोरप वरजं दिवः हिन्वन्न्र्तस्य दीधितिं पराध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: kratvā śukrebhirakṣabhirṇorapa vrajaṃ divaḥ hinvannṛtasya dīdhitiṃ prādhvare

translations.griffith: With wisdom and with radiant eyes unbar to us the stall of heaven,  Speeding at solemn rite the plan of Holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: पर पुनानाय वेधसे सोमाय वच उद्यतम भर्तिं न भरा मतिभिर्जुजोषते |||
verses.transliteration: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vaca udyatam bhṛtiṃ na bharā matibhirjujoṣate

translations.griffith: To Soma who is purified as ordering Priest the song is raised:  Bring meed, as ’twere, to one who makes thee glad with hymns.

verses.sanskrit: परि वाराण्यव्यया गोभिरञ्जानो अर्षति तरी षधस्था पुनानः कर्णुते हरिः |||
verses.transliteration: pari vārāṇyavyayā ghobhirañjāno arṣati trī ṣadhasthā punānaḥ kṛṇute hariḥ

translations.griffith: Blended with milk and curds he flows on through the long wool of the sheep.  The Gold-hued, purified, makes him three seats for rest.

verses.sanskrit: परि कोशं मधुश्चुतमव्यये वारे अर्षति अभि वाणीरषीणां सप्त नूषत |||
verses.transliteration: pari kośaṃ madhuścutamavyaye vāre arṣati abhi vāṇīrṣīṇāṃ sapta nūṣata

translations.griffith: On through the long wool of the sheep to the meath-dropping vat he flows:  The Ṛṣis’ sevenfold quire hath sung aloud to him.

verses.sanskrit: परि णेता मतीनां विश्वदेवो अदाभ्यः सोमः पुनानश्चम्वोर्विशद धरिः |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṇetā matīnāṃ viśvadevo adābhyaḥ somaḥ punānaścamvorviśad dhariḥ

translations.griffith: Shared by all Gods, Infallible, the Leader of our holy hymns,  Golden-hued Soma, being cleansed, hath reached the bowls.

verses.sanskrit: परि दैवीरनु सवधा इन्द्रेण याहि सरथम पुनानो वाघद वाघद्भिरमर्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pari daivīranu svadhā indreṇa yāhi saratham punāno vāghad vāghadbhiramartyaḥ

translations.griffith: After thy Godlike qualities, associate with Indra, go,  As a Priest purified by priests, Immortal One.

verses.sanskrit: परि सप्तिर्न वाजयुर्देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः वयानशिः पवमानो वि धावति |||
verses.transliteration: pari saptirna vājayurdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ vyānaśiḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati

translations.griffith: Like a car-horse who shows his strength, a God effused for Deities.  The penetrating Pavamana flows along.

verses.sanskrit: सखाय आ नि शीदत पुनानाय पर गायत शिशुं न यज्ञैः परि भूषत शरिये |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāya ā ni śīdata punānāya pra ghāyata śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye

translations.griffith: SIT down, O friends, and sing aloud to him who purifies himself:  Deck him for glory, like a child, with holy rites.

verses.sanskrit: समी वत्सं न मात्र्भिः सर्जता गयसाधनम देवाव्यम्मदमभि दविशवसम |||
verses.transliteration: samī vatsaṃ na mātṛbhiḥ sṛjatā ghayasādhanam devāvyammadamabhi dviśavasam

translations.griffith: Unite him bringing household wealth, even as a calf, with mother kine,  Him who hath double strength, the God, delighting juice.

verses.sanskrit: पुनाता दक्षसाधनं यथा शर्धाय वीतये यथा मित्राय वरुणाय शन्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: punātā dakṣasādhanaṃ yathā śardhāya vītaye yathā mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ

translations.griffith: Purify him who gives us power, that he, most Blessed One, may be  A banquet for the Troop, Mitra, and Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं तवा वसुविदमभि वाणीरनूषत गोभिष टे वर्णमभि वासयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tvā vasuvidamabhi vāṇīranūṣata ghobhiṣ ṭe varṇamabhi vāsayāmasi

translations.griffith: Voices have sung aloud to thee as finderout of wealth for us:  We clothe the hue thou wearest with a robe of milk.

verses.sanskrit: स नो मदानां पत इन्दो देवप्सरा असि सखेव सख्ये गातुवित्तमो भव |||
verses.transliteration: sa no madānāṃ pata indo devapsarā asi sakheva sakhye ghātuvittamo bhava

translations.griffith: Thou, Indu, art the food of Gods, O Sovran of all gladdening drinks:  As Friend for friend, be thou best finder of success.

verses.sanskrit: सनेमि कर्ध्यस्मदा रक्षसं कं चिदत्रिणम अपादेवं दवयुमंहो युयोधि नः |||
verses.transliteration: sanemi kṛdhyasmadā rakṣasaṃ kaṃ cidatriṇam apādevaṃ dvayumaṃho yuyodhi naḥ

translations.griffith: Drive utterly away from us each demon, each voracious fiend,  The godless and the false: keep sorrow far away.

verses.sanskrit: तं वः सखायो मदाय पुनानमभि गायत शिशुं न यज्ञैः सवदयन्त गूर्तिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyo madāya punānamabhi ghāyata śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ svadayanta ghūrtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: SING; ye aloud, O friends, to him who makes him pure for gladdening drink:  They shall make sweet the Child with sacrifice and laud.

verses.sanskrit: सं वत्स इव मात्र्भिरिन्दुर्हिन्वानो अज्यते देवावीर्मदोमतिभिः परिष्क्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ vatsa iva mātṛbhirindurhinvāno ajyate devāvīrmadomatibhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: Like as a calf with mother cows, so Indu is urged forth and sent,  Glorified by our hymns, the God-delighting juice.

verses.sanskrit: अयं दक्षाय साधनो.अयं शर्धाय वीतये अयं देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमः सुतः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ dakṣāya sādhano.ayaṃ śardhāya vītaye ayaṃ devebhyo madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ

translations.griffith: Effectual means of power is he, he is a banquet for the Troop,  He who hath been effused, most rich in meath, for Gods.

verses.sanskrit: गोमन न इन्दो अश्ववत सुतः सुदक्ष धन्व शुचिं ते वर्णमधि गोषु दीधरम |||
verses.transliteration: ghoman na indo aśvavat sutaḥ sudakṣa dhanva śuciṃ te varṇamadhi ghoṣu dīdharam

translations.griffith: Flow to us, Indu, passing, strong, effused, with wealth of kine and steeds:  I will spread forth above the milk thy radiant hue.

verses.sanskrit: स नो हरीणां पत इन्दो देवप्सरस्तमः सखेव सख्ये नर्यो रुचे भव |||
verses.transliteration: sa no harīṇāṃ pata indo devapsarastamaḥ sakheva sakhye naryo ruce bhava

translations.griffith: Lord of the tawny, Indu thou who art the God's most special food,  As Friend to friend, for splendour be thou good to men.

verses.sanskrit: सनेमि तवमस्मदानदेवं कं चिदत्रिणम साह्वानिन्दो परि बाधो अप दवयुम |||
verses.transliteration: sanemi tvamasmadānadevaṃ kaṃ cidatriṇam sāhvānindo pari bādho apa dvayum

translations.griffith: Drive utterly, far away from us each godless, each voracious foe.  O Indu, overcome and drive the false afar.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमछ सुता इमे वर्षणं यन्तु हरयः शरुष्टी जातास इन्दवः सवर्विदः |||
verses.transliteration: indramacha sutā ime vṛṣaṇaṃ yantu harayaḥ śruṣṭī jātāsa indavaḥ svarvidaḥ

translations.griffith: To Indra, to the Mighty Steer, may these gold-coloured juices go,  Drops rapidly produced, that find the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अयं भराय सानसिरिन्द्राय पवते सुतः सोमो जैत्रस्यचेतति यथा विदे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ bharāya sānasirindrāya pavate sutaḥ somo jaitrasyacetati yathā vide

translations.griffith: Effused, this juice victorious flows for Indra, for his maintenance.  Soma bethinks him of the Conqueror, as he knows.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदिन्द्रो मदेष्वा गराभं गर्भ्णीत सानसिम वज्रंच वर्षणं भरत समप्सुजित |||
verses.transliteration: asyedindro madeṣvā ghrābhaṃ ghṛbhṇīta sānasim vajraṃca vṛṣaṇaṃ bharat samapsujit

translations.griffith: May Indra in his raptures gain from him the grasp that gathers spoil,  And, winning waters, wield the steerstrong thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: पर धन्वा सोम जाग्र्विरिन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव दयुमन्तं शुष्ममा भरा सवर्विदम |||
verses.transliteration: pra dhanvā soma jāghṛvirindrāyendo pari srava dyumantaṃ śuṣmamā bharā svarvidam

translations.griffith: Flow vigilant for Indra, thou Soma, yea, Indu, run thou on:  Bring hither splendid strength that finds the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय वर्षणं मदं पवस्व विश्वदर्शतः सहस्रयामा पथिक्र्द विचक्षणः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya vṛṣaṇaṃ madaṃ pavasva viśvadarśataḥ sahasrayāmā pathikṛd vicakṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Do thou, all-beautiful, purify for Indra's sake the mighty juice,  Path-maker thou, far seeing, with a thousand ways.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं गातुवित्तमो देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमः सहस्रं याहिपथिभिः कनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ ghātuvittamo devebhyo madhumattamaḥ sahasraṃ yāhipathibhiḥ kanikradat

translations.griffith: Best finder of prosperity for us, most rich in sweets for Gods,  Proceed thou loudly roaring on a thousand paths.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व देववीतय इन्दो धाराभिरोजसा आ कलशं मधुमान सोम नः सदः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva devavītaya indo dhārābhirojasā ā kalaśaṃ madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indu, with thy streams, in might, flow for the banquet of the Gods:  Rich in meath, Soma, in our beaker take thy place.

verses.sanskrit: तव दरप्सा उदप्रुत इन्द्रं मदाय वाव्र्धुः तवां देवासो अम्र्ताय कं पपुः |||
verses.transliteration: tava drapsā udapruta indraṃ madāya vāvṛdhuḥ tvāṃ devāso amṛtāya kaṃ papuḥ

translations.griffith: Thy drops that swim in water have exalted Indra to delight:  The Gods have drunk thee up for immortality.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः सुतास इन्दवः पुनाना धावता रयिम वर्ष्टिद्यावोरीत्यापः सवर्विदः |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ sutāsa indavaḥ punānā dhāvatā rayim vṛṣṭidyāvorītyāpaḥ svarvidaḥ

translations.griffith: Stream opulence to us, ye drops of Soma, pressed and purified,  Pouring down rain from heaven in hoods, and finding light.

verses.sanskrit: सोमः पुनान ऊर्मिणाव्यो वारं वि धावति अग्रे वाचःपवमानः कनिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: somaḥ punāna ūrmiṇāvyo vāraṃ vi dhāvati aghre vācaḥpavamānaḥ kanikradat

translations.griffith: Soma, while filtered, with his wave flows through the long wool of the sheep,  Shouting while purified before the voice of song.

verses.sanskrit: धीभिर्हिन्वन्ति वाजिनं वने करीळन्तमत्यविम अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठं मतयः समस्वरन |||
verses.transliteration: dhībhirhinvanti vājinaṃ vane krīḷantamatyavim abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ matayaḥ samasvaran

translations.griffith: With songs they send the Mighty forth, sporting in wood, above the fleece:  Our psalms have glorified him of the triple height.

verses.sanskrit: असर्जि कलशानभि मीळ्हे सप्तिर्न वाजयुः पुनानो वाचं जनयन्नसिष्यदत |||
verses.transliteration: asarji kalaśānabhi mīḷhe saptirna vājayuḥ punāno vācaṃ janayannasiṣyadat

translations.griffith: Into the jars hath he been loosed, like an impetuous steed for war,  And lifting up his voice, while filtered, glided on.

verses.sanskrit: पवते हर्यतो हरिरति हवरांसि रंह्या अभ्यर्षन सतोत्र्भ्यो वीरवद यशः |||
verses.transliteration: pavate haryato harirati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā abhyarṣan stotṛbhyo vīravad yaśaḥ

translations.griffith: Gold-hued and lovely in his course, througb tangles of the wool he flows,  And pours heroic fame upon the worshippers.

verses.sanskrit: अया पवस्व देवयुर्मधोर्धारा अस्र्क्षत रेभन पवित्रम्पर्येषि विश्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: ayā pavasva devayurmadhordhārā asṛkṣata rebhan pavitramparyeṣi viśvataḥ

translations.griffith: Flow thus, a faithful votary: the streams of meath have been effused.  Thou comest to the filter, singing, from each side.

verses.sanskrit: परीतो षिञ्चता सुतं सोमो य उत्तमं हविः दधन्वान्यो नर्यो अप्स्वन्तरा सुषाव सोममद्रिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: parīto ṣiñcatā sutaṃ somo ya uttamaṃ haviḥ dadhanvānyo naryo apsvantarā suṣāva somamadribhiḥ

translations.griffith: I., HENCE sprinkle forth the juice effused,. Soma, the best of sacred gifts,  Who, friend of man, hath run amid the water-streams. He hath pressed Soma out with stones.

verses.sanskrit: नूनं पुनानो.अविभिः परि सरवादब्धः सुरभिन्तरः सुते चित तवाप्सु मदामो अन्धसा शरीणन्तो गोभिरुत्तरम |||
verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ punāno.avibhiḥ pari sravādabdhaḥ surabhintaraḥ sute cit tvāpsu madāmo andhasā śrīṇanto ghobhiruttaram

translations.griffith: Now, being purified, flow hither through the fleece inviolate and most odorous.  We ladden thee in waters when thou art effused, blending thee still with juice and milk.

verses.sanskrit: परि सुवानश्चक्षसे देवमादनः करतुरिन्दुर्विचक्षणः ||
verses.transliteration: pari suvānaścakṣase devamādanaḥ kraturindurvicakṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Pressed out for all to see, delighting Gods, Indu, Far-sighted One, is mental power.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानः सोम धारयापो वसानो अर्षसि आ रत्नधा योनिम्र्तस्य सीदस्युत्सो देव हिरण्ययः |||
verses.transliteration: punānaḥ soma dhārayāpo vasāno arṣasi ā ratnadhā yonimṛtasya sīdasyutso deva hiraṇyayaḥ

translations.griffith: Cleansing thee, Soma, in thy stream, thou flowest in a watery robe:  Giver of wealth, thou sittest in the place of Law, O God, a fountain made of gold.

verses.sanskrit: दुहान ऊधर्दिव्यं मधु परियं परत्नं सधस्थमासदत आप्र्छ्यं धरुणं वाज्यर्षति नर्भिर्धूतो विचक्षणः |||
verses.transliteration: duhāna ūdhardivyaṃ madhu priyaṃ pratnaṃ sadhasthamāsadat āpṛchyaṃ dharuṇaṃ vājyarṣati nṛbhirdhūto vicakṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Milking the heavenly udder for dear meath, he hath sat in the ancient gatheringplace.  Washed by the men, the Strong Farseeing One streams forth nutriti us food that all desire.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानः सोम जाग्र्विरव्यो वारे परि परियः तवं विप्रोभवो.अङगिरस्तमो मध्वा यज्ञं मिमिक्ष नः |||
verses.transliteration: punānaḥ soma jāghṛviravyo vāre pari priyaḥ tvaṃ viproabhavo.aṅghirastamo madhvā yajñaṃ mimikṣa naḥ

translations.griffith: O Soma, while they cleanse thee, dear and watchful in the sheep's long wool,  Thou hast become a Singer most like Aṅgiras: thou madest Sūrya mount to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो मीढ्वान पवते गातुवित्तम रषिर्विप्रो विचक्षणः तवं कविरभवो देववीतम आ सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: somo mīḍhvān pavate ghātuvittama ṛṣirvipro vicakṣaṇaḥ tvaṃ kavirabhavo devavītama ā sūryaṃ rohayo divi

translations.griffith: Bountiful, best of furtherers, Soma floweth on, Ṛṣi and Singer, keen of sight.  Thou hast become a Sage most welcome to the Gods: thou madest Sūrya mount to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सोम उ षुवाणः सोत्र्भिरधि षणुभिरवीनाम अश्वयेवहरित याति धारया मन्द्रया याति धारया |||
verses.transliteration: soma u ṣuvāṇaḥ sotṛbhiradhi ṣṇubhiravīnām aśvayevaharita yāti dhārayā mandrayā yāti dhārayā

translations.griffith: Pressed out by pressers, Soma goes over the fleecy backs of sheep,  Goes, even as with a mare, in tawnycoloured stream, goes in exhilarating stream.

verses.sanskrit: अनूपे गोमान गोभिरक्षाः सोमो दुग्धाभिरक्षाः समुद्रं न संवरणान्यग्मन मन्दी मदाय तोशते |||
verses.transliteration: anūpe ghomān ghobhirakṣāḥ somo dughdhābhirakṣāḥ samudraṃ na saṃvaraṇānyaghman mandī madāya tośate

translations.griffith: Down to the water-Soma, rich in kine hath flowed with cows, with cows that have been milked.  They have approached the mixing-vessel as a sea: the cheerer streams for the carouse.

verses.sanskrit: आ सोम सुवानो अद्रिभिस्तिरो वाराण्यव्यया जनो न पुरि चम्वोर्विशद धरिः सदो वनेषु दधिषे |||
verses.transliteration: ā soma suvāno adribhistiro vārāṇyavyayā jano na puri camvorviśad dhariḥ sado vaneṣu dadhiṣe

translations.griffith: Effused by stones, O Soma, and urged through the long wool of the sheep,  Thou, entering the saucers as a man the fort, gold-hued hast settled in the wood.

verses.sanskrit: स माम्र्जे तिरो अण्वानि मेष्यो मीळ्हे सप्तिर्न वजयुः अनुमाद्यः पवमानो मनीषिभिः सोमो विप्रेभिरकवभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa māmṛje tiro aṇvāni meṣyo mīḷhe saptirna vajayuḥ anumādyaḥ pavamāno manīṣibhiḥ somo viprebhirkvabhiḥ

translations.griffith: He beautifies himself through the sheep's long fine wool, like an impetuous steed in war,  Even Soma Pavamana who shall be the joy of sages and of holy bards.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोम देववीतये सिन्धुर्न पिप्ये अर्णसा अंशोः पयसामदिरो न जाग्र्विरछा कोशं मधुश्चुतम ||
verses.transliteration: pra soma devavītaye sindhurna pipye arṇasā aṃśoḥ payasāmadiro na jāghṛvirachā kośaṃ madhuścutam

translations.griffith: O Soma,—for the feast of Gods, river-like he hath swelled with surge,  With the stalk's juice, exhilarating, resting not, into the vat that drops with meath.

verses.sanskrit: आ हर्यतो अर्जुने अत्के अव्यत परियः सूनुर्न मर्ज्यः तमीं हिन्वन्त्यपसो यथा रथं नदीष्वा गभस्त्योः |||
verses.transliteration: ā haryato arjune atke avyata priyaḥ sūnurna marjyaḥ tamīṃ hinvantyapaso yathā rathaṃ nadīṣvā ghabhastyoḥ

translations.griffith: Like a dear son who must be decked, the Lovely One hath clad him in a shining robe.  Men skilful at their work drive him forth, like a car, into the rivers from their bands.

verses.sanskrit: अभि सोमास आयवः पवन्ते मद्यं मदम समुद्रस्याधि विष्टपि मनीषिणो मत्सरासः सवर्विदः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi somāsa āyavaḥ pavante madyaṃ madam samudrasyādhi viṣṭapi manīṣiṇo matsarāsaḥ svarvidaḥ

translations.griffith: The living drops of Soma juice pour, as they flow, the gladdening drink,  Intelligent drops above the basin of the sea, exhilarating, finding light.

verses.sanskrit: तरत समुद्रं पवमान ऊर्मिणा राजा देव रतं बर्हत अर्षन मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धर्मणा पर हिन्वान रतं बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: tarat samudraṃ pavamāna ūrmiṇā rājā deva ṛtaṃ bṛhat arṣan mitrasya varuṇasya dharmaṇā pra hinvāna ṛtaṃ bṛhat

translations.griffith: May Pavamana, King and God, speed with his wave over the sea the lofty rite:  May he by Mitra's and by Varuṇa's decree flow furthering the lofty rite.

verses.sanskrit: नर्भिर्येमानो हर्यतो विचक्षणो राजा देवः समुद्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: nṛbhiryemāno haryato vicakṣaṇo rājā devaḥ samudriyaḥ

translations.griffith: Far-seeing, lovely, guided by the men, the God whose home is in the sea-

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय पवते मदः सोमो मरुत्वते सुतः सहस्रधारो अत्यव्यमर्षति तमीं मर्जन्त्यायवः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya pavate madaḥ somo marutvate sutaḥ sahasradhāro atyavyamarṣati tamīṃ mṛjantyāyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, the gladdening juice, flows pressed for Indra with his Marut host:  He hastens o’er the fleece with all his thousand streams: men make him bright and beautiful.

verses.sanskrit: पुनानश्चमू जनयन मतिं कविः सोमो देवेषु रण्यति अपो वसानः परि गोभिरुत्तरः सीदन वनेष्वव्यत |||
verses.transliteration: punānaścamū janayan matiṃ kaviḥ somo deveṣu raṇyati apo vasānaḥ pari ghobhiruttaraḥ sīdan vaneṣvavyata

translations.griffith: Purified in the bowl and gendering the hymn, wise Soma joys among the Gods.  Robed in the flood, the Mighty One hath clad himself with milk and settled in the vats.

verses.sanskrit: तवाहं सोम रारण सख्य इन्दो दिवे-दिवे पुरूणि बभ्रो नि चरन्ति मामव परिधीन्रति तानिहि |||
verses.transliteration: tavāhaṃ soma rāraṇa sakhya indo dive-dive purūṇi babhro ni caranti māmava paridhīnrati tānihi

translations.griffith: O Soma, Indu, every day thy friendship hath been my delight.  Many fiends follow me; help me, thou Tawny-hued; pass on beyond these barriers.

verses.sanskrit: उताहं नक्तमुत सोम ते दिवा सख्याय बभ्र ऊधनि घर्णा तपन्तमति सूर्यं परः शकुना इव पप्तिम |||
verses.transliteration: utāhaṃ naktamuta soma te divā sakhyāya babhra ūdhani ghṛṇā tapantamati sūryaṃ paraḥ śakunā iva paptima

translations.griffith: Close to thy bosom am I, Soma, day and night. O Tawny-hued, for friendship sake.  Sūrya himself refulgent with his glow have we o’ertaken in his course like birds.

verses.sanskrit: मर्ज्यमानः सुहस्त्य समुद्रे वाचमिन्वसि रयिं पिशन्गं बहुलं पुरुस्प्र्हं पवमानाभ्यर्षसि |||
verses.transliteration: mṛjyamānaḥ suhastya samudre vācaminvasi rayiṃ piśanghaṃ bahulaṃ puruspṛhaṃ pavamānābhyarṣasi

translations.griffith: Deft-handcd! thou when purified liftest thy voice amid the sea.  Thou, Pavamana, makest riches flow to us, yellow, abundant, much-desifed.

verses.sanskrit: मर्जानो वारे पवमनो अव्यये वर्षाव चक्रदो वने देवानां सोम पवमान निष्क्र्तं गोभिरञ्जानो अर्षसि |||
verses.transliteration: mṛjāno vāre pavamano avyaye vṛṣāva cakrado vane devānāṃ soma pavamāna niṣkṛtaṃ ghobhirañjāno arṣasi

translations.griffith: Making thee pure and bright in the sheep's long wool, thou hast bellowed, steerlike, in the wood.  Thou flowest, Soma Pavamana, balmed with milk unto the special place of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व वाजसातये.अभि विश्वानि काव्या तवं समुद्रं परथमो वि धारयो देवेभ्यः सोम मत्सरः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva vājasātaye.abhi viśvāni kāvyā tvaṃ samudraṃ prathamo vi dhārayo devebhyaḥ soma matsaraḥ

translations.griffith: Flow on to win us strength, flow on to lofty lore of every kind.  Thou, Soma, as Exhilarator wast the first to spread the sea abroad for Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स तू पवस्व परि पार्थिवं रजो दिव्या च सोम धर्मभिः तवां विप्रासो मतिभिर्विचक्षण शुभ्रं हिन्वन्ति धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṃ rajo divyā ca soma dharmabhiḥ tvāṃ viprāso matibhirvicakṣaṇa śubhraṃ hinvanti dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Flow to the realm of earth, flow to the realm of heaven, O Soma, in thy righteous ways.  Fair art thou whom the sages, O Far-seeing One, urge onward with their songs and hymns.

verses.sanskrit: पवमाना अस्र्क्षत पवित्रमति धारया मरुत्वन्तो मत्सरा इन्द्रिया हया मेधामभि परयांसि च |||
verses.transliteration: pavamānā asṛkṣata pavitramati dhārayā marutvanto matsarā indriyā hayā medhāmabhi prayāṃsi ca

translations.griffith: Over the cleansing sieve have flowed the Pavamanas in a stream,  Girt by the Maruts, gladdening, Steeds with Indra's stiength, for wisdom and for dainty food.

verses.sanskrit: अपो वसानः परि कोशमर्षतिन्दुर्हियानः सोत्र्भिः जनयञ जयोतिर्मन्दना अवीवशद गाः कर्ण्वानो न निर्णिजम |||
verses.transliteration: apo vasānaḥ pari kośamarṣatindurhiyānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ janayañ jyotirmandanā avīvaśad ghāḥ kṛṇvāno na nirṇijam

translations.griffith: Urged onward by the pressers, clad in watery robes, Indu is speeding to the vat.  He gendering light, hath made the glad Cows low, while he takes them as his garb of state.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व मधुमत्तम इन्द्राय सोम करतुवित्तमो मदः महि दयुक्षतमो मदः |||
verses.transliteration: pavasva madhumattama indrāya soma kratuvittamo madaḥ mahi dyukṣatamo madaḥ

translations.griffith: FOR Indra, flow thou Soma on, as gladdening juice most sweet, intelligent,  Great, cheering, dwelling most in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य ते पीत्वा वर्षभो वर्षायते.अस्य पीता सवर्विदः स सुप्रकेतो अभ्यक्रमीदिशो.अछा वाजं नैतशः |||
verses.transliteration: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabho vṛṣāyate.asya pītā svarvidaḥ sa supraketo abhyakramīdiśo.achā vājaṃ naitaśaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, of whom having drunk the Steer acts like a steer. drinking of this that finds the light,  He, Excellently Wise, is come to strengthening food, to spoil and wealth like Etaśa.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हयन्ग दैव्या पवमान जनिमानि दयुमत्तमः अम्र्तत्वाय घोषयः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hyangha daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ amṛtatvāya ghoṣayaḥ

translations.griffith: For, verily, Pavamana, thou hast, splendidest, called all the generations of  The Gods to immortality.

verses.sanskrit: येना नवग्वो दध्यन्नपोर्णुते येन विप्रास आपिरे देवानां सुम्ने अम्र्तस्य चारुणो येन शरवांस्यानशुः |||
verses.transliteration: yenā navaghvo dadhyannaporṇute yena viprāsa āpire devānāṃ sumne amṛtasya cāruṇo yena śravāṃsyānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: By whom Dadhyac Navagva opens fastened doors, by whom the sages gained their wish,  By whom they won the fame of lovely Amṛta in the felicity of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय धारया सुतो.अव्यो वारेभिः पवते मदिन्तमः करीळन्नूर्मिरपामिव |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya dhārayā suto.avyo vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ krīḷannūrmirapāmiva

translations.griffith: Effused, he floweth in a stream, best rapture-giver, in the long wool of the sheep,  Sporting, as ’twere the waters' wave.

verses.sanskrit: य उस्रिया अप्या अन्तरश्मनो निर्गा अक्र्न्तदोजसा अभिव्रजं तत्निषे गव्यमश्व्यं वर्मीव धर्ष्णवा रुज |||
verses.transliteration: ya usriyā apyā antaraśmano nirghā akṛntadojasā abhivrajaṃ tatniṣe ghavyamaśvyaṃ varmīva dhṛṣṇavā ruja

translations.griffith: He who from out the rocky cavern took with might the redmrefulgent watery Cows,  Thou masterest the stable full of kine and steeds: burst it, brave Lord, like one in mail.

verses.sanskrit: आ सोता परि षिञ्चताश्वं न सतोममप्तुरं रजस्तुरम वनर्क्षमुदप्रुतम |||
verses.transliteration: ā sotā pari ṣiñcatāśvaṃ na stomamapturaṃ rajasturam vanaṛkṣamudaprutam

translations.griffith: Press ye and pour him, like a steed, laudworthy, speeding through the region and the flood,  Who swims in water, roan in wood;

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रधारं वर्षभं पयोव्र्धं परियं देवाय जन्मने रतेन य रतजातो विवाव्र्धे राजा देव रतं बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ payovṛdhaṃ priyaṃ devāya janmane ṛtena ya ṛtajāto vivāvṛdhe rājā deva ṛtaṃ bṛhat

translations.griffith: Increaser of the water, Steer with thousand streams, dear to the race of Deities;  Who born in Law hath waxen mighty by the Law, King, God, and lofty Ordinance.

verses.sanskrit: अभि दयुम्नं बर्हद यश इषस पते दिदीहि देव देवयुः विकोशं मध्यमं युव |||
verses.transliteration: abhi dyumnaṃ bṛhad yaśa iṣas pate didīhi deva devayuḥ vikośaṃ madhyamaṃ yuva

translations.griffith: Make splendid glory shine on us, thou Lord of strengthening food, God, as the Friend of Gods:  Unclose the fount of middle air.

verses.sanskrit: आ वच्यस्व सुदक्ष चम्वोः सुतो विशां वह्निर्न विश्पतिः वर्ष्टिं दिवः पवस्व रीतिमपां जिन्वा गविष्टये धियः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vacyasva sudakṣa camvoḥ suto viśāṃ vahnirna viśpatiḥ vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ pavasva rītimapāṃ jinvā ghaviṣṭaye dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Roll onward to the bowls, O Mighty One, effused, as Prince supporter of the tribes.  Pour on us rain from heaven, send us the waters' flow: incite our thoughts to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: एतमु तयं मदच्युतं सहस्रधारं वर्षभं दिवो दुहुः विश्वा वसूनि बिभ्रतम |||
verses.transliteration: etamu tyaṃ madacyutaṃ sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ divo duhuḥ viśvā vasūni bibhratam

translations.griffith: They have drained him the Steer of heaven, him with a thousand streams, distilling rapturous joy,  Him who brings all things excellent.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा वि जज्ञे जनयन्नमर्त्यः परतपञ जयोतिषा तमः स सुष्टुतः कविभिर्निर्णिजं दधे तरिधात्वस्य दंससा |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā vi jajñe janayannamartyaḥ pratapañ jyotiṣā tamaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ kavibhirnirṇijaṃ dadhe tridhātvasya daṃsasā

translations.griffith: The Mighty One was born Immortal, giving life, lightening darkness with his shine.  Wcll-praised by. sages he hath. by his wondrous power assumed the Threefold as his robe.

verses.sanskrit: स सुन्वे यो वसूनां यो रायामानेता य इळानाम सोमोयः सुक्षितीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: sa sunve yo vasūnāṃ yo rāyāmānetā ya iḷānām somoyaḥ sukṣitīnām

translations.griffith: Effused is he who brings good things, who brings us bounteous gifts and sweet refreshing food,  Soma who brings us quiet homes:

verses.sanskrit: यस्य न इन्द्रः पिबाद यस्य मरुतो यस्य वार्यमणा भगः आ येन मित्रावरुणा करामह एन्द्रमवसे महे |||
verses.transliteration: yasya na indraḥ pibād yasya maruto yasya vāryamaṇā bhaghaḥ ā yena mitrāvaruṇā karāmaha endramavase mahe

translations.griffith: He whom our Indra and the Marut host shall drink, Bhaga shall drink with Aryarnan,  By whom we bring to us Mitra and Varuṇa and Indra for our great defence.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे नर्भिर्यतः सवायुधो मदिन्तमः पवस्व मधुमत्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya soma pātave nṛbhiryataḥ svāyudho madintamaḥ pavasva madhumattamaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, for Indra's drink do thou, led by the men, well-wcaponcd and most gladdening,  Flow on with greatest store of sweets.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य हार्दि सोमधानमा विश समुद्रमिव सिन्धवः जुष्टो मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे दिवो विष्टम्भ उत्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya hārdi somadhānamā viśa samudramiva sindhavaḥ juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave divo viṣṭambha uttamaḥ

translations.griffith: Enter the Soma-holder, even Indra's heart, as rivers pass into the sea,  Acceptable to Mitra, Vāyu, Varuṇa, the noblest Pillar of the heavens.

verses.sanskrit: परि पर धन्वेन्द्राय सोम सवादुर मित्राय पूष्णे भगाय ||
verses.transliteration: pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādur mitrāya pūṣṇe bhaghāya

translations.griffith: PLEASANT to Indra's Mitra's, Pūṣan's Bhaga's taste, sped onward, Soma, with thy flowing stream.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस ते सोम सुतस्य पेयाः करत्वे दक्षाय विश्वे च देवाः ||
verses.transliteration: indras te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ

translations.griffith: Let Indra drink, O Soma, of thy juice for wisdom, and all Deities for strength.

verses.sanskrit: एवाम्र्ताय महे कषयाय स शुक्रो अर्ष दिव्यः पीयूषः ||
verses.transliteration: evāmṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukro arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ

translations.griffith: So flow thou on as bright celestial juice, flow to the vast, immortal dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम महान समुद्रः पिता देवानां विश्वाभि धाम ||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānāṃ viśvābhi dhāma

translations.griffith: Flow onward, Soma, as a mighty sea, as Father of the Gods to every form.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्रः पवस्व देवेभ्यः सोम दिवे पर्थिव्यै शं च परजायै ||
verses.transliteration: śukraḥ pavasva devebhyaḥ soma dive pṛthivyai śaṃ ca prajāyai

translations.griffith: Flow on, O Soma, radiant for the Gods and Heaven and Earth and bless our progeny.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो धर्तासि शुक्रः पीयूषः सत्ये विधर्मन वाजी पवस्व ||
verses.transliteration: divo dhartāsi śukraḥ pīyūṣaḥ satye vidharman vājī pavasva

translations.griffith: Thou, bright Juice, art Sustainer of the sky: flow, mighty, in accordance with true Law.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम दयुम्नी सुधारो महाम अवीनाम अनु पूर्व्यः ||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma dyumnī sudhāro mahām avīnām anu pūrvyaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma, flow splendid with thy copious stream through the great fleece as in the olden time.

verses.sanskrit: नर्भिर येमानो जज्ञानः पूतः कषरद विश्वानि मन्द्रः सवर्वित ||
verses.transliteration: nṛbhir yemāno jajñānaḥ pūtaḥ kṣarad viśvāni mandraḥ svarvit

translations.griffith: Bom, led by men, joyous, and purified, let the Light-finder make all blessings flow:

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुः पुनानः परजाम उराणः करद विश्वानि दरविणानि नः ||
verses.transliteration: induḥ punānaḥ prajām urāṇaḥ karad viśvāni draviṇāni naḥ

translations.griffith: Indu, while cleansed, keeping the people safe, shall give us all possessions for our own.

verses.sanskrit: पवस्व सोम करत्वे दक्षायाश्वो न निक्तो वाजी धनाय ||
verses.transliteration: pavasva soma kratve dakṣāyāśvo na nikto vājī dhanāya

translations.griffith: Flow on for wisdom, Soma, and for power, as a strong courser bathed, to win the prize.

verses.sanskrit: तं ते सोतारो रसम मदाय पुनन्ति सोमम महे दयुम्नाय ||
verses.transliteration: taṃ te sotāro rasam madāya punanti somam mahe dyumnāya

translations.griffith: The pressers purify this juice of thine, the Soma, for delight, and lofty fame

verses.sanskrit: शिशुं जज्ञानं हरिम मर्जन्ति पवित्रे सोमं देवेभ्य इन्दुम ||
verses.transliteration: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ harim mṛjanti pavitre somaṃ devebhya indum

translations.griffith: They deck the Gold-hued Infant, newlyborn, even Soma, Indu, in the sieve for Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुः पविष्ट चारुर मदायापाम उपस्थे कविर भगाय ||
verses.transliteration: induḥ paviṣṭa cārur madāyāpām upasthe kavir bhaghāya

translations.griffith: Fair Indu hath flowed on for rapturous joy, Sage for good fortune in the waters' lap.

verses.sanskrit: बिभर्ति चार्व इन्द्रस्य नाम येन विश्वानि वर्त्रा जघान ||
verses.transliteration: bibharti cārv indrasya nāma yena viśvāni vṛtrā jaghāna

translations.griffith: He bears the beauteous name of Indra, that wherewith he overcame all demon foes.

verses.sanskrit: पिबन्त्य अस्य विश्वे देवासो गोभिः शरीतस्य नर्भिः सुतस्य ||
verses.transliteration: pibanty asya viśve devāso ghobhiḥ śrītasya nṛbhiḥ sutasya

translations.griffith: All Deities are wont to drink of him, pressed by the men and blent with milk and curds.

verses.sanskrit: पर सुवानो अक्षाः सहस्रधारस तिरः पवित्रं वि वारम अव्यम ||
verses.transliteration: pra suvāno akṣāḥ sahasradhāras tiraḥ pavitraṃ vi vāram avyam

translations.griffith: He hath flowed forth with thousand streams effused, flowed ihsough the filter and the sheep's long wool.

verses.sanskrit: स वाज्य अक्षाः सहस्ररेता अद्भिर मर्जानो गोभिः शरीणानः ||
verses.transliteration: sa vājy akṣāḥ sahasraretā adbhir mṛjāno ghobhiḥ śrīṇānaḥ

translations.griffith: With endless genial flow the Strong hath run, purified by the waters, blent with milk.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोम याहीन्द्रस्य कुक्षा नर्भिर येमानो अद्रिभिः सुतः ||
verses.transliteration: pra soma yāhīndrasya kukṣā nṛbhir yemāno adribhiḥ sutaḥ

translations.griffith: Pressed out with stones, directed by the men, go fortli, O Soma, into Indra's throat.

verses.sanskrit: असर्जि वाजी तिरः पवित्रम इन्द्राय सोमः सहस्रधारः ||
verses.transliteration: asarji vājī tiraḥ pavitram indrāya somaḥ sahasradhāraḥ

translations.griffith: The mighty Soma with a thousand streams is poured to Indra through the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit: अञ्जन्त्य एनम मध्वो रसेनेन्द्राय वर्ष्ण इन्दुम मदाय ||
verses.transliteration: añjanty enam madhvo rasenendrāya vṛṣṇa indum madāya

translations.griffith: Indu they balm with pleasant milky juice for Indra, for the Steer, for his delight.

verses.sanskrit: देवेभ्यस तवा वर्था पाजसे ऽपो वसानं हरिम मर्जन्ति ||
verses.transliteration: devebhyas tvā vṛthā pājase 'po vasānaṃ harim mṛjanti

translations.griffith: Lightly, for sheen, they cleanse thee for the Gods, gold-coloured, wearing water as thy robe.

verses.sanskrit: इन्दुर इन्द्राय तोशते नि तोशते शरीणन्न उग्रो रिणन्न अपः ||
verses.transliteration: indur indrāya tośate ni tośate śrīṇann ughro riṇann apaḥ

translations.griffith: Indu to Indra streams, yea, downward streams, Strong, flowing to the floods, and mingling -there.

verses.sanskrit: पर्यू षु पर धन्व वाजसातये परि वर्त्राणि सक्षणिः दविषस्तरध्या रणया न ईयसे |||
verses.transliteration: paryū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ dviṣastaradhyā ṛṇayā na īyase

translations.griffith: O'ERPOWERING Vṛtras, forward run to win great strength:  Thou speedest to subdue like one exacting debts.

verses.sanskrit: अनु हि तवा सुतं सोम मदामसि महे समर्यराज्ये वाजानभि पवमान पर गाहसे |||
verses.transliteration: anu hi tvā sutaṃ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye vājānabhi pavamāna pra ghāhase

translations.griffith: In thee, effused, O Soma, we rejoice ourselves for great supremacy in fight.  Thou, Pavamana, enterest into mighty deeds,

verses.sanskrit: अजीजनो हि पवमान सूर्यं विधारे शक्मना पयः गोजीरया रंहमानः पुरन्ध्या |||
verses.transliteration: ajījano hi pavamāna sūryaṃ vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ ghojīrayā raṃhamānaḥ purandhyā

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, thou didst generate the Sun, and spread the moisture out with power,  Hasting to us with plenty vivified with milk.

verses.sanskrit: अजीजनो अम्र्त मर्त्येष्वा रतस्य धर्मन्नम्र्तस्य चारुणः सदासरो वाजमछा सनिष्यदत |||
verses.transliteration: ajījano amṛta martyeṣvā ṛtasya dharmannamṛtasya cāruṇaḥ sadāsaro vājamachā saniṣyadat

translations.griffith: Thou didst produce him, Deathless God mid mortal men for maintenance of Law and lovely Amṛta:  Thou evermore hast moved making strength flow to us.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्य-अभि हि शरवसा ततर्दिथोत्सं न कं चिज्जनपानमक्षितम शर्याभिर्न भरमाणो गभस्त्योः |||
verses.transliteration: abhy-abhi hi śravasā tatardithotsaṃ na kaṃ cijjanapānamakṣitam śaryābhirna bharamāṇo ghabhastyoḥ

translations.griffith: All round about hast thou with glory pierced for us as ’twere a never-failing well for men to drink,  Borne on thy way in fragments from the presser's arms.

verses.sanskrit: आदीं के चित पश्यमानास आप्यं वसुरुचो दिव्या अभ्यनूषत वारं न देवः सविता वयूर्णुते |||
verses.transliteration: ādīṃ ke cit paśyamānāsa āpyaṃ vasuruco divyā abhyanūṣata vāraṃ na devaḥ savitā vyūrṇute

translations.griffith: Then, beautifully radiant, certain Heavenly Ones, have sung to him their kinship as they looked thereon,  And Savitar the God opens as ’twere a stall.

verses.sanskrit: तवे सोम परथमा वर्क्तबर्हिषो महे वाजाय शरवसे धियन्दधुः स तवं नो वीर वीर्याय चोदय |||
verses.transliteration: tve soma prathamā vṛktabarhiṣo mahe vājāya śravase dhiyandadhuḥ sa tvaṃ no vīra vīryāya codaya

translations.griffith: Soma, the men of old whose grass was trimmed addressed the hymn to thee for mighty strength and for renown:  So, Hero, urge us onward to heroic power.

verses.sanskrit: दिवः पीयूषं पूर्व्यं यदुक्थ्यं महो गाहाद दिव आनिरधुक्षत इन्द्रमभि जायमानं समस्वरन |||
verses.transliteration: divaḥ pīyūṣaṃ pūrvyaṃ yadukthyaṃ maho ghāhād diva āniradhukṣata indramabhi jāyamānaṃ samasvaran

translations.griffith: They have drained forth from out the great depth of the sky the old primeval milk of heaven that claims the laud:  They lifted up their voice to Indra athis birth.

verses.sanskrit: अध यदिमे पवमान रोदसी इमा च विश्वा भुवनाभि मज्मना यूथे न निष्ठा वर्षभो वि तिष्ठसे |||
verses.transliteration: adha yadime pavamāna rodasī imā ca viśvā bhuvanābhi majmanā yūthe na niṣṭhā vṛṣabho vi tiṣṭhase

translations.griffith: As long as thou, O Pavamana, art above this earth and heaven and all existence in thy might,  Thou standest like a Bull the chief amid the herd.

verses.sanskrit: सोमः पुनानो अव्यये वारे शिशुर्न करीळन पवमानो अक्षाः सहस्रधारः शतवाज इन्दुः |||
verses.transliteration: somaḥ punāno avyaye vāre śiśurna krīḷan pavamāno akṣāḥ sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja induḥ

translations.griffith: In the sheep's wool hath Soma Pavamana flowed, while they cleanse him, like a playful infant,  Indu with hundred powers and hundred currents.

verses.sanskrit: एष पुनानो मधुमान रतावेन्द्रायेन्दुः पवते सवादुरूर्मिः वाजसनिर्वरिवोविद वयोधाः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa punāno madhumān ṛtāvendrāyenduḥ pavate svādurūrmiḥ vājasanirvarivovid vayodhāḥ

translations.griffith: Holy and sweet, while purified, this Indu flows on, a wave of pleasant taste, to Indra,—  Strength-winner, Treasure-finder, Life. bestower.

verses.sanskrit: स पवस्व सहमानः पर्तन्यून सेधन रक्षांस्यप दुर्गहाणि सवायुधः सासह्वान सोम शत्रून |||
verses.transliteration: sa pavasva sahamānaḥ pṛtanyūn sedhan rakṣāṃsyapa durghahāṇi svāyudhaḥ sāsahvān soma śatrūn

translations.griffith: So flow thou on, subduing our assailants, chasing the demons hard to beencountered,  Well-armed and conquering our foes, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अया रुचा हरिण्या पुनानो विश्वा दवेषांसि तरति सवयुग्वभिः सूरो न सवयुग्वभिः धारा सुतस्य रोचते पुनानो अरुषो हरिः विश्वा यद रूपा परियात्य रक्वभिः सप्तास्येभिरकवभिः || ||
verses.transliteration: ayā rucā hariṇyā punāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi tarati svayughvabhiḥ sūro na svayughvabhiḥ dhārā sutasya rocate punāno aruṣo hariḥ viśvā yad rūpā pariyāty ṛkvabhiḥ saptāsyebhirkvabhiḥ

translations.griffith: WITH this his golden splendour purifying him, he with his own allies subdues all enemies, as Sara with his own allies.  Cleansing himself with stream of juice he shines forth yellow-hued and red, when with the praisers he encompasses all forms, with praisers having seven mouths.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तयत पणीनां विदो वसु सं मात्र्भिर्मर्जयसि सव आ दम रतस्य धीतिभिर्दमे परावतो न साम तद यत्रारणन्ति धीतयः तरिधातुभिररुषीभिर्वयो दधे रोचमानो वयो दधे || ||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyat paṇīnāṃ vido vasu saṃ mātṛbhirmarjayasi sva ā dama ṛtasya dhītibhirdame parāvato na sāma tad yatrāraṇanti dhītayaḥ tridhātubhiraruṣībhirvayo dadhe rocamāno vayo dadhe

translations.griffith: That treasure of the Paṇis thou discoveredst; thou with thy mothers deckest thee in thine abode, with songs of worship in thine home.  As ’twere from far, the hymn is heard, where holy songs resound in joy. He with the ruddy-hued, threefold hath won life-power, he, glittering, hath won life-power.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वामनु परदिशं याति चेकितत सं रश्मिभिर्यतते दर्शतो रथो दैव्यो दर्शतो रथः अग्मन्नुक्थानि पौंस्येन्द्रं जैत्राय हर्षयन वज्रश्च यद भवथो अनपच्युतासमत्स्वनपच्युता || ||
verses.transliteration: pūrvāmanu pradiśaṃ yāti cekitat saṃ raśmibhiryatate darśato ratho daivyo darśato rathaḥ aghmannukthāni pauṃsyendraṃ jaitrāya harṣayan vajraśca yad bhavatho anapacyutāsamatsvanapacyutā

translations.griffith: He moves intelligent, directed to the East. The very beauteous car rivals the beams of light, the beautiful celestial car.  Hymns, lauding manly valour, came, inciting Indra to success, that ye may be unconquered, both thy bolt and thou, both be unconquered in the war.

verses.sanskrit: नानानं वा उ नो धियो वि वरतानि जनानाम तक्षा रिष्टं रुतं भिषग बरह्मा सुन्वन्तमिछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: nānānaṃ vā u no dhiyo vi vratāni janānām takṣā riṣṭaṃ rutaṃ bhiṣagh brahmā sunvantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: WE all have various thoughts and plans, and diverse are the ways of men.  The Brahman seeks the worshipper, wright seeks the cracked, and leech the maimed. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: जरतीभिरोषधीभिः पर्णेभिः शकुनानाम कार्मारो अश्मभिर्द्युभिर्हिरण्यवन्तमिछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: jaratībhiroṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām kārmāro aśmabhirdyubhirhiraṇyavantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: The smith with ripe and seasoned plants, with feathers of the birds of air,  With stones, and with enkindled flames, seeks him who hath a store of gold. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: कारुरहं ततो भिषगुपलप्रक्षिणी नना नानाधियोवसूयवो.अनु गा इव तस्थिमेन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: kārurahaṃ tato bhiṣaghupalaprakṣiṇī nanā nānādhiyovasūyavo.anu ghā iva tasthimendrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: A bard am I, my dad's a leech, mammy lays corn upon the stones.  Striving for wealth, with varied plans, we follow our desires like kine. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वो वोळ्हा सुखं रथं हसनामुपमन्त्रिणः शेपो रोमण्वन्तौ भेदौ वारिन मण्डूक इछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: aśvo voḷhā sukhaṃ rathaṃ hasanāmupamantriṇaḥ śepo romaṇvantau bhedau vārin maṇḍūka ichatīndrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: The horse would draw an easy car, gay hosts attract the laugh and jest.  The male desires his mate's approach, the frog is eager for the flood, Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: शर्यणावति सोममिन्द्रः पिबतु वर्त्रहा बलं दधान आत्मनि करिष्यन वीर्यं महदिन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: śaryaṇāvati somamindraḥ pibatu vṛtrahā balaṃ dadhāna ātmani kariṣyan vīryaṃ mahadindrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: LET Vṛtra-slaying Indra drink Soma by Śaryaṇāvān's side,  Storing up vigour in his heart, prepared to do heroic deeds. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: आ पवस्व दिशां पत आर्जीकात सोम मीढ्वः रतवाकेन सत्येन शरद्धया तपसा सुत इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: ā pavasva diśāṃ pata ārjīkāt soma mīḍhvaḥ ṛtavākena satyena śraddhayā tapasā suta indrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: Lord of the Quarters, flow thou on, boon Soma, from Arjika land,  Effused with ardour and with faith, and the true hymn of sacrifice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: पर्जन्यव्र्द्धं महिषं तं सूर्यस्य दुहिताभरत तं गन्धर्वाः परत्यग्र्भ्णन तं सोमे रसमादधुरिन्द्रायेन्दोपरि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: parjanyavṛddhaṃ mahiṣaṃ taṃ sūryasya duhitābharat taṃ ghandharvāḥ pratyaghṛbhṇan taṃ some rasamādadhurindrāyendopari srava

translations.griffith: Hither hath Sūrya's Daughter brought the wild Steer whom Parjanya nursed.  Gandharvas have seized bold of him, and in the Soma laid the juice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: रतं वदन्न्र्तद्युम्न सत्यं वदन सत्यकर्मन शरद्धां वदन सोम राजन धात्रा सोम परिष्क्र्त इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ vadannṛtadyumna satyaṃ vadan satyakarman śraddhāṃ vadan soma rājan dhātrā soma pariṣkṛta indrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: Splendid by Law! declaring Law, truthspeaking, truthful in thy works,  Enouncing faith, King Soma! thou, O Soma, whom thy maker decks. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यमुग्रस्य बर्हतः सं सरवन्ति संस्रवाः सं यन्ति रसिनो रसाः पुनानो बरह्मणा हर इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: satyamughrasya bṛhataḥ saṃ sravanti saṃsravāḥ saṃ yanti rasino rasāḥ punāno brahmaṇā hara indrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: Together flow the meeting streams of him the Great and truly Strong.  The juices of the juicy meet. Made pure by prayer, O Golden-hued, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र बरह्मा पवमान छन्दस्यां वाचं वदन गराव्णा सोमे महीयते सोमेनानन्दं जनयन्निन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: yatra brahmā pavamāna chandasyāṃ vācaṃ vadan ghrāvṇā some mahīyate somenānandaṃ janayannindrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: O Pavamana, where the priest, as he recites the rhythmic prayer,  Lords it o’er Soma with the stone, with Soma bringing forth delight, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र जयोतिरजस्रं यस्मिन लोके सवर्हितम तस्मिन मां धेहि पवमानाम्र्ते लोके अक्षित इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: yatra jyotirajasraṃ yasmin loke svarhitam tasmin māṃ dhehi pavamānāmṛte loke akṣita indrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: O Pavarnana, place me in that deathless, undecaying world  Wherein the light of heaven is set, and everlasting lustre shines. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र राजा वैवस्वतो यत्रावरोधनं दिवः यत्रामूर्यह्वतीरापस्तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: yatra rājā vaivasvato yatrāvarodhanaṃ divaḥ yatrāmūryahvatīrāpastatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: Make me immortal in that realm where dwells the King, Vivasvān's Son,  Where is the secret shrine of heaven, where are those waters young and fresh. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रानुकामं चरणं तरिनाके तरिदिवे दिवः लोका यत्र जयोतिष्मन्तस्तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: yatrānukāmaṃ caraṇaṃ trināke tridive divaḥ lokā yatra jyotiṣmantastatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: Make me immortal in that realm where they move even as they list,  In the third sphere of inmost heaven where lucid worlds are full of light. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र कामा निकामाश्च यत्र बरध्नस्य विष्टपम सवधा च यत्र तर्प्तिश्च तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परिस्रव |||
verses.transliteration: yatra kāmā nikāmāśca yatra bradhnasya viṣṭapam svadhā ca yatra tṛptiśca tatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo parisrava

translations.griffith: Make me immortal in that realm of eager wish and strong desire,  The region of the radiant Moon, where food and full delight are found. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake:

verses.sanskrit: यत्रानन्दाश्च मोदाश्च मुदः परमुद आसते कामस्य यत्राप्ताः कामास्तत्र मामम्र्तं कर्धीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: yatrānandāśca modāśca mudaḥ pramuda āsate kāmasya yatrāptāḥ kāmāstatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: Make me immortal in that realm where happiness and transports, where  Joys and felicities combine, and longing wishes are fulfilled. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्दोः पवमानस्यानु धामान्यक्रमीत तमाहुः सुप्रजा इति यस्ते सोमाविधन मन इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: ya indoḥ pavamānasyānu dhāmānyakramīt tamāhuḥ suprajā iti yaste somāvidhan mana indrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: THE man who waIketh as the Laws of Indu Pavamana bid,—  Men call him rich in children, him, O Soma, who hath met thy thought. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: रषे मन्त्रक्र्तां सतोमैः कश्यपोद्वर्धयन गिरः सोमंनमस्य राजानं यो जज्ञे वीरुधां पतिरिन्द्रायेन्दो परिस्रव |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣe mantrakṛtāṃ stomaiḥ kaśyapodvardhayan ghiraḥ somaṃnamasya rājānaṃ yo jajñe vīrudhāṃ patirindrāyendo parisrava

translations.griffith: Kasyapa, Ṛṣi, lifting up thy voice with hymn-composers' lauds,  Pav reverence to King Soma born the Sovran Ruler of the plants. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त दिशो नानासूर्याः सप्त होतार रत्विजः देवा आदित्या ये सप्त तेभिः सोमाभि रक्ष न इन्द्रयेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: sapta diśo nānāsūryāḥ sapta hotāra ṛtvijaḥ devā ādityā ye sapta tebhiḥ somābhi rakṣa na indrayendo pari srava

translations.griffith: Seven regions have their several Suns; the ministering priests are seven;  Seven are the Āditya Deities,—with these, O Soma, guard thou us. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते राजञ्छ्र्तं हविस्तेन सोमाभि रक्ष नः अरातीवा मा नस्तारीन मो च नः किं चनाममदिन्द्रायेन्दो परिस्रव |||
verses.transliteration: yat te rājañchṛtaṃ havistena somābhi rakṣa naḥ arātīvā mā nastārīn mo ca naḥ kiṃ canāmamadindrāyendo parisrava

translations.griffith: Guard us with this oblation which, King Soma, hath been dressed for thee.
